text: Risotto and carbonara were delicious. Sgd9.9 meals available to members (sign up for free on the spot) were value for money but didn't taste as great. Beer was sweet, refreshing. Free flow water in carafe on table. Spacious with high ceilings, pretty good ambience.

I had a pleasant experience at this caf√©. The staff were friendly, and orders were processed quickly. Ordering via mobile was convenient, and becoming a member offers great value with set meal options. The Western food was delicious, and I appreciated the free flow of water. A great spot for a casual meal!
Top notch, free and easy show room. My friend was impressed after entering the car and is looking to make a purchase. Sadly, no sales person around, if not, I will have a new chauffeur from now on.

Great sales service by Serene. Remained contactable even after car delivery to answer any queries to her best ability. Lack of one star out of 5 due to the 30% dining discount (BYD Owner Benefit) at BYD lifestyle hub restaurants is unable ‚Ä¶

Highly recommend Serene See!

Ordered my M6 in Feb 2025 and picked it up in early May 2025.

From start to finish, Serene made the car-buying process smooth and stress-free. She kept me informed with prompt updates at every stage and clearly outlined what I needed to prepare. Her responsiveness was outstanding‚Äîshe always answered questions quickly and thoroughly. If you want a transparent, efficient, and friendly experience, Serene is the person to work with.

Great sales service by Serene. Remained contactable even after car delivery to answer any queries to her best ability. Lack of one star out of 5 due to the 30% dining discount (BYD Owner Benefit) at BYD lifestyle hub restaurants is unable to utilise as the eatery does not serve Muslim friendly meals. Hope the restaurant can include Muslim friendly/ Halal food.

A year ago, we purchased the Atto3 with the exceptional support of Serene See, and the entire experience was nothing short of remarkable. Serene expertly guided us in choosing the right finance and insurance options, ensured timely delivery of the car, and continued to stay in touch even after the sale.

We recently met Serene at the BYD1826 roadshow, where she was still energetically engaged in her work. Her dedication truly stands out! Thank you, Serene, for making our car-buying journey so enjoyable. Even after driving over 11,000 km, our Atto3 looks and feels as incredible as it did on the first day. We couldn't be happier with our ride. Cheers to Serene!

Fried noodle with chicken taste flavorful.  Signature vermicelli bowl delicious and refreshing.    Weekday mains come with free water/iced viet tea or $5 upgrade to drip coffee and spring roll.  Will try other dishes next visit.  Overall good experience.

Vietnamese dry vermicelli with grilled pork, crispy spring roll, and a hot cup of Vietnamese coffee ‚Äî always a comfort combo. üçú‚òïÔ∏è
The flavors still hit the spot ‚Äî fresh, savory, and satisfying. That said, I couldn‚Äôt help but notice the pork portion‚Äôs been downsized a bit (come back, meat!) and they‚Äôve swapped out free tissues for wet ones at 30¬¢ each.

Not a dealbreaker, but for a spot that charges service fees and GST, a little dry tissue would be appreciated. Still, can‚Äôt complain too much when the food‚Äôs this good. üòã

First time at Saigon Legend. Seems to be a new restaurant. We were there at lunch time; no problem getting a table about 12nn but it filled up quite fast.

They have lots of lunch specials for a good price so my friend and I had one each, then shared an omelette as well. On weekdays they also gave us a glass of cold vietnamese tea for free.

My vermicelli special came with a spring roll, pork and raw vegetables to be mixed with the sauce and the vermicelli. I thought it was pretty good and the quantity was good for lunch. No flavour enhancers that I could taste; but lots of umami in the food. The omelette was well cooked, nicely browned but with a bit of runny egg in the middle. Worked well with the vermicelli!

Service was quick and the waitress was very patient with us (our first time) and explained all our questions. The tables are basic and it's pretty casual but the important part has to be the food.

Will definitely come back to try other dishes!

Frequented this restaurant a few times. Food is decent, but I was utterly disappointed with their service today.

I have received vouchers from my previous visit to this place before. But in my last visit, their cashier forgot to register the voucher, so we end up paying in full.

I‚Äôm not sure if it was the manager or boss who we managed to communicate this issue to, and she told us that we could use the voucher next time and would waived off the expiry on it.

Today, after visiting the outlet for a meal, they rejected our voucher. Saying it was expired.
We tried to explain the situation to the cashier, but she could not grasp the situation and called her boss. Which we then tried to explain again to the boss via the phone.

They still end up denying our vouchers.
At this point, we did not wanted to drag it further just for a $10 discount, so we paid in full and left.

Just felt utterly disappointed to frequent this place, only to experience the negligence by the staff, and then be given empty promises of being able to use the vouchers next time by whom I assume is the upper management.

Food came fast, and was very yummy. Beef pho was good, banh xeo was a little large and had many ingredients that dropped out, and spring rolls were nice and yummy. Got a free yoghurt by leaving my comments, thank you very much!

High expectations fall short
What we ordered:
Starters: Eggplant Miso; Beef Taco; Fennel, Orange and Burrata; Salt and Pepper Pork Ribs; Sourdough Bread.
Smaller servings, more like tasting plate size.

Best was Orange and Burrata, others were average to slightly below.

Mains: Flat Iron Steak
Nicely seasoned melt in the mouth steak, unfortunately had some foreign material in the salad which ruined the dish.

Deserts: Marshmallow, Flat White,  Soft Serve Cup
Interesting but Average flavours. The soft serve ice cream I would imagine it‚Äôs fairly hard to get wrong, but it was quite average tasting. Not sweet and flavours not full enough.

Drinks: Cucumber Smash, Mocktail Specials
Average, especially given the price they charge for the cocktails and Mocktails.
4 PAX lunch. Small servings, flavours of dishes a few hit and many misses.

The cocktails had a ridiculously massive square ice cube which meant there was actually very little to drink (see mocktail photo). The ice cube is from the bottom of glass to top. Literally 90% of the drink is this giant icecube.

We had a incident with foreign material (tissue / string) in our main flat iron steak meal, which ironically was the highlight best tasting of the entire menu we had. Highlighted this to the staff and kitchen, service recovery was a few complementary desserts which was about 7% discount of the entire bill.

The ice-cream wasn‚Äôt nice, the marshmallow had interesting flavours, not for everyone.

Overall, we felt it was a bit overrated given the hype and also the difficulties getting a booking, we would not return.

always come here after a hard at school, uncles are always friendly and give discount. pratas are crispy on the outside soft on the inside. the olio pasta is also very good! butter curry naan is a cult favourite amongst nus students, highly recommended!!

My mom is from Penang, very rarely I eat Penang food in SG unless necessary, since my grand aunt invited me, why not ? Free food haha. We actually  over -order as there are 7 of us. In terms of authenticity, the prawn mee (Hokkien mee in ‚Ä¶

My mom is from Penang, very rarely I eat Penang food in SG unless necessary, since my grand aunt invited me, why not ? Free food haha. We actually  over -order as there are 7 of us. In terms of authenticity, the prawn mee (Hokkien mee in Penang) and the Penang laksa stands out, the rest so so,  other dishes is our SG typical tze-char dishes. Overall enjoyable, and fyi we ate everything. Will return next year ! (I live in Tampines)

First time trying a strictly peranakan restaurant and it was quite impressive. The pork satay were very tender and flavorful and the crab curry had more crab meat than curry which is surprising to say the least. Lastly the dessert kueh salat is both aesthetically pleasing and delicious. The price came out to around $140 which isn't that expensive for a michelin restaurant.

It has been my long-running wish to dine at Candlenut. Rather than feeling exquisitely modern like typical Michelin restaurants, Peranakan cuisine is typically cooked with thoughtful preparation and tastes like how your grandma(in SEA) would cook! Like most Asian cultures, it is best in a group of 4-5 so you can order multiple dishes a la carte. For couples, there‚Äôs still the ah-ma-kase!

Chef‚Äôs Mum‚Äôs Chicken Curry
One of the signature items in Candlenut, the curry is on the sweeter end and is very ‚Äòlemak‚Äô (aromatic) from the coconut milk. The chicken is not fall-off-the-bone but retains its texture while being easy peel off the bone. Get this with white rice!

Candlenut Buah Keluak Fried Rice
A must order signature dish! Buah Keluak is a nut that gives the fried rice a nutty profile (obviously). It is slightly spiced and has a surprisingly good wok hey to it. Make sure to break the yolk to give it an extra creaminess.

Cassava Kueh
Never ever skip dessert at Candlenut. Other than the signature Chendol, this kueh was really mind blowing. It‚Äôs a kueh(cake) uses grated tapioca base, topped with a custard layer that is wonderfully brulee - giving it a flan-like flavour. Make sure to have scoops of the Gula Melaka sorbet in between!

Venue : carparks around the blocks. Or 5 minutes walks from the closest bus stop. There are 3 restaurants in the same block sharing toilets. Candlenut is on the right side of the block. Decorated in south eastern asian Chinese style. Outdoor dining is available. Fine setting. Reservation is recommended for weekends and holidays. Walk in and got a table at sharp 12 noon on Wednesday. Pretty female toilet is located between two other restaurants.  --- 8/10
Service: 5-starred hotel standard level. Given a stool for placing handbags. Chilled Tap water water was provided and refilled later. Introduced each dish. Clean the table before the dessert is served. Effective. Polite and nice staff. --- 9/10
F&B: a la carte or "ah-ma-kase" menu.
All dishes inspired by Chef Malcolm's heritage. So there are Nyonya, Indonesian,  Philippino, and Malaysian Chinese dises. Good food presentation. Normal portion for "ah ma kase". Reasonable prices for service and quality of food. All dishes are served in communal dining style. Tried "ah-ma-kase" February 2025, S$108pp+10% service charge:
*Prawn Crackers with chili sauce, free of charge.

*Starters:
- Kuen Pie Tee: Lobster, Turmeric curry, roasted candlenut inside  the little cripsy cup. --- 7.2/10
- Deep-fried Carrot Cake with Buah Keluak XO Sauce: heavy flavor of the xo sauce  with little carrot cake cubes. --- 7.5/10
- Charcoal Grilled Bangus Belly Satay, Kicap Manis Glace: Philippines milk fish skewers.  --- 8/10

*Mains served with Steamed 'Thai Hom Mai' Rice, rice was well-cooked:
- Bakwan Kepiting Soup: Traditional  Peranakan dish. There were 2 chicken & crab Tofu Balls, tofu puff, rich chicken broth boiled over 4 hrs.  --- 8.8/10
- Gado Gado: fresh Tau Kwa (bean sprouts), Tempeh, Silver Sprouts,  Cucumber, Long Beans,  hard-boiled Egg, cuttlefish, and pineapple. An Indonesian dish. Stir before eating. --- 7.7/10
- Udang Nanas: 4 Wild caught Angkar Prawns cooked with lemak, ginger flower and coriander. One Prawns on the bottom was relatively small. --- 7.7/10
-  Tau Yu Bak: Slow-cooked  Iberian Pork Jowl, Shiitake mushrooms,  premium dark soy sauce, cabbage, chili, coriander. ---  7.8/10
- Ikan Gulai: There were Red Lion Snapper, Gulai sauce,  Mei Xiang Salted fish, Long Beans, crispy Fried bean curd sheets, and  brinjal (eggplant). Fish wasn't overcooked.   --- 8/10.
- Sambal Telor: There were local Squid, Deep-fried free-range egg, cucumber, coriander, dried squid sambal. --- 7.8/10

*Desserts :
- Mango Puffed Rice: There were Mango Sorbet, fresh Mango, coconut jelly (2 carp fish shaped), young coconut shave rice in a wide bowl. The waitpersons poured the coconut milk into the table. The fresh mango wasn't sweet enough. --- 7.4/10
- Peanut Butter Kaya Toasts: a tiny homemade Roti Kok with peanut crumbs on the top. Nice
* Hot Coffee,  $6.5: served with very traditional Chinese biscuits, interesting.  No other choices of coffee.

Had the ala carte menu. Overall 4.5*
Best recommend the ngoh Hiang and cassava kueh.

Appetisers:
- Kueh pie tee is complementary, fragrant 4*
- Satay is flavourful tho a bit too sweet 4*
- The ngoh hiang is super good! 5*!
Main:
- Curry chicken, is thick and lemak, some part of chicken not so tender 4*
- Chap Chye is the best I‚Äôve eaten so far, but I‚Äôm not a chap chye person, so 4*
- Buah Keluak fried rice, very special taste 4*
Dessert:
- Buah Keluak ice cream, super chocolatey, many layers of taste, crispy and caramel sweet, popping candies inside 4*
- Cassava kueh very good 5*! It is tapioca cake but super soft

The service is really good, top up water, always around, give complementary food and free small cake and candle for birthday.

Wonderful fine dine experience at Claudine at their weekend brunch. Beautiful ambience, the free flow of wine has excellent pours, and we had the sparkling rose and the white. All the dishes we ordered were full of complex flavours and special touches of the chef in the sauce was unmistakable.

Had a beautiful brunch at Claudine, couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better way to celebrate our anniversary. The space was beautiful, the food was absolutely delicious, and the service was impeccable. We can‚Äôt wait to come back here for dinner.

My only feedback from our visit is that, while we appreciated that our photo that was taken as a gift, we were a little disappointed there was no other gesture to mark the occasion, especially since we had to purchase our own desserts. Many restaurants typically offer a small complimentary treat for such celebrations, which would have made the experience even more special. Also, if I‚Äôm not mistaken, the head ma√Ætre d‚Äô (or possibly the general manager) seemed a bit selective when checking on guests, which stood out during our visit.

Unfortunately I did not enjoy anything here, except for the amble free parking that is of close proximity to the restaurant. My monkey 47 cocktail was diluted. The crepe suzette texture was more like custard than a crepe (took a video to show this but can‚Äôt upload video here.) the puffed pastry dish was bland and just not to die for. Service was rather slow too. Ambience didn‚Äôt stand out either. As I was having my main course I was dreaming of McSpicy üçî üí≠

Food is average. I think the highlight is the free bread they offered. Other dishes are interesting but not very tasty.

Environment is beautiful. Even though it‚Äôs packed with tables, but they still leave enough space to make you feel comfortable. The colored glass and bar is special.

Service is ok only. Even though there are many waiters, but somehow they all just hang  out in the kitchen area, not really paying attention to customers. For example, our water was only filled once before we left.
I had a good experience, especially for kids over the weekend. They offer a free kids' meal and have a nice kids' corner for fun activities. ‚Ä¶

Nice place for dinner. Kids eat for free on Saturday, Sunday and public holiday which is great for families with young kids. The rack of pork is pretty good. Only flaw is they don't provide free ice water.

I had a good experience, especially for kids over the weekend. They offer a free kids' meal and have a nice kids' corner for fun activities.

I loved the food, and to my surprise, it tasted great. However, I was a little disappointed with the service; we waited for 50 minutes for the pork ribs, they sent to the wrong table and finally when ours arrived the pork rib weren't fully cooked. Thus the u gave us a waiver. Thanks! The waitress was prompt and attentive, which was a positive aspect of the experience.

Been here a few times and it‚Äôs time to lock in my review. First of all, the rack of pork rarely disappoints! It‚Äôs Duroc pork chop sous vide and then pan fried. So it‚Äôs crusty yet so tender in the middle. You never knew pork can taste like that. The service is always top notch and nice atmosphere too. I highly recommend to come for lunch as you can pay for the main and get soup, drink and dessert for free.

Always a great ambience to dine here.
Kids dine for free on weekends too.

My favourite is always the beef bolognese and cheesy beef burger!

Great place to chill out, there was plenty of seats available and ample parking lots during weekday lunch hour. Food arrive hot and was very big portion, good for sharing. We order the set lunch, which is the price of the main but come with free soup, drink and dessert. Taste wise was good, very value for money.

The food and atmosphere are fascinating. Good and awesome service. I want to compliment the staff Mui ling. Definitely recommended people to come. I think it is very smart promo for free meal for kids 11yrs and below.

Came here on a weekend, and its kids eat free. Ordered 2 burgers, 1 salami pizza, and a French toast. The service was good, and the food was nicely presented and tasted good! Highly recommended. Can also watch soccer on TV for soccer fans.

Fantastic experience! The staff is extremely helpful, quick and friendly. The food was great, we had short ribs and a burger. The kids even ate for free on Saturday. Cocktails recommended as well! We will be coming back.

We love having dinner here on weekends and public holidays with our three young sons, because kids get to eat free!

Food is yummy and ambience is great with some kids' toys available for play. Our fav main course is the Rack of Pork, and my youngest son loves eating the French toast with fresh fruits.

Worst Michelin Restaurant Experience Ever

I went in expecting a three-Michelin-star standard, but it was an utter disappointment. Service was mediocre, and the food was simply bad.

The first dish‚Äîpasta with caviar and truffle‚Äîwas overwhelmingly sour. The acidity drowned out every other flavor; I could barely detect any truffle at all. The sourness lingered unpleasantly after each bite.

Then came another caviar dish. It felt like they were just sprinkling caviar on everything and calling it fine dining. Adding caviar to every plate doesn‚Äôt automatically make it Michelin-worthy.

The mushroom with cream was no better. The first thing I tasted was pure oil, followed by a faint mushroom chew. The cream in the middle was overpowering and clashed badly with the mushroom.

Overall, I can‚Äôt fathom how this place earned three Michelin stars. The taste was poor, and the menu seemed to revolve entirely around truffle and caviar‚Äîwithout any real finesse or balance.

Service was exceptional. Felt really well taken care of before, throughout and after the meal. All of the staff make sure you are having a great experience. We went for the tasting menu with the classic wine pairing and really enjoyed all the dishes. The mushroom, Hokkaido scallop and wagyu beef dishes were standouts for us. Well balanced dishes with complex flavours. It is a lot of food though, so be prepared. The only minor thing that detracted for me was that I felt the lighting was a bit too harsh in the room, but this is really nit-picking. All in all amazing experience. Will definitely go again.

A fine reputation for unpretentious classic French cuisine, with the sole focus on top-quality, imported ingredients and refined French cooking techniques, has made Les Amis a gourmand‚Äôs delight, especially complemented by an outstanding wine list of mainly Bordeaux and Burgundy.

The immensely enjoyable meal of Brittany blue lobster, Wagyu beef terderloin, and angel hair pasta, generously garnished with foie gras, truffles and caviar washed down with the brilliant Krug‚Äôs flagship, Grande Cuv√©e, was a memorable example.

Evocative of fine dining in Paris‚Äô affluent 7th arrondissement where old-money wealthy Parisians call home, there‚Äôs a tinge of formality in Les Amis where a dining jacket, even a tux, wouldn't be out of place. However, a diner is put at ease by the  professionalism of the engaging servers from the aperitif to the petit fours.

Les Amis is impressive and expensive, but you wouldn't expect less from a famed restaurant with three Michelin stars since 2019, and ranked 28th on Asia‚Äôs 50 Best Restaurants, 2025.

From the moment I stepped into Les Amis, it was clear that the experience would be nothing short of exceptional. Nestled in the heart of Singapore, Les Amis has set a high bar for fine dining with its meticulous attention to detail and a parade of culinary delights.

Ambiance: The atmosphere exudes a tranquil elegance, striking a perfect balance between luxury and comfort. The lighting is thoughtfully dimmed to set an intimate stage, allowing the cuisine to shine‚Äîboth metaphorically and literally.

Service: The service at Les Amis is a seamless performance of hospitality. Staff members are not only attentive but demonstrate a passion for gastronomy and guest experience. Their recommendations were spot-on, and the timing of each course was impeccably synchronized with the pace of our evening.

Cuisine: Each dish is a masterpiece, marrying traditional techniques with modern execution. The ‚ÄòL‚Äôoeuf poch√© en chaud-froid au caviar‚Äô was a standout‚Äîan innovative rendition of a poached egg, enveloped in a warm yet cool caress of caviar that played a symphony on the palate. The special selection of caviar paired with spring turnip showcased an artful blend of textures and temperatures.

Overall Experience: Les Amis didn‚Äôt just serve a meal; they curated an exquisite dining escapade that engaged all senses. It‚Äôs not just the Michelin stars that shine brightly here‚Äîthe entire experience is stellar. This is a restaurant that doesn‚Äôt merely aim to feed but aims to inspire. For anyone seeking to indulge in the pinnacle of culinary artistry, Les Amis is an imperative.

In conclusion, Les Amis stands as a paragon of fine dining in Singapore, and my dinner there was an experience that will be etched in memory for years to come. Whether you‚Äôre a local connoisseur or a traveler with a discerning palate, Les Amis is a destination that promises‚Äîand delivers‚Äîan unparalleled gastronomic adventure.

Visited in Mar 2025

A visit to Fiz had long been in my cards. The dining experience at Fiz is really good, with food and service, both being top notch. The restaurant‚Äôs ‚Äúmodern‚Äù take on Malaysian/Southeast Asian cuisine whilst retaining traditional flavour profiles deserves appreciation. The courses are a mix of intricate and bold favour profiles which a treat to palates of diners who like Southeast Asian food. Among the starting courses, the heirloom carrots was my favourite course. The Nasi Dagang main course was absolutely fantastic too.

For drinks I went with the non-alcoholic pairing which was basically 3 Kombuchas. I believe there is also wine pairing for those interested.

Service was super good with Chef Hafizzul himself serving some of the dishes.

A definite recommendation for those willing to try a unique take on our region‚Äôs food/cuisine. Will def visit again when they have a new menu.

After abstaining from dining out for several months due to a medical procedure, I had a delightful weekend lunch experience at Restaurant Fiz recently.

Malay/Indonesian cuisine, with its generous use of herbs and spices, can be overpowering at times. But Restaurant Fiz did extremely well in mixing Southeast Asian ingredients to produce a remarkable and balanced taste and flavour. The food was a feast for my tastebuds, and I left the restaurant wondering the herbs and spices used in each course. In any case, as I only tried the four-course Sajian Pilihan lunch menu, I am making plans to be back for the Sajian Warisan dinner very soon!

The kari puff pusar (as a Singaporean Malay, I'm used to calling it epok-epok pusar, heh) was a nice, fiery introduction of what was to come. The tiger prawn with heirloom tomato (tasted very fresh!) was really yummy with its sweet-tangy dressing. I had ikan pekasam for the very first time - fermentation is common in Malay dishes but they can be quite extreme, so I appreciated that the ikan pekasam (accompanied by a bowl of piping hot congee that had a nice mix of ulam) was thankfully relatively easy/balanced on the palate. Dessert was so good - the Kuih Jiwa Melayang looked so deceivingly simple, but the mix of glutinous rice, ice cream and coconut custard was a nice way to end the meal.

I appreciated the attentive service. I had dietary requirements, and a team member phoned me prior to explain the menu in full. When I had to visit the restroom (I am on crutches), a member of the staff stopped what she was doing and led the way to the restroom. (On a side note, my friends loved the soap products in the restroom.)

Chef Hafizzul Hashim was very hands-on and involved in directing the kitchen. Chef came by our table a couple of times, including to explain the main course. When we exited the restaurant, he also came over to walk us out. Warm and hospitable gesture, as if we were visiting someone‚Äôs home.

Wonderful interior, with thoughtful layout and tasteful furniture and design. Well-maintained as to be expected. The restaurant floor had two rows of dining areas flanked by an island - so it was easy on the eyes and to get around. I also enjoyed the playlist, featuring Malay icons such as filmmaker-actor-musician P Ramlee and keroncong queen Katrina Dahari.

I think Chef Hafizzul did extremely well in challenging and imagining what Malay Fine Dining can be. (For one, I think we have to stop thinking or expecting an atas/elevated nasi padang or nasi campur experience!)

The moment I left the restaurant, I started texting my family and friends to encourage them to consider dining at Restaurant Fiz. You should too!

I had a wonderful lunch at Restaurant Labyrinth, where local Singaporean classics are brilliantly transformed into a fine dining set menu. Each course reimagined familiar flavors in creative ways‚Äîespecially the chicken rice, where the traditional scallion oil  was reinvented as a smooth pur√©e. The aroma of the scallion oil literally burst in my mouth, making every bite unforgettable üòäüòã
And good service too.
Special thank to the general manager company us the right way back to our hotel. üôèüôè

A Personal Journey Through Singapore‚Äôs Past at Restaurant Labyrinth

Dinner at Restaurant Labyrinth wasn‚Äôt just a meal, it was a full-blown storybook of Singaporean flavors, flipped open and rewritten with imagination and pride.

Tucked inside Esplanade Mall, the space feels calm and intentional, no distractions, just you and the food. And the food? Bold. Playful. Rooted in heritage, but not afraid to break the rules.

We started with a prata topped with black winter truffle crispy, fragrant, and rich in a way that made me smile. It was the perfect opening act: familiar but dressed for the occasion. Then came the rojak, but not the one you expect. This version had 12 different local herbs, layered into a kind of botanical chaos that somehow worked. It was earthy, punchy, and deeply Singaporean.

One of the most memorable dishes was the crispy roast chicken rice, where the chicken wing was deboned and stuffed. Bite-sized nostalgia with precision cooking. The char kuey teow, meanwhile, featured ahk shellfish and Hokkaido scallops luxurious, smoky, and silky all at once.

Then there was chilli crab, but elevated made with local flower crab and paired with snow pear. It had heat, sweetness, and crunch like the original, but distilled to its essence. And the Bak Kut Teh? A revelation. Manjimup black truffle brought unexpected elegance to a soup I grew up with.

There was also a tribute to Cairnhill Steakhouse, ahk golden pomfret grilled beautifully and served with green asparagus. Simple, but perfectly done. And the Shashlik-style Angus short ribs? Cooked for 48 hours, fall-apart tender, and paired with an edible candle made of beef fat. Yes, really. It was theatrical, but grounded.

Dessert didn‚Äôt hold back either. Ice kachang came reimagined with ginger snow refreshing and nostalgic. And the final bite, a cereal prawn oatmeal soft serve, was the kind of cheeky local twist that makes you laugh and crave a second spoon.

Labyrinth doesn‚Äôt just serve food. It tells stories. Stories about childhood flavors, street stalls, and forgotten dishes, told through the lens of a chef who clearly reveres the past but isn‚Äôt afraid to remix it. It‚Äôs not traditional, and it‚Äôs not supposed to be. It‚Äôs Singapore, messy, proud, layered and I loved every bite of it.

business_name: Thong Thai Bistro | Number One Thai Seafood Restaurant in Singapore
text: So happy we found this hidden gem of a restaurant. Food, service and atmosphere was perfect. Just leave it to Indi to recommend the food. We practically polished the plates. Will definitely be back and try other dishes.

business_name: Thong Thai Bistro | Number One Thai Seafood Restaurant in Singapore
text: The food is superb. Authentically delicious Thai food. Restaurant owner is friendly and welcoming.  Coupled with the cosy ambience - totally unparalleled.

business_name: Thong Thai Bistro | Number One Thai Seafood Restaurant in Singapore
text:
Good food but incredibly slow and not good organized service. The restaurant was not very full (2nd floor tables arrived after us) and not a lot of tables ahead of us, but we still had to wait 50minutes for our order. It came only partially. After 5min wait we asked the owner when the papaya salad will arrive just to learn that he told us he can't serve the dish anymore and it is out ... this he could have told us 50min earlier when we ordered the food and we would have ordered another starter. The "alternative" mango sticky rice we would have ordered anyhow as dessert.

We saw several other guests complaining about similar experiences. And overall the owner dealt with the situation poorly and without any communication.

Instead of charging a 10% service fee the owner should actually think about to at least give a drink or dessert for free to make up for an unaccetable service.

business_name: Thong Thai Bistro | Number One Thai Seafood Restaurant in Singapore
text:
Thai Thong is truly a hidden gem that deserves far more recognition. From the moment you step in, the beautiful ambience sets the tone for an exceptional dining experience. The food is nothing short of outstanding ‚Äî delicious, authentic, and clearly prepared with care and attention to detail.

The menu offers a generous variety of options for both vegans and vegetarians, making it an inclusive spot for all. Standout dishes include the fish, prawn, lobster, yellow curry, and squid ‚Äî each bursting with rich, balanced flavours. And the sticky rice? Easily one of the best I‚Äôve had outside of Thailand.

Adding to the charm are the owners Indi and June, who are incredibly warm and friendly, making guests feel right at home. If you‚Äôre looking for a memorable Thai meal in a serene setting, Thai Thong is the place to be.  One piece of advice, please call to make a reservation as they are pretty popular.

After a sudden change of mind, I was looking for a place at Chijmes for lunch with my beau before attending the NDP preview and read a review about this restaurant. The person happened to be looking for a restaurant like me and was impressed. So I decided to dive in too and I'm glad I did. The ambience is cozy. The food was amazing. Apart from the occasional sourness, there was absolutely no chance to frown because each dish was so well presented and curated. And they did well to accommodate my special request for non-dairy servings without much discount in taste and presentation. I salute the chef. The crew were very professional. Our server made us feel really comfortable and she was really sharp and observant. She noticed the birthday gift I slipped on the table before my beau even notice it. Did well also to present the dishes in mandarin for my beau and even prepared a birthday surprise for her. Fantastic lunch which added to a wonderful day. I'll definitely be back for more!

Whitegrass Restaurant is a cozy and elegant dining establishment known for its exquisite fine dining experience. Nestled in the heart of the city, the restaurant offers a sophisticated ambiance with a touch of modern charm. The menu features a delightful fusion of international flavors, crafted with fresh, locally sourced ingredients to create culinary masterpieces that will tantalize your taste buds. Whether you're looking for a romantic dinner for two or a gathering with friends and family, Whitegrass Restaurant provides impeccable service and a memorable dining experience that will leave you craving for more. Come and indulge in a culinary journey at Whitegrass Restaurant, where every dish is a work of art."

We came to celebrate a belated birthday last night. Food was really good but what makes it really stands out is the exceptional service especially from Raaj and Qamarul. They were kind, funny, and genuinely friendly and their energy made the whole evening unforgettable. Qamarul took Polaroid photos of us, gave us a handwritten birthday card from the team and treated us to a free scoop of gelato. It was such a thoughtful and personal gesture. Thank you so so much!!

Visited on a public holiday and learned the hard way that the 25% Hilton Honors discount doesn‚Äôt apply on eves or holidays‚Äîended up paying $110 for just three dishes, seated outside in the sweltering heat. Not ideal, but our fault for doing a walk in.

That said, the pizza was excellent‚Äîa perfect blend of Blue Label‚Äôs crispy base and D.O.C‚Äôs flavour. Easily a 10/10.

The fried potato dish was a confusing mess‚Äîcrispy bits over guacamole mush. Flavour, texture, and temperature all clashed. It honestly shouldn‚Äôt be on the menu.

The duck ragu was generous in duck and used fresh pasta, but tasted exactly as expected‚Äînothing memorable.

Would I pay $110 for this meal again? No.
Would I come back just for the pizza (and air-con)? Yes.

3 star because, it was really too hot for where we were sitting, and that fried potato dish killed my appetite.

The food here is pretty delicious. Specifically, get the mussels and the pasta, those are really good. I also like their cocktails, many of the ones I sipped tasted thoughtfully blended! Staff were also super attentive and took a Polaroid of our party (guess it‚Äôs part of their birthday process but nonetheless thoughtful)

Rising up to be one of my favorite Italian restaurants although I feel that the quality of the food varies from visit to visit. My favorite is the rigatoni vodka followed by the beef cheek ragu tagliatelle. Meatballs was fantastic and you can miss out on the pizza. Hilton members get a discount, 15% for gold and above. I love the outdoor seating more than the indoor as there is a great calming bistro vibe. Service is great, food serving however can be slow

I haven't eaten at many Michelin starred places, but I have eaten at a handful in Singapore London New York.  I think this is one of the best experiences and meals ever.

Ordered the 6 course menu at 298 nett and took vegetarian (as my partner is vegetarian).

The meal absolutely blew me away.  Every dish had a wow factor.

I did think dessert was slightly disappointing (good but not out of the ordinary) though even  their petit fours and a small passion fruit cake they gave for us celebrating an anniversary -- was splendid.

Chef had a beautiful story to explain his vision of using seasonal produce vegetables from France and why he also dedicated himself to a vegetarian menu, service was splendid and not intrusive.

I'm sure the food was cooked with a lot of technique and finesse. The explanation and the presentation never did seem too-over-complicated and yet lack the wow factor, which I had felt at some other fine dining.  Overall, I thought the food was just impeccable and wowwwww

The place, at first sparse and looked not that impressive for a Michelin starred restaurant, really started to take its form as the sun set and lights dimmed and more guests filled the space.

I didn't do alcohol as I was driving, but I had a lovely introduction to the Heaps Normal XPA beer Non-Alcoholic (it's actually 0.5% alcohol but technically qualified as non-alcoholic).  I'll be looking to purchase some to drink at home lol

I think everything was close to perfect-- of course there is no perfection-- but this is one experience not to miss.  I'll be back to try another season's vegetarian, and perhaps the protein too to see what other wonderful food Chef Gillion can make~

This was my second time dining at Jag, and unfortunately, it fell short in several ways. First visit was memorable.

We booked a private room for a large group gathering ‚Äî something we do every few months. We chose a private space so we could enjoy ourselves freely. To our surprise, a staff member came in mid-meal to tell us we were being too loud. That completely killed the mood. What‚Äôs the point of a private room if we‚Äôre still expected to stay quiet? We‚Äôve dined at many other high-end restaurants and never encountered this issue. Either the room is poorly designed for sound or the staff doesn‚Äôt understand the purpose of private dining.

Food-wise, it was hit or miss.

The saving graces:
The great company amongst friends.
‚Ä¢	Excellent cheese selection.
‚Ä¢	Dessert was the highlight ‚Äî hats off to the pastry chef for ending the night on a high note.

‰∏∫‰∫ÜÁªôÊãõÂæÖÊàëÁöÑÊúãÂèãÈù¢Â≠êÊàëÊâçËúªËúìÁÇπÊ∞¥ÔºåÊ∑°ÂÜôËÄåËøá„ÄÇ

honestly one of the best restaurants in singapore. we took the light experience and the food was portioned just nice that you feel full but not stuffed.. loved the breads, fish dish and smoked scallops, dessert is usually a sore spot for ‚Ä¶

We had an exceptional experience at JAG with their AUTUMN Menu. It‚Äôs rare to find a restaurant where vegetables are the star of the show, with proteins and sauces thoughtfully crafted to complement them. The menu featured unique vegetables not commonly found in Singapore, such as yacon, Jerusalem artichokes, and salsify. These introduced a wonderful array of flavors and textures, offering a truly distinctive dining experience. The pigeon was prepared in a way that made it feel more like steak than poultry, in terms of mouthfeel. The seabream dish with salsify was undoubtedly my favorite of the night.

Although the dinner was a 6-course meal, we were treated to an impressive array of appetizers and refreshers, bringing the total to about 14 dishes, depending on whether you opt for cheese or an aperitif. This was followed by a pre-dessert, dessert, and post-dessert. The dessert, featuring truffle ice cream (not the chocolate kind!), was an unforgettable experience. The fragrant truffle, typically paired with potatoes, was infused into the ice cream, perfectly complemented by chocolate ganache and cacao nibs ‚Äì an absolute journey of flavors.

The entire dining experience lasted nearly 3.5 hours, including an additional caviar experience. Be sure to allocate sufficient time for your visit, as this leisurely pace allows you to fully savor each dish without feeling rushed.

The staff were incredibly attentive throughout the evening, always quick to top up our water and explaining the intent behind each dish. They also made sure to check in and ensure we were enjoying the experience. What truly stood out was the chef, who personally visited each table not once, but twice, engaging with guests in a meaningful conversation about the menu and our experience ‚Äì not just a brief hello and goodbye.

As a thoughtful touch, we were sent off with two small bottles of their signature perfume, which had a lovely woody, earthy scent that was actually quite pleasant.

While some of the dishes featured ingredients that were new to me, I appreciated the creativity and boldness behind each one. Although personal preferences may have meant I wasn‚Äôt as fond of certain elements, I could still recognize the skill and thoughtfulness in every dish. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed the experience and look forward to returning to explore their ever-evolving seasonal menus.

business_name: Baguo Grilled Fish Â∑¥ÂõΩÁÉ§È±º - 154 West Coast
text:
Had 2 set meal, seafood  braised noodles and hot and sour mee sua. Both set meal came with a small side dish and a drink.

The side dish was pretty and had a variety of food inside but taste wise lacks a punch. The free drinks that came with the set were very good. The lime juice and chestnut drinks were v well balanced.

As for the main dishes, pls note that mee sua Èù¢Á∫ø is a thin liked spaghetti type noodles and not those thin oyster mee sua ones. Very generous with the noodles portion.

For the braised seafood noodles, all there was were 4 Lala, 3 spring small prawns and egg mixed and a few slices of fish cakes. Told boss it would be good if there were at least 2 meat slices. The Lala flesh was also missing and not in the shell. Overall it is not ex, but the ingredients were lacking.

Friend has hot and spicy noodles, also 4-5 pieces or fishes. Soup was warm. Couldn't finish the mee sua.

Both dishes had a good soup base and the braised noodle's soup gravy base was tasty.

Place is new. Renovation new, beautiful. Boss and boss lady v friendly. Dishes came quickly. Will try their grill fish the next time.

Aircon environment. Top level. Order through QR. Payment flexible.

business_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
text: I had an amazing dining experience at The Halia! The food was delightful, bursting with flavors and beautifully presented. The service was top-notch‚Äîattentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. The combination of outstanding cuisine and warm hospitality made it truly memorable not forgetting the nice ambience of nature. I highly recommend The Halia for anyone seeking a warm, yummy and aesthetically pleasing meal!

business_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
text: Our 3rd visit here. It was raining heavily that night, so Francis called ahead to tell us so and remind us to bring an umbrella. Short of actually sending a valet service to pick us from the car park, it was indeed a nice touch. Food has ‚Ä¶

business_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
text: Our 3rd visit here. It was raining heavily that night, so Francis called ahead to tell us so and remind us to bring an umbrella. Short of actually sending a valet service to pick us from the car park, it was indeed a nice touch. Food has improved significantly from before. We ordered 4 mains  - crab spaghettini, halibut, chicken and the ribs and 2 light mains - pulled beef and burrata. Loved the spaghettini, halibut and the chicken, ribs were so so.. or could it be because we were already quite stuffed when it was finally served? :). Service was excellent from John and Chan - Attentive without being intrusive. New plates were changed fairly frequently. Atmosphere could have been better had it not been raining - they had to put the blinds down to stop the rain from coming in but it still was rather cosy with nice subtle lighting. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience this time around. Thanks to John, Chan, Francis, the chef and staff of the Halia again for making it a nice night out for the family.

business_name: The Halia at Singapore Botanic Gardens
text:
First time there, and I am happily surprised on how good is the food. I ordered the halibut,  which is soooooo good. The char octopus is very tasty too. Service is excellent.  I got a free drink as my order was missed. Wow. Thanks!!
Btw, I put "moderate noise" as the girls at the next table talked very loudly. Otherwise,  it's a very good environment for dining.

Food is superb only down side is the bar table seating. We booked and pay deposit via credit card and told only can choose bar table. Most of the place bar table is fine as we can see the cooking station but this place we were seated facing the washing station. In the photo you can see chef cooking with their back facing us so practically we can‚Äôt see any cooking stuff except the washing part üò† we asked to shift table and they said only outdoor is applicable as that is for walk-in. You expect us to seat outdoors with the terrible humidity weather and don‚Äôt forget we paid for reservations with the extra effort of booking. They should re-arranged their seating to allow 2 pax in proper dining tables indoor. Will not return unless I have bigger group to dine with

Artichoke at Kim Yan Road. Was there on a Friday. As it was nestled in a residential area we were told that last order was at 930 pm and the place would need to close at 10 pm. On a Friday night and not having seen some of my friends since a few months, this is not a place if you need a long catch up time with good friends. Food was good despite the limited time we had.

Fantastic dining experience. Came in with a larger company, and enjoyed our time properly.
The dishes were fantastic - japanese fusion, the taste was exactly on point! Every dish was fantastically balanced and lovely. Plating was beautiful, modern and fun.
It was however a little harder to grasp the concept of the menu - we needed a little assistance. Likewise, when we asked for more info about some of our plates, we got incorrect information. Not a big issue though, we had a great experience.
Fully recommend! Beautiful views from the restaurant, as well as from the very intimate garden!

Being super indecisive on my food. Told Marcus to plan our dinner. And we totally love it!!!

We started with sashimi platter, best flounder I ever had! Scallop sashimi seems to have paired with yuzu, super refreshing!!!

We are too engrossed in our food. No more photos after that ü§£ü§£ but the wagyu beef was sooo good!!! It‚Äôs melting in my mouth and we order a 2nd portion!

The menu fine prints were hard to read. Overlooked the additional charge of $22 when we selected the steak for the set dinner. Would have appreciated the waiting staff mentioning it when taking the order. Surprised that request for a second bun came with a price tag of $7, and the butter needed to be asked for. Would have expected it to be served with a fresh plate automatically.

Attended an event here. Couple of things to note: this restaurant is not located in Barracks Hotel as website suggests (a walk away, check map) and event chairs were hard wooden ones (too uncomfortable for me to sit through courses). Some lovely interior design points, and food I tried at start of the event was okay.

Held my engagement at Camille and the overall experience was exquisite. When I had submitted the reservation, I had merely asked if I could send flowers to the venue and if the ring could be hidden in one of the dishes. What I didn‚Äôt expect was Ashleigh going way above and beyond: immediately reaching out and suggesting innovative ideas to consider. On the day of the engagement, she walked me through the entire process and it was clear that they wanted to facilitate as far as possible to make the day a success! She was also supported by Rohit and Net, who were extremely caring and as far as I recall, the best service staff team that I have ever experienced.

The food was also spectacular. First, they served us with a Parker Roll, which was extremely flavourful while being both soft and crisp. The daily selection of the butter was excellent too, a miso butter and a black olive butter ‚Äì it was so good that we held onto them throughout the whole service even after we finished the bread!

As for the mains, we had the White Miso Cod and the Duck Breast. The cod in particular was spectacular. Taste, texture and the sauce were on point ‚Äì in fact, probably among the best cods that I have had and it was really unique, bringing both the Western and Japanese sides together. The Duck was excellent too but I am someone who likes strong tasting meats - if that's not you, then perhaps another dish could work better!

For the dessert, we had the deconstructed black forest which was really unique, esp as they will prepare the dish at your table, explaining each of the deconstructed component! The quality of the ingredients were also top-notch and it was a great dish overall!

Super happy with my dinner at Camille and would strongly recommend for others to pay them a visit, especially if one is celebrating special occasions. Thanks again Ashleigh, Rohit and Net for going above and beyond!

We were attracted by the many good reviews & decided to order a set of canap√©s for our wedding anniversary on the 21 Feb. To our horror and disbelief, the food never came. We called and was told that the kitchen is closed on that 'fateful' ‚Ä¶

From the initial contact with the company to the end result, everything was professional, individualised and overall an amazing experience. They were able to easily cater for x1 person being gluten free, totally adaptable to my changing ‚Ä¶

We were attracted by the many good reviews & decided to order a set of canap√©s for our wedding anniversary on the 21 Feb. To our horror and disbelief, the food never came. We called and was told that the kitchen is closed on that 'fateful' day ! But how could that be ? We had received confirmation email for our order !!  Fortunately, we didn't order for any guests  otherwise, they would have been left hungry because of your utterly disappointing & unreliable service ü§®‚òπ

(Edits to previous comments)
Couple of days later ....To our great astonishment, Tim himself appeared at our door. He came to apologise & to explain what exactly happened. Service recovery well executed Tim ! You have our support back  üòä  Btw, ur canap√©s taste great üëç

From the initial contact with the company to the end result, everything was professional, individualised and overall an amazing experience. They were able to easily cater for x1 person being gluten free, totally adaptable to my changing requirement of a sit down starter to canap√©s and provided incredible food! I cannot recommend them highly enough.

Eat at French Laddle ‚Äì Highly Recommend!
Had a great meal here ‚Äì the French onion soup was very good, full of rich flavor. They also serve a free loaf of bread that‚Äôs warm and fresh, and the chocolate ‚Ä¶

Quaint French outfit in an old condo.

Interior was small and it can feel a bit claustrophobic. Furniture seemed old and rickety as well, but you could say they have true French character.

Food was great, no complaints there. Free bread basket was generous.

1. Beef cheek was rich and fatty, with a luxuriant red wine sauce.

2. Duck confit was cooked perfectly, with crispy skin and fall-off-the-bone meat. The veg stew that it came in was nothing to write home about though.

3. Pork tenderloin was the black horse - tender and juicy with little porkiness.

Serving sizes could be larger for the price, but I'm greedy.

Got the apple pie and lemon tart for dessert. They were okay, not bad.

Booked this place for a celebratory lunch with my partner and it delivered - packed a punch.

Came on a non-holiday Sunday, made reservation for 1245pm, which thankfully I did because it was otherwise full. Shared a 2-course ($32 nett) and 3-course ($38 nett) set between both of us.

Starters - Fig salad, seafood soup
- Great starters. Seafood was rich, and fig salad was just right to whet the appetite.

Mains: Duck Confit Aglio Olio, Pan Seared Barramundi
- Aglio Olio was al dente, and somehow had a (nice) slightly toasted taste? Duck meat was also tender and seasoned well
- Barramundi was the better dish for me, skin was crisped well and fish meat was just rightly cooked. The baked potatoes tho, was melty in my mouth. No chunks felt at all.

Dessert - Lemon Tart
- One of the best, most balanced lemon tart I've had in my life. Just the right amount of sour, zest, and natural sweetness from the fruit toppings. Pastry was well textured too.

Worth every penny. Great quality to dollar ratio. Free parking in the condo is a plus! haha.

Eat at French Laddle ‚Äì Highly Recommend!
Had a great meal here ‚Äì the French onion soup was very good, full of rich flavor. They also serve a free loaf of bread that‚Äôs warm and fresh, and the chocolate ice cream was absolutely delicious. Overall, 9/10! More people should definitely try this place ‚Äì plus, no GST!

It is a tiny French restaurant in a private condominium. We came for their 3-course set lunch ($38 nett) and were quite blown away by the food. The Catch of the Day I had was simply one of the best fish dishes I've had in a while. Water is free of charge, but the set lunch did not include coffee or tea, which cost an additional $3. Overall, it was a nice environment for a quiet lunch with good food.

A cosy restaurant that is well loved by many. Pretty obvious from the unpretentious menu offering decent fare. I would definitely come more often if I‚Äôm not staying at the other side of the island. There‚Äôs 1-1 free corkage if you purchased a bottle of wine from them. So definitely worth noting. The restaurant gets hard to talk when it‚Äôs full but that contributes to the whole vibe.

Nestled discreetly within a residential condo lies a culinary gem, a haven of delectable French cuisine that whisks you away from the tropical island vibes to the enchanting streets of France. From the moment you step inside, the cozy ambiance envelops you, setting the stage for a gastronomic journey like no other.

Each bite at this hidden gem is a revelation, a tantalizing glimpse into the culinary mastery of French cuisine. Take, for instance, the fig salad, a seasonal delight that bursts with freshness, awakening your taste buds with every forkful. It's like a symphony of flavors dancing on your palate, transporting you to a sun-kissed orchard in Provence.

And then there's the duck confit pasta, a dish that embodies the essence of French cooking with every twirl of the fork. The pasta oozes with richness and depth of flavor, courtesy of the tender duck confit, creating a harmonious melody of taste that lingers long after the last bite.

But let's not forget about the trout, a dish that's just as impressive in its simplicity as it is in its execution. Each flake of fish is perfectly cooked, delicate yet bursting with flavor, a testament to the chef's skill and attention to detail.

And then there are the beef cheeks, a true revelation for the senses. Tender, succulent, and bursting with flavor, they practically melt in your mouth, leaving you craving for more with each heavenly bite.

Of course, no French culinary experience would be complete without a taste of foie gras, and this hidden gem certainly doesn't disappoint. With its generous portion and unparalleled taste, it rightfully claims the throne as the crowning glory of the menu, leaving you utterly enchanted and longing for just one more bite.

In conclusion, if you're looking to indulge in an unforgettable French dining experience that transcends the ordinary, look no further than this hidden oasis. With its cozy atmosphere, impeccable service, and mouthwatering dishes that transport you to the streets of France with each bite, it's a culinary journey you won't soon forget.

Great 3 Course Lunch Set!  Soup, Mains And Dessert for only around $30 is totally worth it!  Their pasta is massive with lots of premium tasty toppings.  Indoor dining area is limited but they have a lot of al fresco seats.  Good thing its not hot that day and had a pleasant time dining outdoors.  Service is courteous and efficient.  I love how they paced the courses.  You might need to call for reservations as most tables were reserved when we went.  This is a fantastic special lunch with colleagues!

We ordered a few dishes and everything was spot on! We came at night and the ambience was really nice, very nice music and place was windy! My personal favorite will definitely be the ebi mentaiko, scallop bacon and the truffle mushroom ‚Ä¶

the food was delicious, especially the iberico pork jowl. we did not really like the scallops though - it was written as "jumbo scallop" on the menu but it was actually processed scallop (akin to those from the supermarket).

A friend told me there is a beautiful, clam, peaceful and lively place in Singapore called Dempsey Hills. Got a chance to visit today, such a superb life place and liked it a lot. Filled with greenery, calm and peaceful place with lot of ‚Ä¶

A friend told me there is a beautiful, clam, peaceful and lively place in Singapore called Dempsey Hills. Got a chance to visit today, such a superb life place and liked it a lot. Filled with greenery, calm and peaceful place with lot of eateries of different cuisines and drinks. Night view of most eateries is too good with lights. We thought it‚Äôs a less known place, however, to our surprise the restaurant where we had dinner was full and many people returned due to no seats available. Must visit place for all. It is not far off from Dhoby Ghat MRT.

Best place  to chill‚Ä¶ many restaurants and bars around like Greek, Mexican, Thai, Mediterranean, Indian, Western, Korean, Japanese and many more. Try different food and drink here. Visited many restaurants here. Awesome üëè. Free parking available here. ‚Ä¶

Good breakfast/brunch/lunch/dinner place. Free parking for all. Big place, they have supermarket too. Singapore‚Äôs Cars N Kopi event is held here every time from 8am onwards on selected public holiday. Do check out @carsnkopi_sg on Instagram for updates on the next one.

Dog friendly place. Can bring the dog while you eat.
Brunt ends coffee is great !

Got the truffle mushroom pizza. Great for sharing! But to each 4 slices on your own would be difficult as the mushrooms are q overpowering. The aglio olio was DELICIOUS but q expensive for just aglio olio. The other seafood pasta wasn't as yummy but it's more value for money. Didn't like the BBQ pork ribs but maybe I'm just not a fan of BBQ sauce and pork ribs. My grandmother loved them tho. The squid ink risotto was not bad, nothing fantastic.

Drinks were really not value for money so we didn't get any üôÉ bill added up to $200+ for 5 people and also I got a free slice of bday cake (cuz my mom asked for some bday promo HAHA) which was really delicious btw. It was red velvet cake drizzled with some berry sauce. I'd pay for that.

Service was excellent.

Overall, beautiful place with nice ambience but not so affordable (I'd only go for special occasions).

8pm busy Friday and it‚Äôs a warm palmy night at 29C‚Ä¢83F. The restaurant is smallish, no A/C. We ordered out of the menu for the deep fried E.plant/squid, with the scallop gratin√©e with parsley sauce, Fritta crudo basically fried pizza with ‚Ä¶

8pm busy Friday and it‚Äôs a warm palmy night at 29C‚Ä¢83F. The restaurant is smallish, no A/C. We ordered out of the menu for the deep fried E.plant/squid, with the scallop gratin√©e with parsley sauce, Fritta crudo basically fried pizza with Parma. Maybe for us too much fried. It‚Äôs Italian Zhi Char for sure. Chatty Master of ceremony is the boss and his able assistant Elena? Who sang story about Baladin IPPA in north western Italia, the very first craft beer castelli, now there are a thousand brewers. Because of the warmth no red wine ordered though I actually wanted the Chanti and Merlot.  Food is generally great, the toretilli truffle Bolognaises was the star, not the lamb rack which was under seasoned, because of the warmth we didn‚Äôt take dessert as it will probably melt b4 it gets around.  Let‚Äôs save it for another day.

It's a nice, quaint, authentic restaurant that serves quality food. We really liked all the dishes.

The meat balls were crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. The eggplant was well done but a bit more on the bland side. The beef and pork filling was very fragrant.

The Parma ham fried pizza was really good too. The crust was crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. The cheese was very tasty and the taste overall blended together very well.

The scallops were very tasty and fragrant.

The truffle risotto was delicious. The truffle was fresh and wasn't overpowering. The cheese was great too.

The carbonara was alright. It was served with pepper, which was interesting. The taste was good, but the pasta was a bit too hard for our liking.

The braised beef cheek was very delightful. It was crispy on the outside and so tender on the inside. The taste wasn't overpowering as well.

The burrata and truffle was good too. The taste is perfect.

The beef tenderloin was a bit overcooked (we ordered medium rare but was served more like medium). But no complaints on the taste - the meat was well marinated.

We ordered three tiramisu - the espresso (which was our fav), rum (this was very good too, and the taste of rum was strong enough for our liking) and normal tiramisu (this was good but a bit more sweet compared to the rest)

Overall, a very good meal and the service was excellent. The pace at which the food was served was great too. However, do note that there's a minimum charge per diner when a reservation of more than 6 pax is made on the weekends / PH.

Unapologetically Italian. Chef-owner David and his wife Elena are very friendly and enthusiastic about sharing their culture! The selection of Italian wines is fantastic, carefully selected from small, family-owned wineries with great reverence for nature. Definitely make a trip down if you want to have an authentic Italian experience.

business_name: TINTO Spanish Restaurant at Dempsey Hill - Best Paella in Singapore
text: The Hokkaido scallops black truffles under the special edition was very delicious and well cooked. The fish skin was very crispy and the fish melts into your mouth. However, the lobster paella was abit salty for our liking but overall a ‚Ä¶

business_name: TINTO Spanish Restaurant at Dempsey Hill - Best Paella in Singapore
text:
Food quantity was small size.
Ice cream for dessert can give a bigger scope.

Signed up for membership, and entitled to welcome drink.  However, they don't serve on weekend and this benefit will expire in 12 hours.  So not sure what is the purpose in this case.  10% discount in your next visit and in my case this benefit will expire in September.

business_name: TINTO Spanish Restaurant at Dempsey Hill - Best Paella in Singapore
text: We had a lovely dining experience at TINTO Spanish Restaurant. The decor was on point, and the food was absolutely delicious. However, the live band music was a bit too loud for our liking. Our table was right next to the stage, and it made conversation really tough - we had to practically shout to hear each other üòÇ. Maybe request a table further away from the music if you're planning to dine here. Overall, great food and ambiance, just a bit too loud for a relaxed meal. Would still recommend, but with a heads up on the noise level!

business_name: TINTO Spanish Restaurant at Dempsey Hill - Best Paella in Singapore
text:
The Hokkaido scallops black truffles under the special edition was very delicious and well cooked. The fish skin was very crispy and the fish melts into your mouth. However, the lobster paella was abit salty for our liking but overall a fantastic meal.

John, the service person was very friendly and welcoming.

Wonderful experience üëç

3.5 stars.  A 8 persons lunch for $1500+ table, so almost $200/person. Service was very good. Attentive and Friendly. Kudos to them! Food was so-so for the price. We came specifically for their suckling pig, and steam Alaskan crab (3.42kg), ‚Ä¶

3.5 stars.  A 8 persons lunch for $1500+ table, so almost $200/person. Service was very good. Attentive and Friendly. Kudos to them! Food was so-so for the price. We came specifically for their suckling pig, and steam Alaskan crab (3.42kg), and also ordered their fried eggplant (delicious), steamed bamboo oyster/clam (this was good), alaskan crab bee Hoon (too dry) ,   spicy  kangkong (under-seasoned) and had very yummy desserts (coconut jelly, ornee, and mochi).  The star of the afternoon, for most of us were the mochi desserts.

The reason why the food was ranked 3 stars is because the main dishes that were supposed to steal the show, were disappointing, namely the suckling pig (the skin wasn't crispy enough and it's kinda gummy‚Äîlike they didn't render the fat out enough),  and the Alaskan crab that was prepared two ways (steamed and with bee hoon). The steam garlic one was enjoyable but the flavor was almost there but not even 90% there, and the alaskan crab beehoon while tasty, was too dry.  The sauce for the beehoon was really great, but it was just not enough for the beehoon at all, so we had chunks of dry beehoon.

You know, sometimes when you eat a dish, and you feel like the chef's heart wasn't in the cooking?  That's how we felt... or that it wasn't the executive chef who cooked for us.

We had dined here before so hopefully, it was just an one-off day in the kitchen and not a change of staff.  We did finsih the food, I mean, we skipped breakfast for it :) and we do not like the idea of waste.

I finally got to try the legendary Chin Huat Seafood‚Äîand now I see why it‚Äôs so well known! From the moment we arrived, the warm service and fresh seafood made it clear this place isn‚Äôt just hype‚Äîit‚Äôs tradition.

The highlight? That iconic claim: they serve lobsters bigger than a little girl‚Äîand yes, it‚Äôs true! The portions are massive, and the flavor holds up just as impressively.

We dined in one of their elegant VIP rooms, which has a minimum spend of $998 on weekdays (not sure about weekends), but it‚Äôs worth it for celebrations or family feasts. One pro tip: call ahead to ask if the seafood you‚Äôre after is fresh on the day. It shows how committed they are to quality, and you‚Äôll thank yourself later.

All in all, Chin Huat delivers big‚Äîboth in size and experience.

We came to Chin Huat to celebrate my dad‚Äôs birthday, having made a reservation several days in advance. Given that this is a seafood restaurant, we expected at the very least to be able to order their signature items like crab or even basic options like chicken.

To our shock, we were told on the spot that there was no crab, no chicken, basically nothing left. No one had informed us beforehand that we needed to pre-order, and when we expressed our surprise and disappointment, the staff were not the least bit apologetic. Instead, they turned it around and blamed us‚Äîsaying ‚Äúsometimes we do tell customers to pre-order,‚Äù which clearly means they didn‚Äôt this time.

What was supposed to be a special occasion turned into a frustrating and embarrassing one, with almost no proper food to serve our guests. We‚Äôve patronized Chin Huat in the past, but after this experience, we will definitely not be coming back.

If you‚Äôre planning a celebration or looking for reliability and good service, this is not the place.

It‚Äôs a very cozy restaurant in Sunset Way neighbourhood. I booked a table for 7. Ordered 3.3kg of Alaskan King Crab (steam and also cooked with Bee Hoon), Braised Tofu, steam Soon Hock fish, Qing Long Vege, two pots of hot tea (Pu Er and Osmanthus) and 3 coconut jellies. Food is of superb quality, service was top notch and place is cooling (even though we are seated outside). Total bill $912ish after 10% discount. Great place for family gatherings!

Ordered salted egg crab and qing long veg.
Salted egg crab is yummy and fresh. You get to chose your own crab.

Very friendly staff team. They also give 10% disc as long as you sign up for free membership on the spot.

A very Christian place. Nice songs played also. Went early on a Christmas night. Was half filled only.

business_name: Legendary Classics by Legendary Hong Kong
text: Was looking for a dim sum place serving great dim sum classics at a reasonable price. This place definitely meets all the criteria, good price, food is amazing, and restaurant is very nostalgically decorated playing favorite Cantonese songs

business_name: Legendary Classics by Legendary Hong Kong
text:
The service staff that take care of us is good, his name is John. He does make sure our table is clean when we dined.

Food wise we tried a few typically dim sum items and some new item. Average for the food, we just particularly like the siew Mai and the chili that restaurant served. We order the Hong Kong styled noodles, the original sauce which seems to be oyster sauce is not really good but when I added the Chili paste in, it taste so good. We also ordered the ‰∏âÊãº„ÄÇroasted duck is nice, roasted pork with the very crispy skin, the HK cut may be too big for eating, you can request for smaller cut, the char siew is too dry for our licking: not recommended for this.

business_name: Legendary Classics by Legendary Hong Kong
text: My family and I celebrated Mother‚Äôs Day at this restaurant and we were very satisfied with the service, ambience and food. Service was prompt and the seats were comfortable. The architecture of the building and the interior deco were aesthetically pleasing. It brought us back to the chachaantings we visited in HK. We mainly ordered dim sum dishes this time and will definitely be coming back to try the other dishes, especially the roast duck and other meats!

I've been a loyal patron of this authentic western restaurant for over a decade, ever since I was a kid. My family and I have always frequented this place. We even followed the restaurant when it relocated to a new spot.

This year, I decided to celebrate my birthday here, and as always, the food was amazing, especially the Sirloin steak with black pepper. What truly sets Mariners' Corner apart is their baked potato. The staff takes it to the next level by topping it with sour cream, scallions, and garlic/bacon, a unique touch you won't find anywhere else.

The ambiance is delightful, and I must mention the exceptional manager, who was not only very friendly but also incredibly sweet. The attentive waiters surprised me with a delightful birthday cake and sang 'Happy Birthday.' It was a heartwarming touch that made my day.

I highly recommend Mariners' Corner, and I will most definitely visit again.

It's been years since we ate at Shashlik and wow the place has been beautifully renovated!!!! Cosy vibes. We especially like the "history" wall - such a good way to honour its beginnings and the people who worked there.

The üçû bread was a little denser than how I remembered it, but still yummy. The ribeye was SO GOOD though! Definitely much better than I recall! There's a good amount of marbling/fats in the ribeye (see photo) which made it so tasty! The ribeye is what a classic western steak should be. Many Western places can't do a classic western steak right, but Shashlik proved that they know how to do a classic steak well. It's everything we expect from a western styled steak on a hotplate.

Mushroom soup is on the creamier end with a generous portion. We'd recommend to share it between two people.

We didn't order their dessert because we were too full, but check out the video of the fancy dessert with FIRE. The orange zest smelt so good from where we were seated too.

Finally, the kids Mac & Cheese was legit + came with yakult. The white sauce they made was really good, and look at that cheese (see photo) ü§©. The adults liked the Mac & Cheese too. It's always appreciated when restaurants put as much love and thought into kid's meals, and it's not an after thought.

AND FINALLY, WE NEED TO RAVE ABOUT THEIR SERVICE. We find it so rare to get such nice, homey, authentic service these days in Singapore. The staff and Shashlik were all so attentive, WARM, and helpful. The lady who served us was so kind towards our son, and made our experience so much better. One of the staff who served us wore the original red vest - means he's one of the OGs! Such an honour to be served by this old uncle. We really get the sense that everyone who works here are here to really serve others - such wonderful hospitality and service. It's service like this that makes us keep coming back to Shashlik and telling our family and friends about them.

Again, super nice renovation!!! We are stealing this grey wall colour for our future home, haha.

We will come back again, not years later, but soon!

We had a great time with all the good food and service. Really worth coming especially for special events.

Love the bread, the soup, scallop, veal and portion, especially for the starters, were generous.

Also love the lovely gesture by the team to prepare nice birthday surprise for my partner :)

This restaurant really prides herself on great food as the chef took great attention to guests‚Äô feedback and experience in the restaurant. Highly recommended!

One of the worst meals I‚Äôve ever had ‚Äì and I‚Äôm still haunted by the experience two years later.

From the plating to the actual flavours, everything fell flat. The starter featured raw fish that was overly fishy and unbearably salty. The scallop tasted like it had been simply boiled, then topped with some caviar and a strange popcorn foam ‚Äì it felt random and unrefined. The beef course was bizarre, paired with a sweet raspberry foam that completely clashed with the meat. As for dessert, it was nothing more than ice cream with some fruits and nata de coco ‚Äì unimaginative and lazy.

The only redeeming part of the meal? The bread.

Unfortunately, this was one of my most memorable birthday meals for all the wrong reasons. I would not recommend Rhubarb to anyone ‚Äì it‚Äôs baffling how this place holds a Michelin star.

Rhubarb's food was really great. We had lunch omakase.

We loved the main course, the meat was perfectly cooked with delicious mushrooms and sauces. The pork dumpling was great too.

The signature 'tiramisu' was good, but I felt that it did not necessarily achieve a good balance as the sourness of the mushrooms would overpower the other mild tastes. I also feel that a foam dish is not a worthwhile fourth course meal.

The opener cones were a great palette introduction!

The fish appetiser was perfect. The texture of the fish is really good, it had a smooth and chewy texture within due to the slight rawness. Loved it.

The desert could use a bit more mango and perhaps some additional flavours to manage the neutral taste of the coconut and dry ice.

Overall, food was great.

Service on the other hand was lacking. We had some last minute scares on not being able to make our reservation and tried calling to ask about cancelling and asked for a fee waiver. Although it was not a good thing on our side, I felt that the person on call wasn't very friendly and got agitated with the inquiry. In the end, we managed to make it.

When we were seated, the waitress asked a lot of questions. Firstly, she Asked if we were going to order liquor. We said not for now, so she proceeded to take the wine glasses. However, we were still interested to look at the wine menu so we held onto the menu. The waitress became annoyed and tried to still take the menu and asked us again if we actually wanted wine. We then said not now, but could we not look at the wine menu??? And the waitress just left.

Aside from that, I didn't like that there were another waiter and waitress frequently standing at the kitchen counter seemingly gossiping and staring at us a lot.

Also, when I asked the waiter for more bread or anything, he just smiled and went away to do it. I feel that for fine dining service, the waiter should try to give a response such as, "sure of course".

For the atmosphere, I loved the floral arrangements.

In overall, Rhubarb's food was good, but man I seriously recommend rhubarb to take a good look at themselves and especially their service, and ask themselves if they are actually worthy of a michelin star.

The restaurant well deserves its 1 Michelin star !!! Everything was great,except for the surprised charge of SGD 13 for a sparkling water (while still water is free). It was a surprised because I did not think there would be that big of a ‚Ä¶

The food is very salty to me and my husband. Especially the monkfish. Good starter and bread. A bit disappointing on the dessert and cheese. If you are looking for French cuisine fine dining, There are better choices in this area. Atmosphere is good but normal service. Can see the difference when the waiter is treating regular customers and the new customers. One good thing is free corkage on Tuesday, it‚Äôs good value to bring your own wine.

The restaurant well deserves its 1 Michelin star !!! Everything was great,except for the surprised charge of SGD 13 for a sparkling water (while still water is free). It was a surprised because I did not think there would be that big of a difference and the server should have given me a warning‚Ä¶ Anyway,the food was excellent. It was an omakase lunch so we did not know what we would have. Paul the chef was amazing and friendly. He even came out and greet us with the first petit bite ! We had a crab petit bite right after the 3 choices of bread. For appetizer,we had raw shrimp as the first course, truffle and mushroom as the second course. Quail was served as the main course and it was cooked to perfection ! The breast was well seasoned and cooked. It was tender,flavorful and a just a little smoky. Dessert was coconut sorbet with chocolate,caramel,almond and white chocolate mousse i believe. It was refreshing and milky ! Overall,very impressed with the menu,techniques and quality of food. The sparkling water part should not happen. Also,the restroom was a little too small. Hard to move around

Excellent meal! Enjoyed every bite! Attentive and pleasant service

Amuse bouche was nice but I think I was too excited about the rest of the meal so don't remember the details of how it tasted. Took the olive bread with a very creamy butter.

Oyster was amazing! Still thinking about it and wishing I could have it again. Perfectly balanced citrus, sweet, savoury notes :3

Soup was chestnut with mushrooms, very very nice. I never thought they would go well together but they did. Texture was like a mousse.

Scallop was good, but slightly plain in comparison to the preceding oyster. The lemongrass sauce didn't completely agree with my taste buds. Interesting flavours that I don't regret trying though.

Main was pork with a sausage dumpling thing on top. Pork was perfectly done, natural flavours of pork coming through well. The sausage dumpling thing was vaguely reminiscent of luncheon meat but nicer, and I'm not complaining about that!

Dessert was a pleasure to look at and taste. Various bits and types of chocolate with a strip of almond jelly.

Petite fours to end off the meal as well and they came in a very cute drawer box.

Great experience overall! Will return!

Special shout out to their sparkling water! Best I've had so far! It's not Perrier or any of the conventional brands. The bubbles were dense but soft, a pleasure to drink.

The scallop starter is exquisite! Dessert is perfect. We were here to celebrate hubby‚Äôs birthday and received a beautiful surprise dessert. Thank you Rhubarb for making our day! We enjoyed ourselves ü©∑
