Food are all tastefully plated and delicious. They were kind to ask me if I have dietary restrictions and I told them I would like to have all cooked food. So they made changes for me to replace the lightly torched scallops to cooked crab stick for appetiser. Really appreciate it:) every dishes were all well explained and executed.

Focused on something he calls "Crossroads Cooking" Nouri Restaurant sees Chef Ivan Brehm investigating the interconnectedness of various food histories across five continents, the results part traditional and part innovative but undeniably ‚Ä¶

Focused on something he calls "Crossroads Cooking" Nouri Restaurant sees Chef Ivan Brehm investigating the interconnectedness of various food histories across five continents, the results part traditional and part innovative but undeniably interesting.

Open for lunch as well as dinner in Chinatown, the entrance understated for a Michelin-starred eatery, guests are greeted in a foyer by friendly staff before being led to a room with tables lined up around a marble countertop and what is at least half of Nouri‚Äôs kitchen.

Offering a truncated afternoon tasting, four courses for S$168, lunch begins with an offer of Bubbles, Wine or bottled Tea from Muri whose ‚ÄúFade to Black‚Äù blend pairs well to Snacks eaten with Bread and  Hamachi on Bread with lots of acidity.

Petite in terms of portions, Bass let to age deftly balanced by Vanilla and Pepper, it was after Brehm loudly dressed-down one of his Sous that ‚ÄúChicken & Dumpling‚Äù arrived with restrained heat and a ‚Äúdumpling‚Äù of Rice wrapped by Cabbage.

Stretching to India for preserved Rose Petals at Dessert, ‚ÄúThings That Go Well Together‚Äù including Strawberry Sorbet and cracked Peppercorns, Petits Fours span globally such that Black Sesame,  Osmanthus, Tempeh and Coffee all get a moment but nothing really to connect them.

Fine dining restaurants typically offer only set menus, usually consisting of 9 to 12 courses. Invariably, there tends to be one or two dishes that are difficult to understand in terms of flavor.
However, to my surprise, this restaurant did not have any such 'puzzle' dish; every course was exquisitely delicious with stunning presentations.

While we enjoyed pairing the dishes with sake, which featured an unusually unique selection, that is a story for another time. As a sake sommelier myself, I must commend the choice of brands.

Upon entering, there was almost a ritualistic hand-washing ceremony, and a moment during the course to select tea leaves, which I found to be a brilliant touch. It prevents any dull moments and reflects the staff's concerted effort to create a wonderful atmosphere. The interior, with its serene and sophisticated yet warm ambiance and high ceilings, added a sense of spaciousness.

Overall, it was a flawless dining experience that left nothing to be desired.

Had a wonderful catchup with friends during lunch time here. I could see much thoughts put into the menu design, table setting and choices of cutlery. Highly recommend the scallop, the strawberry/tomato salad and the beetroot dessert. Only the lobster dish was a miss to me. Will definitely return in the future.

Nice lounge style setting that offers good looking and tasty food. Not sure if this can be considered fine dining though?

A few gripes:
1. the environment is a bit like a lounge than a fine dining place. Maybe they're learning from Japanese restaurant that seats guess on the counter next to each other, but where's the chef if this is the case?
2. presentation of food is excellent, but the taste is not nearly as good as the look.
3. the service is attentive but a bit over enthusiastic about the wine. I don't really need a 300-words lecture for each wine, seriously.

Somewhat comically the bill came in a jaw of cute little wooden crocodile, I immediately thought does it mean the bill is gonna bite? I guess it's matter of taste...

Such a difficult review to write, evoking conflicting feelings till this day even though our visit was in Sep 2024. It was a birthday lunch treat from the wifey.

I'll start with the negatives. Space wise, while the dining room itself was adorned with beautiful flower arrangements, the lack of a proper entrance and the restaurant being situated almost in the middle of nowhere resulted in the lack of a sense of place. Upon arriving, we stood outside wondering if we were at the correct location, and upon entering, it was the dining room immediately. However, my biggest gripe was with the service. Despite being dressed in a shirt, bermudas, and Birkenstock sandals, I was promptly informed that I was apparently in ‚Äúshorts‚Äù and ‚Äúslippers‚Äù. Then, I was told that they would make an exception in accommodating us in a manner that we were being done a favour. Every dish was served without a glint of a smile and for some, without any explanation. Even when I gave a glowing feedback for one dish and described it as ‚Äòstunning‚Äô, all it drew was a muted ‚Äúthank you‚Äù with a tentative half-smile from the manager. At one point, I was so deep in thoughts savoring the food and unrealizingly dangled my sandal for a mere few seconds, and was swiftly told off by the manager. Though not defining per se, the chef greeted the other 2 tables but skipped ours completely, which felt like the icing on the cake. In short, I felt discriminated and utterly unwelcomed throughout the entire lunch service by the manager and server on duty.

Minor credit due: a complementary dessert was arranged for the celebratory occasion. Granted, I accept partial fault for not fully adhering to the dress code. Though quite frankly, in Singapore‚Äôs unbearably humid climate and for a lunch service, I did not feel my dressing alone warranted such treatment.

Such a pity: because the food was exceptional. I remarked that this was the best non-Michelin starred restaurant we‚Äôve been to in Singapore solely based on food.
-Amuse bouche (4.5/5) ‚Äì All 3 were packed with so much flavor ‚Äì albeit each in their different ways ‚Äì that left us wanting more.
-Burihira (3.5/5) ‚Äì Not bad and the acidity opened appetites but did not really stand out.
-Scallop Kakiage (3/5) ‚Äì This dish did not really work imo as the tempura coating for the scallop became soggy shortly after by the sauce which had a watery consistency. However, the taste was interesting, bold even, and still enjoyable overall.
-Nori Bread (5/5) ‚Äì So good, the bread, the butter, all of it. One of the best bread we had in Singapore, probably only behind or perhaps on par with Sommers parker house roll.
-Sakura Ebi Risotto (5/5) ‚Äì Without a doubt: the best dish. From the contrasting flavours of the ebi‚Äôs umaminess matched with the curry base infused with a hint of smokiness to the varying textures, it was a perfectly balanced dish pretty much in every aspect. This was the dish I described as ‚Äòstunning‚Äô.
-Duck and Wagyu (4/5): Tried options for the mains. The duck was expertly cooked. The accompanying sauces added an interesting touch as it wasn‚Äôt just the usual jus. Perhaps, the wagyu could have had better marbling. Delightful dishes.
-Blackberries (3/5) ‚Äì Nothing mind-blowing but a decent dessert that played on textures.
-Petit fours (3.5/5) ‚Äì Really nice bites, including the complementary celebratory ‚Äúcheesecake‚Äù. Fitting end to the meal.

In sum, I chose to end on a positive note (the food) as it was that good, though unfortunately, the whole experience was marred by the service. Perhaps, the service might have already changed for the better and assuming the food level remains, it is definitely on par with 1* restaurants in Singapore we‚Äôve been privileged to visit. Also, the chef has a moving backstory at his previous stint which I chanced upon a couple of years back. Much support for such an inspiring young talent. With Singapore‚Äôs Michelin Guide Ceremony 2025 to take place later today evening, my personal experience aside, I hope the restaurant receives the accolades it deserves.

My third dining experience at Ce Soir with Chef Seth and his team and every visit was a gastronomic adventure. I had the chance to taste two different menus in the three visits and I loved every dish that was presented. So much attention to each ingredient and how it would balance with each of the sauces made by Chef from scratch. In the most recent visit, I enjoyed the Hokkaido scallop with Sarawak white pepper and Bouchot mussels so much! The white pepper elevated the taste of the Hokkaido scallop and together with the subtle flavours of the Bouchot mussels made a perfect balance to the dish!‚≠êÔ∏è Another favourite was the Lobster with smoked sherry butter! An amalgamation of the sauce and lobster brought out the umami-ness of the dishüëçüèª
Chef‚Äôs seaweed bread is also the best! That sticky  slightly sweetish  coat on the top of the loaf just enhances the flavours of the perfectly baked bread! So many delectable dishes on this menu !
The team of service staff were also very attentive and explained all the dishes clearly! Even when the restaurant is full, each staff still made sure that everyone was taken care of! Well done!
I will definitely be back again very soon!

Actually I tried visiting here a few times before. But due to every single time not making reservation, there's no available tables.

This time, it was still an impromptu decision, to try again. As we were celebrating our anniversary, and also had a 8PM show at the Sands Theatre.

Initially the FOH staff (I'm sorry I forgot her name üòÖ) told us if we could accept a bar table seating, it'd be around 15 mins wait time. We were OK with it.

Thankfully, after 15 mins she told us there's a table available, as the diner was done with. We went ahead with it.

We were served by Kok Fong at the table.

It starts with choices of water. Between Sparkling & Still, We went with Sparkling. With Lime.

Kok Fong was spontaneous, great at convos, had a keen-eye, and great at engaging with customers.

We ordered a Barbecue Iberico Pork, Yellow Mountain Honey Char siu (ËúúÊ±ÅÈªëÊØõÁå™ÂèâÁÉß)($52). Kok Fong did explain to us that it was a 50-50 Fat-Lean ratio. Or we call it ÂçäËÇ•Áò¶. Which I like how he explained about it. I could taste the smokiness of the char siu, with the hint of the honey and it was marvelous.

We also ordered a Fish Maw, Conpoy, Garoupa soup (Ëä±ËÜ†Áë§Êü±ÈæçË∫âÁæπ)($25 each). Served with pepper on the side. It was thick, didn't have a strong fishy taste, but you can taste the essence of the collagen & the fish in the thick soup. Had strips of black fungus too. Delicious!

We also ordered a Shredded 42 Days Peking Duck Salad, beetroot, crispy taro, citrus truffle dressing (Âåó‰∫¨ÁÉ§È¥®Áµ≤Ê≤ôÊãâ)($24). Kok Fong even assisted us to give the salad a good mix. Thanks, KF! Salad was good. Had a hint of the truffle, but not too overpowering. Strips of duck weren't too thin & also had ice plants inside as well. Good starter. Airy. Crunchy.  But makes you a little full.

We also had an Alaskan crabmeat fried rice, flying fish roe (ËüπËÇâÈ£õÈ≠öÁ±ΩÁÇíÈ£Ø)($60). We were contemplating initially on either this, or the Yangzhou Fried Rice. But this has more customers ordering, yeah we went with this. Theres a substantial amount of crabmeat in the fried rice, and a good amount of roe. When having it together, the texture of the rice complements the roe well. Rice is Á≤íÁ≤íÂàÜÊòé too.  Good for sharing between 2-3 pax.

At this point we're a little too full for dessert. But the dessert menu looks good too. Guess we could only try it the next time.

There's a toilet inside as well. Which is very clean. Nobody really reviews this. But I feel the whole interior design, colour scheme, warm comfortable lighting play an important part of dining.

Overall, I liked the food & the service is remarkable. Recommended to make advance reservation.

Aside from that, the ladies from the Front of House also offered to help me store my backpack in the front as it was alittle big. Which made my dining experience better too.

Staff at the checkout area also asked if I was a Sands Member, and if I was driving.

Of course, these are probably SOPs, but, these also help elevate the dining experience the guests have. So, thank you again, for the Team @ Mott 32, on 26 July 2025, around 6pm. Wonderful service.

Came here specifically for the Peking Duck after seeing all postive reviews.
The duck was freshly done and while waiting, the other dishes I had built up my expectations for the signature duck.

Fish maw soup with garoupa was so flavourful that i might just come here and order this with a bowl of rice and it would be a very satisfactory meal.
The crispy pork belly was sooo good, crispy, good balance of fat and lean meat and juicy,  a little bit of mustard adds a bit of tangyness which i quite like.
The egg tarts were worth the wait as well, frshly done, flaky and soft. The prawn dumplings were decent and not bad at all. The stir fried ee mian was also love at first bite, it was really well done!
The environment was nice, the service was also great, quick response and friendly staffs.

But, the signature dish was a huge letdown. i was expecting ÁâáÁöÆÈ∏≠Ôºåbut there was only 1 small plate of duck skin which was not as crispy as i hoped and dry, it felt like it was there in the oven for abit too long. It came with a plate of sugar to dip in, but it didnt help much. Other plates were huge cuts of duck meat that did not go well with the flour crepe served, it was hard to chew altogether. The meat is pretty good for a roast duck but not what i wanted for a Peking duck.

I would love to go back again for all the other dishes, but not the peking duck.

Came to Mott32 for din sum lunch with my visiting friends.  Still the best dim sum in town imo.

We ordered these:
-  Barbecued Iberico pork, with yellow mountain honey:  definitely our favorite - so tender and juicy. I will come back just for this

-  Steamed dim sum:  we like the king prawn har gaw, soft quail egg black truffle siu mai the most. The quail egg is half boiled filled inside the siew mai, very interesting

- Crispy prawn rice roll:  this is another item we always order. The prawn filling ÁÇ∏ÂÖ© inside the rice roll, gave 2 contrast layer of texture , sort and crispy in one bite

- Pan fried turnip cake: very simple recipe, but the turnip cake was pan fried to the optimal temperature, crispy and flavorful.

- We also had the scallop dumpling, beef hor fun, normal siu mai , black truffled chicken. These were also nice, though not as stand out.

I will definitely come back again. High quality even comparing to the best Cantonese dim sum from HK.

Mott 32_MBS
Dishes were rich and savoryüòã. Staff were friendlyüëç.
Highly recommend:
"Scallops Prawnsüç§ Crispy Riceüçö in Fish Soup".
"Buddha Jump Over the Wall"
"Alaskan King Crab Casserole, Crab Roe, Vermicelli"

Came here for dinner years back but didn‚Äôt know that Mott 32 has Executive Set Lunch. Which is value for money.

The feast brings together seasonal highlights and signature classics, making it a perfect midday indulgence.

It is $68 per person (min. 2 pax), available daily from 11:30am ‚Äì 2:15pm. Plus, for a limited time, enjoy a complimentary Jasmine Cooler mocktail with every set!

The starter platter comes with chicken with black truffle, Marinated cucumber, and that melt-in-your-mouth Barbecue Iberico Pork!

And instead of one main there‚Äôs three:
- crispy Wok-Fried Prawn, coated with Rainbow Quinoa.
- steamed Garoupa Fillet with Vermicelli
- Fish Maw, Shredded Chicken and Udon.

I was so full but satisfied too. we end off the meal with their Guava Sago Soup & Mango Glutinous Rice Roll, that‚Äôs refreshing and not too sweet

Very nice ambience with delicious Chinese cuisine.

Highly recommend the apple wood Peking duck, make sure you call in and reserve it.
The steam tiger garoupa was also excellent.

They have a range of cocktails with Chinese elements.

Overall a great venue to bring your parents for a indulgent Chinese dinner

Celebrated my mother‚Äôs birthday here last year, and the experience was exceptional.

Reservations were fully booked online, but while at MBS, we approached the reception staff, who promised to try her best, though with no guarantees. To our delight, we received a call the next day confirming our booking, along with the confirmation of pre-order of all three ‚Äústar‚Äù dishes that required advance preparation. Truly commendable service!

The food impressed with its bold flavors and modern take on traditional recipes. The roast was beautifully smoked and well-executed, while the dim sum, though standard, was still worth trying.

A memorable celebration, made even better by the attentive service. Thank you for making it happen despite the initial full booking!

Nice place with HK/ Szechuan style dishes.
Food (In order of taste)
Char Siu was amazing, soft and caramelised.
Saliva chicken very tasty as well, perfect spice.
Asparagus was tasty.
Jelly fish cucumber salad was pretty good cold dish as well, savoury, crunchy with a bit of zest.
Hanami Cocktails were great.
Lobster mapo tofu and claypot rice (they call it fried rice) was so-so, desserts were decent, nothing particularly special.

Atmosphere:
Absolutely gorgeous, very modern and chic looking interior. Very special style of designs that blend well together.

Service:
Great service as well

I ordered the three-course set lunch ($48++), choosing Lobster Scramble as the starter, Coconut Beef Curry Rice as the main, and Orange and Chocolate for dessert. As a special touch, they served an additional ice cream on toast free of ‚Ä¶

Visited Siri house for my anniversary and birthday. The atmosphere was calming and the interior was pretty! Furthermore I felt at ease although the restaurant was quite full. Lastly the staff there were really attentive to our needs. Shoutout to the female staff, donna (overheard her name being called) for being really nice too!

I love their free flow brunch, got to taste different types of food and they were delicious. Love their cocktails - ordered the Siri Original and Kyuri Sour. Their service was also great, gave us the space, very warm welcoming and flexible and polite. Thank you so much for the great food and hospitality!

A night of real gastronomic treat for us ladies. We have been looking forward to the night after I booked it with Sharon, my beautiful owner and friend.

The pictures speak for themselves but I still gotta rave about it!

From starters to mains to desserts, each rightly perfected.
A‚Äôs top dish is the starter named ‚Äòbikini‚Äô. Nothing sexy but the surprising display and flavours put together totally matches her inner child‚Äôs palate. The complexities within in a simple and pure showcase.
A & B both picked the uni pasta as their top choice. Every strand of pasta was nicely glazed with the rich gravy dripping tinges of uni. It was really all gravy and groovy to us all.
My personal favourite is the KFC (Korean Fried Cauliflower). Somehow the clever concoction of gochujang, spam crisps and toasted sesame transforms a simple vegetable into a magical dish. I‚Äôm
Excited to try my other favourite vegetables- Broccolini and Brussels sprouts next.
I have to give a special mention to our plate of oysters - these babies from Hokkaido as Chef Ivan intro-  were so fresh and succulent.  Pretty much slurped them all up in no time.
Thanks for the fabulous dishes whipped up by chef Ivan and the wonderful service team at Siri House. The food as a whole was delectably enjoyable.
Perfect setting for us ladies to freely enjoy the whole wine and dine experience together.
The free flow of wines and bubbles was merely the tip of the iceberg.
Little did we know that the best part was to be the desserts, which anyone should always have a spare room for.
How do they taste as good as they look? The 3 items were so pretty in their own way, we were admiring so hard that we almost couldn‚Äôt bear to ruin the aesthetic display. But we simply couldn‚Äôt resist sinking our teeth into those delightful desserts. Brought our sweet moments to another level.
Life is sweet after all to end off the night.

I ordered the three-course set lunch ($48++), choosing Lobster Scramble as the starter, Coconut Beef Curry Rice as the main, and Orange and Chocolate for dessert. As a special touch, they served an additional ice cream on toast free of charge since one of us was celebrating a birthday.
The food was excellent and uniquely flavored‚Äîdistinct from the usual tastes found elsewhere. The service was truly five-star. Overall, it was an enjoyable meal in a great environment with outstanding service.

Had a lovely birthday dinner at Siri House. We ordered the uni cream pasta, beef short rib, and sourdough with kombu butter. The sourdough was heavenly! Crispy on the edges, soft inside, and full of flavour. The beef short rib was tender and perfectly cooked, with a rich, savoury sauce. The uni pasta had fresh scallops and a tasty creamy sauce, though it got a bit gelak after a while.

The service was fantastic too, staffs were friendly, attentive, and gave great recommendations. It's a great spot for a special night out!

Lunch with clients. Really enjoyed the place. Pretty crowded for a weekday but could be due to it being Valentine's Day. Had. the scallop ceviche to start which wasn't too bad. Really enjoyed the pork cheek don for my main though. Portions were pretty decent and the price for the set lunch was reasonable

First time visited here for our anniversary celebration. Ambience is perfectly nice. Less crowded could be due to weekday. Service staffs are very attentive. Food and drinks were great. Comfy seats setup and chill music playing at the background. One of the best restaurants I ever been to in Singapore. Try on their scallop for starters. The red curry sea bass and lamb tenderloin from Mains are good as well! Last but not least thank you for preparing us a cake for our anniversary! Sweet act from the restaurant :)
Service was amazing. Recommend the scallop appetiser. Portion was on the small side

Over priced ban Mian, not much ingredients per se, atmosphere is quite bad cos aircon like not working, so damn hot. The drink is super sweet especially the teh o hot, the chilli is quite unique and not so spicy. Servicing time takes like a while, and person calls your number continuously without using the queue system? Just find it slightly weird

I had high expectations of this restaurant but was disappointed when I visited as they were out of the chicken mousaka as well as all fish dishes when we were there.

Definitely a very pricey restaurant, so was a bit dejected that we couldn‚Äôt try the dishes we went there for. For the food, the prawn orzo was really delicious! And as expected, dips and pita are a must have. The octopus is really interesting, it is not chewy like normal octopus and was really easy to bite through.

The restaurant was lovely, not too crowded so we could chat easily. And staff were friendly and helpful when we asked for more water.

I really want to give a higher rating, but it is really a shame to travel specially to a restaurant and not be able to order what we wanted to try. Would recommend calling the restaurant to check before going down if you are really eyeing any specific dish.

Opted for the Taramasalata dip ($20.50+) to go with the Grilled Pita ($5.50) and Koulouri Bread ($7.50). There is the option of three dips but we found it to be overly pricey at $43.50+ and decided to make do with one. Really enjoyed everything, just need to be quick when consuming the bread as it hardens overtime.

We also ordered the Meat Platter Small ($112.50+) to try abit of all the different proteins. The clear winner would be the lamb chop, I would definitely order this specifically for future visits. I was not a fan of the chicken skewer as it was quite tough. The bifteki, which is a meat patty, was not bad and grew on me with subsequent bites. The beef was okay.

For dessert, we got the Baklava ($17.50+). As we were quite full, we ate half here and took away the other two pieces. Surprisingly, it tasted much better chilled in the fridge overnight and softened slightly, which was great because it was really hard to bite.

Desmond was the highlight of our day! Such a cheer and happy guy spreading his positive energy to everyone in the room. I have not seen such a happy guy smiling ear to ear for a long long time! He was thoughtful and observant. He saw that we are hot and fanning and he automatically turn on the fan for us! Such great service is really hard to come by these days! Food wise, big portion and yummy! Nothing to complain about.

Had a reservation at this cozy and beautifully decorated restaurant with a 2-hour dining limit. The restaurant caters to various dietary needs, offering gluten-free, dairy-free, vegetarian, vegan, and keto-friendly options. ‚Ä¶

This was my third or fourth time here. My last visit was quite awhile back. The food, ambience, and service here are very good! Parking is free! Place tends to get crowded and there‚Äôs sometimes a queue, so it‚Äôs wise to make a reservation before heading down. Had the dips and bread, octopus, sea bass, spinach pastries, and finally, baklava for dessert! Everything was great! Octopus was nice and tasty + tender, sea bass was fresh, all the pastries were warm and the Greek coffee we had to end the meal was pretty good too! Will be back here again to try more food! Hopefully sooner than later! Highly recommended for authentic Greek Mediterranean food! Fantastic experience every visit!

Been here thrice already and still really enjoy their food! We usually get some dips to share - the Harissa is a fan favourite (spicy tomato). The roasted eggplant is also really flavourful and has a nice texture (not completely smooth).

We got their grilled octopus the first time we went but I wasn‚Äôt particularly impressed (also not cheap) but it‚Äôs quite alright. Roasted veggies / Vegetables of the Day has never disappointed. They‚Äôre juicy and well-seasoned. Typically, it comes with some Zucchini, Peppers, Broccoli etc.

We tried their Tomato soup (soup of the day) recently and it was really creamy - not something I fancy but was interesting to try.

The outside seating area is dog friendly!

What an awesome place to enjoy a meal, especially as a group, since the dishes are perfect for sharing! The atmosphere is really nice, with a beautiful backdrop of lush greenery and an interior filled with plants that creates a wonderful, relaxing vibe.

All the dishes we tried were tasty and so well presented. The absolute highlight of our meal was the tropical scallop ceviche pictured here - it was incredibly fresh and flavorful. Highly recommended for a delicious and out-of-the-ordinary Peruvian dining experience!

Passed by few times but didn't try. Finally this time we did, and no regrets at all!

Recommend to reserve your seats.
Location, right at Dempsey so ideal for those with car and free parking. A little challenging for the rest, there are public buses but need to walk in. There's free shuttle buses to the area, check out the time table and pick up locations.

Service: excellent. Good recommendations for the food and friendly, professional. Very helpful.

Food; yummy yummy! Tried two types of tacos the lamb and fish. So good. The street food beef skewers are really good.

The seafood menu: must try the fish. It's really good, seabass.

The pork ribs very good too!

Dessert: the coconut cake is really good very interesting. We had the cream by the side just in case. But having it onto the cake is really nice. So if you want, do request to have the cream by the side

Recommend to order the food to share.

Interior design is nice and comfortable.

This is hands-down the only Peruvian restaurant I know of in Singapore, an absolute hidden gem for someone like me who has travelled to South America and loves Peruvian food. I‚Äôve already been back several times.
My favourite ceviche here is the Aquachile Tropical. The Hokkaido scallops were incredibly sweet and tender, beautifully complemented by the vibrant pineapple aguachile, tangy passion fruit chalaquita, and juicy mango. Every bite was refreshing and bursting with flavour. The Nikkei Tuna is also excellent, with a beautiful balance of flavors and textures.
And then there‚Äôs my ultimate favourite, their Peruvian-style seafood rice. Creamier and more risotto-like than a Spanish paella, it comes loaded with scallop in shell, prawns, calamari and fish, all cooked in a rich sauce of Peruvian panca chilli, tomatoes, white wine and cheese. The seafood is incredibly fresh, the portion generous, and every bite bursts with briny sweetness and umami. The mariscada is just as good.
Oh, and spotting Peru‚Äôs national drinks - Chicha Morada and Inka Kola - on the menu during my first visit was such a delightful surprise.
Highly recommended!

Good experience overall, place is nice and the location has some cool options. Food was good, but not great, I will come back to try a few more dishes later.

Ceviche is good. Lomo saltado is ok but comes without rice (as typically does). Patacones and yucas are a bit small in my opinion.

July 2025:
Returned for a celebration and this time around the food impressed more!
Didn‚Äôt really like the steak.
Others were good -
Chorizo was one of my fav
Prawn too

2022:
Came here for a birthday celebration!
Ordered the duck taco and it comes with this crazy spicy sauce that was tasty!
We also tried the octopus, and seafood soup. The Seafood soup was pretty sour - not really my kind of taste. The octopus sauce was good! Got a free desert too for the birthday person. We ordered the Coconut cake with cream and that was an absolute delight!

I wanted to take a couple pic with the big green outside to commemorate the date but the waiter seem to prefer to stay indoors.  I feel that the waiter could go a little out of his way to step outside  to take a pic for us.
Nonetheless 3/4 of the food were tasty!

Made reservations to celebrate our anniversary as we had a great experience previously. First up, the tuna tostadas had great flavors and came in a decent portion. The Aguachile tropical - Hokkaido scallops was pretty disappointing. It was ‚Ä¶

Had an amazing meal at Canchita to celebrate my boyfriends birthday. We ordered the Classic Ceviche, Seafood rice and the Octopus A La Brasa, and the restaurant served us complimentary bread to start. All 3 dishes we ordered were amazing and cooked to perfection, extremely flavourful and overall pretty mind blowing. My boyfriend‚Äôs favourite was the seafood rice, while mine was the ceviche. These two dishes are definitely a must order when you‚Äôre there!

Ambience was nice too. The only not so positive feedback I have is that I wish the staff were slightly more attentive to our table! We found ourselves having to wait pretty long for our dishes to arrive and for water. It was difficult for us to find anyone to call as there wasn‚Äôt sufficient people on the floor.

Nonetheless, the food here was delicious, and I will be back to try out other dishes for sure! :-)

My Take on Thevar

„ÄêThe Dress Code Drama„Äë
So, we showed up at Thevar totally unaware about some dress code reminder they sent out. Theyre super strict about dressing smart. I mean, tons of Michelin-starred places has this rule, but most dont make a big deal if you rock up in shorts or whatever. Not Thevar‚Ä¶they hit you with a $50 charge to borrow long pants! Compare that to a place like Les Amis, where theyll hook you up a pair of new pants for free. We ended up wasting like half an hour going back home and coming back to sort out this pant situation, which was such a buzzkill. I later heard that it was some French foodie YouTubers who trashed Thevars staff because they had seen people dining in shorts and accused Thevar as undeserving of their michelin stars. Honestly, why are these guys staring at peoples legs under the table instead of enjoying they‚Äôre food? It totally threw off my dinner vibe. No other fancy restaurant we been to has sent us back to change clothes. they care more about you having a good time. And here‚Äôs the thing: the decor‚Äôs all warm and cozy, like you‚Äôre at someone‚Äôs home, but this stickler attitude about long pants and the staff‚Äôs stiff vibe (except for one guy, more on that later) just didn‚Äôt match that welcoming feel at all.

„ÄêThe Vibe Was Off„Äë
After that rough start, things didn‚Äôt get much better with the atmosphere. The background music was cranked up like we were at some Clarke Quay bar, not a Michelin-starred spot. Plus, the dining areas all one big room, so you hear *everything* from other tables. There was these two ladies laughing and chatting so loud the whole night, it was impossible to tune out. Like, what was so hilarious? It felt like they didn‚Äôt care about anyone else trying to enjoy their meal. I was annoyed that Thevar seemed more obsessed with enforcing they‚Äôre dress code than keeping the noise in check. Shorts under a table? Barely noticable. But loud music and cackling? That hits everyone. It really messed with my dining experience. The cozy, homey decor made you expect a chill, warm vibe, but the strict rules and most of the staff acting all robotic totally clashed with that. However One server, Elgin, was a total gem, he treated us like friends and made us feel right at home, unlike the others who seemed like they were just going through the motions.

„ÄêThe Food Saved the Day„Äë
Okay, but lets talk about the food. It was honestly awesome and pulled me out of my grumpy mood. The dishes looked and tasted amazing, and the lamb? So tender and just perfect. A couple of courses was a bit salty, but nothing too bad. I went for the chefs special (king crab) and a masala tea as extras, and both were totally worth it.
In fact the king crab was unreal, tasting like baby lotus root. It is so unique and delicious. but there was this small piece of cartilage in it that should‚Äôve been removed. The attention to detail could be improved. Still, the food was a highlight. Plus, the price was super reasonable, way lower than what you typically see at other Michelin two-star or even one-star restaurants, and the service from Elgin especially was on point. The food and drinks really turned things around and made me focus on the good stuff.

Food was excellent! But it is a tad bit more expensive than the other fine dining places but it‚Äôs worth trying once. We had the tasting course for dinner and my tummy was practically bursting at the end of the night!
We started off being served with the snacks - idli, chaat, pork & puri. My favourite was the tomato heirloom chaat! The different flavours just bursts in your mouth and the tomato is very appetising. Honestly this was a very good starter as it made me look forward to the rest of my meal.
We were then served the French turbot, lobster, chicken and guava gujiya. The French turbot had an interesting flavour in it and it was the best among the 4. Unfortunately the lobster was tough and chewy so we didn‚Äôt enjoy it. Chicken roti was deliciously savoury - the bread was crispy and it goes very well with the chicken whose flavours are very well mixed.
The lamb was the highlight (apart from the chaat) of the night and the briyani that goes with it was so good! We even asked for additional serving (which is probably why my dress was practically bursting at the end of the night). I really enjoyed the thogayal as it was very different from the conventional ones.
Dessert was just alright for me as I‚Äôm usually more of a pastry/ cake kind of person rather than ice cream.

Service was excellent and the wine serving (got the wine pairing) was generous too!

Had dinner here for the first time and it was a fantastic experience. Great vibes, staff were super friendly and both the drinks and the food were amazing. My wife is a Celiac and they were super helpful with gluten free options and we're able to do most of the menu for her. Highly recommended!

I was there to celebrate my birthday with my partner and this is my very first time to try out modern Izakaya food/dining. I must say I am extremely impressed with the service and food here especially "the guy with
the bun" who serve us, thank you so much for the recommendation and you made us feel sooo welcome here. (Please give him a raise/bonus/recognitionüòâ He deserve it!) and thank you Chef Sean for the amazing food, lovely cake and free shot! üòç

We ordered our classic aperitif Negroni for a start, amazingly on point. Kudos to the bartender. Overall the ambiance was pretty cool with a laid back vibe. Definitely a good place to enjoy for some good drinks/ and lip smacking food.

A must order:
-Tokyo Hummus serve with curry chips (soooo smooth and creamy and we love the idea of using edamamme instead of chickpea)

-Uni and bone marrow (literally melt in your mouth sooo good!)

-Duck Gyoza =foie gras with orange ginger ponzu (loving it really give a nice balance flavour that is not overpowering the foie gras)

Thanks for making a memorable birthday experience for me and I will be back for sure!

Spent my birthday here with a nice dinner! Service was top notch - friendly, approachable, very ease-free and recommended a good portion as well as the best sellers. Tokyo Hummus and Wagyu Sando was so good , wished I had space for second servings but will definitely be back!

Always enjoy my visits to The Spot be it for drinks only or for food. Good vibes, nice ambience. Food and service are great. Staff are friendly and service efficient. Special shout out to Winnie, who was very attentive and takes initiative to make our dining experience more pleasant. Hiring the right people is indeed more important than training them. I believe that's what makes The Spot such a popular and successful spot!
Food recommendation: Cheese Bread, Crabcake, Lobster Pasta, Scallops.

Third visit here. I don't visit this place unless there's promo cos i feel it's overpriced for the quality. Came because i had the kris+ 1 for 1 birthday privilege. Was planning to let my family try this place. As there are 4 of us, i called to check if the 1 for 1 can be used with the 3 course set lunch, a staff checked with another staff (manager?) she said yes, and i reconfirmed this cos some restaurants are pretty strict about this, and she said can.

When i arrived and checked again with the staff before ordering, the manager on duty, however, said no. I argued for a bit because i called to ask and another staff said yes (my mistake was not getting the staff's name or recording our convo). He insisted no, and was not apologetic at all.

It was my birthday that day and i was really mad but as i was there with my family, we ordered 2 main courses and 2 small plates.

The small plates were so small our mouths dropped open when it came. 3 scallops for 30+, 4 tiger prawns  (which was quite small compared to those my mum get at the market) at around 30+ iirc, the taste was above average, but this is way overpriced.

The lobster linguine was not bad, but i wouldn't pay 52+ for just 2 small pieces of lobster. Arteastique lobster pasta comes with 1 huge full lobster and it is 38+. If it wasn't for the 1 for 1 i wouldn't visit... cos we were not even full after our meal. This place is clearly targeted at the expats staying there.

I hope the management can ensure that all staff are aware of the promos happening and the T&Cs of it, provide more value for money food, and imprive their service quality. The attitude of the manager on duty (an indian gentleman) was disappointing. At least apologise for the miscommunication from ur staff.

Reserve here for Chirstmas lunch and need to deposit with your credit card. Food overall ok but not really the best relative to the price. Strip loin  well done is very dry and overcooked. Scallops sauced with curry hence a bit surprised. Gnocchi is made with very strong blue cheese smell.

Beautiful restaurant with a really nice bar and great service staff. They really took the initiative to give my bestie and I a good birthday experience. They automatically gave her a birthday cake (chocolate was so rich and it was so good ‚Ä¶

Just moved in at Bijou and found this very very nice place, coffee and food was delicious, give a try to Kimchi tuna sandwich on sourdough, it‚Äôs amazing.
Was happy to know that residents do have discount. Will definitely come again to try everything in the menu ü•∞

While the culinary experience and atmospheric concept at NOX were commendable, my visit was marred by deeply disappointing service. During the meal, my phone screen briefly lit up due to an urgent call from home (my mother had suffered a ‚Ä¶

While the culinary experience and atmospheric concept at NOX were commendable, my visit was marred by deeply disappointing service. During the meal, my phone screen briefly lit up due to an urgent call from home (my mother had suffered a fall, and I was unable to return the call for two hours). Instead of showing empathy, the staff reprimanded me harshly, which felt unnecessary and insensitive. Another diner (a Western gentleman) also contributed to the discomfort by loudly voicing his complaints, adding to the unpleasantness.

Though the food and ambiance were enjoyable, the S$300 price tag raises expectations for professionalism and courtesy, which were sorely lacking. A single star reflects this imbalance between cost and service quality. Moving forward, I hope the team exercises greater understanding and discretion‚Äîacknowledging that patrons may have valid reasons for minor disruptions‚Äîbefore publicly chastising them. An apology for this experience would be appropriate.

I had the opportunity to dine at Summer Pavilion at The Ritz-Carlton, Singapore, and it was a memorable experience overall. We ordered the Hyacinth Dinner Menu with some customisations ‚Äî swapping the barbecued suckling pig for Iberico pork with honey sauce, and the stewed pork for braised duck (from the Peking duck we also ordered separately).

From the start, we were served a refreshing plum juice with strong, appetising sour notes, and sugar-coated cashews that were not overly sweet ‚Äî a lovely way to begin the meal. The lychee oolong tea also deserves praise ‚Äî aromatic with a good balance of floral and earthy tones, pairing well with the savoury dishes throughout.

Highlights:

Peking duck: Crispy skin, nicely complemented by spring onions, cucumber, sauce, and Êò•È•º. Portions of condiments were slightly limited but replenishable on request.

Iberico pork: Sweet with honey glaze, tender with good marbling. Portion was small, but quality was top-notch.

Double-boiled sea whelk soup: Rich, flavourful, and nourishing. The nostoc algae added an interesting berry-like texture.

Steamed Dong Xing grouper: Fresh, clean taste, complemented by a surprisingly light and well-balanced sauce. The dried beancurd skin was a standout.

Poached rice with lobster: The broth was generous, almost too much for the small amount of rice, but flavourful nonetheless. A comforting dish, though the lobster didn‚Äôt particularly stand out.

Some dishes were a little on the heavier side ‚Äî particularly the scallops and abalone, where the sauces, although tasty, were thick and left a cloying mouthfeel, needing tea to refresh the palate. The same applied to the braised duck (which we requested in place of the pork) ‚Äî well-executed but understandably rich due to the nature of duck meat.

The dessert course was a delightful way to end: a chilled mango sago with pomelo that was light and refreshing.

The service was excellent ‚Äî warm, attentive, and thoughtful. Staff kindly waited for us to take photos before portioning and serving, and they were accommodating with our dish modifications.

The ambience was elegant and peaceful. Our table by the window allowed for a spacious, open feel, and the overall atmosphere was calm and suitable for intimate gatherings or celebrations.

Overall: While no single dish was groundbreaking, the consistent quality, fresh ingredients, and refined presentation made the experience special. It's a place where you can enjoy an elevated Chinese meal in a refined setting, especially for special occasions. The price point is steep, but justifiable considering the location, service, and quality of ingredients.

Came here twice, once on the 15th of cny in 2022 and april 2025 Enjoyed the food the cutlery and tea :) scallop was great and the soup is da best finished every drop. The duck was hard so i didnt take any photos. The crispy white bait fish was always ordered

Went for a birthday celebration during weekday lunchtime and was surprised that it was almost packed. Despite this, it was not noisy because there was ample space between the tables and it didn't feel cramped or uncomfortable. This is very much welcomed because a lot of Chinese restaurants tend to be jam packed and the din can make it difficult to have a decent conversation.

Since this is a Michelin one-star fine dining place, it seemed like there was an effort put into the selection of utensils and plates used. Personally, I felt that the black and white version looked classy while the other colours felt a bit odd.

The appetiser was a dish of sweetened cashew nuts which again was quite different from most appetisers at Chinese restaurants that tend to be on the savoury side. Usually, I don't touch the appetisers at all but I finished this in no time.

As for the dim sum, the general consensus was that some dishes fared better than the others i.e. deep fried lobster roll and sweet corn prawn dumplings. Opinions were split for the other dim sum - some felt that the skin of the dumplings was too thick while the prawn filling was fresh and flavourful. The lingzhi dumpling was a tad lacklustre and lacked a wow factor. The abalone dumpling in clear broth also had a mixed bag of reviews - the broth's abalone umami was felt to be a bit fishy by some while others relished it.

On the other hand, the dishes were more well-received than the dim sum. The pomelo chicken pot was delicious but the pomelo's flavour was probably fully absorbed by the dish to the extent that the fruit no longer bore any resemblance to its original taste and texture. The braised vegetables with mushrooms would go very well with plain rice since it was a bit on the salty side but still could be eaten on its own. As for the poached rice with lobster and poached fish noodles with lobster,  the former was more well-received.

Since we were celebrating a birthday, there was a prosperity buns platter given for free and we bought a slice of cake from Colony which was added to it. The staff helped us to cut the cake and served it together with the buns.

Special mention goes to the staff Laura and Sky who were very polite and prompt with their service. They definitely made the dining experience a lot more pleasant.

Overall, I thought that the food was good with some misses which probably were due to personal preferences. The prices are definitely higher than the norm so whether you find this worth it or not probably hinges on whether the taste is to your liking.

Food: üåùüåùüåùüåùüåù
Service: üåùüåùüåùüåùüåù
Ambience: üåùüåùüåùüåùüåù

A wonderful dining experience from start to finish. Special thanks to Wai Ling and Ping Jie for their professionalism and kind service, which made the meal memorable.

Impressive attention to detail - GF soya sauce was served when we requested for the GF menu.

For those with GF/allergen-free requirements, the service staff are attentive with good suggestions to swop out ingredients, and the chef kindly accommodated our requests for allergen-free dishes.

Dishes are on-point, delicious without excessive seasoning which would mask the taste of the fresh ingredients. Overall a top-notch Chinese restaurant worth visiting over and over again üëç

The staff good service ..food and environment niceüëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª
Thanks for the Kim free beer üç∫ ‚Ä¶

The staff good service ..food and environment niceüëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª
Thanks for the Kim free beer üç∫

Mother day dinner. A day worth celebrating for.

Research and found this nice little place called the ranch. ‚Ä¶

Mother day dinner. A day worth celebrating for.

Research and found this nice little place called the ranch.

Did a booking  and here we are sitting and enjoying the dinner setup.

Ribeye 300g medium rare is decent. Everything is correct.

Pork ribs, well it got what it takes. International standards apply. If you got what I mean

Lastly reconstructed tiramisu. Sorry this one I can't concord.

And that nice wine from Rutherford. That was a +1

Here we go. If you need to get a fixup for fine dining.

Go ahead and book this place.

Love the service here, staff are very friendly, professional and attentive. Celebrated my hubby‚Äôs birthday here and they gave a small cake for us to celebrate! They were very attentive and advised on the raw food to us as I was pregnant. Cos fish with Miso is fantastic! Hubby had the wagyu sirloin and it does not disappoint him.
Even the side dish are of quality ingredients. Menu lights up! Which is cool! Appetizer scallop carpaccio is fresh and flavourful! Crabcake was good too! Not too floury.

Celebrate my dad‚Äôs bday. Had the most wonderful service. Gave is an appetizer on the house and a free dessert as well! Highly reccomend the foie gras!
Thank you Derek!

I missed those days enjoying their Hokkaido wagyu steak at their previous Clarke Quay outlet. I decided to give this outlet at Purvis street a try to satisfy my steak crave. The recommended Japanese black A3 Wagyu Cube-roll cap is tender and has a right amount of fat. The 300g portion is actually quite filling for two pax. While it is a smaller place compared to the previous outlet at Clarke Quay, it is cozy and romantically decorated for a special evening night out. A satisfying meal with a bottle of Portuguese red at quite a reasonable price.

Celebrated the husband‚Äôs birthday at Braci and the dining experience exceeded my expectation.

It was a cosy resturant situated along boat quay. We had the 5 course dinner($168++ per pax) and opted for wine-pairing ($148++ per pax). For the appetizer, we topped up for the Foie Gras Semifreddo ($22 per pax).

Every course was on point. I love foie gras while the hub loved the scallop pasta. It was one great meal to end a working weekday. Wouldn‚Äôt mind revisiting to try their executive lunch!

Total bill came up to $800ish for two pax.

Quite an amazing experience as the small but open kitchen is actually right in your face (if you are sitting indoors) and you get to see a LOT of chefs busy at work. Dishes that stood out for me were the micro lasagna appetiser, the 100-year old balsamic and the twirly pasta with the most SUCCULENT scallops I have ever eaten üòô The place could have been better with nicer decor and ambience (it was abit too claustrophobic for me)

A delightful meal served via an unorthodox Italian methodology.

I don't recall a time when I was not stuffed after patronising a great Italian joint. Braci was an exception, for good reasons. I was held back by my dinner companion from going the full distance. We ordered the 5 course instead of the 7. But it came with plenty of in betweens that made the dinner special.

The chef did a lot of justice to the seasonal ingredient. Almost all the dishes were mind blowing and the one that stood out the most was the ice cream pate with kumquat jam. Very memorable. I'll let the pictures do the rest of the food talking.

The service is attentive. The big bonus of the night was the nice cool weather which made our outdoor seating extra pleasant.

5 stars!!

This place has been on my list for the longest time, but someone never got to it.  My wife and I dad a wonderful weekday afternoon celebrating her birthday there - one of the best fine dining lunches I‚Äôve had, ever!  This is one of the very few restaurants with the full degustation menu available for lunch AND dinner.  It was a small place; vibe was friendly, warm and cosy, nearly all tables right next to an open kitchen.  Great to see the team at work and the camaraderie.  It was particularly nice to have Chef Matteo serve and explain most of his creations - he provided insight into the inspirations, ingredients and techniques behind them.  We were blown away by the complexity yet congruity and balance of the multiple layers of tastes and textures.  Pasta was satisfyingly perfect (we had scampi and seasonal white truffle) - we will come back even if just for this  The desserts were also extremely well executed and clearly not an afterthought.  What‚Äôs more, also a rarity, Braci offers gluten-free/light options.  Only little room for improvement: we wish the portions would be a little bit bigger (yes, despite the 7 courses + bread)!

After the wonderful and memorable lunch I had at Braci many years ago, I have been thinking of going back again. And the International Women‚Äôs Day Special at Braci gave me the exact motivation to push aside all my commitments, prior plans and beauty appointment to come here to enjoy these specially curated dishes, with southeast Asian influences, created by the female chefs at Braci. This is one of the best dining experiences I have.

Instead of serving pure Italian food for the special occasion, the dishes in the menu feature European cuisine with Southeast Asian influences, inspired by the chefs‚Äô backgrounds. I totally love it. There are so many flavours packed in beautiful harmony within each dish, It is complex and spellbinding.

I opt to dien at the exciting rooftop bar with a quaint bar counter and 270 ¬∞ panoramic unblocked view of the Singapore River, the landscape of Marina Bay and skyline of the city. It is so breathtaking, and the soft breeze blowing makes it even better Yes, I feel like I‚Äôm living it up when dining here.

The service is exceptional, impeccable and friendly, completing the exceptional experience of savouring awesome food with awesome ambience and service.

Makan Makan by Chef Li Vian is a lovely trio of Tom Kha Kai, Corn Tarlet and Scallop Semifreddo. I love the transition from simulating taste of Tom Kha Kai to smokiness of Corn Tarlet, and finally to luxurious treat of Scallop Semifreddo.

Suan Ni Bai Rou by Chef Aaron is one of the best pork dish I have. With the pork belly soaked with wine, sprinkled with fried shallots, paired with umami rich Sakura Ebi Furikake and zesty cool Cucumber Snow, the medley of rich flavours is amazing.

Aglio&Olio, But I don't like Garlic is very interestingly named by its creater, Chef Yoke. Given a twist to Braci's signature 32 Egg Yolks Tagliolini with creamy sweet Bafun Uni, which is by the way the best pasta, garlic foam and hamaguri clams are added for the extra oomph in taste and crunchy texture. The Tagliolini here is a must-try.

Tropical Tart by Pastry Chef Yasmin is a delightful dessert made up of mango mousse, passion fruit and coconut sorbet. Full of nuanced flavours, it tastes refreshing and rich at the same time. I love it.

Thoughts: Amazing Beautiful Experience that hits all the Sweet Spots

The food is displayed luxuriously and artistically, the taste is also exquisite with well balanced flavours, an absolute treat to the palette. The salmon which I had was well seared and the mash potato coupled with a dash of chili crab ‚Ä¶

The food is displayed luxuriously and artistically, the taste is also exquisite with well balanced flavours, an absolute treat to the palette. The salmon which I had was well seared and the mash potato coupled with a dash of chili crab sauce balanced out the creamy taste of the mash potato perfectly.

The durian flan was also aesthetically presented when served though the caramel is diabetically sweet, perhaps can balance the taste out a bit better in future.

However the service crew for some is slightly green I suppose as there were some confusion in getting the orders correct and remembering who ordered what, for which a fine dining restaurant could consider more training in that aspect.

The restaurant is inside The Sultan hotel. It's decoration setting is very cool and beautifully done up, at a new place with beautiful ambience. It's not very crowded. The food was really good. The server, Azli, was doing a great job in explaining the concept of dining in this restaurant. All the food was fresh, tasty and exquisite. The best is the free flow of lemon tea. Good desserts too. Worth the wait.

Went here for high tea on my birthday and had the loveliest experience! The staff were so friendly and even surprised me with a free slice of cake, which made my day extra special. Delicious treats, great atmosphere, and wonderful service. highly recommend!

First time eat Nong Geng Ji  @ Orchard gateway branch , surprisingly it was good and delicious. Worth to eat , the server especially Boon was helpful too. Thanks for the great service . Join the free membership to get extras 50% dishes . Will sure come back again üëç ‚Ä¶

Quite a good experience with the food quality and service. Food is tasty but can be a little spicy for some who are not accustomed to the favouring. Lots of garlic used in the cooking, which adds to the delicious taste. Service is great, and minimum wait if you go during off-peak hours.
Serving portions are big (even the drinks), so you might want to place your orders sparingly first, and when the dishes are served, judge for yourself before ordering more.
The ‚Äúicing on the cake‚Äù is the free ice-cream that you can help yourselves to, after your meals, which are both tasty and refreshing.

First time eat Nong Geng Ji  @ Orchard gateway branch , surprisingly it was good and delicious. Worth to eat , the server especially Boon was helpful too. Thanks for the great service . Join the free membership to get extras 50% dishes . Will sure come back again üëç

Had a pleasant dining experience with, but the food didn‚Äôt quite meet my expectations. The restaurant is not that big or spacious.

The stir-fried sliced pork with green peppers was quite oily but still flavourful. I enjoyed the steamed prawns with rice vermicelli, freshly cooked on the spot. The stir-fried romaine lettuce was average, and the sauerkraut fish was too sour and still quite spicy, even after requesting it to be mild.

I think the only thing that was truly tasty is the dessert that I ordered. It‚Äôs called fried glutinous rice dumplings stuffed with sweet mochi inside and sprinkled with salty black sesame powder on top. It‚Äôs sweet and savoury at the same time. It‚Äôs an interesting combination. It‚Äôs quite similar to the dough fritters texture and taste.

Some dishes were hit some were miss. Overall a tad pricey, The sauerkraut fish was good, had enoki mushrooms, veg and fish was decent, soft and had a good bite. The prawn snd vermicelli was Yums too, prawns came raw and had to wait 7mind for it to cook. The grass cooked fish was super bad tho, we followed their policy and changed for another dish. The fish there was chewy and just bad. The preserved pork was salty and oily, so is the long bean. Minced meat steam egg was also salty and pretty normal. Lotus root was also just meh. Wanted to order the century egg dish but was sold out, drinks were huge in size and also more ex at $4.90, came in limited quantities. The gua pork with preserved veg was ok, fat was pretty melt in the mouth but meat was on the tougher side, pretty oily too. Could order rice in a pressure cooker (serves about 3-4) and rice was nice.
Service was great, they were fast and prompt. They have some interesting deals for members too, free to join, included some rebates and free dishes and deals on birthday month.
Came with free flow ice cream, there was only coconut, yam and corn flavors tho.

The food really taste good with the right amount of spiciness level. The veggie is fresh and crunchy. They also have a free flow ice cream and the flavours are all good too. Will definitely come back.

You can smell the fragrance of their wok fried dishes from a mile away.

Fresh ingredients that are seasoned and cooked to perfection. Their screw pepper pork dish with baby abalones can rival, or I might even say is better than, Xiang Xiang's version. Offers complimentary ice cream as well.

Service is good, but Xiang Xiang is a tad bit better imho. Membership is free, and members get a 30% off voucher on their birthday month.

Will definitely visit again!

Nong Geng Ji @ Orchardgateway is a top spot for authentic Hunan cuisine, delivering bold, fiery flavors true to its roots. I came for lunch and left impressed ‚Äî the dishes packed real heat and depth, just as they should.

Founded in 2017 by Chef Feng Guohua in Shenzhen, Nong Geng Ji has grown rapidly with over 100 outlets across China, gaining a loyal following for its rustic Hunan home-style cooking. The Singapore Orchardgateway branch, opened in November 2024, is its second outlet locally and introduces private dining rooms for 8‚Äì10 guests ‚Äî a first for the brand here. These rooms offer a more refined experience with exclusive menu items like Braised Kampung Chicken with Golden Abalones and Steamed Carp Fish Head with Chopped Chili.

Rated 5 out of 5 ‚Äî Nong Geng Ji is a strong pick for anyone after serious spice, quality ingredients, and a taste of southern China done right.

Reviews seemed hyped up but personally found the food just average; the cooking style is generally very oily and salty. Was there for lunch on a weekend, lots of seats. Observed that it starts getting filled up around 1pm onwards. Do reserve in advance if you want to avoid the ques. Scan QR at the table to place order.
1) Stir-Fried Pork with Abalone and Chilli Combo: enjoyed the tiny chewy Abalone pieces dry fried wth pork, gren chillies & garlic chunks. The green chili had a sweet taste to it, wasn't at all spicy. Very oily at the base of the dish.

2)Sauerkraut Fish with Soup: sour and mild spicy broth with fresh slices of fish. Goes really well with rice and makes you want more of it.

3)Stir-Fried Pork Intestines with Sauerkraut: the pork intestines had an interesting smokey flavour, no foul taste. There was more oil than gravy.

4) Signature Lemon Tea: tasted normal and quite diluted.

5) Special Fermented Tofu ÁâπËâ≤Ë±ÜËÖê‰π≥: this is actually like fu yu. Unless you are having rice, please don't order this coz its very salty. We ended up having to takeaway the balance.

Easiest way to locate the outlet, go up to Level 1, head toward the area where IRVINS or Chagee is located. You will see an escalator in front of Chagee going down to B1. You wont miss it coz there are large green signages with this restaurant brand featured on the sides.

The front counter will sign you up for a free membership with your name and mobile. We got a $6 discount off our bill with the membership. Diners who leave a google review will receive a free dessert (glutinous rice cake with brown sugar) hence the high rating I suppose.

As the restaurant was still quite empty initially, some of the male staff didn't know what to do with themselves, so they stood near our table chatting away which was quite annoying when we were trying to enjoy our meal in peace. Was very parched and thirsty after the meal. Will I be back, likely not - once is enough.

I just upgraded this restaurant to be my no. 1 go to place for yummy Oysters!! Now I am still thinking of the Oysters hahaha.. another two dishes must have is the baked cabbage and raw scallops. The service is fabulous, I get to talk to most of the waitress and the Oyster chief üòÅ ‚Ä¶

We had a selection of oysters, the scallop ceviche, crab croquettes, broccolini, and prawn tagliatelle. Everything was absolutely fantastic. Fresh, delicious, and perfectly prepared. Really loved every single dish. And the service was lovely. Would highly recommend and will definitely be back to try more!

I just upgraded this restaurant to be my no. 1 go to place for yummy Oysters!! Now I am still thinking of the Oysters hahaha.. another two dishes must have is the baked cabbage and raw scallops. The service is fabulous, I get to talk to most of the waitress and the Oyster chief üòÅ

The service was excellent üòçüòç

Tuna with blood orange was quite mediocre - the orange was better than the tuna.
Broccolini and scallop pasta were OK. Oysters are very worth it - $3 a piece during happy hour (before 7pm) and all tasted sweet. The halibut was cooked well and very delicate. Chocolate tart was interesting and well balanced. it is quite a dense tart.

Overall slightly overpriced but I really really appreciated the service.

The restaurant focus on seafood, particularly oysters and other fresh catches. A popular spot for both casual dining and special occasions.
Humpback often features a menu that celebrates seasonal ingredients, with a range of dishes that highlight the flavors of the ocean, complemented by creative preparations. The drinks menu typically includes a selection of wines and craft cocktails, which pair well with the seafood offerings.
If you enjoy seafood, Humpback is definitely a place to consider!

An Iranian restaurant that seemed promising in Singapore. We found it through Google, and when we arrived, the area was nice and full of restaurants and caf√©s.
The restaurant itself was tidy, classy, and upscale. Unfortunately, the food didn‚Äôt meet our expectations ‚Äî the kibbeh wasn‚Äôt good at all, the koobideh was decent, the joujeh kebab was delicious, the fetawsh was tasty, and the eggplant kashk dish was okay.
We expected the staff and ambiance to feel more authentically Persian, but sadly, we were disappointed.
On top of that, out of nowhere, a belly dancer showed up ü´£üôÉ
And honestly, the bill was extremely high.

There were 4 of us‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.
We appreciate that gluten-free menu is offered.Food was served  ‚Äúless salty‚Äù as requested, thank you very much.The meat kebabs (including the fish kebab) were ‚Ä¶

There were 4 of us‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.
We appreciate that gluten-free menu is offered.Food was served  ‚Äúless salty‚Äù as requested, thank you very much.The meat kebabs (including the fish kebab) were fresh, not salty yet tasty and still moist (not dry)The chicken in walnut & promeganate sauce was so so delicious, the best I‚Äôve tasted in any Persian restaurant!The  sharing starter dips platter was so yummy and as my husband is on gluten-free diet, carrot & cucumber sticks were offered to him instead of bread‚Ä¶‚Ä¶good options for those on less carb diet too! All the dishes were fresh & delicious; we feel we have eaten healthy after leaving the restaurant. Thank you to the chef!And thank you to the service staff for being friendly, helpful & informative abt the food they are serving and what is in the menu.Will definitely recommend your restaurant.

business_name: Private Dining Singapore | Avodah by Stellamoon
text:
Very chill environment. Hosts are very friendly and chatty. Ingredients are fresh and the dishes are delicious. Pasta can adjust portion size free of charge too.
Definitely recommend

business_name: Private Dining Singapore | Avodah by Stellamoon
text:
Dining at Avodah by Chef Kent and his wife Stella was an extraordinary experience!

From the moment we stepped in, we felt welcomed into the warmth of their home, surrounded by soothing lighting, gentle music and beautiful art pieces hand-painted by Stella herself. The ambiance was truly unique and set the perfect tone for an unforgettable evening.

Chef Kent and Stella‚Äôs hospitality was impeccable. They shared wonderful stories, and Kent even sang for us on his guitar, adding a personal touch that made the evening feel magical.

Every dish was crafted with the freshest ingredients and an abundance of love and passion, making it hard to pick a favourite because each one was a masterpiece.

The meal began with their homemade olive, bread and butter, setting the bar high.

From the wagyu bresaola with burrata cheese to the Japanese lobster bisque with Hokkaido scallops, every bite was a delight.

The slow oven-baked tenderloin with cherry tomato on the vine and Japanese leek was cooked to perfection, while the clams pasta with white wine and ooba was bursting with flavor.

To top it all off, we had handmade glutinous rice balls in sweet ginger soup‚Äîthe perfect ending to a beautiful meal.

Chef Kent and Stella took exceptional care to ensure we were well-fed and comfortable throughout the evening. It was clear that they poured their hearts into both the food and the experience.

If you‚Äôre looking for an intimate, heartwarming and utterly delicious dining experience, Avodah is a hidden gem you won‚Äôt want to miss.

Thank you, Chef Kent and Stella, for a truly memorable evening!

business_name: Private Dining Singapore | Avodah by Stellamoon
text: Booked dinner for a group of 12, Stella was very easy to communicate with, very responsive and accommodating. Parking was fuss-free, though the directions on google maps might be a little confusing. Food was tasty and nicely presented. The ‚Ä¶

Absolutely love this place! Everything we got was top-notch so prices are more than reasonable. The whole place is warm and pleasant and the staff in particular are just the sweetest. They gave us free lemon tarts on the house. (:

Visited on a Saturday for brunch. This was my second time. Probably one of the best deals out there for free flow brunch (35$ for 1.5 hours; top up a bit more and you can get free flow oysters for 55$; the oysters are tiny but good).

Service is superb and you won‚Äôt have to call to top up the glasses.

Stuffed eggplant is really good if you like‚Ä¶ eggplant (it‚Äôs a parmigiana with some different spices)

The beef tartare on bone marrow is superb - 5stars.

The ‚Äúpasta‚Äù is a bit of a letdown, the sauce is amazing but not a fan of those little pasta balls (recommend to change to other type of pasta)

Desert - wow!

I‚Äôd love to try their dinner menu next.

1 Star ‚Äì Terrible:
Extremely disappointing. Poor taste, bad texture, and low quality.

2 Stars ‚Äì Poor:
Edible but far from enjoyable. Lacks flavor, freshness, or proper preparation.

3 Stars ‚Äì Average:
Decent and passable. Nothing special, but it satisfies hunger.

4 Stars ‚Äì Good:
Tasty and well-prepared. Shows quality and care, with quite a few standout elements.

5 Stars ‚Äì Excellent:
Delicious, memorable, and expertly crafted. High-quality ingredients and exceptional flavor.

Reservation is only allowed for level 2 communal which comes with minimum spend of $40 per pax.

The ambience and service were great!

However for the price we paid ($300+ for 5 of us, with one alcohol each), we didn‚Äôt find it filling and satisfying.

The rice set with egg and condiments is $9! The main dish prices are quite steep too.

The taste is not mind blowing either.

It is a nice place to bring overseas guests to try but won‚Äôt be a good place to visit often in my opinion.

Try walk in and dine at level 1, the prices might be friendlier.

And called few times before, hardly picked up.

Food here is good and a refined version of Korean food but for my Singaporean tastebuds, perhaps not quite as flavourful as you expect; the bold tastes you typically expect from Korean cuisine seem to have been refined away. A couple of dishes are memorable, like their jooak with truffle but for the price point, not quite worth it

I finally get to try Naeum's lunch - Episode Recollection. Had been anticipating it and i was not disappointed at all. I think all the dishes complemented each other. Even though I do not eat/like duck, I tried one piece and i can still say that the duck dish was flavourful especially around the fats and skin part. Each dish practically have something that I like about. Love the seasoning and texture of the taco galbi. My partner likes the muchim from the appetiser set. The soup/sauce complenents the sea bream. I was tempted to finish every drop of the buckwheat sauce. The fish skin is so light yet crispy. The sesame/truffle makes the rice so flavourful that I deserted the sauce from the banchan. The sorbet and fruits was not too sweet or melty, instead there was a mixture of crunchy and softness. I love all the 3 korean sweets too! I recommend the Jiran Jigyo, Chamomile takju (rice wine) if you can only do 1 glass. Staff were all friendly, polite and professional. Small restaurant but doesn't feel packed or squeezy. The interior is clean. Dishes presentation are colourful and interesting. Will definitely come back to try another different episode! And I shall order my Chamomile takju again!!!

I am so glad that Singapore is so crazy fast in following global trend from K-street food to K-fine dining within a few short years.

Location was where many similar or other kinds of restaurants call home, competitive! In short, parking was not so easy and definitely was not free.

Naeum is spacious and has that hi-end vibe. The service was overall good but how pristine( for the price you are paying) would be completely depends on your waiter/tress. A nice place to have a small dinner celebration or a place you‚Äôd head out when you feel like dressing up (not required).

The food - everything is fine. Nothing really jumped out except for the lobster. It was wonderful. Nothing I would complain on or fuss about. Every dish was pleasant.

The concept was great. The restaurant and the menu were carefully curated.

Episode Hello Signature - $238

Would have given more of a 4.2 out of 5 stars. The food at Naeum was really good, but I feel like in order to get a full 5 for a fine dining experience, every dish must have been memorable. There were 2 to 3 dishes in the signature menu that I felt were more forgettable unfortunately. I'll name one: the cold buckwheat noodles with scallops.

Service was really good though, and the ambience of the place was nice and warm. The dishes that people at my table of 5 seemed to like most were the appetisers. A decent experience overall.

It's Episode 8 : Journey of Hwagyo
We did the Signature with full wine pairing. They bring you through the time of Hwagyo where the Chinese community influence the cuisine of Korea. You will not get your tang.tang hu.lu.hu.lu but the gwanja deopbap (Hokaido scallop paired with morel mushroom and rice. Delicious!!! The buckwheat noodle is tasty and interesting as the match it with white kimchi and o-hyang jangjuk. The wine pairing is good, enhancing the taste of each dish. The season just started, but can't wait for the next one.

Loved the food here! Octopus was so good. Anchovies was amazing. And of course the beef skewers was awesome too!! Service was top notch, and didn‚Äôt realize this place is huge‚Ä¶ such good ambience and feel! Will definitely be back. Did I mention they gave us a free scoop of ice cream as well.

I was absolutely dazzled by the overall experience here at Bakalaki Greek Taverna. The service, atmosphere, and most importantly the food all played crucial roles in making this one of my best restaurant experiences.

The servers and waiters were all polite, friendly and enthusiastic. Service was quick and neat. The restaurant was spacious and very fancy,  which provided a nice space while dining.

Food was simply phenomenal. We had a starter of bread with two dips. Tyrokrafteri: spicy feta cheese with greek yoghurt and roasted bell peppers, and Melitzanosalata Agioritiki: a smoky eggplant spread with red peppers, garlic, and olive oil. The eggplant salsa was really tasty, the texture was just right and the smokiness elevated it very much.  The Tyrokrafteri was just heavenly. One of the best cheese spreads I‚Äôve ever had, just pure deliciousness that went well with the bread.

The Htapodi Grilled Octopus was the star of today‚Äôs show. Grilled to perfection with extra virgin olive oil, it was tender and not overly chewy, which shower that it was cooked just right. The taste was very addictive and the char added more flavour to the octopus.

Grilled Lamb Chops and potatoes were next. Beautifully grilled medium rare lamb was juicy and tender, the potatoes were no exception, oven baked just right.

We also ordered a chicken yards Souvlaki that  I found surprisingly good. The pita bread and fries also went well with the Tyrokrafteri Dip.

The Brtam oven-baked vegetables were decent, but the eggplants were the highlight of that dish.

We got a free Baklava for dessert from the staff as well. The custard and pastry were drenched in honey that was delicious, but got it was a little too heavy for me.

Overall a fantastic experience here. Prices are definitely on the high side, but the food is really good.

Bakalaki Greek Taverna is a lovely Greek restaurant in Martin road. The place feels warm and cozy, with simple but stylish decor. It‚Äôs a nice spot for a relaxed meal with friends or family.

I tried the grilled octopus legs and the Greek doughnuts, called loukoumades. The octopus was soft, tasty, and had a nice grilled flavor. It wasn‚Äôt chewy at all, which is a good sign it was cooked well. The loukoumades were amazing‚Äîcrispy on the outside, soft inside, and covered in sweet honey and nuts. They were the perfect way to end the meal.

The staff were friendly and helpful. They made me feel welcome and were happy to explain the dishes. Even though I only ordered two items, I could tell the food here is made with care and fresh ingredients.

If you enjoy Greek food or want to try something new, Bakalaki is a great choice. The food tastes good, the service is kind, and the place feels relaxing. I‚Äôm looking forward to going back to try more dishes next time

Always say hi to George

We came to Buona Terra for a birthday dinner celebration and had an absolutely amazing night out with a beautiful 7-course menu.

Here are my üîù3 favourite picks:

1Ô∏è‚É£ The Irish Duck was the winning dish of the night, perfectly succulent with crispy skin, accompanied with an unbeatable combo of eggplant, tomato, burrata and basil.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Coming in at a close second was the pasta dish, Baby Squid linguine with a fresh tomato and squid ink sauce. I didn‚Äôt expect to like this dish as I‚Äôm not a fan of squid generally, but wow! This pasta totally blew me away with its punchy smoky flavors. I‚Äôm so impressed at how flavorful the tomato sauce was!

3Ô∏è‚É£ Another banger of a dish was the Scampi, with a robust garlicky and citrusy sauce. I loved the subtle flavor of anchovies coming through, not overwhelming at all lending just the right touch of balance.

No fuss, no frills, just a classically simple Italian meal starring some extremely fresh ingredients. Such a delightful meal and definitely one I‚Äôll remember for a long time!

A sensational lunch which well exceeds its price point of $178++ per pax. The only criticism would be that the bread course was uninspiring, but who cares? It‚Äôs free anyway. Canap√©s started with their signature playful tomato soup. Using trompe l‚Äôoeil to make it look like tomatoes it‚Äôs actually a soft shell with tomato gazpacho encased within. The scallop tartare with avocado and tomato jelly was wonderfully light with all the elements working in harmony. The cod mousse taco was nice but overshadowed by its two counterparts. The first course started with a bang, yellowtail finished table side with a horseradish snow. Light, refreshing and full of flavour with an added air of theatricality for good measure. The second course was Mozambique langoustine which was the highlight of the menu. Sitting on top of a creamy anchovy sauce.
