The sweetness of the langoustine was a perfect complement to the (not-too) salty sauce. While the gem lettuce added some crunch to contrast with the soft and plump shellfish. This course was pure delight from start to finish! The pasta course was an elevated carbonara which utilised cured egg yolk. It was not too heavy which was a pleasant surprise. The main was veal with white asparagus coated in sabayon in a moscato sauce. The veal was cooked to perfection and the kitchen, once again, demonstrate their attention to detail by ensuring that each dish consists of an equal balance of flavours and textures. The palate cleanser was finished table side with a prickly pear granita, highly refreshing after two somewhat heavier courses. The dessert was the chef‚Äôs take on semifreddo using Marsala grapes, dessert wine sauce and clotted cream. Wonderful and I loved the bitterness of the grapes and wine sauce. Overall a spectacular meal, one of the best michelin-starred lunches one can grab in Singapore that showcases high quality ingredients, inventiveness while also not ripping a gigantic hole in one‚Äôs pocket. The setting of the restaurant is intimate and perfect for a date or a more private business meeting. Staff are warm, attentive and knowledgeable (and also take good photos). Definitely worth a visit.

Great food and service :)

We arrived late for our booking due to the limited timeslots and had to move ‚Ä¶
We had dinner here recently and while the food was generally good, the service experience‚Äîspecifically from one male waiter‚Äîwas disappointing enough to ruin the evening. ‚Ä¶

Great food and service :)

We arrived late for our booking due to the limited timeslots and had to move tables for the second seating.

Thankfully, Fazirah and the team were incredibly accommodating‚Äîthey moved all our plates for us to the outdoor alfresco and even provided complimentary desserts.

Not to mention, the food was delicious! Especially the half roast chicken, crab kottu, hoppers and cauliflower.

With such thoughtful service from Fazirah and the excellent food, we‚Äôll be back!

We had dinner here recently and while the food was generally good, the service experience‚Äîspecifically from one male waiter‚Äîwas disappointing enough to ruin the evening.

Food:
Most dishes were flavorful and well-presented. Highlights included the Crab Cutlet, Jaffna Duck Curry, Dhal, and Egg Hopper. Cocktails were creative, and portions were decent though some felt overpriced (e.g., Chicken Kottu at $28). Overall, food rating: 4/5.

Service Issue:
Unfortunately, the dining experience was soured by the behavior of one waiter:

Pushy from the start:
At 6:30 p.m., while I was still within the 2-hour dining window (reservation at 6:00), he pressured me to order because the table had to be released by 8:00pm

üò° Rude comments:
When my friend and I took some photos of our food (which had just all arrived), he came over and said, "My goodness, why are you still taking photos? Just eat‚Äîthe food is going cold." That comment really soured the mood. It was off-putting, especially since we were still within our reserved time. Who cares if the food gets cold? We‚Äôre the ones eating it. Even if it was meant as a joke, it didn‚Äôt land well and made things uncomfortable.

From then on, he kept glancing at our table, as if calculating when to usher us out. I even noticed him clearing neighboring tables prematurely, while guests were still seated.

Repeated interruptions:
He kept hovering and watching our table. At 7:45 p.m., he asked if we wanted to pack the rest to go‚Äîwhile we were still eating.

Inconsistent treatment:
Other diners weren‚Äôt being rushed as intensely by him same way, even those seated before us. Why was our table being singled out? Was our specific table booked for someone else? Or was there another reason behind the different treatment? I truly can‚Äôt understand.

He came again at 7:55 p.m. to inform us that the next guests would now be delayed until 8:15 p.m. At that point, his presence felt so intrusive that we no longer want to continue eating.

Food is meant to be enjoyed. But being hovered over and rushed like that ruined our appetite. And hey, we spent about $100 per pax. This service is not it. Perhaps he held a supervisory role and felt the need to be the ‚Äúbad cop,‚Äù while the other staff remained warm and courteous. Regardless, the disparity in service was jarring.

This constant pressure made the meal stressful instead of enjoyable. Other staff were kind and professional, but this particular male waiter left a very negative impression.

I genuinely wanted to enjoy the experience and write a review about the food, but due to the service, I can‚Äôt enjoy the food properly nor will I ever recommend this place to anyone.

Came here as a party of 4 on a Saturday night, after my fianc√©e's recommendation. Lived up to it.

Had the Dallo Baduma (calamari), lamb shank, gowa mal kiri hodi (cauliflower), chicken kottu and egg hopper.

Servings looked slightly small initially, so we called for the waiter and asked to add 1 serving of yellow rice. The waiter was attentive enough to know that we just wanted a small serving each to pair with all the gravies, and suggested a half portion instead of the "1 serving" I had asked for without looking at the menu. She explained the size, and we understood why when it came. In the end the whole meal was just the right amount for us.

Food was very well balanced and spiced - every bit of the spice (and spicy) taste but without too much intensity that pierces. Good taste without being overbearing. Calamari was my favourite as if had the most variety of textures within the dish and it came together so well. Lamb meat came off neatly and was tender. Cauliflower had a nice char, and sauce was quite perfect for me.

Wished they had more dessert options - many had coconut which I didn't like. Definitely worth a try.

Food was great! View was also nice for an afternoon visit. Celebrated birthday for a friend and the restaurant offered a plate of complimentary cookies w candle. Alittle costly for 2 course set lunch at $68++ but portion was good for the main. No free coffee for lunch set which was alittle disappointed. Overall was great experience but wasn't perfect.

Surprise birthday dinner by the hubby at VUE ‚Äî a romantic night with stunning views of Marina Bay Sands!

We both went for the 4-course menu ($168 per pax), and the dishes were beautifully presented and generally well-executed. I had the pan-seared foie gras, grilled lobster tail, USDA filet mignon, and strawberry osmanthus cake. My husband opted for the scallop & pearls, wild forest mushroom risotto, Spanish octopus, and chocolate peanut butter dessert.

We thoroughly enjoyed most of the dishes ‚Äî highlights included the perfectly cooked lobster tail and the rich, tender filet mignon. However, the scallop and risotto were unfortunately on the salty side, which slightly took away from the experience.

What held me back from giving a full 5-star rating was the service, which had some inconsistencies. While the team kindly helped take photos for us and even surprised us with a lovely birthday dessert and handwritten card, there were noticeable lapses. Some courses were served without explanation, and there were two mix-ups with our orders: our first course was mistakenly sent to the adjacent table, and the desserts were switched.

Overall, it was still a special and memorable evening ‚Äî the ambiance, view, and culinary highlights made it worth it, but service could definitely be tightened for a truly fine dining experience. Total bill came up close to $600 for two pax.

my partner surprised me with a birthday dinner here and it was truly an incredible night! the food was extremely delicious, meticulously crafted and beautifully plated - my favourites are the scallop and the a5 wagyu beef. chef jin wei and the team took great care of us, passionately explaining every dish that was served and completing the night with complimentary chocolate cake and a little card from the team. we had a very memorable and pleasant experience - can‚Äôt recommend this place enough!

VUE Bar & Grill (@vuesingapore) has just launched their new Seasonal Summer Menu, highlighting the premium 2GR Wagyu‚Äîone of Australia‚Äôs top Full-Blood Wagyu producers.

Prices start from $68++ for lunch and $128++ for dinner, available on weekdays and Saturdays.

We kicked things off with the Grilled Argentinian Red Shrimp Salad‚Äîthe spicy sesame dressing really whets your appetite.

Then came the Pan-Seared Scallops‚Äîhuge, juicy, and super fresh. The Pan-Seared Perigord Foie Gras (add $12)‚Äîrich and indulgent.

And we couldn‚Äôt resist their Signature Uni Risotto (add $15) before diving into the mains.

The stars of the show:
‚ú® 2GR Oyster Blade ‚Äì beautifully charred on the outside, tender and full of flavour
‚ú® 2GR Braised Beef Cheek ‚Äì melt-in-your-mouth goodness with rich, bold flavours

We ended on a sweet note with the Chocolate Peanut Butter and Pistachio Apricot desserts‚Äîboth are must-orders!

View is amazing as the name implies. Food is decent, but not fantastic. Typically filled by business people during lunch and influencers during dinner. Executive set lunch are value for money and unlike certain places they really allow any combination of 5 dishes among the appetizer, risotto, main and dessert.

There is a good variety of food choices, and everything is fresh and delicious. The seafood, in particular, is very fresh, with the baked lobster with cheese being the highlight of the buffet. The service from the staff is excellent‚Äîthey are attentive, always ready to assist, and promptly clear the tables and plates. The desserts are also quite good, with tasty cakes and ice cream. The dining environment is pleasant and comfortable, making it an ideal place for dinner. It was definitely an enjoyable experience celebrating my partner's birthday, and we had a wonderful night.
Remember to pay with citibank or American express card to enjoy 20% discount for the weekend buffet, after discount it will cost around 122 per pax included tax

Buffet was good, except not much fresh lobster. Everything else was amazing, cooked dishes were very good too. Service was excellent, I didn‚Äôt catch the name of the girl that kept clearing our plates, but she was so lovely. And Steven at the front desk was great, helped us get a discount by signing us up to the Hilton rewards!! Thanks!!

We had the absolute pleasure of attending a food tasting by Executive Sous Chef William Tan, who personally walked us through every section and yes, my stomach was already doing a happy dance halfway through.

The Cold Seafood section? Oh, be still my oyster-loving heart! Freshly shucked French oysters, Boston lobster, Alaskan king crab legs & more‚Ä¶ basically, if it swims, they‚Äôve made it delicious. Perfect for any occasion and seriously worth loosening your belt for! üôåüèº

Chef‚Äôs Signatures: Singapore Laksa with Boston Lobster Claw (fancy meets comfort), Rojak with Soft Shell Crab (chaotic but glorious), Kong Bak Pau with Braised Kurobuta Pork Belly (don‚Äôt wear white), Pan-Seared Foie Gras with Tahu Goreng (rich but I‚Äôm worth it), and Miso Halibut (so good, I forgot to share).

Special shout-out to Assistant Outlet Manager, Pauline Ng, for her warm hospitality and eagle-eyed attention. She made sure everything was spot on before I could even think about asking.

Another big thanks to Hui Ting, who was so on-the-ball that my empty plates barely had time to feel lonely.

Had lunch on a weekday so less people. They offer discounts for certain bank credit cards. We have dined here on a Sunfay but noticed its a bit crowded that is why we opted for a weekday lunch. The difference, there are lesser options. But ‚Ä¶

29April2025 (Tuesday) : Estate, Hilton Hotel, has Excellent & Humble Chefs and Assistant Manager

We celebrated our auntie Mdm Pauline Seow's Birthday at the Estate.  On that day, Chef William Tan Ngiap Wah was on duty.

While we were enjoying the awesome buffet spread at Estate, we were greeted by Chef William Tan.  We just briefly mentioned to William that we were celebrating Mdm Seow's Birthday on that day.

Towards the end of the buffet at 2.11pm on 2025-04-29, Chef William PERSONALLY brought out a BEAUTIFUL and WONDERFULLY handcrafted Birthday Cake that is Crimson in colour and that matches Auntie Seow's red attire as well.

This cake & Chef William have indeed left a deep impression in all of our hearts!  The Cake resembles a blooming flower with a piece of chocolate written "Happy Birthday" on it and one candle was placed on top of it. We were all SUPER impressed with Chef William's sharp observation ( the Crimson Cake matches Auntie Seow‚Äôs Blouse), Culinary skills (such a beautiful cake), his Warmth attitude, Great & Friendly Customer Service and Humility.

I ask myself, which restaurant has their Chef come to our table to greet us and deliver such great service and a Birthday Cake?  Only Estate by Hilton Hotel.  Other Restaurants usually have their waiters and waitresses deliver the Birthday Cake to the patron.

Even though it is already 2 weeks after our dining appointment, this desire to compliment Chef William Tan never goes away. If we did not leave Chef William Tan a 5-star review, it will be wrong of us.

Assistant Manager Ms. Pauline Ng has very good customer service.  In the midst of her duties, she will always pop by and check with us if everything is alright. Furthermore, she will on and off come and do small talks with us.  We are pleased with her sincerity.  She does not do it out of duty, but out of passion.  She deserves a 5-Star review as well.

Uncle Ray is another Chef that deserves my 5-Star Review.  He has excellent memory.  He remembers that I patronised the former Estate known as 333 Somerset.  I am so impressed with him.  Imagine how many diners he has met during the course of his work? He is such an awesome staff who serves with a heart.

As our diet is Kosher Diet (meaning we do NOT take pork, prawns, lobsters, crabs, scallops, squid, cuttlefish, sotong, abalones, sea cucumber, clams, mussels), we still have plenty of food to eat for the buffet as they use Beef, Mutton, Duck, Chicken, Fish & Vegetables to cook many of their dishes.

Management, please help us thank Assistant Manager Pauline, Chef William Tan and Chef Ray for their Excellent Customer Service & Culinary Skills.

We will definitely return for more dining pleasures at Estate, by Hilton Hotel.

Warmest Regards,
Serene Yew Ker Huan

We had a truly memorable evening at Hilton Hotel Estate for a special buffet dinner celebrating Mother‚Äôs Day and the 50th wedding anniversary of my sister-in-law‚Äôs parents. The experience was nothing short of exceptional.

The spread of food was extensive and beautifully presented, with each dish crafted with care and creativity. From appetizers to desserts, everything was delicious and thoughtfully arranged, adding to the overall elegance of the occasion.

What truly made the evening stand out was the top-notch service. Every staff member we encountered was warm and professional. A special mention goes to Lilian Peter, who was especially attentive and ensured our needs were met throughout the evening. Her kind demeanor and proactive service added a personal touch to the celebration. We also deeply appreciate Executive Sous Chef William Tan for his gracious hospitality ‚Äî it was a pleasure to meet him and thank him in person for the wonderful food.

To top it off, we enjoyed a 20% discount with our AMEX card, making the evening even more delightful.

Thank you, Hilton Hotel Estate, for giving our family such a fantastic and memorable experience!

We were there last Tuesday for the Meat & Seafood dinner buffet.

We headed straight for the chilled seafood selection, where generous amounts of fresh sashimi, clams, mussels, prawns, crab claws and legs, and oysters greeted us.

Then it was off to the warm foods section, and it was so hard to resist taking multiple plates of the melt in your mouth foie gras with unagi.

The Sunday Roast (beef), which was better than the Surf & Turf (lamb & crab leg) in our opinion. It went well with their mash potatoes, asparagus and carrots well.

The Singapore chilli prawn was slightly sweet, while the herbal drunken tiger prawns was perfect to warm you up during the rainy weather of last week. There was also a great selection of Indian curries, briyani and nanns.

Make sure you leave room for desserts. Their gelato was light and not too sweet, provided you don't go too heavy handed at the toppings bar.

The service we experienced with our server, Si Thu Win, was exemplary. He cleared our plates without us having to ask. When we requested for a nut cracker to open the crab claws we took, he took the initiative of bringing finger bowls for us to wash our hands. All through our time there, he was always there with a smile.

When it was time to pay the bill, we were served by Steven, who helped us secure a discount by suggesting we sign up as Hilton Honors Members.

Well done, Estate and Hilton Orchard Singapore.

Food was of decent quality and the variety was not bad. Cheese selection was a little disappointing. I like how the portions are small which allows small eaters like myself to sample everything. I definitely skipped the bread section. Prawns were really fresh, sweet and plump. I enjoyed the flat white that was included in the budget. We got a window seat which was nice and service was good. Signed up for the Hilton membership since it is free and why not which allows us to get a 10% off. Amex cardholders get more discounts but we didn't expect it wasn't valid since it was the eve of a public holiday. Bummer..$70 pp.

From the start till the end, what an experience. I would give 6 stars to both the services and foods.

The buggy ride was a godsend on a sunny day and the sense of luxury really started from there. The restaurant was naturally scented from what I presumed coming from the flowers in the flower dome. It wasn‚Äôt over powering the sense of smell.

The 4 courses lunch with a choice of wagyu or lamb was splendidly prepared. I liked the lamb better though. Overall, I enjoyed the journey that the chef curated for the taste buds.

The service staffs were attentive and professional. It‚Äôs commendable that they didn‚Äôt try to sell you bottled still water but served refreshing cold complementary water. I was also surprised by the reasonably priced tea to pair with the mignardises.

The cherry to top off the wonderful time was the free entry into the flower dome. Lovely.

We visited Marguerite in August 2024, and it was a fantastic dining experience! The meal was exceptional, with the melon almond as the first dish and many other appetizers leaving a lasting impression. A delightful bonus is that you can enter the Flower Dome free of charge. The service was top-notch, making our visit truly memorable. Highly recommended!

We came to Marguerite to celebrate my friend's birthday, and it was a fantastic experience from start to finish. There's a free buggy ride to the restaurant from the Gardens by the Bay entrance, which added a fun and convenient touch to our ‚Ä¶

Had my birthday dinner here and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The service is attentive, prompt but not overly intrusive. The staff also take pride in their service, explaining the dishes clearly and for those with dietary restrictions/preferences, they will do their utmost to meet their needs. We had the seven course menu and I can only describe each dish pas exquisite - the design and execution of each dish was spectacular to say the least.

The best dishes are the mushrooms and scallop, pasta purely made of prawn meat and the Angus beef. Masterfully executed and we enjoyed the dining experience. Highly recommended!

Celebrated my wife's birthday a couple of months back. Buggy service from GBTB taxi stand and free entry to the flower dome is a nice touch. Friendly greetings from the staffs upon entering and ushered us to our seats. ‚Ä¶

We came to Marguerite to celebrate my friend's birthday, and it was a fantastic experience from start to finish. There's a free buggy ride to the restaurant from the Gardens by the Bay entrance, which added a fun and convenient touch to our visit. Plus, we enjoyed free entrance to the Flower Dome, which can be before or after the meal, making the day even more special.

The restaurant customised a welcome menu for us and gave us a complimentary slice of cake, which was a lovely gesture. We opted for the set lunch menu, and it exceeded our expectations. Every dish was tastefully executed; the presentation, explanation, and taste were all on point.

The service was prompt and warm, making us feel genuinely welcomed. Considering the quality of the meal and service, the price point was very reasonable, making it a highly valuable dining experience.

The only minor drawback was the mignardises, which we felt fell short of the standard set by the other dishes. However, this did not detract significantly from our overall experience.

Overall, I highly recommend Marguerite for a special occasion or just a delightful meal.

Hands down one of the best Michelin starred meals in Singapore. Most miss the mark, or are overrated, since the Michelin standard in Singapore is definitely a notch or two lower than the rest of the world, especially given the exorbitant prices they have to charge to cover rent here‚Ä¶ but this place not only deserves their Michelin star, but has one of the most stunning locations to top it off. Whilst it is technically indoors it very much gives outdoor vibes and the light is beautiful.

You not only get free entry to the flower dome, or a buggy ride to and from the restaurant (if needed), with their amazing service. You get every single dish on the menu really hitting the mark and an open kitchen concept which is very unique and you can walk straight up to and watch your meal get plated.

My wife also really enjoyed this (we went for our anniversary), and whilst most Michelin places have a couple of dishes that aren‚Äôt quite perfect, this menu left us extremely impressed, there wasn‚Äôt a dish that missed or lacked balance or flavour. Executed to perfection.

WOW.

We had our anniversary dinner last night. Got the NYE dinner set and the food was delish! The carrot and marigold tart, pineapple dessert, the truffle scallops, etc was sooo good, we were sooo full up that we went straight home to rest our ‚Ä¶

I almost hesitate to write this review, as Flutes has long been my favorite restaurant in Singapore ‚Äî a city I have called home for nearly two decades. Having been fortunate enough to dine at many of the world‚Äôs finest establishments, I can ‚Ä¶

I almost hesitate to write this review, as Flutes has long been my favorite restaurant in Singapore ‚Äî a city I have called home for nearly two decades. Having been fortunate enough to dine at many of the world‚Äôs finest establishments, I can say with confidence that what makes Flutes extraordinary is its rare combination of exceptional cuisine and impeccable service.

The menu is a brilliant symphony of Asian flavors and contemporary flair, easily rivaling ‚Äî and at times surpassing ‚Äîeven the most celebrated three-Michelin-starred restaurants. The chef‚Äôs genius lies in transforming the familiar into the unforgettable, with each dish balanced between innovation and elegance.

Equally remarkable is the service: the most gracious, attentive, and genuinely warm team I have ever encountered. Dining here feels less like a meal and more like an experience in true hospitality.

For years, Flutes has been my go-to for both hosting distinguished business visitors from around the globe ‚Äî who invariably leave deeply impressed ‚Äî and celebrating cherished family milestones.

Quite simply, Flutes is a jewel of Singapore dining. I recommend it without reservation.

The restaurant gives off an elegant and cozy vibe, though it's a bit on the smaller side. The staff is warm and welcoming, making us feel right at home.

For the executive lunch, there are options for 2 or 3 courses. Before the appetizer, we were served delightful bread paired with smooth, milky, and slightly salty butter ‚Äì a perfect combination. For appetizers, we had Spring Asparagus, the soup of the day, and foie gras. The asparagus I ordered was wonderfully fresh, with a natural flavor and great seasoning. My colleagues enjoyed their dishes as well, describing them as equally delicious.

For the main course, I had the risotto, which was a creative blend of barley, other grains, mushrooms, and eggplant. It was flavorful but not overpowering, perfectly balanced. The meal ended with a rich chocolate mousse paired with black coffee, making for a perfect finish to a delightful lunch.

The service here is exceptional. The staff is attentive, professional, and goes above and beyond, unlike some places where you have to constantly call for attention. The service quality is top-notch. As my boss put it, if you're looking for an outstanding lunch near Bugis, Fluets is the place to go.

Looking for a Peranakan restaurant and nearly overlooked this one... due to its name... 'Bonding'... a bit clich√©, a bit 'kampung'... haha...

However, don't regret coming here... although we had to wait quite a while because we didn't make a reservation. They called us after 45 minutes when a table was available.

Wanted to give it 5 ‚≠êÔ∏ès because of the excellent service from the crew... but cannot because of the food.

The Buah Keluak in the Ayam Buah Keluak dish wasn't stuffed back into the shells... so it took away the old-school 'dig the paste out' fun out of the dish. They gave us a separate addition scoop because there were 3 of us and we ordered the set, which was for 2. Very thoughtful of them.

The Babi Pongteh was delicious but the babi was fat fat fat... the fat layer was gooey and overwhelming.

The Chendol was terrific though... the chendol bits were plump and springy.

The tables they had were huge and wide... making intimate conversations across the table a bit tough. Made the restaurant noisy because everyone had to raise their voices talking amongst themselves.

Would I go again? Yes... but not during meal times.

Wife found this on some foodie reviews and we want to try it as there not many good Perenakan places around. Turns out this is the place we‚Äôd want to return. Originally we wanted to try the set menu which typically showcases the restaurant‚Äôs good food but decided after seeing the ala carte menu that has interesting dishes. Like the sambal petai with ikan bilis and sotong masak hitam. We‚Äôre happy we did as those dishes as well as the others are yummy. Their selection of wine is good too. Overall it‚Äôs a great dinning experience even though some dishes are modernised. Guess that‚Äôs the way food preparation is changing. Stay rooted to tradition but add certain ingredients to modernise some dishes.

Greeted w a welcoming smile and serve with water rite away. Staffs are very friendly and thoughtful. üëçüèª

Complimentary Tiramisu cake for the bday girl ‚ù£Ô∏è Gluten free pasta super delish! Downside is Im not a fan of the pork belly and ravioli pork in it due to it porky smell. Overall still have a wonderful lunch üòã

This is the place that I always like to return for Italian food. It gives me very pleasant dining experience each time. I like the cozy resort feel ambience and attentive service.
I love the homemade pasta with its chewy texture and creamy sauce.
The pumpkin soup has silky smooth texture and I like the sweetness from the pumpkin and bites of the scallops.
The tiramisu is fine and soft, perfect to end with the dinner.

I absolutely enjoyed the food and service in this hidden gem found in a landed housing estate. It was a trip worth making. Parking was easy and free. Warning ‚ö†Ô∏è the waiting time can be long so go with a good friend whom you want to spend lots of time with.

First visit and perhaps my last.
I ordered the Mummy‚Äôs Curry Chicken, Spaghetti Carbonara, and a drink called Passionate. Overall, the food was average. The carbonara leaned heavily on the ‚Ä¶

First visit and perhaps my last.
I ordered the Mummy‚Äôs Curry Chicken, Spaghetti Carbonara, and a drink called Passionate. Overall, the food was average. The carbonara leaned heavily on the richer, more intense side of flavor, which might appeal to some but felt a little overwhelming for my taste.

The drink is priced at $8, which feels steep given the modest cup size. Even plain water comes with a $0.50 charge and it‚Äôs self-service.

Service was surprisingly slow, especially considering there was no crowd. The curry chicken, for instance, was pre-cooked and simply scooped from a pot, yet still took longer than expected to arrive.

Aesthetics and concept might draw you in, but for me, the experience didn‚Äôt quite justify a return.

Love this place and have been a patron for the past few years. This place has offered sanctuary and respite from the busy hectic Singapore pace of life. The music immediately calms your senses and you feel time slow down. A wide selection of drinks gives everyone something to enjoy and chill over (alcoholic, caffeinated, or just sweet delights.. they have them all!)

More importantly, they also have an awesome selection of food, all of which are delicious and value for money. Their servings are larger than what you‚Äôll typically expect from Singapore F&B outlets, so if you‚Äôre a small eater, bring a partner to share!

My first post of this place I think, but will gladly post more reviews the next time I visit! ‚ù§Ô∏è

This cafe as bespoke as it gets for parents with toddlers. Designed specifically with activities and a toys corner to entertain kids.
The menu also provide kids meals.
I wish many people get to know and visit the place, as the location is a bit interior from the main road's access. It is nestled among the row of landed houses between Clementi road & AYE.
The pistachio chocolate cake is one of the best I've tasted.
Pizza is well made, with a smokey flavour (like wood fired)
The Mama's curry chicken with bread is quite good, but a bit less spicy for my taste.
Flat whites and hot chocolate is refreshing.
Overall a fine near 5-star experience. Would come for more.
Taste gratification, Tummy satisfaction, Total satiation. Clean environment. 4 calling fans at full blast for cool comfort on a hot day. üëç

Had a wonderful lunch experience. The raw soy marinated prawns and scallops were delicious! Fresh, savoury, but not salty. Was pleasantly surprised to see sunchoke tea on the menu. The drink came with lots of artichoke bits in it, giving it a rich flavour. We were served by the friendly Kris. Will be back again next time.

The service staff was attentive and frequently filled our glasses. The plates were also cleared once we finished. They put a candle on one of the desserts when they realised that we were celebrating an occasion. Food looked good aesthetically and tasted prettily good. Food is good for those who want to try different kinds of Korean food. One interesting thing was the makgeoli buns which is not the usual offering in a Korean restaurant. The food items on the set tasted only okay for us as we were used to heavier flavoured Korean food.

A very pleasant dining experience, most dishes were well executed, portion sizes were just right for sharing.

What we ordered:
Kimchi Platter - well seasoned and fresh
Makgeolli Bread - a tad too dry, the white bean butter didn‚Äôt complement it much
Iberico Pork Jowl SSAM - surprisingly juicy but not heavy on the palate, well paired with endives
Jeju Pork Noodle - broth was so heart warming that I had to ask for more
Prawn and Scallop Jang - fresh but a little too salty
Beef Bulgogi - very well marinated and tender
Jeyuk with Bean Sprout - a little too sweet for my liking, could be more spicy

business_name: FORKETTA -- an artisan Italian restaurant at Dempseyhill - make the best wood-fired baked sourdough Pizza in Singapore
text:
A romantic restaurant with a fine-casual feel. Service was prompt and friendly. Food is great, solid Italian food - the pasta is made in-house with organic wheat. The desserts are AMAZING - I‚Äôd recommend the panna cotta (not too sweet) and the cheesecake (rich but not jelak), both doused in a lovely berry sauce.

Great place for stress-free dates.

(Paiseh, did not take photos of all the food because it was guzzled up, fast)

business_name: FORKETTA -- an artisan Italian restaurant at Dempseyhill - make the best wood-fired baked sourdough Pizza in Singapore
text:
Very disappointing experience despite good food and nice environment.
We booked a table for 4 people to celebrate a birthday. Reservation was made for 20:30 directly with the restaurant. According to the restaurant‚Äôs own website, ‚Ä¶

I had a very enjoyable experience at Quenino.

The food was a nice blend of south East Asian elements. Everything felt harmonious and intentional. I loved that they included what the chefs liked in some of the dishes, it made the experience feel more personal. I also loved that there was some freedom to eat the dish however you wanted.

I only wish for there to be 1 more slice of beef since it was so perfectly cooked.

Atmosphere was quite relaxing. Music was good and tables were spaced out nicely.

Service was attentive, my special request was met, service speed, cutlery change, water top up were all well taken care of.

I also love the energy and vibe at Artyzen Hotel in general. Every staff we met was friendly and had a bright smile.

If you‚Äôre looking for a date night or special occasion spot, look no further!

I have a very good fine dining experience in Quenino @ Artyzen.

The quality of ingredients and culinary technique is paramount. Dishes are typically prepared with meticulous care, often featuring seasonal or rare ingredients. Presentation is artistic, with attention to color, texture, and plating balance.

Service in fine dining is discreet yet attentive. Staff are knowledgeable about the menu and wine pairings, often anticipating guests‚Äô needs. The ratio of staff to diners is higher than in casual restaurants, allowing for personalized attention.

Will be definitely be there again for their next special menu. ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞

Had the pleasure of being invited to Quenino by Victor Liong at Artyzen for a corporate lunch today and was totally enchanted with their Tasting Menu of some of the most exquisite, creative & tasty dishes I have had for while!

Located on the 4th floor of the beautiful & lush Artyzen hotel (side note ~ completed in 2023 designed by Ong & Ong architects), we were welcomed warmly into a modern asian style Quenino restaurant by the staff.

2 bite sized amuse bouche (Fried Yam Dumpling & Bany Cucumber) came plated beautifully nestled above dried chilli, corn kernels, oysters shells & lime leaves. The infusion of carmelised lemongrass chilli, kicap manis taste in these 2 petite appetizers kick started our Tasting Menu lunch.

The Green Lip Abalone layer with veiled bamboo fungus beneath was tenderly cooked & drizzled over with a delicious angelica herb sauce (inspired by local Yong Tau Fu dish).

Next came a XO sauce dip made up of spiced cod roe, tiger prawn was an excellent match with the warm buttery house made flatbread.

A refreshing palate cleansing ginger sorbet was served before we moved on to the perfectly grilled Yellowtail Kingfish.

The main course of Yugo Crossbreed Wagyu was my favourite! It came with a mixture of colourful garlic sauces ranging from Jungle Garlic, Black Garlic and even an in-house concocted green Garlic Chilli Sauce üßÑüßÑüßÑ A pepperish umami rich beef broth (inspired by our local Bak Kut Teh soup) added a nice finish to the meat dish.

Finally, it was dessert time and we got our taste of the most unusual - Green Chilli Ice Cream üç® The ice cream was creamy (not spicy) & came with bakkwa bits, pineapple tart style paste rolled into tiny ball, almond flakes. A truly interesting ice cream flavor we must say üå∂Ô∏è

The lunch then wrapped up with locally inspired Petite Fours and Mignardis.

Overall - I truly enjoyed the 1.5 hour Tasting Menu at Quenino. It was a lovely visual, sensory & culinary experience highly recommended for those looking to explore asian inspired flavors
üòãüôåüèªüòã

Kudos to the Chef/ team for coming up such creative dishes using so many varied asian ingredients üëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª

text: I'm not sure what is all the hype about. Normal Korean food at most. There were 8 of us, and we all felt the same. We had various and different dishes. And the sides are not free flow as others highlighted. We were told we could refill just once. Service was ok, and the place was clean.

business_name: Hoodadak Korean Restaurant ÌõÑÎã§Îã• ÌïúÍµ≠ ÏùåÏãùÏ†ê
text: Love the free flow side dishes! Every time they serve different side dishes and I like the eggplant and omelette the most. The food is a bit pricey general but the food variety and taste are not bad~ Recommend seafood pancakes and grilled pork

business_name: Hoodadak Korean Restaurant ÌõÑÎã§Îã• ÌïúÍµ≠ ÏùåÏãùÏ†ê
text: Been craving their sundae gukbap for long and finally got to try it, the meat portion they served was quite generous! Love their free sides, sauces, cold water, and tissues too, just simple things that left a nice impression on me‚Ä¶

business_name: Hoodadak Korean Restaurant ÌõÑÎã§Îã• ÌïúÍµ≠ ÏùåÏãùÏ†ê
text:
I was told this restaurant is very popular and there were queues during lunch and even weekends. We were lucky on a Monday nite with no queue at all, so we decided to pop by.

I asked what are their signatures, I was told their pork soup, so we ordered to share. I'm not sure how do they get their popularity as I find their food normal.  What I like is the free flow side dishes that came in a plate of 4. The price was pretty decent too.

business_name: Hoodadak Korean Restaurant ÌõÑÎã§Îã• ÌïúÍµ≠ ÏùåÏãùÏ†ê
text:
Delicious korean food hidden within the one-north office district. Very generous portion sizes and the food taste really authentic to what you can find in Korea. Prices are reasonable for the amount you get. You know the food is authentic and good when majority of customers on a weekend are koreans :)

They provide homemade side dishes but you are only allowed to refill it for free one time! Free ice water as well.

business_name: Hoodadak Korean Restaurant ÌõÑÎã§Îã• ÌïúÍµ≠ ÏùåÏãùÏ†ê
text:
This korean restaurant is located in fusionopolis with the nearest MRT being one north. We came on a weekday, and the place filled up pretty quickly.

The staff were not as friendly and were quick to get you to a seat that is rather cramped with other customers. They were also slow to give you menus etc. But once you order, all the food came pretty quickly.

We ordered galbitang and this was delicious. Definitely something that is nice for a cold and rainy day. We also ordered a pork dish, bulbaek, which comes with lettuce, rice and soup. Both dishes were really good. Don‚Äôt think we could order more because the tables were rather small and there was just not enough space for dishes. The banchan was also good; fish cake, potato, seaweed and kimchi. We also managed to get it refilled once. Water was also free flow.

We enjoyed the meal. Service and atmosphere could be better.

It was a last minute search nearing 2 pm on a weekday for a lunch place after a very active outing with our 2 young ones.  My partner searched this place and I called to check if they are opened in the afternoon.  Many restaurants/cafes ‚Ä¶

The world‚Äôs Best Beef Rendang, of course all other dishes amazing, and the Chili Crabs two ways! Doesn‚Äôt get better than that!

Gourmet Heaven

Dearest Lynnette! Today was just amazing, what privilege! You are getting better & better! Thank you for allowing us into your home! The food was perfect, the company, true Family! We appreciate everything you have done for us! All Guests are praising your food! Simply PERFECT! Thank you so much! üôèüèªüôèüèªüôèüèªüôáüëçüèª

The Kitchen Goddess, A Gastronomic Excellence Experience!

A Cultural Medallion Recipient, A 1st Violin, A retired Co-Concert Master with the SSO (Singapore Symphonie Orchester), turned Master Chef in her own right! (Former Miele Ambassador) and most importantly a Personal Family Friend for almost 32 years! Ms. Lynnette  Seah!

Having known Lynnette for that many years, and being proud to have this friendship I have always been inspired by her artistic prowess but especially by her culinary forte, and her being of proud Peranakan heritage,  Combine all that and one is in for a treat!

Had quite a number of meals with Lynnette over the years, but last nights dining experience, topped it all. She was exuding a lust for life, a degree of happiness and a level of contentment that clearly showed she has arrived at the higher echelons of culinary mastery!

To be fortunate enough to be allowed into her home, is in itself an experience of perfect hospitality, but be aware, trying to make a booking (preferably in a group of 10-12) can be challenging as her popularity has risen to a level that you better plan well in advance! And trust me the who‚Äôs who, that have graced these homely walls, bears testament to her ability to deliver an exceptional experience!

The Food:
We started off with a modernised version of Kung Pau Pau, braised pork served on a single slice of Fried Mantou, eaten like a sandwich, it was the perfect way to start off! The tender Pork Belly braised in a multitude of herbs and spices, pure soft & tender joy! The fragrance still lingers in my mouth! üíØpointer!

Followed was a unique Salted Egg Sri Lanka Crab, and while I personally have never been a super fan of salted egg dishes, this creative gem was simply superb, I truly had to restrain myself not to fill up on this marvel

Also served one of Lynnette‚Äôs number one favourites, Beef Rendang, truly another üíØ pointer, this dish should never be missed when dining here, it‚Äôs complexity of spices, cooked to such degree of tenderness shows the true craftsmanship of someone who knows what they are doing! A Klassiker!

The Highlight of the evening, at least for me, was the creation of a Laksa-Paella! It was Lynnette‚Äôs idea, and should be copyrighted! I think it was a Spanish Symphony meeting the Great Asian Violinist, a composition which I will try to emulate one day! A sensational concoction of truly the best of east & west!

The main, was one of the best Prime Rib Roasts I had in years! Perfectly Cooked, and as my right hand dining partner proudly proclaimed: Lawry‚Äôs, step aside! Accompanied by superb vegetables and a wonderful gravy, it was a truly fitting finale to an outstanding meal.

No more space left for what looked like a perfect Almond & Pistachio Cake for dessert, we called it a night, Filled with outstanding everything, friendship, hospitality, gastronomic delights . A perfect evening!

#singapore #foodsg #sgfoodie #sgfoodporn #gourmet #cuisine #foodagram #foodaddict #SGfood #sgfoodstagram #sglifestylesingapore #lynnetteskitchen #lynnetteseah #privatechef
Excellent gluten free vegan Japanese omakase! Delicious and creative dishes. I‚Äôm not vegan but I came here with a vegetarian friend and we were delighted. Very enjoyable meal. ‚Ä¶
Had one of the best gluten-free vegan Asian fusion meals ever. Favorites were the 4 Snacks, gluten free pasta, ‚Äúsharksfin‚Äù soup, wagashi mooncake ‚Ä¶

Earlier, gfs and I indulged in a delightful journey of flavors with @vegan_wakamama - wholesome plant-based gluten-free omakase. Chef Joyce does not add sugar and salt in her cooking. Superb culinary creations that you gotta try! @herbyvorefoods was used in one of the dish too üòç.

She‚Äôs able to customise omakase to be allium free (do request accordingly) & if you like to learn cooking, she offer that too. Must make reservation before heading down. For Omakase, we paid $158/pax. After adding mocktail drinks and taxes, ~$200/ pax.

Cozy restaurant, perfect for an intimate gathering with loved ones üòãüíö.

Excellent gluten free vegan Japanese omakase! Delicious and creative dishes. I‚Äôm not vegan but I came here with a vegetarian friend and we were delighted. Very enjoyable meal.

There‚Äôs only omakase menu, no a la carte. The drinks were great too - I had the black goji tea and topped up hot water a few times. The kombucha mocktail was refreshing and delicious.

Dining at WakaMama is such a delightful experience. Joyce put in so much effort to create vegan, gluten free dishes that‚Äôs not only appetizing but also a feast for the eyes.
We had the autumn menu with vegan moon cakes which is really yummy.
An exquisite dining experience with delicate taste.

Had the Vemakase which featured many different courses that were not only vegan, but also salt-free, sugar-free and msg-free as well. Chef Joyce did an amazing job of using natural ingredients to bring out the flavours in her food, and there wasn't a single dish that did not disappoint. Throughout the meal, we learnt a lot about her sustainability efforts, and enjoyed the company of Momo as well. Would highly recommend this even to non-vegans!

Had one of the best gluten-free vegan Asian fusion meals ever. Favorites were the 4 Snacks, gluten free pasta, ‚Äúsharksfin‚Äù soup, wagashi mooncake

I really appreciate how much heart and thought went into creating all these different dishes from scratch and with natural ingredients yet still bringing the flavors together. You can really tell the passion Chef Joyce has for the food she is making.

With the resident PR manager/bouncer MoMo for company, this has been a very nourishing heartwarming experience.

My husband and I were blown away with the GF vegan foods prepared with loads of love and dedication by Joyce. Foods were flavorful and refreshing with the right combination of texture. A must go-to place if you‚Äôre on a gluten free/vegan diet for both lifestyle choice or medical reasons. So glad we found Back To Basic!

A 5/5 ‚≠êÔ∏è Vegan & Gluten-free harmony of natural ingredients brought to its utmost to satisfy your palate. Each ingredient undergoes different processes from fermentation to drying before they are assembled into a dish. Friendly chef and ‚Ä¶

business_name: Zaffron Tandoori - North Indian and Mexican Restaurant & Bar
text: Love my guy munna, mutton biryani was great got free gulab jamun. Love you munnu‚ù§Ô∏è

Scenic view of Singapore from the restaurant‚Äôs 55th floor. Was served by Rana and Winnie that provided excellent service and served a small cake as I was celebrating an anniversary lunch. The SG60 free flow ribeye steak was very tasty accompanied by three sides for an additional S$18.

There are many great food options in Singapore, both economically and on the expensive side but price doesn‚Äôt always translate to the food quality you get.  We decide to try Man Fu Yuan for dim sum and tried their sets.  Food was delicious ‚Ä¶

There are many great food options in Singapore, both economically and on the expensive side but price doesn‚Äôt always translate to the food quality you get.  We decide to try Man Fu Yuan for dim sum and tried their sets.  Food was delicious and worth the one time experience.  Here‚Äôs my TA$TE ratings:

Taste:5 stars/delicious
Ambience: 5 stars/beautiful & clean
$: 4 stars/on the pricey side
Treatment: 5 stars/service was very good & attentive
Experience: 5 stars/overall experience was great.

Had a thoroughly enjoyable meal at Man Fu Yuan. The food was not only of high quality, but the portions were generous. The variety of cod and scallop dishes stood out in particular ‚Äî each preparation was flavorful, fresh, and well-executed. A great spot for Chinese cuisine.

Restaurant was pretty quiet when we visited on Monday evening and got more packed as the night went on. Food was as expected, traditional Chinese Cantonese cuisine executed quite well. Enjoyed the wasabi prawns and spicy sour soup. The duck we did had better elsewhere. The service crew were attentive, save for the lady manning the reception who pointed me to the bathroom near the ballroom instead of the restaurant and made me walk farther for reasons puzzling to me. Prices were high but expected considering establishment is within a 5-star hotel. We paid around $260 for 4 pax after a 20% member discount. Overall, an ok experience dining here.

business_name: Morsels Restaurant & Gastro Wine Bar | Morsels Private Dining
text:
This hidden gem in Dempsey Hill captured my heart with its creativity and passion. Each dish at Morsels is a unique blend of natural ingredients and flavors, crafted without MSG by Chef Petrina Loh.

Morsels offers a 4-Course Set Lunch for $50, including an appetizer, main course, and dessert. Add a glass of wine or sake for an additional $18.

Here‚Äôs a glimpse of our feast:
- Okayama Emperor Oyster with coconut kefir, homemade yuzu kosho, and Thai basil oil.
- Primrose Farms Pulled Pork with kimchi thousand island, kimchi, and belinjo cracker.
- Shio Koji Kombujime Hokkaido Scallop with fermented aguachile, pickled fungus, ikura, and ao nori rice puff.
- Pulled Duck dumpling with brodo, pickled kale, and juniper kombu oil.
- Noodle of the week: Iwashi Sardine Assam noodle with cured mackerel, marinated baby cuttlefish, wild Sri-Lankan tiger prawn, homemade prawn ball, and laksa leaf habanero fermented chili.
- Confit Sunchoke with homemade petai miso, Akitakomachi rice risotto, maitake, and sunchoke chips.
- Seasonal Lunch Dessert: Matcha Cheesecake with candied pecans and matcha mousse, and Morsels Signature Milo Tiramisu with Saratoga dark rum and shiro miso.

Morsels' menu is always evolving with Chef Petrina's innovative spirit. Visit their website to see their latest creations, including weekly rotating noodle dishes.

Highly recommended! This cozy spot, seating up to 40, is perfect for private parties and offers a unique and intimate dining experience.

*Morsels is led by Chef Petrina Loh, a Le Cordon Bleu graduate and former private banker.

business_name: Morsels Restaurant & Gastro Wine Bar | Morsels Private Dining
text:
Morsels is tucked in one corner of Dempsey, with a quaint and rustic ambience.
The $50 set lunch is definitely worth a try. Hokkaido scallop carpaccio had a just right balance of acidity and umami while the Primrose farm pork belly was ‚Ä¶

business_name: Morsels Restaurant & Gastro Wine Bar | Morsels Private Dining
text:
Founded by Celebrity Chef Petrina Loh in 2013, Morsels is located in the lush greenery of Dempsey Hill in a historical Civil Service Clubhouse built during the British era. We enjoyed the inviting and homely vibes which resembles a cozy barnyard cottage while we explore the interesting art, paintings and landscape photographs.

Chef Petrina's love for culture, food anthropology and artisanal foods gives her inspiration to create progressive fusion cuisine, which promise nothing but the best. We are impressed with the unique combinations of each dish that tantalise our taste buds with every bite.

üç§Aka Ebi Tartare $18
Interesting combination of raspberry, gochujang and compressed green apple on nori rice cracker. Refreshing and balanced dish that's both vibrant in flavor and visually appealing.
üç¥Shio Koji Kombujime Hokkaido Scallop $28
Impressive combination of textures and flavors with fermented aguachile, pickled fungus, ikura and ao nori rice puff. The natural sweetness of the Hokkaido scallop, enhanced by the umami richness of shio koji and kombu, is incredibly delicate.
ü•üPulled Duck dumpling $30
The tender pulled duck inside the dumpling provides a rich, savory depth, especially when paired with a warm, aromatic brodo. The pickled kale adds a pleasant contrast of tanginess to balance the richness, while the juniper kombu oil offers an earthy, slightly piney flavor, elevating the umami notes.
‚ù§Ô∏èBurnt Red Cabbage $20
The Burnt Red Cabbage with romesco, manchego, and pumpkin seed bubu arare is an intriguing dish, blending smoky, nutty, and crunchy elements. Perfect combination of bold flavors and textures!
üêüThreadfin $34
The firm threadfin paired well with the slightly tangy and umami-rich fermented tomato jus, adding a layer of depth and acidity. The creamy yucca mash adds a starchy smoothness, while the ikura provides bursts of briny saltiness, enhancing the overall flavor profile.
üêÆUS Rib Finger (1/2 size) $22
Impressive fusion of HK & Japanese style curry mee tai mak served with quail egg, tendon, tripe, fukujinzuke and homemade fermented chili. The beef is almost melt in mouth and further elevated with chilli that is aromatic and packed with punch.
‚òïMorsels Tiramiso $17
Enjoyable twist on the classic tiramisu using shiro miso and Saratoga dark rum with elevated umami layer and depth to the flavor profile. Fascinating balance between sweet, salty, creamy, and boozy flavors‚Äîa bold, fusion take on tiramisu.

We enjoyed our dine in experience with excellent service and memorable spread of food and fine selection of wine that is mindblowing. Definitely recommend Morsels for an unforgettable dine in experience!

business_name: Morsels Restaurant & Gastro Wine Bar | Morsels Private Dining
text:
2024.10.26 (Sat)
Morsels is a quaint little restaurant tucked away in an obscure corner of Dempsey, away from the hustle and bustle. The setting reminds me of a manger/barn. Unassuming. The services from Fai and Poh Lin are very earnest and authentic.

The culinary offerings has its fair share of hits (more) and misses (less). It‚Äôs also an acquired taste because of the fermented sauces the chef likes experimenting on. I deliberately avoided the beef ragu because I received rather disappointed feedback from my family members who tried it.

Snack: was a prawn broth with cracker. I really didn‚Äôt fancy the prawn broth. The cracker was ok.

Appetiser:
Hokkaido Scallop carpaccio 7/10
Whipped Burrata Kale Salad 9/10

Mains:
Catch of the week : Barramundi 9/10
Noodle of the week: Fisherman Assam seafood Noodles 7/10 - the fish is way overcooked. I liked how the prawn was grilled with flat sole fish before added into the soup. This is a fusion take of Assam noodles. It‚Äôs an acquired taste.

Dessert:
Hojicha panna cotta 10/10 - not too sweet ‚Ä¶ it just hits ALL the right notes. Considering I am not a dessert person!

My family tells me the tiramisu is excellent too.

Ambience:
I really love how wine corks are being recycled as chopsticks stands and shells being recycled as a napkin weight.

The owner founder is clearly passionate about her craft, working with a very supportive staff team.

Morsels is a delightful Dempsey hidden gem, especially for those who are more adventurous and experimental with their food. I hope the restaurant will phase out/improve on the misses and keep the hits on the menu.

business_name: Morsels Restaurant & Gastro Wine Bar | Morsels Private Dining
text: Came here for the first time for a business dinner. Will come back again with the family. I like that it‚Äôs a quaint small place. Service is very personal. Food was excellent. Was graciously given a few bottles of free corkage on requests, but the wine list looks interesting. Would like to try next time.

business_name: Morsels Restaurant & Gastro Wine Bar | Morsels Private Dining
text:
Morsels is tucked in one corner of Dempsey, with a quaint and rustic ambience.
The $50 set lunch is definitely worth a try. Hokkaido scallop carpaccio had a just right balance of acidity and umami while the Primrose farm pork belly was succulent and tender without being overwhelmed by fat.
The duck dumplings were tasty enough but not in the same league as the scallops or the pork belly.
Fermented tomato fruit jus gave a nice tangy flavour to the thread fin.
Service from Pauline was friendly and attentive without being intrusive.
Thumbs up to the chef and service crew.
I will be back for sure to sample the other dishes!

business_name: Morsels Restaurant & Gastro Wine Bar | Morsels Private Dining
text:
Reading alot on this resturant that run by a local award winning chef Petrina Loh, her own private dining at Dempsy.

The resturant itself is rustic and small but cozy, this I would say the best resturant design in Dempsy.

Fusion Korean, Japanese,  Singapore cuisine.  Ingredients are imported from Korea and Japan.

The olive butter with multi grain bread, sounds simple but is amazing.. is a must.

Had scallop ceviche, jeju abalone porridge, Iberico grill pork in kimchi.

Portion is ideal, flavour is unique,  food is made out of passion.

Highly recommended to do a party in this 40pax resturant,  and private dinning in a fashion touch.

Service is great. And chef was always seen in the kitchen making sure food is to her standard.

We have mostly bought takeaway from them and dine in occasionally. The standard of food has dropped drastically the weekday night we visited recently. There was only 1 other table that night, who soon left so we had the restaurant to ‚Ä¶
Don‚Äôt waste your money!! You can get a free gelato if you leave this place a 5 star review so trust me and don‚Äôt go here. It is terrible!!! ‚Ä¶

We have mostly bought takeaway from them and dine in occasionally. The standard of food has dropped drastically the weekday night we visited recently. There was only 1 other table that night, who soon left so we had the restaurant to ourselves.

Waiting staff were polite and attentive. But not enough to make us overlook how disappointing the food was that night. The beef wasn't fantastic, not flavourful at all. The seafood bag was a small bag, unlike in the picture, but they were overly salty. Even basic expectations are not met. I will not even say pizza was fine.  We thought they have a change of chefs but we were told they haven't. Guess standard wasn't maintained then.

With so many choices out there, it will definitely take many more pull factors to revisit.

We went to their rubato outlet at greenwood to had their 7 course Omakase meal for dinner .Drinks of Beer and Iced lychee tea üç∫üçπüçπ Start off with A gift from the angel which consist of chilled angel hair pasta, hokkaido scallop sashimi, ‚Ä¶

Went for my birthday dinner as my sister highly recommended, but it was quite disappointing

First the service was not fantastic, we have a call them a few times before someone attended to us.

Then the toilet was having some heavy cleaning for like almost the whole night and we got to use the next door toilet which was quite rundown.

The food were not fantastic, out of so many dishes we ordered, only the cold pasta,  squid ink ravioli and tuna pizza were the better one.

The roasted cauliflower is lacking salt, the octopus leg was dry and miserable looking, for that price tag, we had better ones.

The place is nice but I don't think I will go back.

Don‚Äôt waste your money!! You can get a free gelato if you leave this place a 5 star review so trust me and don‚Äôt go here. It is terrible!!!

We spent $272 for the worst ‚ÄúItalian‚Äù food in sg after a while. Switzerland-esque food pricing but everything was super salty. We told the service staff our feedback when she asked and she kindly offered us gelato and tiramisu. The gelatos had ice chunks in them - the same kind you get in your ice cream when you leave it in the back of your freezer for too long. Tiramisu was ok. I don‚Äôt recommend this. I wish we stayed home and saved that money. Also, minimal street parking.

They used farmed prawns in their $30+ ‚Äúaglio olio‚Äù, and put ketchup on their pork ribs üò´ chicken had that sus taste. The ‚Äúfull‚Äù burrata salad had regular tomatoes, the cheese itself was harder than expected and cost $65.

Oysters were the only good thing we had there. Anyways, don‚Äôt go.

We went to their rubato outlet at greenwood to had their 7 course Omakase meal for dinner .Drinks of Beer and Iced lychee tea üç∫üçπüçπ Start off with A gift from the angel which consist of chilled angel hair pasta, hokkaido scallop sashimi, japanese seaweed infused white truffle oil and also Japanese bafun uni.

Next is their Micheli Quatity Burrata ,burrata cheese and a sliced of ham üëçAlso we tried their Mushroom Risotto ,love their mushroom risotto , big mushroom with lots of truffle at the sideüòã Pretty dish of their crispy capellini with burrata cheese inside , great to pair with their white wine ü•Ç

We also had their Charcoal grilled premium cut waygu beef, totally loving it! The beef is so tender and juicy ! Side of mash potato and crispy bacon. End off with their dessert Angel's Breath Tiramisu ü§©ü§© Delicious dessert to end our meal .

The whole meal experience is so good , staff was so friendly. Service was great ! Nice and relaxing atmosphere ,definitely will be back to try out their other dish ü§©üëç

Food here is good and the serving sizes are slightly on the bigger side. Loved the pizza with the burrata and the wagyu beef is one of the most tender pieces of meat I‚Äôve ever eaten. Loved that it came with roasted vegetables and potato wedges as well. The cold pasta with scallops are worth a try, but not something I‚Äôll order again. For dessert, the molten lava cake hit the spot while the tiramisu wasn‚Äôt anything memorable.

Dining at Rubato was an absolute joy

The manager Hazel made sure to infect us with her joy and positive vibes.
She brought warmth to the dim & cosy ambience of the restaurant.

We came as 2 pax and tried their Omakase Set for $128++ per pax and was pleasantly surprise.
What I love the most is that the set wasn‚Äôt rigid and set in stone.
We could choose our mains and sides.
The desserts were also a perfect ending to the dining experience.
I had the Scallop angel hair pasta. The 3 x scallops were HUGE and super fresh. There was uni on top of 1 of the scallop and truffle bits on every part of the dish.
Next, I got their Australian Wagyu steak and it was tender yet super flavourful‚Ä¶
For desserts I got their chocolate cake and it was wonderfully paired with a scoop of hazelnut ice cream.

I tried their oysters out of curiosity and paid for it on top of the set and found that rather disappointing. Oysters weren‚Äôt ‚Äúlive‚Äù and had a bit of stench to it. A dish you can pass on.

It was our first time dining at Rubato and it definitely won‚Äôt be our last.
Thank you Hazel for serving us üíØüíØüíØ

Visited for the first time during Valentine's day and it wasn't a great experience. Food was okay, but the service... OMG. I understand that it's a special occasion and the restaurant is trying to 'squeeze' the opportunity as much as possible, but it was bad!

Booked for 7.30pm dinner but the restaurant was so crowded that all people who reserved seats, waited outside in that already jam packed and narrow corridor, for another 20mins or so before getting in. Each table was only given 1hr to dine. Understaffed so service was slow, atmosphere was so hectic it feels like a warzone, (we saw another patron asking the waiter on the menu and said he rather get it himself) and yet the restaurant continues to take in reservations. We had a quick pasta and left in 45mins.

Food wise, we were quite mindblown by the cold angel-hair pasta with scallops. But other than that I don't think we'll be there again anytime soon.

--------------
Edited:
Service recovery was great! Went down on an afternoon for lunch to meet Hazel and the team and this time round we could enjoy the food and ambience so much more.

Service was excellent and we were very well taken care of. All the dishes were great and we love the tiramisu as well - really one of the best ones we've ever had.

Thank you again for making the experience so much better for us!

Every item that was served on the table has a certain quality to it. Very good in terms of taste and presentation. The Hokkaido scallops pasta was pretty good. The lamb is very well cooked as well. The portions are adequate. Service is good though a little hectic. Environment was a little warm and stuffy. Not a place recommended for long chats over meal during the weekend. Pricing is fair for the quality, on the higher side in general. Reservations recommended. Location is tough to get to without a car but parking is extremely challenging at the same time.

Overpriced, Overhyped, and Utterly Underwhelming

I recently celebrated my birthday at Odette, a 3-Michelin-star restaurant that promised an unforgettable culinary journey. Unfortunately, it turned out to be one of the most disappointing fine dining experiences I‚Äôve ever had.

We were seated right in front of the kitchen‚Äîa spot I initially thought would be interesting, but it offered no privacy. Staff constantly walked past us, and the seating arrangement (three round tables back-to-back) meant we could clearly hear the full conversations from the table behind us. This noisy, distracting environment was far from the refined ambiance expected at such an establishment.

As for the food‚Äîthe main event‚Äîit was surprisingly ordinary. Presentation was uninspired, flavors lacked depth, and the lighting at our table did nothing to enhance the visual appeal of the dishes.
‚Ä¢	Normandy Brown Crab ‚Äì Pretty to look at, but the avocado jelly was tasteless, and there was barely any crab meat.
‚Ä¢	Rosemary Smoked Organic Egg ‚Äì Over-the-top dry ice theatrics, but ultimately just an overpriced soft-boiled egg.
‚Ä¢	Langoustine ‚ÄòComme un Dumpling‚Äô ‚Äì Couldn‚Äôt taste the langoustine at all. Even with a $98 add-on, the quality didn‚Äôt justify the price.
‚Ä¢	Seaweed Butter Poached Scallop ‚Äì Pleasant but flat; it lacked the complexity and depth expected from a 3-star dish.
‚Ä¢	Scottish Blue Lobster ‚Äì Perfectly cooked, but the sauce clashed with the lobster‚Äôs delicate flavor.
‚Ä¢	Aveyron Lamb Saddle ‚Äì Tough, overly gamey, and unenjoyable.
‚Ä¢	‚ÄòIspahan‚Äô Vacherin ‚Äì Cheap-looking, overly sweet, artificial-tasting, and served with mediocre ice cream. We barely touched it, and the waiter cleared it without asking for feedback‚Äîservice far from fine dining standards.

Ironically, the best dish wasn‚Äôt even on the main menu‚Äîit was the palate cleanser before dessert. The delicate crispy leaf, paired with icy mint and lime sorbet, offered the surprise, texture, and harmony that I had hoped to find throughout the meal.

Adding to the disappointment, we were handed jars of jam as parting gifts‚Äîwithout any mention that they needed refrigeration and should be consumed within two weeks. I only discovered this a month later, rendering them inedible.

Overall, Odette failed to deliver on its reputation. I expected innovation, bold flavors, and exquisite presentation, but the experience felt safe, uninspired, and overpriced. For a bill exceeding $1,000‚Äîwith not even a parking coupon offered‚Äîthis was a complete letdown.

My boyfriend arranged a late birthday celebration for me at Odette, and it was truly special. It was my first time dining at a 3-star Michelin restaurant, and the experience definitely lived up to the reputation.

We had the course meal with wine pairing. While we generally prefer red wine, the staff did a wonderful job accommodating that preference, even though the menu leaned more toward seafood‚Äîwhich typically pairs better with white. They found a thoughtful balance that allowed us to enjoy some reds too, which we really appreciated.

The service was excellent‚Äîgenuine and attentive. It didn‚Äôt feel like they were just going through the motions; you can tell they truly care about the experience they‚Äôre giving their guests.

The food had a very homey, nostalgic feel to it. Each dish brought a sense of comfort, which is rare at fine dining establishments. It‚Äôs something we‚Äôll remember for a long time.

All in all, a beautiful evening and a truly 3-star experience. Highly recommend!

Quite possibly the worst dining experience I've ever had. From the lukewarm reception to the lacklustre courses, one struggles to find the slightest semblance of a redeeming quality for this "priceless jewel", as dubbed by the powers that be behind the Michelin guide.

In fact, its presence on the roster calls all other entries into contention, notwithstanding that our visits elsewhere were delightful, and this being the chief (and sole) offender.

There are many outfits which are pretentious, but they at least have the decency to match their air of superiority with an impressive gastronomic experience.

Odette was neither.

(1) Service & Ambience
We were seated in the main dining hall. If you prefer a modicum of privacy while you try to make justifications for this sorry excuse of a meal, well, unfortunately, you would be fresh out of luck.

When we were not making awkward eye contact with patrons seated across from us, we were treated to an incessant, unrefined flurry of staff who simply could not remain out of sight. To top it off, we had the great fortune to be seated where the entire kitchen could gawk at us throughout the meal while the ‚Äúopen kitchen‚Äù barely provided vision of kitchen activity.

The entire atmosphere was distracting, intrusive and highly uncomfortable.

(2) Presentation
Plating was boring, the very limited finesse present was contrived, and there was a severe lack of performative entrances.

(3) Culinary
- Grignotages: Flavours were very muted. Nothing spectacular.
- Mushroom ‚ÄúTea‚Äù and Brioche: Appetising and earthy. Quite possibly the best dish Odette has to offer.
- Normandy Brown Crab: A complete blank. Zero flavour and there was hardly any crab.
- Rosemary Smoked Organic Egg: Laughable. For all its fanfare, it tasted barely a notch above a soft-boiled egg made at home.
- Langoustine ‚ÄòComme un Dumpling‚Äô: Supplement $98, but hold the flavour. Truffles were either not properly stored or of a low quality, as they had no aroma at all. Langoustine was tasteless.
- Seaweed Butter Poached Scallop: Decent presentation and flavours, but I am being generous here. Very forgettable.
- Aveyron Lamb Saddle: A very sad lamb dish. The texture was completely off (tough, wrong mouthfeel), and its flavour was overly gamey with no depth.
- ‚ÄòIspahan‚Äô Vacherin: A tribute to‚Ä¶ sad ice cream and sickeningly sweet artificial rose syrup? When I thought it could not get any worse, the server cleared our relatively untouched plates without bothering to ask how we found the dish. Come on.
- Douceurs: Looked sad, and tasted like it looked. Canel√©s were way too hard with barely any flavour, and seriously, cut fruits? Regardless of provenance, such a selection betrays laziness and incompetence.

(4) Value
No uni. No caviar. No foie gras. No high quality ingredients. Did I just pay a premium to be ogled at while I eat unimpressive and unimaginative food?

I am in no way saying those are obligatory inclusions, but when you can offer nothing else, at least soften the blow.

They say ‚Äúprice is what you pay, value is what you get‚Äù. Well, at Odette, the price is a four-figure sum, and the value is an inside joke "at least it's better than Odette", that I can make reference to every single time I have a substandard meal.

Pathetic.

##

I will not even deign to discuss elements such as complexity and synergy, as the individual flavours (or lack thereof) were either too muted or completely missed the mark.

In summary, dining at Odette was a lesson in mediocrity.

The food did not even taste bad, which makes it worse ‚Äì because what that means is, it's not that Odette isn't trying, or that the crew has no formal training. Odette is pulling out all the stops, only to arrive at this utterly forgettable and pedestrian experience. Disappointing and embarrassing.

Dining at Odette was truly one of the most unforgettable culinary experiences of my life.

From the moment I stepped inside, I knew I was in for something special. The ambiance is immaculate‚Äîelegant and refined without ever feeling stiff or pretentious. It has that perfect balance of warmth and upscale sophistication, the kind of place that instantly makes you feel like you‚Äôre somewhere extraordinary.

The service was nothing short of impeccable. It was intuitive in a way that felt almost magical‚Äîthey knew what I needed before I even had to ask. Every interaction was gentle, thoughtful, and gracefully unobtrusive. It made the entire experience feel seamless, almost like the restaurant was choreographing a dance that I was simply invited to enjoy.

And then, there‚Äôs Chef Julien Royer. What an absolute angel. He came out to speak to the guests with the warmest, kindest energy‚Äîno ego, just genuine passion and hospitality. I even got the chance to peek into his kitchen and snap a couple of photos with him, which honestly felt like meeting a culinary rockstar. You can feel how much love he pours into everything.

Now, the food. Mindblowing doesn‚Äôt even begin to describe it. Each dish was a journey‚Äîvisually stunning, technically flawless, and emotionally resonant. The concept, execution, and ingredients were all at the highest level, but what truly impressed me was how harmonious everything felt. Nothing was done for show‚Äîevery element had purpose, texture, depth, and soul.

The highlights of the menu included:

Marukyo Uni with Red Sicilian prawn, mussel cloud, and Kristal caviar‚Äîa luxurious burst of oceanic flavor and incredible texture

Normandy Brown Crab with avocado, nashi pear, and coriander‚Äîfresh, light, and beautifully balanced

The iconic Rosemary Smoked Organic Egg, paired with smoked potato syphon and chorizo Iberico‚Äîwarm, comforting, and rich with umami

Scottish Blue Lobster with Kyoto miso, endive, and sak√© beurre blanc‚Äîperfectly cooked and bursting with delicate sweetness

Kombu Steamed Kinki served with squid, Obsiblue prawn consomm√©, and sudachi‚Äîelegant, clean, and deeply satisfying

Kampot Pepper Crusted Pigeon with Solli√®s figs, black garlic, and Piedmont hazelnut‚Äîa standout, complex yet balanced and full of character

A refined selection of artisan cheeses, perfectly ripened and presented

The Comice Pear ‚ÄòGourmandise‚Äô‚ÄîJerusalem artichoke, peanut, and Vanuatu vanilla‚Äîunexpected, thoughtful, and layered

And a beautiful interpretation of a French-style tiramisu/coffee dessert, which I believe was called ‚ÄúHigh Coffee‚Äù or something similar‚Äîcreamy, bold, and the perfect ending note

Every dish was plated with poetry and served with intention. The meal unfolded like a quiet narrative‚Äîsubtle at times, powerful at others, always unforgettable.

Odette is more than a three Michelin-starred restaurant‚Äîit‚Äôs a place that feeds your soul while dazzling your senses. I walked away with a full heart, a deeper appreciation for food as art, and memories I‚Äôll carry forever.

If you're lucky enough to dine here, savor every second. This is a masterpiece.

Business Dinner here and fantastic as i recall having dined here some years back. This place crushes les amis hands down. This is what 3 stars is. Not the type of service nor food nor menu at les amis. This fully deserves 3 stars in every way

True Michelin star experience.  The birds nest was exquisite.  The Prawn with Chili Crab made specifically for the SG60 was another standout.  Very clean and precise flavors all around.  Highly recommended.  Their tea cocktails are a must for a first drink.  The wine list also had a decent number of good Riesling producers as well.

I never had a bad lunch here. I was surprised to see so many 1 star rating for this restaurant that deserves good attention. I brought my cousin here to celebrate her 50th birthday in advance and as I'd reserved, we got a nice table by the window. Table was large yet comfortable for good interaction. I only want to order their Dim Sum as they are always good. However, they should dish out each dish slooooowwwwer. Yes we did ask to bring food out when they are ready, but not all at one go right? :) since dim sum is best to eat while is pipping hot.

I enjoyed every dish and they even have amuse bouche to start and end with some cute tasty dessert. They were also so nice to bring out a special dessert platter for my cousin's 50th birthday.
This small gesture makes me want to go back more often! I just forgotten about them since there are too many restaurants in Singapore.
With the new TEL MRT now just 300m away, I will definitely be back soon! Just need to find more friends who have time on weekdays!

Special shout out to staff Marcus who is so pleasant, speaks well and very attentive serving us :)

We came here for lunch on a Saturday. Service is top notch. The lady who first attended to us, Jennie, is very knowledgeable about the selection of teas and even told us how the tea leaves are made. We followed her recommendations for a pu-er and were not disappointed. Her recommendations for the dim sum selection was also spot on.

Our second server, Alwin, is also a jovial chap and what impressed me was that he noticed my partner was left handed and even rotated the plate to cater to him. Such attention to detail is top notch and very few restaurants I have been to can boast of such staff. When my partner had a sneezing phase and had to go to the bathroom, he automatically told me that he would change my partner‚Äôs napkin to a new one.

Food was also impressive and delicious. Our tea pot was constantly looked after and they made sure our pu-er was not too thick or too thin. Food presentation and taste (chef kiss). I would come back here even just for the dim sum.

The whole experience is totally worth it and I would come back here. The place really does live up to its name and kudos to the jovial and friendly staff.

We had a lovely time at this restaurant. Their service was impeccable right from the start, when I asked to see the menu. Their manager, Sydney was v friendly n helpful in introducing the food that I was looking for. Their prices for similar food are higher than my usual haunt, Hai Tian Lou, by $10-12 per dish with slightly larger portions. The service n atmosphere makes up the difference too.
All service staff wore a smile n were quick to come forward to help in every little way. Thou, we order 2 dishes only, as we had dim sum tea jus before 5pm, our server, Alwin is v happy to introduce their range of "caffeine free" tea to help digest our "dim sum".
The crabmeat in our fried rice is juicy n fresher than what we had before, in a generous amount.
Sydney brought us samples of 2 other dishes and the Har Cheong pork belly is the best!
Being locals who grew up in SG from 70-80's, the nostalgic inside view of the hotel lifts n rooms, as we sat at the "outdoors" area, jus reminded us of the grandeur of hotels from the last century fused with modern upgrades.

Visited on 24 May 2025 for lunch.

Whole Peking duck with 2nd course was great. Though the fried corn cracker was too oily tasting and crepe felt thick pancakes and didn't go well with the perfect duck.

Dim sum was good with the exception that Siew Mai was a bit funny tasting - filling was too compacted to taste natural. Lobster was outstanding. Portions and size of each dim sum (comes in threes) were actually surprisingly big.

Price was generally high and i don't find it warranted. We would probably only return for the dim sums during lunch.

Service was a bit slow but it had a very classy feel. Almost butler style. But our tea was not refilled or poured regularly. Some staff could not speak good English, so I had a hard time translating with my friends.
