Tea selection was wide but we had no way of knowing what was good for us. Perhaps there could be a sample tea tray for guests to sniff or see the teas before making a more informed choice. We just went for Ju Pu because we had no clue what anything could drink like.

Hilton honors members dine with 20-25% off. It should be courteous that the staff mention this because no one told us and we had to call them out on this.

BF brought me here on Valentine‚Äôs Day. The atmosphere and vibes here are totally different from what you‚Äôd typically expect from a Korean restaurant. Food was complex with many layers of flavours and prepared in unique ways! The alcohol ‚Ä¶

BF brought me here on Valentine‚Äôs Day. The atmosphere and vibes here are totally different from what you‚Äôd typically expect from a Korean restaurant. Food was complex with many layers of flavours and prepared in unique ways! The alcohol also paired nicely with the dishes! I was most impressed with the yangnyeom cauliflower as they managed to simulate the taste and crispiness of fried chicken/sweet and sour pork while maintaining the juiciness of the cauliflower on the inside. Similar to the other reviews, I would recommend to skip dessert here as it was so-so.

Korean fine dining. Very refined food of Excellent quality! Taste is on point and well balanced all around.

Fried dried shrimp appetiser $10. Very worth it and so yummy! There's also a sparkling makoli that is so worth drinking, esp if you've never had it before. And it wasn't ex at $80 a bottle,  comparable to standard Prosecco's and cheaper than Champagne.

Must try's: scallop carpaccio, beef tartare, bossam (flame grilled pork), galbi (beef). The strawberry bingsu is amazing too!

First time at ANJU.

Food was great and I‚Äôm surprised by the portion. Thought the portion will be small so we ordered 6 dishes to be shared between 3 pax hahaha we were sooo full.

- Uni scallop was interesting - love the pickles and dill the most.
- Hogam Jeon - so crispy!! +3 bucks to add cheese but the cheese was kinda non existent hahaha
- cauliflower - can skip the sauce is more sweet than spicy.
- abalone seaweed pasta - nice and the seafood taste is stronggggg. Abalone was QQ and tender.
- bossam - the meat melts in your mouth but is it really worth 50 bucks‚Ä¶? Idk but it‚Äôs pretty good HAHAHA
- maekgeolli panna cotta - my favourite dish out of everything I ate. The maekgeolli taste is strong but the alcohol taste balance off with the sweet melon and popping candy. Love that it‚Äôs not cloyingly sweet.

This is such an average restaurant, tried all the famous dishes, the cauliflower is just sweet and sour hard coated and really didn‚Äôt match all other high rating reviews‚Äô descriptions. The taste is just overpowering sweet and sour sauce you get from Chinese restaurants in western countries, the mini‚Äùrice cakes‚Äù is soaked with only vinegar that makes your face squeeze.

Potato pancake is like some cheap version of rice cracker snacks with a few pieces of zucchini on 40% of the potato slices, which was hard on first bite and soggy after dipping their vinegary sauce.

Main abalone dish, which really is just a cold angel hair noodle (they should have put it in cold section, not main) took over 40mins to get ready and the taste is just, average, for about 40bucks.

I noticed it‚Äôs mainly locals (including the staff) that dine and serve here, so really it has nothing much to do with Korean. At best i would say it‚Äôs an attempt to go into the fine direction from but really just form over essence (even form not so much). We wanted to order more initially if the food was good, after trying all the popular dishes we simply just didn‚Äôt bother to order,despite staffs multiple times of ‚Äúlast order call‚Äù to us.

Their eagerness to try and find out what we think about the food/how did we discover them/asks us to order more etc. somehow hints to me that they know the food is average. Perhaps the good reviews are sponsored too

I hope more people will develop a good sense of taste so that only the good restaurants get supported. Anju is apparently overrated IMO. There are plenty of good restaurants at that area.

My friends also got diarrhoea after this.

Highly do not recommend this restaurant for special occasions ü§Ø

The food is consistently good, but the service leaves much to be desired. I went with my girlfriends for a farewell dinner before one of them returned to her home country, and the entire experience felt rushed. We were barely starting our mains when the staff came over and asked us to order dessert as it was the last call. To make matters worse, the check arrived with the dessert, and we were told we needed to leave in five minutes. This felt completely unreasonable.

While we understand the two-hour dining limit, the speed at which the food was served didn‚Äôt match the time allotted, leaving us to rush through our meal. I shared this feedback with the server, who said she would pass it along to management, but when she walked by again, she avoided eye contact. The lack of professionalism was disappointing.

If you scroll down to read the reviews, seems to have many people giving feedback about the rushed experience. If you‚Äôre charging premium prices, the least you can do is to try offer a premium experience.

It was my first time trying elevated Korean cuisine and it exceeded my expectations. Every dish was a burst of flavour in the mouth, especially the black bean mascarpone and uni scallop. Despite the seemingly small portions, I left feeling ‚Ä¶

Had a memorable dining experience in this Chic Restaurants some time ago, that serve exquisite comtemporary korean cuisines. We ordered the following dishes during our visit.

-Galbi Jjim .. Slow-braised beef short ribs were tender and bathed in soy-garlic reduction. The sauce was deeply savoury with hint of sweetness and balanced by the warmth of ginger as well as toasted sesame seeds. Cut Mushrooms, Carrots and Daikon soaked up the braising liquid like sponges, adding earthy depth to each bite. Finished with a scattering of scallions and sesame seeds for brightness and crunch. It was really a deep flavoured and well textured dish.

-Yangnyeom Cauliflower .. was not only visually appealling but also a bold, flavour-packed twist on classic Korean Fried Chicken. Each floret was well battered and fried till Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, then coated in a sticky, spicy-sweet gochujang sauce, and garnished with rice cake, caramelized sesame seeds and cut green chilli. I would consider it a good vegetarian dish using cauliflower as substitute for chicken meat.

-Hogam Jeon .. What they serve here wasn‚Äôt a average Jeon but a next-level combo of sweet, savoury and cheezy. The soft, naturally sweet mix of Potato, Zucchini and Onion Pickle paired well with juicy prawns and gooey Mozzarella. Pan-fried to a golden brown crisp, each bite was melty, rich, comforting and full of flavours.

-Sweet Potato (Ice Cream Dessert) .. Was creamy and full of cozy and earthy sweetness. The Salted Caramel Creme added a rich, buttery swirl while the Brown Butter Crimbie brought the perfect crunch. The roasted sweet potato skin powder gave a subtle, roasty finish and could have tied the whole dessert together, if not for the Charcoal Curd Foam that was abit too smoky for my liking.

Overall, we loved all the three dishes that were served, except for the dessert, even though we did not paired them to drinks (Alcohol) as suggested.

The Ambience of the restaurant was rather cosy with the modern decorations and lightings, but can get a little noisy when fully filled with patrons. Service wise, their Service staffs were patient, efficient and attentive enough, although abit of delay were expected especially when restaurant was filled.

It was my first time trying elevated Korean cuisine and it exceeded my expectations. Every dish was a burst of flavour in the mouth, especially the black bean mascarpone and uni scallop. Despite the seemingly small portions, I left feeling stuffed (in the best way possible). 10/10 would recommend and I would definitely be back to try the rest of the menu.

Highly recommend the spicy fried shrimps, fried cauliflower, potato jeon and seotbap. Found that their scallop ceviche and uni ice cream had a bit of an acquired taste. Their desserts (sweet potato one and chapsal balls) tasted very mediocre, would not recommend spending money on them.

We came on a weekend and ordered the tom yum seafood pasta, the smoked duck aglio olio, and the salted egg popcorn chicken.

Food: the tom yum pasta was great. The spiciness is customizable, which adjusts the amount of chilli padi. We tried the 'bit more spicy' version and it was just about right. The aglio olio was sinfully good as well, on the oily side.

Service: After seating, order and pay at the counter before being served. Food came relatively quick.

Price: Objectively, on the higher end in price. However, it is relatively reasonable factoring the location and that there is no service charge.

Overall, I would recommend to try out when there are ongoing promos and discounts.

It was pretty hard to find since I went there when the Central Point mall was already closed, but it was so worth it. I love the vibe and the food here. I also got a 10% discount bc I dined in after 10pm üëèüèªMust try ‚Ä¶
Take the 5 star reviews with a pinch of salt - patrons get a free serving of fries upon posting and verifying their 5 star review‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶

Food was good but abit jerlark (the Tomyum salted egg sauce)
The servers are not very attentive
We ordered the set which has a drink and a soup
We were not served the soup even after our mains and drinks were being served
Have to ask for it

There are a lot of 5 star reviews because they are offering free dishes if u write a 5 star review on google‚Ä¶

Take the 5 star reviews with a pinch of salt - patrons get a free serving of fries upon posting and verifying their 5 star review‚Ä¶

We got the supposed signature tomyam pasta. It was incredibly salty although the one good thing is that they were very generous with the seafood.
It‚Äôs a night spot that opens till late which is great if you want somewhere to hangout and aren‚Äôt fussy about the food!

It was pretty hard to find since I went there when the Central Point mall was already closed, but it was so worth it. I love the vibe and the food here. I also got a 10% discount bc I dined in after 10pm üëèüèªMust try

business_name: Godmama at Funan - Modern Peranakan Restaurant Singapore
text:
Booked via Chope for 230pm slot. We arranged on time and host brought us to our table. I asked if we can have sofa seat but was rejected as someone else was supposed to have book the sofa seat. However, there was no one seated there even when we finished our meal, we only saw the crew packing things using the tables.

Can also use Chope voucher if you make reservations via Chope.

Food was good though. The beef rendang was very good, is a must order. The rest of the dishes such as otak, chap chye, chicken buah keluak were also very nice. Free flow water and water refill was prompt though.

The coconut pudding with hitam is so-so only though.

business_name: Godmama at Funan - Modern Peranakan Restaurant Singapore
text:
In the context of Asian cuisines and esp. in comparison with Chinese, Japanese or Korean foods, (often considered as "mainstream" locally), we have often thought peranakan food as niche, 'atas' and pricey. However, after a recent visit to Godmama, we have totally changed our erroneous initial perceptions on all counts.
The food there was indeed highly delicious, and their pricing rather pocket-friendly!
Staff were helpful, meticulous and attentive to all our cues and dining needs.
(We were grateful that staff helped us to expeditiously secure a table upon our arrival, despite the fact that we had mistakenly booked online the Parkway Parade outlet, instead of the Funan Mall outlet.)
Seating and layout were rather cramped though, especially during peak hours. It also did get rather noisy at times.

First time trying this place, recommended by friends. We purposely came on Friday night where they served seafood buffet. Understand Sun-Thurs may have some 15% discount for certain credit cards, but no discount on Fri and Sat.

Basically, there are 3 main section of food, the desserts, the cold dishes and the cooked food (together with fruit juices and fruits).

I must say the selection of food is great, but considering the price per pax vs quality , I give it a 4-star only. Some of the food item is quite disappointing, such as the lobsters, al of us concluded the sauce taste funny, and we had to specially asked for it without sauce. The oysters and crabs are fresh though.

The environment is nice and cosy, but t think they placed too many tables, resulting the walkway between tables are narrow and can be dangerous when you move with hands full of food. I give it a 4-star.

The staff are friendly and helpful but they lack of some product knowledge, and we had some
Hard time checking on discounts, and almost needed to avoid our payment. 3 of us paid for $425

Plentiful of parking at the hotel car park and they do give complimentary parking ticket.

The space especially the sushi section , the walkway so narrow and the snow crab and seafood section also kinda narrow. I have eaten many buffet oversea n locally. This the only one I found they dun even wash or clean the oyster shell. ‚Ä¶

A luxurious buffet experience with a stunning ambiance and a diverse selection of international cuisine. The seafood and sushi section is a highlight, featuring fresh crabs, prawns, and scallops along with premium sashimi. With live cooking stations and impeccable service, it‚Äôs a top choice for an indulgent dining experience.

Doesn't have fresh oysters so kinda disappointed. The cheeses were a little dried out. The king crab leg was salty, prawns were huge and both tasted without the fridge smell. Skip the other crawfish and scampi, both were not pleasant. No problem with the shell fishes and sashimi.

Half lobster with cheese was ok and kudos to the staff replenishing speed. Never saw an empty table for the lobster section. The sliced beef was soft, squid ink pasta with a half cooked egg was good, and clam soup was superb with the seasoning and wine. Chicken satay was nicely charred and marinated. Love the vinegar pork trotter, it tastes authentic.

The Indian section was meh, fried soft shell crab tasted of old oil and pork stomach soup was underseasoned. The mushroom custard bun was a disappointment.

The cakes were nothing surprising, matcha red bean ice cream was the best.

Overall, attentive and professional services staff, food wasn't mind-blowing and satisfying as I felt the standard dropped and with the price increased, it will probably be worth it during their discounted price.

The space especially the sushi section , the walkway so narrow and the snow crab and seafood section also kinda narrow. I have eaten many buffet oversea n locally. This the only one I found they dun even wash or clean the oyster shell.  Most of the oysters I took the shell all have sands like never wash beside they peel open. Not a good experience on a 5stars hotel can improve on it and most oysters in hotel I eaten they have prepare and it's nicely off the meat from the shell.   And during the buffet I have diarrhea need to rush for wash room . 1st time I having diarrhea dying a buffet section same with my friend who I treated him for his birthday dinner.  The jackfruit on fruits section is a plus point. Mention: the fried hokkien mee is surprisingly delicious with wok hei.

Colony‚Äôs definitely one of the better buffets in SG, with a nice mix of variety and ambience. The space feels atas and cozy at the same time, perfect for celebrating something special. Service was top-notch‚Äîstaff were super on the ball and made sure everything was smooth.

Food-wise, there were hits and misses:

Live Stations: Confirm plus chop the best part of the buffet. The laksa, ramen, squid ink linguine mentaiko carbonara, and roast meats (especially the roast pork and duck) were solid.

Cooked Food: Generally good (Shout-out to the super crispy skin panseared salmon and tender guiness shortrib), but some dishes like the Chinese zichar fare and Indian curries were a bit too salty. Dim sum? Can skip.

Seafood: Prawns were the best, and coming up close was the snow crab, but the rest like scallops and mussels didn‚Äôt wow me.

Sushi & Sashimi: Standard buffet fare‚Äînothing to shout about.

Desserts: Huge selection, but some were a bit too sweet for my liking. The Taiwanese peanut yam ice cream wrap was unique, and the tiramisu and mango pudding were defo legit.

Overall, it‚Äôs a great place for the experience, but if you‚Äôre expecting the best buffet in SG, maybe manage expectations a bit. Still, I‚Äôd give it 5 stars for the vibes, service, and standout dishes!

First time trying this place, recommended by friends. We purposely came on Friday night where they served seafood buffet. Understand Sun-Thurs may have some 15% discount for certain credit cards, but no discount on Fri and Sat. ‚Ä¶

The space especially the sushi section , the walkway so narrow and the snow crab and seafood section also kinda narrow. I have eaten many buffet oversea n locally. This the only one I found they dun even wash or clean the oyster shell.  Most of the oysters I took the shell all have sands like never wash beside they peel open. Not a good experience on a 5stars hotel can improve on it and most oysters in hotel I eaten they have prepare and it's nicely off the meat from the shell.   And during the buffet I have diarrhea need to rush for wash room . 1st time I having diarrhea dying a buffet section same with my friend who I treated him for his birthday dinner.  The jackfruit on fruits section is a plus point. Mention: the fried hokkien mee is surprisingly delicious with wok hei.

A luxurious buffet experience with a stunning ambiance and a diverse selection of international cuisine. The seafood and sushi section is a highlight, featuring fresh crabs, prawns, and scallops along with premium sashimi. With live cooking stations and impeccable service, it‚Äôs a top choice for an indulgent dining experience.

First time trying this place, recommended by friends. We purposely came on Friday night where they served seafood buffet. Understand Sun-Thurs may have some 15% discount for certain credit cards, but no discount on Fri and Sat.

Basically, there are 3 main section of food, the desserts, the cold dishes and the cooked food (together with fruit juices and fruits).

I must say the selection of food is great, but considering the price per pax vs quality , I give it a 4-star only. Some of the food item is quite disappointing, such as the lobsters, al of us concluded the sauce taste funny, and we had to specially asked for it without sauce. The oysters and crabs are fresh though.

The environment is nice and cosy, but t think they placed too many tables, resulting the walkway between tables are narrow and can be dangerous when you move with hands full of food. I give it a 4-star.

The staff are friendly and helpful but they lack of some product knowledge, and we had some
Hard time checking on discounts, and almost needed to avoid our payment. 3 of us paid for $425

Plentiful of parking at the hotel car park and they do give complimentary parking ticket.

Doesn't have fresh oysters so kinda disappointed. The cheeses were a little dried out. The king crab leg was salty, prawns were huge and both tasted without the fridge smell. Skip the other crawfish and scampi, both were not pleasant. No problem with the shell fishes and sashimi.

Half lobster with cheese was ok and kudos to the staff replenishing speed. Never saw an empty table for the lobster section. The sliced beef was soft, squid ink pasta with a half cooked egg was good, and clam soup was superb with the seasoning and wine. Chicken satay was nicely charred and marinated. Love the vinegar pork trotter, it tastes authentic.

The Indian section was meh, fried soft shell crab tasted of old oil and pork stomach soup was underseasoned. The mushroom custard bun was a disappointment.

The cakes were nothing surprising, matcha red bean ice cream was the best.

Overall, attentive and professional services staff, food wasn't mind-blowing and satisfying as I felt the standard dropped and with the price increased, it will probably be worth it during their discounted price.

Colony‚Äôs definitely one of the better buffets in SG, with a nice mix of variety and ambience. The space feels atas and cozy at the same time, perfect for celebrating something special. Service was top-notch‚Äîstaff were super on the ball and made sure everything was smooth.

Food-wise, there were hits and misses:

Live Stations: Confirm plus chop the best part of the buffet. The laksa, ramen, squid ink linguine mentaiko carbonara, and roast meats (especially the roast pork and duck) were solid.

Cooked Food: Generally good (Shout-out to the super crispy skin panseared salmon and tender guiness shortrib), but some dishes like the Chinese zichar fare and Indian curries were a bit too salty. Dim sum? Can skip.

Seafood: Prawns were the best, and coming up close was the snow crab, but the rest like scallops and mussels didn‚Äôt wow me.

Sushi & Sashimi: Standard buffet fare‚Äînothing to shout about.

Desserts: Huge selection, but some were a bit too sweet for my liking. The Taiwanese peanut yam ice cream wrap was unique, and the tiramisu and mango pudding were defo legit.

Overall, it‚Äôs a great place for the experience, but if you‚Äôre expecting the best buffet in SG, maybe manage expectations a bit. Still, I‚Äôd give it 5 stars for the vibes, service, and standout dishes!

Starters were chef‚Äôs kiss! The amberjack and scallop fish absolutely stole the show, fresh, flavorful, and beautifully plated. Crab toast was alright but nothing to write home about. The umami rice? DELICIOUS, definitely worth ordering. ‚Ä¶

Starters were chef‚Äôs kiss! The amberjack and scallop fish absolutely stole the show, fresh, flavorful, and beautifully plated. Crab toast was alright but nothing to write home about. The umami rice? DELICIOUS, definitely worth ordering.

We shared 2 starters, 2 middle courses, 2 mains, and a dessert between 3 of us and left very full and happy. Service was attentive and the vibes were perfect for a girls‚Äô night out!

Damage: ~$83/pax for 3 of us, totally worth it for the quality and experience. Would come back in a heartbeat.

Visited on a Friday night, and overall was an amazing experience.

We ordered quite a few dishes with the highlights being their Umami Prawn Rice - texture and flavours were very well balanced. Hokkaido Scallop Crudo -quality scallop and refreshing, presentation was spot on.

We went in a little late, so placed order slightly after last order. Staff were really accommodating and attentive to our request.

The ambience was really nice and cosy, very well decorated. Good for taking Instagram pictures!!

Would definitely recommend this place for date nights!! Looking forward to coming back!

Went for a dinner to celebrate a special occasion as I've always wanted to try Marcy's (bc seafood <3)
Our attentive server recommended 1 item from the hot, cold apps, & mains section, but we could not resist all the temptations. So we ordered an Amberjack Tiradito, Scallop Crudo (so good I was slurping the leche de tigre), Fritto Misto, Crab Toast (my absolute favourite), Prawn Umami Rice, Peanut Butter Sundae, & le bete noir. Everything SLAPPED and I can't wait for my next visit to Marcy's :-)

Vibey place for dates, among the 4 dishes we tried the crab toast and scallop crudo stood out to me. Our waiter was genial and helped us take a few nice photos so thank you ü´∂ü´∂! I‚Äôd have liked the tables to be slightly further apart and the ‚Ä¶

A Dining Experience to Remember

From the very first bite, this restaurant delivered a symphony of flavors that left us completely in awe. We began our evening with the Brussels sprouts and Hokkaido scallops‚Äîan exquisite opening act that set the tone for what would become an unforgettable meal.

We then indulged in a variety of mains to share: both pasta dishes, the rice, the pork chop, and the seasonal fish. Each dish was a masterclass in culinary artistry, but the standout was undoubtedly the sole fish. Smoky, savory, with a subtle tang that lingered beautifully on the palate‚Äîit had a texture so delicate and meaty, I could have sworn I was eating perfectly cooked white meat. It genuinely blew our minds and sparked an excited conversation about how the chefs managed to craft such deep, complex flavors with such finesse.

To finish, we shared the pecan ice cream and the chocolate cake‚Äîboth rich, comforting, and satisfying. As a heartwarming surprise, the team brought out a chocolate brownie to celebrate my friend‚Äôs birthday, a thoughtful gesture that perfectly captured the warmth of the evening.

Special thanks to waitress Jo for her kind and attentive service, and to Chef Yu Hui for the phenomenal meal that made us feel completely at home. We‚Äôre already looking forward to our next visit to see what other culinary magic the chefs will conjure up!

Vibey place for dates, among the 4 dishes we tried the crab toast and scallop crudo stood out to me. Our waiter was genial and helped us take a few nice photos so thank you ü´∂ü´∂! I‚Äôd have liked the tables to be slightly further apart and the brightness of the table lamps to be adjustable (we placed one of the coasters over the top of the lamp to make it less bright :D) Corkage fee is $50 I believe. The chardonnay which you can order by the glass is good!

We had an excellent time here, the catch of the day (swordfish), scallop appetiser and pecan pie sundae were definitely standouts. The place is beautiful and the food is delicious. Special shoutout to our server Jo who was lovely and attentive!

The ambience and staff are very friendly. The roast beef is well cooked to the correct doneness. There‚Äôs a promotion for birthday celebrations where the third person dines free. They will give the person a free cake and sing a song for ‚Ä¶

The ambience and staff are very friendly. The roast beef is well cooked to the correct doneness. There‚Äôs a promotion for birthday celebrations where the third person dines free. They will give the person a free cake and sing a song for him/her. We had a great time enjoying the view of Orchard Road and the food. The prices are on the higher sides. We spent $700 for 4 pax.

Have been here for about 3 times. We went on a Sunday lunch to celebrate husband birthday. The service was excellent (as usual), and the free flow bread was awesome. Just wish the desserts were better tasting (we ordered tiramusu ala carte and the lunch set dessert that was pistachio cake, however the taste , texture could definitely be improved). Yhe kids meals desserts were ok though. The rest of the experience was lovely, they sang a birthday song to my husband and provided a complimentary cake without us needing to tell them to. The photo taken was really lovely too. The Kids were able to dine for free, hence that was really great. Thank you for everything.
Blast from the past steakhouse, loved the medium rareness, free flow Yorkshire, got a birthday picture card as well ü•∞ Amex great deals!

Lawry‚Äôs The Prime Rib is located in Mandarin Gallery on Orchard Road. Their signature dish is, of course, the Prime Rib, where you can choose the size of your cut. Since this is Asia, they offer the smallest cut, called the Singapore Cut (130 grams). The set includes the Prime Rib, which the chef carves and serves tableside, along with salad, bread, and Yorkshire pudding. Personally, I think the meat is just okay, but the presentation is impressive. My favorite part was actually the Yorkshire pudding. ü§£

It is a high-class environment, evoking an upscale atmosphere. While the setting exuded elegance, there's room for improvement in the service department. We did find ourselves waiting a considerable amount of time to place our order.

The restaurant offers a unique amenity: photo-taking services with free prints. However, we encountered a slight hiccup when our photo wasn't promptly printed. A bit of a delay ensued before we finally received our printed photo.

Opting for the anniversary 4-course meal set, which comprised a starter, appetizer, main, dessert, and beverage, we were treated to a mix of flavors. The standout was undoubtedly the signature prime rib, a delectable dish that is an absolute must-try. On the other hand, the braised beef rib fell slightly short of expectations, with the sauce impressing more than the somewhat dry meat.

We indulged in the chocolate cake and strawberry trifle for dessert. While the chocolate cake delighted our taste buds, the strawberry flavor of the trifle didn't quite resonate with our preferences.

Adding to the thoughtful experience, complimentary drinking water was a nice touch, as was the complimentary cake for those celebrating birthdays.
Very delicious food. We enjoyed so much. However if there are further discount for senior citizen will be much appreciated.

Authentic turkish taste, the balloon bread is very chewy and smells so fragrant, lamb is cooked perfectly with no aftertaste. Abang Azad is helpful with the order and Dennis is friendly, also gives us free small cup of tea, very kind thank you! ü´∂üèªü•∞
The place has a mediterranean ambience with nice staff that accommodated us well. They even gave us free baklava and turkish coffee to taste and chef is approachable too.

Me and my colleagues had a good dinner at Ayasofya. We were just walking around and looking for a good resto for dinner when we passed by this Turkish restaurant. We enjoyed our dinner while dancing to the beat of their music and some of their staffs joined the beat too. A very happy and jolly environment. The food was good. The staffs are respectful and We love our free baklava ( I really love this) and sips or hot tea after our meal.

My family wasn't feeling particularly hungry, and we decided to go to A-Poh Kitchen for dinner, a place we hadn't been to for several years.

This is basically a halal chinese restaurant.  I am perfectly fine with eating chinese food in a halal restaurant provided there is no compromise to the taste of the food.

Am happy to say that the food at A-Poh Kitchen is very good.  I ordered beef chye sim, salted egg sotong, and  oyster omelette, with one plate of rice to be shared among the three of us.

The waitress who took our order (a middle aged chinese lady) had the presence of mind to serve the plate of rice together with another two empty plates even though we did not ask for the empty plates nor indicate to her that the three of us wanted to share one plate of rice.  This may seem to be a small thing, but nowadays, common sense isn't that common.  So kudos to our waitress.

For me, the star of the show is the salted egg sotong. I muttered "wow" in my mind whilst eating it.  There was a very generous coating of salted egg on the sotong, such that when you take a bite, you might initially think you are biting into a salted egg pastry, except that a few joyous seconds later, your taste buds tell you that it is not pastry but sotong that is in your mouth.

We ought to come back more often.  I think we will!

business_name: Fourgather Thai Casual Dining (Telok Ayer Branch)
text:
We were here for lunch on a Monday and it was very crowded! It was obvious that it was a very popular place, and I can understand why!

I feel there's quite a bit of a modern touch to the Thai food they serve. They taste authentic, but not boring. One of the dishes had a very funny name: Son-in-law eggs.

The vibe inside was comfortable and nice. It is suitable for big and small groups, so it is perfect for a work lunch.

One tricky part is finding the entrance. Basically you want to look for Amoy Hotel, and from Telok Ayer Street, you enter through this entranceway that looks like a Chinese temple.

Cosy quiet place with quite a few drinks choices. Food at certain timings have different % of discount. Ordered before 8pm so we had 20%. Ordered the beef ribs, crispy pork belly and lamb chops. Beef ribs are yummy and meaty, comes with BBQ ‚Ä¶

Cosy quiet place with quite a few drinks choices. Food at certain timings have different % of discount. Ordered before 8pm so we had 20%. Ordered the beef ribs, crispy pork belly and lamb chops. Beef ribs are yummy and meaty, comes with BBQ sauce which is a little salty. Personally don't quite fancy the pork belly as it doesn't have a lot of meat, although it is indeed very crispy. The Sauerkraut and mashed potato sides were quite ordinary as well. Loved the lamb chops, though it is quite a small portion (3 small pieces). Had the spirulina beer which tasted like regular beer that was dyed green lol.

They have recently move a few block down the street to 39 Rochester Drive, which is right opposite the Star Vista and right next to the Starbuck building at Rochester. The food and drinks is still good. Wednesday is also Ladies night with free flow drinks. We tried the beer platter which is a great way to taste all the beer. Also we tried the sausage platter, spicy chicken, potato wedges and pharma ham. Delicious and great pricing too.

Ordered black angus oyster blade, prawn scallops pizza and fried calamari. All were average. The steak was heavily brined and over salty till it did not have much beef taste. Pizza was so so with the prawns and scallop flavor not integrated into the pizza. Calamari was alright but the kewpie sauce tasted diluted.

Went to summerhouse on 26 July to help my friend for his surprise proposal. Definitely was not expected to be ‚Äòtold off‚Äô by one of the service crew during the process. Booking of the dome was not done by me but by my friend (the groom to be). He has requested to Summerhouse for the dome to be opened earlier as there were decorations to be set up and his intention to propose before dinner service starts at 6pm. This was agreed by Summerhouse that we can have the dome at 5pm. Closer to the proposal time, the service crew started coming in to place bottled waters and was preparing to set up the table. I had to ask them to come back later as my friend was coming into the dome and a video recording was in process. The next moment, the manager (I assumed) came inside the dome and told me off for asking his staff to come back later and how they are running a tight schedule to get everything ready on time. While I completely understand how F&B crew has it tough and the stress level is high at meal time, we specifically told Summerhouse to give us the dome earlier for the proposal purpose. If that was communicated, shouldn‚Äôt the table be pre set up  before we came? Perhaps there were some areas of miscommunication between both sides but it certainly leave a bad experience to an otherwise joyful occasion, especially when I am here to just witness my friends get engaged and I was not even involved in the reservation of the dome. The manager eventually left when he understood a proposal was in progress but I wish he communicated in a nicer tone.

Bread and Butter
Artisanal Cold Cuts
Seared Alantic Scallop ‚Ä¶

Came to celebrate my wife and brothers birthday. Had the $118 set with family. Enjoyed the double boiled chicken soup, hor fun & mango sago. The goose web was a new experience too.

Website was outdated so they don't serve the birthday set anymore, but other than that, all was good.

Will definitely be back again!

Can‚Äôt believe this is a Michelin star restaurant. Service is not good‚Ä¶. Food presentation none‚Ä¶.. whilst taste is not bad, it‚Äôs totally not worth to pay so much.

Plain water I have to pay $2.50++ each‚Ä¶ $9 for 3 pax!!

PS: Just last night I went to Golden Peony, warm water was free! Service was great. Huge difference between the 2 Michelin star restaurants.

A very good Cantonese restaurant. The scallop and prawn congee is comforting and yet delicious with very fresh ingredients. Sweet and succulent crustaceans makes for a tasty bowl of porridge. The pao fan with dong xing grouper was sweet ‚Ä¶

Mixed feelings‚Ä¶ ordered the mixed platter (excellent), siew mai, radish cake, yam croquette, scallop noodles which were all good. BUT very disappointed with the xiao long bao. First tray that came ‚Ä¶ maybe we didn‚Äôt eat it immediately ‚Ä¶ the ‚Ä¶

Mixed feelings‚Ä¶ ordered the mixed platter (excellent), siew mai, radish cake, yam croquette, scallop noodles which were all good. BUT very disappointed with the xiao long bao. First tray that came ‚Ä¶ maybe we didn‚Äôt eat it immediately ‚Ä¶ the skin was stuck to the paper and broke apart and the precious broth flowed out! The manager kindly replaced with a new tray ‚Ä¶ this time we ate it immediately‚Ä¶ but the skin was stuck to the paper again! Pretty disappointed üò¢

Mixed feelings on service as well. Catherine who served us was excellent ‚Ä¶ the rest of the staff were not attentive and definitely not hospitality trained. There‚Äôs no prompt clearing away of dishes which I think is a min standard.

All said, the experience is pleasant just because of an excellent staff. Well done, Catherine!

I ordered the lunch set and I must say the food was pretty decent, especially the pan-seared scallop and abalone appetisers. On the other hand, the price was quite steep üòß because of the bird nest and abalone, so I wouldn‚Äôt say it was good value. Probably worth visiting if you don‚Äôt mind spending, plus the service and ambience was also great for a Chinese restaurant üòÑ p.s. shoutout to Fave Wong for amazing service!
Quality dimsum + Chinese dishes. Baked mango chicken tart, Irish duck and fermented bean eggplant are our favourite! The scallops with asparagus are great too. Good pricing and great service too

A very good Cantonese restaurant. The scallop and prawn congee is comforting and yet delicious with very fresh ingredients. Sweet and succulent crustaceans makes for a tasty bowl of porridge. The pao fan with dong xing grouper was sweet with a mouth watering broth. The live ginger and spring onion prawns tasted great and the ballot saucer scallops with asparagus was stir fried expertly bring out the natural sweetness and succulence of the ingredients. The worst dish is the chilli crab fried buns which tasted pretty middling, rest of the dim sum were good. Plating was fantastic as well.

Irish roasted duck and crispy roasted pork - Excellent.
Xiao long bao - Good.
Har gau - Excellent.
Double-boiled fish maw soup - Excellent. Large piece of fish maw. Thick soup.
Prawn cheung fun - Good.
Chinese spinach with trio eggs - Good.
Steamed soon hock - Excellent.
Almond cream - Fine.

From an earlier visit:
Enjoyed the roast duck, roast pork and char siew. The har kau was ok. Wasn‚Äôt impressed with the siew mai and XO sauce turnip cake. Enjoyed the 10-head abalone with foie gras. Enjoyed the scallops with asparagus and fungus but felt that the scallops could be larger for the price of the dish. The Chinese cabbage dish was not bad but could have more vegetables and less tang hoon. The pork and raw egg hor fun was not bad but I didn‚Äôt get any pork in my bowl. I didn‚Äôt enjoy the chilled mango sago too much. Perhaps the dish doesn‚Äôt go too well with the peach resin and could do with more sago and mango. Overall the quality of cooking is good but it feels like there‚Äôs some holding back on the ingredients.

Hua Ting is located in Orchard Hotel which is at the end of the Orchard Road shopping belt. The place was fully patronised and some outstanding dishes included the beef bun and battered octopus tentacles. We would like to particularly highlight a staff called Katherine. She was extremely attentive and went above and beyond to look after our needs, explain many dishes in detail after they arrive, and was so warm and sincere in her demeanour. Hope the restaurant will recognize her work ethic and excellent service.

business_name: Canton Paradise Ê®ÇÂ§©Â∞èÈ¶ôÊ∏Ø at The Star Vista
text: We were being usher to a little corner at the end of the far room. Good point is we enjoyed the privacy; bad point is waiters and waitresses were no where to be seen. We need to go out and call them. No bell to press for assistance. ‚Ä¶

business_name: Canton Paradise Ê®ÇÂ§©Â∞èÈ¶ôÊ∏Ø at The Star Vista
text:
We were being usher to a little corner at the end of the far room. Good point is we enjoyed the privacy; bad point is waiters and waitresses were no where to be seen. We need to go out and call them. No bell to press for assistance.

We ordered set menu and added on a few other dishes. I didn't take photo of all food served. Taste was average, fat duck is really fat!
Very slow in serving the food and interval timing was quite bad that we almost finished our carbs before they served our last 2 dishes. We can't finished them as both dishescwere too salty to eat with rice or noodles.

This is the 1st time i ate at Canton Paradise and encountered such issue. Maybe we should not take the corner table.

business_name: Canton Paradise Ê®ÇÂ§©Â∞èÈ¶ôÊ∏Ø at The Star Vista
text:
Thsi branch food focus is on canto style dishes

One could get 40%discount on dim sum, porridge and some noodle dishes... ‚Ä¶

business_name: Canton Paradise Ê®ÇÂ§©Â∞èÈ¶ôÊ∏Ø at The Star Vista
text:
Thsi branch food focus is on canto style dishes

One could get 40%discount on dim sum, porridge and some noodle dishes... excluding roasted meat types, drinks and dessert

Food tried:
Roasted meat... I always.anticipate high quality roast meat/duck in restaurant settings
Alas.. this is not one of those times, meat does not taste fresh and the roasted slin was not crunchy

Pork and Century Egg Porridge... smoorh porridge with pork and century egg bits... light and good to warm one's stomach

Prawn and Pork Dumplings in Hot Chilli Vinaigrette...pork did nit taste fresh...vinaigrette had an interesting mix if chilli, vinegar and citrus taste

Xiao Long Dumplings...pork did not taste fresh and the dumpling skin was kind of thick

Prawn Dumplings... nice prawn filling and dumpling skin did not stick to the oiled paper sheet

Prawn and Mango Fritters... delicious prawn and mango fritter that was freshly fried

Steamed Chicken Feet... chicken feet tasted old... quite sad to see this quality in a restaurant setting

Pan Fried Radish Cake... well pan fried and delicious radish cake... a staple dish in canto dim sum restaurant that is a mark of food quality... in my opinion

Stir Fried Ee Fu Noodle...delicious hand made Ee Fu noodle that had good wok hei.. a dash more of pork lard oil would bring it up another level

Chillied Osmanthus Cake... chilled refreshing dessert after all the above heavier dishes

Service not very attentive even though it was at best 1/4occupied.. need to get attention in order to have removal of dirty dishes and replacement despite ordering quite a decent amount of food

business_name: Canton Paradise Ê®ÇÂ§©Â∞èÈ¶ôÊ∏Ø at The Star Vista
text: Nice decent place to satisfy your dim sum craving! All dim sum are freshly made so that u can enjoy the best taste! Services from the waiter and waitress are attentive and the ambience is great for small or family gathering. Prices are generally reasonable and do always check out discount deals for greater savings üòÄ ‚Ä¶

Had lunch with family, 1st time trying. Portion is quite generous and big. Taste is so-so only. But due to the big portion, I shall say is worth it. Has free self service hot tea just like dining in korea. Their cold noodles are my ‚Ä¶

Fuss free shop selling a mix of Korean and Japanese food.
We tried the Kimchi Tofu, Soybean Mixed Vegetable Soup with Rice, and Fried Fish and Chicken Bento. All were decent, nothing special. ‚Ä¶

I‚Äôm uncertain about the Korean flavour of this dish but it sure has the essential element of local zi char [a.k.a. stir-fry] cooking ‚Äî tender and flavourful beef slices with onions on a sizzling cast iron hot plate with the distinctive ‚Äòwok hei‚Äô [a.k.a. smoky flavour].
P.S. Did I mention that this set that comes in generous portion and free-flow of barley tea cost below SGD8?!

Had lunch with family, 1st time trying. Portion is quite generous and big. Taste is so-so only. But due to the big portion, I shall say is worth it. Has free self service hot tea just like dining in korea. Their cold noodles are my favorite, opens up your appetite and very nice chewy noodles. Beef bulgogi porridge is normal, porridge not sweet or flavorful enough, but with the beef is alright. Potato pancakes are korea sweet pancakes. It's a small Cafe restaurant dinning outlet, I think the price is ok and worth visiting again.

Located on the level one of West Coast Plaza near the main entrance. This Korean food taste was reasonably good. My favourite was the spicy chicken with Saba fish was priced at a awesome value of $7.  You get to enjoy the best of both worlds. The meal would come with free tea and seaweed soup. Last but not least,  you can order your food via the orange self ordering kiosk in-front of the shop entrance.
Good place to have great value for money Korean dishes at West Coast Plaze. Free barley tea for dine-in customers.

Standard Korean fare with reasonable pricing and best tasting saba (extra long too) I've tasted. The hotplate pork is my second choice.

Free-flow  Korean hot and iced tea a bonus.

Not sure it is just me, but after every meal of kimchi fried rice or hotplate pork, my scalp will itch. After a shampoo, all is well. Maybe too much ajinomoto?

Fuss free shop selling a mix of Korean and Japanese food.
We tried the Kimchi Tofu, Soybean Mixed Vegetable Soup with Rice, and Fried Fish and Chicken Bento. All were decent, nothing special.
There is very little in terms of service, you order from the kiosk and collect your food when your order is called. You can also order your food from the person if he's around.
The one redeeming feature is the free barley tea, which is also free flow.

We ordered Korean Chicken Ramen and it felt more like a bowl of Ê≥°ËèúÊâãÂ∑•Èù¢ than what it is called. I might have given half a star more if I wasn‚Äôt expecting it to be a bowl of Korean ramen. ‚Ä¶
Food is cheap and tastes not bad. Tastes like a mix of Korean and Chinese -- but it's still nice. Comes with free tea.
Large portion and reasonable price. Ordered steamboat chicken with miso soup. Chicken was already cooked with kimchi. So the soup turns kimchi after cooking. Free roasted barley tea btw.

We ordered Korean Chicken Ramen and it felt more like a bowl of Ê≥°ËèúÊâãÂ∑•Èù¢ than what it is called. I might have given half a star more if I wasn‚Äôt expecting it to be a bowl of Korean ramen.

The portion is huge though and I can barely finish the whole bowl. And at $5, it is very decent which might have explained why there is still a crowd at the store.
Ordered scallop teriyaki chicken set, was served less than 5mins. Scallops are well fried n chicken crispy on the outside juicy on the inside.

8picure offers a cozy, intimate setting for a special meal. Chef Gabriel's Italian-Asian fusion delights with fresh, high-quality ingredients. Must-tries include Hokkaido Scallop Antipasti, Red Prawn Pasta, and Herbs and Nuts Encrusted Lamb ‚Ä¶

Came here for Christmas Eve dinner and got their special Festive Menu which was SGD 135 per person. Overall the experience and the food was super nice and I would've given it five stars if it would've been slightly cheaper. My favourite was the wagyu and the pasta with scallops. The foie gras was also delicious. And their tiramisu is a must! So good and so original to combine it with pannetonne. The ginger cookies at the end are also amazing, make sure you leave space for them.

A review on a 1-star in Singapore‚Äôs Top Restaurants 2020/2021.

Chef Gabriel Lee, from 8picure, brings a wealth of culinary expertise rooted in European fine dining and personal culinary creativity. Known for blending technical finesse and heartfelt preparation, Chef Gabriel‚Äôs creations showcase his commitment to high-quality ingredients and unique flavors. His background, including training in Italy and working under celebrated Chef Emily Watkins in England, underpins his distinctive approach to cuisine.

At 8picure, guests can enjoy signature dishes such as:
‚Ä¢ Amuse-Bouche: A surprise dish showcasing the chef‚Äôs creativity.
‚Ä¢ Tuna Salsa with Prawn Crackers: A popular starter since 2020.
‚Ä¢ Chilled Pesto Capellini with Hokkaido Sashimi Scallop: A refined, fresh pasta dish.
‚Ä¢ Chilli Crab Crabcake: A twist on Singapore‚Äôs beloved dish with chili crab sauce (one of my favorites)
‚Ä¢ Sakura Ebi Capellini: Flavored with shio kombu and white wine (one of my favorites).
‚Ä¢ Herb-Crusted Cod Fish: Served with roasted bell pepper sauce and seasonal vegetables.
‚Ä¢ 8picurean Tiramisu: A standout dessert made with house-made mascarpone mousse, coffee and whisky-soaked ladyfingers, and roasted almond flakes. This dessert has been a bestseller since 2023.

Chef Gabriel‚Äôs passion for food and thoughtful service ensures each guest experiences dining beyond just a meal‚Äîit‚Äôs an event to savor and share.
