#HerbCrustedCod #SignatureTiramisu
#CreativeCuisine #SeafoodLovers

8picure offers a cozy, intimate setting for a special meal. Chef Gabriel's Italian-Asian fusion delights with fresh, high-quality ingredients. Must-tries include Hokkaido Scallop Antipasti, Red Prawn Pasta, and Herbs and Nuts Encrusted Lamb Rack. Attentive service and an extensive wine list enhance the experience. While pricey, the quality justifies the cost. Reservations are highly recommended for this hidden gem.

Came here for lunch. Very nice fresh ingredients and great presentation. Price is really reasonable. We ordered two pastas, both really nice. The appetizers superb too. üëç

Make sure you take reservations as the restaurant is very small. You can simply book on their website. Staff is very nice and polite. Water tap is free and set lunch comes with coffee / tea too. Will come back for dinner next time.

Food 4/5. Their signature san sui chicken and the accompanying ginger sauce was good. The chicken was tender and smooth. Other dishes were tasty.
Service 3.8/5. Staff were friendly and prompt in their service. Booking system needs to be improved as we had to wait for our table even after reserving earlier for the time slot.
Ambience 3.5/5. Place is nicely decorated, generally clean and comfortable. Can be noisy due to the crowd.
Price 4/5. A little pricey as expected for a restaurant in a mall. Can join as member to get 15% discount off the meal. There is also promotional free dish if order exceeds a certain amount.

A delightful little outlet, part of a chain. Staff members were excellent in terms of service, and the decor bringing you right back to olden China, as though dining in an inn. The selection of traditional Chinese soups was quite broad, and serving size is perfect for one.

Orders were quickly taken and promptly served. The signature dish being the chicken is highly recommended by myself, as the texture of the meat was so soft and tender. The ginger sauce complemented the dish well, as someone who utter dislikes ginger, I can vouch that it is really good. The rest of the dishes we had were executed perfectly as well, as the balance of flavours and seasonings were in precise harmony. Only let down was a lack in beverage choices. Most certainly will be back, especially when we got a return discount voucher for being Citibank card holders.

I went to the Soup Restaurant at Clementi Mall to have my birthday early celebration. I thought we wasn't allow to make reservations during weekend but call them to check and in fact I was able to so. Just had the scrumptious meal today and ‚Ä¶

Very friendly staff especially Ms Linda.
Service n food is very good. We tried their new soup: Collagen soup is fantastic.
Early bird is 20 percent discount. Don‚Äôt miss it !!

Disappointed with the customer service. The staff did not clearly inform us that the olive rice would take 15 minutes to prepare, even though our other dishes were already being served. This caused an unnecessary delay and disrupted our meal.

When we were making payment, the cashier, Catherine, was confirming our order and we were taking a moment to review. Out of nowhere, she asked, ‚ÄúDo you understand Chinese?‚Äù ‚Äî which came across as rude and uncalled for. Such a question was unnecessary and left a bad impression.

I went to the Soup Restaurant at Clementi Mall to have my birthday early celebration. I thought we wasn't allow to make reservations during weekend but call them to check and in fact I was able to so. Just had the scrumptious meal today and would like to put up few lines for the review. Very friendly and helpful staffs. I have ordered the Appreciation Set from them. Dishes came out real quick and we completed our meal in 1 hr. No rushing though, just nice pace for us. Dishes seems not too much or big but ended up quite filling. They have a good judge of serving potions to prevent food wastage which is nicely done. I like the soup and the samsui chicken very much. Other dishes were OK. Take a look at the pic attached.

We made an online reservation here to celebrate Mother's Day with my family. Reminded by email and phone call of the reservation by staff. On the day itself, we went into the restaurant and were shown to our table. After deciding what we wanted to eat, we called the waitress over and placed our orders. After ordering, the waitress asked for our membership. We were unsure of this requirement, and she said there was nothing she could do and just kept apologizing. Completely threw us off and spoilt the evening for our celebration. Yes, it was our mistake that we did not read the fine prints in the booking. But we cannot believe that all the confirmations, reminders, and even entering into the restaurant, we were not once informed to show the membership. The waitress did not even bother to follow up on my request to speak to her manager. She just kept saying sorry, making it very embarrassing for us and waiting for us to get ourselves kicked out of the restaurant. Please update your reservation procedure so as not to waste another customer's time. A simple member login to reserve will simply resolve this mess.

Beautiful food served beautifully. You can sit in a private Japanese style room, or in a private (curtained off) private seated (with chairs) area. There is a full service bar also. Counter service, or table service available. We opted for the counter service as we had a Tempura Kaiseki lunch set so we were able to enjoy watching as the chefs prepared each course. their menu is on their website. Service is very efficient. The staff are all outfitted with earpieces so that all the staff are notified immediately you are done and someone magically appears to clear away and prepare for the next course. Have been several times and always perfect.

I usually go to Donguri, but this was my first time at Akane! I ordered the lunch kaiseki course. I took lots of pictures, but it was so delicious that I forgot to take a picture of the tempura ‚ò∫Ô∏è The appetizer was absolutely delicious!

I made a reservation for 12:30. I also reserved a karaoke room for 2:00 PM, but I thought an hour and a half would be enough, but it was just barely enough. There were more customers than I expected, so it was noisy, but the staff said they were busy all day thanks to a promotion. We were there to get a discounted meal because of the promotion, so I didn't mind the noise ‚ò∫Ô∏è

I'll come again!

Charming restaurant with an impressive wine list and exquisite French food worthy of its Michelin star accolades. All the times I‚Äôve visited, food, wines and service were impeccable. Many of the dishes were outstanding - the pissaladiere, the scallops, lamb‚Ä¶ the pigeon dish was the best I‚Äôve had. The atmosphere is relaxed yet refined. It‚Äôs a must-visit for authentic French food in Singapore.

If you like to have wine to match the meal, I highly recommended this place. We ordered one bottle of red wine which waitress thoguht smell isn't in the best condition, they opened new one for us. Quality of meal is great and price is a bit high but not too much. They dont offer set so everything is ordered specifically. Reason why I rank as 4 stars because it's not recommeded to the people who just want to have meal without matching wine. the waitress will not offer you meal menu unless you order one kind of wine...

The food is very Creative with great wine selection. However, the service attentiveness needs further improvement so to deserve the Michelin star standard. Asking for a wine to pour but ignore for awhile, Wai Teresa can forget to replace my new plate even food has been served. The scallop stuffed with truffle tasted worst as you can‚Äôt even taste or smell the truffle. The anchovies, onion on the crispy biscuits was really good. The sardine with bread tasted just as good. The beef is out of the world but the Pigeon tasted so so. Wine selection was great and it paired with your food.. and the port wine served at the end was great too..

The food was delicious and the portions generous. There is free-flow of water, but do try their assortment of authentic beverages- they are delicious! The restaurant does have a cramped feel, being small and busy. Our table was not cleaned, ‚Ä¶

Second time here after a year. We enjoyed the first time more. The scallop was overcooked (would recommend a nice short sear instead) and the chicken was dry. The cod is still delicious, as is the rock shrimp and the small selection of ‚Ä¶

Second time here after a year. We enjoyed the first time more. The scallop was overcooked (would recommend a nice short sear instead) and the chicken was dry. The cod is still delicious, as is the rock shrimp and the small selection of savoury buffet dishes. The dessert buffet had an insect landing on various items, and the service was slower ‚Äî we had empty dishes taking up space on the table throughout the meal. Given that the price has increased since our last visit while the standard has dropped, that‚Äôs disappointing.

Nobu at the Four Seasons Hotel offers a decent Japanese lunch buffet, though some dishes fell short of expectations. The scallops were a bit dry and lacked depth in flavour, while the sushi, though well-balanced with more fish and less ‚Ä¶

Purchased the Taste of Nobu Weekend Brunch KrisFlyer Experience and we had an absolutely fabulous time! From the get go the service was impeccable. We reached a few minutes before 11am and were told to wait at the bar first, but was immediately ushered in at 11am to our table. The server brought the menu and carefully explained what was included in our package.

Starting from the cold buffet, we tried their variety of sushi which was super fresh! My fave would be the yellowtail jalapeno, it wasn't spicy, but it had just enough kick to make your tongue dance. The seafood ceviche was nice too.

For the exclusive selection, we obviously choose the Lobster salad with spicy lemon dressing and toban yaki A5 wagyu beef. Usually we would be quite sceptical when ordering a lobster because the meat can be tough and too chewy. That wasn't the case here. It was so sweet and easy to bite. The spicy lemon dressing really compliment the lobster and make it a very refreshing dish.

The wagyu beef was just... A mah zing! üòç it definitely earn the spot as my no. 1 fave out of all the dishes we've tried. Served on a hotplate, it was a simple but cooked to perfection. The taste was so tender, rich, buttery, sweet and savoury all melt in your mouth.

By this time we were starting to get full, but lo and behold, we still have 12 more hot dishes to go! So we decided to just focused on the ones we wanted to try and skipped the rest.

The rock shrimp tempura with creamy spicy sauce is SO good. It was coated in sauce but when you bite into it, it was soo crispy. The sauce was on the heavy side that we ended up strugling to finish (but we did finished it ü§≠).

The 2 fish dishes: the black cod miso and umami chillean sea bass were really nice as well. I liked the black cod more than the sea bass because the sauce was sweeter, but my husband like the seabass more as it taste lighter compared to the black cod.

We didn't expect much of the seafood toban yaki and the josper charcoal grilled spring chicken, but we were pleasantly surprised. The chicken was really fragant and the skin has a nice crisp.

By this time our tummies were about to explode, but we can't bear to finish the brunch without trying the difference between F1 beef steak and F1 beef toban yaki. I can tell you for sure, always choose toban yaki style. The steak was a bit tough, but the toban yaki beef was sooo tender!  It was a nice closing dish to our brunch journey.

We did try the desserts, but I can't comment too much as we both are not desserts person and we thought the desserts was a tad too sweet for our taste. They were super cute tho!

Everything including the non-alcoholic drinks were already part of the package so we only paid $40 for the free flow of sake for hubby.

All in all we thouroughly enjoyed our dining experience in Nobu and 10 /10 will definitely go again when we get a chance ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Came here with the expectation that it will be a classy, sort of fine dining high end sushi place.

Definitely on the pricey side but you pay for the experience. Ambience was brilliant, cozy and intimate with the dim lighting and modern Japanese furnishings. Service and staff was impeccable. It was our first time and the servers were patient to explain the menu and give recommendations because we took some time to decide.

Love rice cakes with tuna and the soft shell crab maki! For the maki, it was interesting to note that on top of seaweed, they also rapped a thin slice of radish which gave a crunchy refreshing twist.

Salmon tacos seemed ordinary and portions were way too small even for the price point ($6 each I believe) so your money is better spent on other dishes. Beef was also not too bad, super umami and filled with savoury buttery flavour.

Overall, we would have preferred the portions to be a bit bigger for most dishes. We weren‚Äôt craving any dessert and asked for the bill but they surprised me with a free dessert on the house. So nice of of the staff! Dessert was super unique ‚Äî was never served a jackfruit dessert before ‚Äî and had many depths of flavours that was beautifully combined.

Nobu at the Four Seasons Hotel offers a decent Japanese lunch buffet, though some dishes fell short of expectations. The scallops were a bit dry and lacked depth in flavour, while the sushi, though well-balanced with more fish and less rice, had slightly soggy rice. The buffet spread is modest in variety, but the mini chirashi stood out with its generous mix of ingredients. Desserts are delightfully sweet, perfect for those with a sweet tooth, and while the F1 steak was a tad tough, it was still enjoyable. The brinjal was a pleasant surprise, beautifully glazed with a rich sauce. Service was impeccable and the staff were warm and welcoming, which enhanced the dining experience. However, the experience was slightly marred by a kitchen staff member who seemed unhappy, shouting and then walking off. Overall, while the buffet has room for improvement, the dining atmosphere and service make it a worthwhile experience, though at $200 per person after service and GST, one might expect a bit more in terms of food quality.

Weekend brunch buffet was fantastic and exceeded expectations given lacklustre ratings on Google, which we personally found was undeserved.

The cold buffet section, albeit a bit limited, is good quality and I really loved the guacamole, chips and sashimi section. Having said that, where this buffet shines is definitely the free flow hot food selections from their menu - the cod and steak in particular. That is where most of your stomach space should be saved for.

Pricey? Sure, but it‚Äôs Nobu and the quality was worth it, in our opinion. In terms of highlights - the miso black cod absolutely hit the spot although the third portion we ordered was fishier, we still loved it. The F1 Japanese beef came in 2 styles, toban (sizzling skillet) or steak, and we preferred the steak version as it was cleaner tasting and retained the melt-in-the-mouth texture.

Service was faultless - the young man attending to our table was great and unfortunately his name escapes me but he was professional, warm and attentive.

We will definitely be back to treat ourselves one day soon!
Weekend Brunch by @nobu.singapore ($158/ pax). It includes Hot Dishes and unlimited access to Cold and Dessert Buffet Stations. There‚Äôs also free flow soft drinks and mocktails. ‚Ä¶

Slightly disappointed, it was very pricey and also AC was freezing cold!
Food and ambiance overall was good, we had the signature black cod , the beef was also great but the rest was soso. A plus was the service which was quite ‚Ä¶

Such a pleasant dining experience at this quaint and cosy authentic French crepe shop.

We had the Breizh Menu: 1 savoury crepe (ham, egg, cheese), 1 sweet crepe and a glass of apple cider. Also had the mushroom soup and the scallop appetisers.

Clean flavours, quality ingredients, yummy flavours.

My fave was the sweet crepe. Simply delicious!

Great service and ambience, too.

IG @sporkandbeanz

üöá Bugis, City Hall
üßæ $37 for the set

Had crepes for desserts after dinner nearby. It's a small French eatery with closely packed tables. We ordered 2 sweet crepes, one is gluten free (buckwheat). The original crepe with flour is very thin and soft. Gluten-free crepe is thin and crispy, which I much prefer. Prices are on the higher side ($15-18+ per crepe) and if you're seated indoors, there's a minimum order of one crepe per person. Accepted payment are cash or PayNow/PayLah only. We wanted to make payment with PayNow but were unable to because the network indoors is non-existent.
Food was nice and you know it's authentic French food when half the customers are French.

Best gluten-free crepes I‚Äôve ever had!!! Crispy and yummyü§§ Started with avocado one and had to order second one - Geraldine‚Äôs favorite. Both were sooo good! Ice cream and caramel sauce is home made. The only disadvantage is that they don‚Äôt accept cards but you can also pay with US dollars at least. Food highly recommended! ‚Ä¶

Best gluten-free crepes I‚Äôve ever had!!! Crispy and yummyü§§ Started with avocado one and had to order second one - Geraldine‚Äôs favorite. Both were sooo good! Ice cream and caramel sauce is home made. The only disadvantage is that they don‚Äôt accept cards but you can also pay with US dollars at least. Food highly recommended!

Delicious üòã Authentic galettes both sweet and savoury are available. Try the coconut glaze ones for the burst of sweet-flavoured goodness. My campanion had a savoury galette  (forgot the name) and she remarked it‚Äôs SUPER! Gluten-free and vegan options available too. And they have some  really excellent  aperitifs.üòâ ‚Ä¶

I recommend this place 100 times over! Especially if you are gluten-free! I was so happy while I was eating and I am sure my mom was tired of me gushing over the food. First, they can make any crepe item on the menu gluten-free with their ‚Ä¶

Easily one of my favorite Michelin rated spots I‚Äôve tried. This is French cuisine with a lot of influence from others too. My experience was better because of view on top of the meal. We rsvp‚Äôed for lunch for $138 SGD menu each. Their sparkling drink for when you first enter is deliciousness vs opting in for champagne for lunch. I also appreciate the whole experience for cleaning when you‚Äôre seated too.

I appreciated the story behind the dishes about his purpose of the circles in all his presentations and taste. My favorite of our menu were the first three appetizers, Hokkaido scallop, beef, bread with eggplant dip, and the final dessert of the tiny lemon cakes.

I can‚Äôt recommend this spot enough! Amazing job Chef Emmanuel and thank you for taking the time to check in on us during the meal too :) little things like that is appreciated for a good meal.

This restaurant definitely lived up to its two Michelin stars. I am willing to make a detour to savour its beautifully prepared dishes and curated wines.

The 4 course weekend set lunch was aesthetically pleasing and the taste wouldn‚Äôt throw you over the edge. Although only one dessert was listed in the menu, be prepared to be pampered with more after that. Even though I wasn‚Äôt a frequent wine drinker, the sommelier was able to recommend a very fine pairing based on my crude description. The tea that i separately order to go with my desserts was also skilfully brewed. It‚Äôs these little detail of perfection that made this place unique.

The service staffs were pleasant and professional. However, the person who greeted me at the entrance wasn‚Äôt enunciating properly. I almost tripped over a small step but she might have warned me about it. I also felt that the ingredients of the dishes can be explained more slowly. The entrance to the restaurant wasn‚Äôt obvious as it served two restaurants.

Out of this world, absolutely mind-blowing food. Every dish was made to perfection, with all the flavours bursting in your mouth with every bite you take. I practically inhaled the food. Atmosphere was just amazing. Perfect for date nights ‚Ä¶

Honestly a solid dinner from start to finish. Food was great. Staff were attentive, wine and drinks flowed automatically. Really felt the warm and genuine service. Could hear the staff cracking jokes at each other and also joking with us ‚Ä¶

Out of this world, absolutely mind-blowing food. Every dish was made to perfection, with all the flavours bursting in your mouth with every bite you take. I practically inhaled the food. Atmosphere was just amazing. Perfect for date nights or catching up with friends. Dishes were explained by none other than MasterChef winner Chef Woo Wai Leong. Overall an unparalleled experience.

business_name: The BOILER @ Buona Vista | Best Seafood Boil | Crabs & Lobsters |
text: Had a great meal with 10% discount! Highly recommend the seafood Bombdiggity Bag which came with fresh prawns and a huge crab! The salmon Mentaiko pasta, spare ribs and Ultimate Burger were also great. Service was friendly, and we had a choice of indoor seats or outdoor. Good to book in advance to avoid waiting in queue

business_name: The BOILER @ Buona Vista | Best Seafood Boil | Crabs & Lobsters |
text: Had a great time gathering with good friends, with fantastic food! Danish provided great service even though initially I was upset with Jun cos called for service twice with him nodding to me but still never come over. But the food and great service subsequently made the bad feelings go away. Will be back for sure!

business_name: The BOILER @ Buona Vista | Best Seafood Boil | Crabs & Lobsters |
text:
[Jul 2025] Been to Boiler many times over the years across different outlets, the food and service never fail to deliver, be it for cosy date nights or large gatherings.

Tried the flavour of the month - laksa! (To Boiler, do consider making this a permanent flavour, it‚Äôs bombilicious!) The ingredients were completely coated with the rich and fragrant laksa sauce, especially the mantous.

Food was served fast. Note that the place and crowd may be a bit loud for babies and young children.

üÖøÔ∏è Free parking (up to $3) is available for Boiler customers at Elementum.

business_name: The BOILER @ Buona Vista | Best Seafood Boil | Crabs & Lobsters |
text:
Celebrated a birthday here, really appreciate how they gave a birthday bib and a free slice of cake :)

Seafood bags had generous portions and seafood was quite good! The free lobster for the birthday deal was particularly big, to my surprise. The garlic butter sauce was very good. I think the truffle lobster mee pok could do with a richer sauce + noodles were slightly undercooked.

What made our visit particularly enjoyable was the attentive service by Jia Qi. it‚Äôs rare nowadays to have service that is thoughtful, personable, proactive and helpful! keep up the good work!

business_name: The BOILER @ Buona Vista | Best Seafood Boil | Crabs & Lobsters |
text:
Went to have a try with a friend here with no reservations at around 7 which is great. Had the medium duo bag with the sauce of the month. I would say it was pretty dang good though more buns would be great personally the seafood was pretty fresh especially the prawns though I wish it was more generous with the sausages and the corn as there were one piece each. And we ordered the Sri Lanka crab with garlic butter which was a lighter sauce and as well with their promo of 50% off which I don‚Äôt know if they did do the discount on the bill but! It was pretty good. And a little side we ordered was the wings those were honestly great with a nice crunch and to end it off we tried the lava cake which was nice with the side of ice cream as well. No complaints there staff were pretty friendly I would say though they came back twice just to check on the promo they were quite swift as well. Overall ambiance was pretty chill.

Would recommend if craving something unique rather then your normal seafood though quantity I would say could be improved.

business_name: The BOILER @ Buona Vista | Best Seafood Boil | Crabs & Lobsters |
text:
Consistent quality. Remember to come on bdays for the free lobster! Niha asked me to mention her name in the review, she was nice and prompt w service but you guys really shldnt be judging them based on this man lol.

Pls give her whatever incentive la it is la.

business_name: The BOILER @ Buona Vista | Best Seafood Boil | Crabs & Lobsters |
text: came here for my mom‚Äôs birthday. service was impeccable and food was üíØ. we ordered a set and the birthday promo meant we had a free lobster. we opted for the signature sauce for the set and the butter garlic one for the lobster. both were ‚Ä¶

Entrance is outside.

Squid ink pasta with scallops ‚Ä¶

Been a loyal customer after falling in love with their burrata and have been spreading word of mouth about the pleasant experiences I have had here but my experience today was extremely disappointing. We typically reserve slightly in ‚Ä¶

Entrance is outside.

Squid ink pasta with scallops
Gnocchi with crab meat
Burrata
Fried calamari

Very good food with great service. A little out of the way and pricey but is a delicious meal. The squid ink pairs well with the seafood and the calamari is perfectly fried.

The burrata is a little on the larger side 300g to share with 2 people and has a bit too few sides paired with it.

Have been coming here a couple of times a week for the past 10 years. Unfortunately after their recent renovation and an influx of new staff, standards have massively dropped. After arriving to get a takeaway, one member of staff who I had never seen before was incredibly rude /  dismissive because he claimed the foodpanda order hadn‚Äôt come through. Mistakes happen, I get that, and can accept it. But his attitude was terrible, dismissive and patronising (and to the so-called boss, who seemed to think the whole situation was funny, you know who i am referring to). This is especially disappointing given the customer service from the team here was previously so impressive. I‚Äôm afraid after many years of custom, I won‚Äôt set foot in this place again. Such a shame that a great neighbourhood restaurant has lost its standards.

Somehow I think the chef must be different from the one some years back.
I avoided this restaurant as the food before was quite oily.
This time, I thought of coming in with an Eatigo voucher but only after ordering did they tell me that the thalis were not included in the Eatigo equation.
I was puzzled as to why the waiter didn't tell me what was included when I walked in and specifically mentioned that I booked with Eatigo.
Nevertheless we didn't want to have our orders changed so we just went for it.
They were both delicious and actually a little too much but for something which you don't eat often, we were very satisfied with the taste and quality of food.

business_name: YC Dining & Bar | Western Restaurant Bar
text:
Went for wine invitationüòö Never try too much of their food but the overall first impression about this restaurant is on point. The skewer is SO GOOD that I do not think I can forget about this placeüòÇ Another plus point is that mrt station is nearby! How convenient. They know how to place their business strategically. Nice works.

Will definitely come back for more when I‚Äôm in the West area of Singapore againü•π

Great atmosphere! Chocolate drink was awesome with marshmallows on it. Grilled cheesewhich, chicken waffle and chilli crab pasta were nice. Recommend for special occasions as they gave free truffle fries for Father's Day

Planned to take the family to check out Jurong Lake Gardens, and decided to plan dinner nearby as well - Canopy was recommended by Google.

Enquiry call: Couldn't figure out the parking situation from Google Maps, so I called in the afternoon. Staff who picked up the call was polite and helpful. Advised that the restaurant would be about a 10-15 minute walk from the car park. Noted.

Accessibility: Open-air car park is indeed located a 10-15 minute pleasant slow walk from the drop-off point. However do note that the last hurdle is the famous Chinese Garden arched bridge which is quite steep.

Ambience: We visited on a quiet Monday evening with only 3 other occupied tables. Nice and quiet with a couple of well-behaved kids present. Was told that there is a live band performing on Saturdays. Well noted. Vibe is very casual with greenery in birdcages hanging from the ceiling. Outdoor area is pet-friendly, and we passed two doggies on our way in.

Service: Very attentive, our server was observant and responsive when we needed to catch his eye. Helpful with dish customisation too. Nice touch to offer mum a cup of hot water. Thanks!

Food: Quite tasty and well-presented. Portion sizes were adequate. Had to wait a little while for our mains which was puzzling as the restaurant wasn't very busy.

Affordability: Menu prices are on the higher side, considering the standard and taste of the dishes we ordered, but well worth the vibe and locale. Good for a first date or for celebrating a family event, maybe not for our weekly meals.

Hint: Come a little earlier for dinner and go for a stroll behind the restaurant to see the stone boat, lotus pond and the pagoda in the distance. Well-maintained garden is a pleasure to wander through. Toilets are located a short walk outside the restaurant, visit before your meal.

Menu sampling:
‚Ä¢ Wild Porcini Mushroom Soup $10
‚Ä¢ Signature Fried Calamari $18
‚Ä¢ Oven-Baked Barbecue Ribs $30
‚Ä¢ Crabmeat Aglio Olio $25
Dropped by on a public holiday for brunch! They had a free welcome lemon tea for oddle members which was nice and strong but a little too sweet. ‚Ä¶

Dropped by on a public holiday for brunch! They had a free welcome lemon tea for oddle members which was nice and strong but a little too sweet.

Had their breakfast platter, which was kinda mid but not bad for the price $20. Though the menu said sourdough, the toast was just normal white bread/baguette. Kind of disappointing. Scrambled egg is abit dry and some bits was over done.

The star of the dish was the  sausage, the hint of spice was just right and pork was fragrant. I also liked the pumpkin wedges sweet and nicely roasted. my long black was alright, not good but not bad.

What makes the place worth the visit would be the pretty lake gardens around it and the vibe is naturey and calming. Good music and nice place to just chill out with friends.
Came here because of free beer from drinkies. Also if you scan the oddle app, you get a free ice lemon tea for first timers. Pet friendly restaurant is a plus
Had a beef burger set for 8.5 sgd with student discount. Quite affordable for students. Seaweed fries is top notch. Recommended. ‚Ä¶

Had a beef burger set for 8.5 sgd with student discount. Quite affordable for students. Seaweed fries is top notch. Recommended.

The elderly lady also really kind and soft spoken.

business_name: Signature Restaurant & Bar - Best Briyani and Grill chicken
text: Very good place for a hassle free drinks and food. Their chilli chicken and biryani tastes very nice. Would definitely visit again.

The food is nice. Always the best choice when craving for xiao long bao in Jurong East area. They have the special 8 flavor XLB, look so nice but for me the ogirinal flavor is the best. You can see they make XLB in the kitchen when you walkin the restaurant.
Besides good food, services crew here is also super friendly and helpful. The Vietnamese staff at cashier introduced me to joined membership to get discount and earn point. So helpful. Recommended Xiao Long Bao, Pan-fried Shanghai bun, Drunken Chicken, Pork chop fried rice.

This branch food focus is on china dishes... with spreads from Szechuan to Shanghai

40% discount available on weekdays excluding eve of/and public holidays, and one must have PGR membership...pretty good deal

Food tried:
Pan Fried Shanghai Pork Bun ... juicy pork patty within a bun that was oil,/water fried at the baseline... delicious... and beware of soup splatter when one bites into it
One could easily have 2 if there is not mich ordering of other dumplings or buns... a return dish

Steamed Vegetable Dumpling
Chives and garlic fillings in dumplings served in a wooden steam basket... nice rendition

Prawn and Pork Dumpling in Hot Chilli Vinaigrette... pork and pork patty in dumpling that is soaked in chilli vibaigrette...
Portion tried did not have a fresh pork taste..but the vinaigrette had an interesting and appetising mix of chilli, vinegar and citrus taste (perhaps lime)

Chilled Assorted Vegetable and Tou
Fu Tossed with Vinegraitte... nice rendition of sliced seaweed/tau pok/beansprout and vermicelli in chilli vinaigrette

Drunken Chicken... chilled chicken thigh in shaoxing wine... some bits can be a bit tough if turnover is not high

Red Bean Glutinous Rice Roll topped with Soy Bean Powder... interesting chilled dessert not commonly found in most Spore Chinese Restaurant... however meal partner did not find it as authentic tasting as those ftom China

Chilled Aloe Vera with Osmanthus in Honnet Lemon Juice... tasty refreshing dessert after the above meat and vege dishes

üêü Dive into the world of premium Giant Grouper over at Mr Johnny Tan's restaurant. One-of-its-kind, the fish weighs nearly a whopping 300kg! Priced for its rich, thick collagen, Johnny knows the best ways to bring out the freshness and unique taste of this delicacy with a stock simmered with loads of fresh fish. Another unique stock is made with Coconut Cotelydon that give the dishes a natural sweet taste.
Almost every part of the fish can be consumed, including its scales, which are used to make the nutrious Gui Ling Gao ÈæüËãìËÜè.
Apart from fish, Johnny sources special vegetables from the Saba aboriginals, such as Crystalline Ice Plant. It makes a perfect match with Coconut Cotelydon for a refreshing, crunchy delight.

Food is good, but experience got drastically affected by the rude service staffs. I fundamentally believe if you don't like your job you should either quit or do something about it and not vent it on the business's customers. Either the ‚Ä¶

Food is good, but experience got drastically affected by the rude service staffs. I fundamentally believe if you don't like your job you should either quit or do something about it and not vent it on the business's customers. Either the owners is oblivious to the situation or the staffs are putting up a front.

Staff wasnt patient at all when we asked about the ingredients displayed as there were no descriptions and it's our virgin visit. Asked for napkins if possible upon checkout and all 3 front staff quickly jumped on aggressively to say don't have, saw tissues at the cashier counter and asked if I could have one if not I could buy it and they said that's kitchen towels and not tissues so no. After seating down heard the staff complaining among themselves of how they haven't had their off days. I guess they are overwhelmed as they were are seating inside the counter on a toilet stool when we walked in. The place was empty tho with only 1 table of 2pax.

Food was good and super value for money as recommended by a fellow alumni. I personally feel it's underpriced for the quality.

To the owners I hope you're seeing this as you have a great business given your NTU story, and it will be a waste if you lose customers over stupid unnecessary things like this. Super great fast service business model with exceptional prices and the last key to the lock is to have basic decent human to human respect from the service staffs. We are not even talking about any customer service here.

We celebrated my husband‚Äôs 41st birthday at Jaan and it was a truly memorable experience. This was our third time dining here and our first visit since the restaurant's revamp‚Äîand I‚Äôm happy to say it‚Äôs just as exceptional as ever.

We had the 5-course lunch paired with a non-alcoholic flight of 4 and a wine flight of 3. The food and pairings were spot on, with the non-alcoholic flight being a real standout. Each drink was thoughtfully crafted to mimic the experience of reds and sparkling wines‚Äîcreative, refreshing, and full of surprises.

A special shoutout to Jagan for the kind gesture of an additional scallop dish and a beautifully printed ‚ÄúHappy 41st Birthday‚Äù message, which made the celebration feel even more personal and special. A great recommendation by the sommelier to pair the cheese plate with Kopke port‚Äîit was spot on.

From the refined service to the exquisite presentation and the thoughtful touches throughout the meal, Jaan continues to impress. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a refined and memorable dining experience in Singapore.

Visited in Jun 2024 for dinner.

The dinner menu was a ~12 course dining experience (incl. the starting bites) for S$388++. The starting courses were excellent, esp. the Goose Mousse and the Barbecue Scallop courses. Among the main courses, the trout and the lamb were the best ones according to me. While there were a couple of dishes which felt a bit ‚Äúlacking in flavour‚Äù to me, the overall experience of the savoury courses was good. For desserts, we could choose between a strawberry and a chocolate course - the chocolate one tasted better to me. At the end of the 12 courses, there also 4 petit fours which were good - the chocolate  petit four was top notch.

For drinks, we just went with some Krug champagne as this is a Krug Ambassador restaurant.

Service is fantastic here, as would be expected of a restaurant of this stature. The restaurant was kind to cater to some of the allergies our group had. At the end of the meal, they were also very gracious to give us some extra petit fours as we had really liked them.

Overall, a visit to this OG Singapore Michelin star restaurant is recommended if you haven‚Äôt been here before.

Tried a Brazilian-inspired restaurant and really enjoyed the food. Everything is gluten-free, but still full of flavour. The corn ribs were crispy and tasty, and the grain-fed White Pyrenees lamb was tender and well-seasoned. ‚Ä¶
Delicious food but on the pricey side. We were able to book online on the same day for a Sunday night which is great. They do everything gluten free.

Tried a Brazilian-inspired restaurant and really enjoyed the food. Everything is gluten-free, but still full of flavour. The corn ribs were crispy and tasty, and the grain-fed White Pyrenees lamb was tender and well-seasoned.

Ended with the a√ßai sorbet, which was light and refreshing ‚Äî not too sweet.

The staff were friendly and helpful, and the whole place had a warm, relaxed vibe. Food was satisfying and easy on the stomach. Would definitely come back.

Everything is gluten free on the menu. Walk in on a weekend night. The waiters were very friendly and accommodating. Not very easy to get here. Food is good but not amazing. Had the focaccia and the steak. Too much potatoes and not enough steak.
Nestled in the heart of Tiong Bahru, The Butcher‚Äôs Wife is a vibrant, gluten-free bistro that masterfully blends Latin and Mediterranean flavors. ‚Ä¶

I ordered the wagyu and octopus, which was really on point. I also had the ceviche which served as a great starter.

For a gluten-free restaurant it certainly does not feel like one. Recommend trying the focaccia because it does not feel like it was gluten- free!

I was so nervous about traveling not only after the pandemic but after I suddenly got diagnosed with Celiac Disease. It‚Äôs been kinda difficult to find places pretty much anywhere in Asia, and this place is so good. I expected the price to be costly as a gluten-free establishment, but regardless of that, this place was great!! My own Singaporean friend will be bringing his own friends back here too!! We had the Moqueca and Feijoada!!

So immediate ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚Äôs of you go all out gluten free and nail it in such a way that a non-celiac would come back for the food again.

The only issue was a wonky table that was fixed within a minute!

Great job guys! Thank you!

If you're looking for a venue to host a small, elegant, and stress-free ROM celebration, look no further! We hosted our ROM lunch here with 20 of our closest friends and family, and it was nothing short of perfect. ‚Ä¶

Amazing restaurant for celiacs. Having everything fully gluten free means every dish can be shared.
The restaurant is quite fancy and the presentation was right on point.
Some dishes taste great, while others were a bit blunt. Overall, we had a good experience

The food is really good, gluten-free.
The service is really good as well!
They gave us 2 Dodinhos to try for free, it is really nice! Must order next time. They also made us 2 special cocktails for a special occasion. Great and will return!

Love the vibes, interior, food, drinks, and service! It was such a great experience there and thank you to the team for the awesome service and free birthday dessert, making my partner‚Äôs birthday an extra special one! ü´∂üèª Would love to try the other dishes, and will pop by again one day! ‚Ä¶

‚ÄãLolla delivers an exceptional dining experience. The Scallop, Beef, and Crab dishes were exquisite, showcasing fresh ingredients and creative execution. Yuki provided outstanding service, attentive and friendly throughout our meal. The "Tira-misu" was a delightful finish. A truly 5-star experience deserving of high praise.

Incredible menu, service and atmosphere
Very fresh seafood with an originality which I have not seen in other establishments in Singapore.

First time trying fine Filipino inspired dining, the eleven course menu was fantastic - I loved the scallop mushroom piyaya (kind of like a savoury pancake like a softer doughier tostada) and the pili nut, the dessert was also such a tasty surprise - smoked hay ice cream with caramel, sesame oil and caviar - perfect combination of salty and sweet (honestly the caviar in dessert idea slightly scared me but it was delicious)

I had quite a few dietary requirements which the team managed to handle very well, best to tell them asap when you book

McDonald's at West Coast Park is a war zone on Saturday nights. Perhaps you need a better collection setup or workflow to prevent customers from crowding around the collection point while still allowing them to be near and hear their numbers being called.

To those blocking the collection area when your food isn‚Äôt ready‚Äîstanding there won‚Äôt make it arrive any faster. Instead, you‚Äôre obstructing others who are trying to navigate in and out with trays full of food and drinks.

And for those constantly checking on your orders, it‚Äôs best to give the servers time to prepare your food rather than interrupting them. They‚Äôre doing their best.

A little patience goes a long way.

Limited indoor seats
Bigger group most suggest to call to reserve seats 1st. ‚Ä¶

Limited indoor seats
Bigger group most suggest to call to reserve seats 1st.

Outdoor seats was warm due to recent weather although there were fans

Not easy to find parking lot if you are driving. Need to circle around for a while to get a lot especially so if it is a peak hour for meals.

They have member (foc) system which entitles you to discount on the meals which is kinda nice.
Order from QR code at seats and payment option via app or at counter is available

If not for the hot weather and outdoor seats, it would be a better experience

Formerly known as Yuan Bistro, then rebranded as Botanict. They have shifted several locations - from CT Hub, to Tampines Mart Cloud Kitchen, and now currently in the Bukit Batok heartlands (9 min walk from Bukit Batok MRT). What remains constant is the lady boss' dedication to preparing unique and tasty allium-free vegetarian food! Apart from more conventional Chinese dishes, they also serve Western, Nyonya, and Indonesian dishes. Previously had their CNY 2024 edition of their Indonesian Nasi Tumpeng, and some of their signature items such as Homemade Spicy Otah and Boneless Chicken. This time, I also enjoyed more bestselling dishes such as Ayam Penyet, Buah Keluak, Vegan Oyster Omelette, and Grilled Stingray. They will be closing at their current location on 31st May 2024; do support them in the meantime! Rooting for them and looking forward to their new chapter!

Really lovely, locally owned, plant based restaurant. Candra and her husband make everything themselves from scratch and it really shows in the quality and tastiness of the food! They also have island wide delivery for those who don‚Äôt stay nearby but have cravings for tasty vegan food. Highly recommended!!

Yummy foods :)
Thanks for the free membership :)
Enjoy 10% disc immediately upon joining as member :)
I call this place the veranda. Very nice big veranda in the middle of some condos. One of the few places left serving Paulaner draft. Great Pizza. Friendly young people responding quite fast.
Casual fuss free play to chill out. Lots of beers & other drinks. Surprised to see Hibiki & Yamazaki whisky on the board
Nice spot to chill outdoors. Only - is the limited, but free street parking.

Had bf there & bought 3 pkt of takeaway: mee Siam, laksa & curry chicken rice. Utterly disappointed. Mee Siam was in tact. Instead of laksa, it‚Äôs mee tai mak. Curry chicken rice is only a box of rice without curry & chicken. Tried calling them about 10 times but no one answer the phone.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND  ****

So, heard alot about this breakfast place called Toast Box and thought of finally trying it.. and guess what??!! guys I loved it‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Location and Ambience:
well you can find its branches almost anywhere in Singapore. It is amongst those few eateries which I would strongly recommend people to visit mostly because of its interior and Ambience. This place has this grandiose look and as soon as you enter you feel fresh because of the pretty white walls and bright lightings.

Food:
Food is good. Although I haven't tried everything but I have tried few of them like peanut butter toast and coffee. I personally love the peanut butter here. it tastes creamy and fresh as if they have just made it.
Coffee is also good but keep in mind that the spoon given is for some reason and that is to stir(I didn't stir it once and had to have it as it is and later realized that the sugar was there and all I needed to do was stirüòÖüòú).

Service:
Its a self service eatery. So, you ll have to stand in the queue and as soon as you give your order you recieve your drink be it coffee or tea or milo anything but for the food like toast or anything else you will have to wait but not for long.

Cost:
Yes It is pocket friendly and that is the one of the major reasons why I loved it.

Came around 8pm and enquired about what menu items were still available. After only the 2nd or 3rd menu item, the male staff told the cashier, to tell me "to go eat grass." Very rude and uncalled for, that came out of nowhere, especially since the conversation between myself and the cashier was cordial and friendly. I'm guessing this male staff wanted to go home early and I was standing in the way.

Food is on par with what I would expect for a Michelin 2 star. Beautiful, elegant, right portioned, and most importantly, they taste really great. The desert at the end was really the best I‚Äôve had.

After finishing the main course, we were brought to level 2 for desert. I was asked on whether I want coffee or tea, without knowing that they are not free. Ceylon tea costs 12 dollars a small pot, and long black coffee costs 8 dollars a cup. Compared to the total cost it‚Äôs trivial, but it would have been considerate to mention they are not complimentary.

As for atmosphere, I find the music a little too loud. I could barely hear when the waiters were introducing the dishes.

Cloudstreet is a two Michelin star restaurant led by Sri Lankan chef Rishi Naleendra who trained in Australia. He is the first Sri Lanka-born chef to receive a Michelin star. Serving one tasting menu only. Chef Naleendra draws on his coming-of-age years in Australia as well as his Sri Lankan heritage. Some Japanese influence is also apparent on the menu. The signature dish is a crayfish called ‚Äúmarron‚Äù which had been poached and precut into bite-sized pieces.
The interior is simple, modern design with the dominant black colour. The main scene is a large chef‚Äôs table style with few tables at the back. Desserts are served upstairs in a much brighter lounge. The desserts were a bit let down

Have not visit this place after pandemic. They have lots of varieties of Tze Char on the menu. Orders garlic see hum (claim), Wat Tan Hor, Kai Lan Gu Lou Yok (sweet sour pork). Serving was fast maybe it has y the dinner time. Food were good after we decided to add on Salted Fish Fried Rice. When I asked if they have served wrongly? They told me it is like that. Practically, this is fried rice and sprinkle on salted fish? Felt cheated. I would ordering this dish if I have a chance to order again.

A rustic natural ambience draws me to sit and savour the view and the food. The Salmon miso was good but the Sirloin steak was more Medium well rather than medium which made chewing even harder. Coffee was good!  But the highlight were the spirit-free drinks which were so refreshing! It's a great place to chill when the weather is cooler and if the fan circulates wide cos the ambience is lovely!

Very pity portion with the money we paid.. The first time i hv with so much disappointment of the egg benedict..
Kids free choice menu asked to choose one from broccoli/carrot/corn... Why  cant serve 3 together.. Colours added into the kids meal more appetite!

Wonderful service by a group of young and well trained staff (all females waitresses!) the place is very kids friendly, kids can enjoy outdoor play freely while parents can watch over their meals. The patio is huge can host long tables and it's airy even on a hot day. Like the simple but tasty food choices.

We had a fantastic enjoyable lunch experience at Z√©n restaurant.

Once you enter the restaurant, you feel the three-star Michelin star atmosphere right away. The fabrics on the furniture look like art. The decor is kinda fun and energetic, creates that pre meal atmosphere, to ease you in and make you relaxed. Even the coaster for the water is pretty fancy.

We were served canapes.
First was a cannoli looking thingy, choux pastry filled with cream, and chestnut honey coating. Nice crunch.
Second was a tartlet with turnip base and marron crayfish and Thai basil. The crayfish had a nice bite and was so fresh, taste of the ocean.
Third was Tofu Yuba deep fried skin used as a tartlet base, bottom of tart is burrata cheese, with otoro and grilled pomelo with hint of wasabi. The otoro melts in your mouth.
Fourth was beignet with hazelnut mousse. that will ooze out. Eaten with one bite. The saltiness of the caviar and sweetness of the hazelnut mousse blends well together.

The staff explained all the ingredients they had used for the lunch experience. Pretty cool that they show you all the unique ingredients and sourced from where. So when we taste the dishes later on, we know what we are eating. E.g. the rhubarb is especially red and thick unlike the fainter and thinner ones we typically find in the supermarket. The grapes are so plump and glossy too.

We were then brought upstairs. Cool decor again, with the plants and sunlight.

First proper dish - Crudo: Scallop, artichoke, Amalfi lemon, galangal. The scallop was sliced so thinly and evenly, must have taken a lot of skill to do that. Below that was a thin layer of gel sheet thingy, and below that were small cubes of (I think it's artichoke). Very beautiful presentation with the thin strips of lemon, galangal.

Second dish - Chawanmushi awabi foie gras, matsutake. The mushrooms gave a very nice bite and meaty feel. It's really an immersive dining experience with the staff plating the dish in front of you.

Third dish - Madai, mussel, saffron, salted fennel. The fish melts in your mouth, but the blue mussel had a somewhat muddy taste.

Fourth dish - Onion, almond & liquorice. onion soup reduction, almond milk, almond oil, with real almonds for crunch, & liquorice powder. Our favourite dish! The almond milk and oil goes so well with the onion soup reduction, and the almonds provided good texture.

We were then presented knives from Sweden. hand painted. Birchwood. we can choose our knife to use for the main course

Fifth dish - Kurobuta pork, cabbage eescabeche', Kampot pepper, nori. YM had the same dish but was A4 Yukimuro wagyu instead of the Kurobuta pork. The fried kale was so good and the sauce was yummy.

Sixth dish - palate cleanser. rhubarb sorbet with strawberry granita and pink peppercorn. The rhubarb and strawberry was so good. But think the pink peppercorn was a bit overpowering.

Seventh dish - Sweet potato ice cream,grilled pineapple, mezcal (like tequila with smokey flavour that matches grilled pineapple) made into caramel sauce with anise mousse. Everything goes well together so nicely. And it was fantastic we got to see the pineapple ingredient and the whole roasted pineapple, and finally the immaculately arranged pineapple (like scales) on the plate.

Lastly we were brought to the third floor. Huge collection of wines and liquors. Nice comfy sofas and book collection. Meant to make you feel relaxed to enjoy the last desserts of the meal.

Trio of fruits in a very elegant dish - eat the grapes first (skin removed!) with soaked lemongrass water, followed by mango with Yuzu powder, and finally the super sweet melon!

Then we had a bowl of madeleines with brown butter. so fragrant! The staff kindly offered a second bowl! So yummy when it is so fluffy and warm.

The staff served us an entremet cake to celebrate birthday. The layers were so defined, and can see many vanilla specks in the mousse. So satisfying!

The staff showed us the balcony, nice view!

All in all, a very enjoyable experience. It's not just the food, but the atmosphere and service too.

Ticked off another place on my to try list, this time at 3-Michelin starred Zen. Every dish was excellent; from the canap√©s, to the items on the menu, and to the petit fours.

Pictured:
- Crudo: Shima aji, tangelo kosho, marjoram
- Chawanmushi, razor clam, 100 days aged pork, Bafun Uni, coriander
- Marron, hamaguri, ginger dashi, okahijiki
- White asparagus, coffee ponzu, lemongrass, coconut
- Biwa masu, harissa, Swarnadwipa, sansho
- Seared scallop, maitake, juniper, Vin Jaune
- A4 Yukimoro wagyu, cabbage ‚Äòescabeche‚Äô, Kampot pepper, nori
- Rhubarb, strawberry granita, rose pepper
- Salted carrot ice cream, hoshigaki & mikan, Jin Xuan oolong

An exceptional experience! The Frantzen group experience is second to none. The flavors, ingredients and service is always worth it. The chefs brought out a dish I once had at their Stockholm location and it was such a touching gesture. It was a scallop dish with black currant leaf, foie gras and kampot pepper. One of the dishes I look back on often and will tell people about. The staff, Jared, TC, Rachel, Ernest, Zoo are all rockstars.

Very yummy food! Amazing wedding venue in Singapore! Such a hidden gem. My fiance and I were so happy to find this place. Good food to make parents happy, fuss free and even includes wedding photography and wedding videography. How amazing! Thank you so much team

Went for dish sampling. Cost close to $250 pax. All are great with some wow.

Cold dish was superb. Crispy eel might be my favorite and only spring roll is mid. Lychee prawn was well made.

Soup was excellent can taste how concentrated it was. But asked for abalone to be changed to fish maw and scallops.

Deep fried prawns were gigantic, crispy and tasted great. Were because there were two prawns.

Steam soon hock, abalone and noodles were okay.

Smoked duck was savory and full of the oily flavorful. Going with bun does makes the oiliness more manageable.

Aloe vera crystal jelly was excellent with the minty giving it a unique herby twist.

Disappointing First Visit to Grand Shanghai Restaurant in Singapore

I recently had the opportunity to dine at Grand Shanghai Restaurant in Singapore, and I must say that my first visit left me feeling rather disappointed. While the restaurant had been recommended to me by a friend, my experience fell far short of my expectations.

Pros:

Ambience: The restaurant's ambience was pleasant, with traditional Chinese decor that added a touch of elegance to the dining experience.

Chinese Cuisine Variety: Grand Shanghai offers a wide range of Chinese dishes, promising an extensive selection of flavours and culinary experiences.

Cons:

Unwelcoming Reception: My visit began on the wrong foot when the front desk Chinese lady did not make any effort to guide me to my reserved table, even though it was my first time there. This lack of attention made me feel unwelcome and lost.

Inconsistent Service: As our food was served, I noticed that some guests at adjacent tables were left waiting for their orders. It was disappointing to witness the lack of consistency in serving the food promptly to all customers. We had to repeatedly call over the waitress to remind them to serve the missing portions, which disrupted our dining experience.

Lack of Attention: The waitstaff's attentiveness was notably lacking throughout the evening. For instance, they failed to refill the teapot with hot water, even when we turned the lid upside down as a signal. This neglect of basic service elements hindered our enjoyment of the meal.

In conclusion, my first visit to Grand Shanghai Restaurant in Singapore was not as enjoyable as I had hoped. The restaurant's beautiful decor and variety of Chinese dishes are overshadowed by the unwelcoming reception, inconsistent service, and a lack of attention from the waitstaff. While the potential is there, there is significant room for improvement in customer service and attentiveness to ensure a more pleasant dining experience for guests.

üü¶ This Shanghainese restaurant looks like it came out of a vintage film.‚ñ™Ô∏éGrand Shanghai Restaurant gives off lots of nostalgic vibes  = with a spacious & majestic looking main dining hall with crystal chandeliers hanging above & a stage for live band singing in the night.

üü¢ Luxurious furnishings, including plush cream coloured chairs, dark green banquettes, warm lighting, with a blend of table lamps and soft overhead illumination, creates an intimate and cozy atmosphere. üüß Private rooms are also available for special occasions ( ‚û°Ô∏èyou need to check with the staff)

They were very kind, polite, affable and gracious. üüßThis is truly top-notch service befitting that of an opulent and grand Chinese eatery. ü©µ Thank you so much to all the wait staff for their outstanding omotenashi sense of hospitality.

üß° I forgot to add = The cutlery and crockery really wow-ed me. ‚úîÔ∏è The chopsticks were the beautifully crafted type adorned with a silver tip, and the plates for souffle desserts were the embossed patterned type.

üíú All in all, I had a most luxurious dimsum lunch experience. ‚úîÔ∏è Superb food and good personable service, I have to give 5 out of 5 stars.

üü°Dated 16th March 2025 Sunday noon

Live music that reminisces the 1930s jazz era of good old Shanghai is the coolest & unique experience in Singapore. Great appeal if one loves nostalgia & digs the Chinese shidaiqu Êó∂‰ª£Êõ≤. Songs by the likes of divas Âë®ÁíáÔºåÂßöËéâ are performed tastefully here. The singer is elegant and did good interpretations for the classics.

Special mention to the manager, David, and the service staff - kind, good sense of humour & very attentive. Service staff warmly accommodate our request to sit near the stage and constantly check in with us throughout dinner.

The smoked duck is very tender & skin crispy! Scallion noodles is so springy to the bite. Egg white ball dessert w red bean & banana is refreshing though I prefer more banana in the filling.

Will come back again for more good old Shanghai vibes.

Ambience
Nestled in the bustling heart of Singapore's Central Business District, Vibe Bistro offers a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere that blends modern aesthetics with a cozy vibe. The restaurant provides both indoor and outdoor seating, catering to different moods and preferences. The decor is simple yet stylish, creating a pleasant environment that complements the dining experience.

Service
The service at Vibe Bistro is commendable, as the staff are attentive and friendly. We appreciate the quick service, especially during the busy dinner hours, which is a significant plus for professionals in the area.

Food Quality
Vibe Bistro specializes in Asian Fusion cuisine, offering a menu that creatively blends Eastern flavors with Western culinary techniques. We tried the Ayam Pedas Cutlet which is slightly spicy but flavourful and fish and chips which is crispy on the skin and fluffy inside. The Ondeh cake complements our meal with its rich taste

Portion sizes are generous, ensuring that diners leave satisfied. The quality of the ingredients is consistently high, with sustainably sourced food items adding to the appeal of their dishes.

Price
Prices at Vibe Bistro are reasonable considering its location in Raffles Place. Most dishes are priced around $20 to $25, which is competitive for the area. The restaurant also offers set lunch options and promotions, such as a buy-three-get-one-free drink deal, which adds value for money.

Overall Experience
Vibe Bistro at Raffles Place offers a well-rounded dining experience that combines great food, efficient service, and a pleasant ambiance. It's a suitable venue for both casual lunches and business meetings, thanks to its strategic location and the quality of its offerings, making it a recommended spot for those looking to enjoy Asian Fusion cuisine in Singapore's CBD.

In conclusion, Vibe Bistro stands out as a culinary highlight in Raffles Place, perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a meal that is as delightful in taste as it is in presentation. Whether you're a local professional or a visitor, this bistro promises a memorable dining experience amidst the hustle and bustle of Singapore's financial district.

Super cute and cozy place for dinner!

The cocktails were super strong and super delicious! Didn‚Äôt budget on the alcohol used and they were super interesting and unique!

Tried the course dinner and was super worth it for $58+ per pax! There was really too much food and loved the soup where it was filled to the brim with seafood like fish maw and scallops! My favorite was the rendang as it was really melt in your mouth tender!

Would love to come back again!

Aesthetically food presentation in a Peranakan looking tingkat was pleasing and exciting to the eyes.

However food was underwhelming and nothing exciting about it. Not one single dish either the main or sides was memorable.

Main dish portion of carbs like  fried rice and dry laksa was generous. Sides serving were small.

Sambal as an accompaniment was pale looking ,not spicy, more garlicky and oily.

We would not return nor recommend.
Great spot for quiet celebratory weekday dinners with seniors‚Äîespecially with the Early Bird discount if you WFH and can be flexible on timing. ‚Ä¶

Great spot for quiet celebratory weekday dinners with seniors‚Äîespecially with the Early Bird discount if you WFH and can be flexible on timing.

Kudos to Zhou Yanfei and Rebecca Ma for their friendly and attentive service. They accommodated mobility and dietary needs with patience, handled our order without QR fuss, and even helped us access extra discount on Grab DineOut (our 1st time using).

Bonus: complimentary lotus paste longevity buns were a lovely touch!

Dinner on Mon, 19/5/2025.

(Forgot to take food pics except for the tasty black chicken soup in coconut and the cute buns.)

Had a wonderful experience at Soup Restaurant Holland Village! ü•∞

I made a reservation for 15 people to celebrate my grandmother‚Äôs birthday, and the staff went the extra mile to arrange a private corner for us so the family could spend quality time together. I really appreciated that thoughtful touch.

It‚Äôs been a long time since I visited Soup Restaurant (it‚Äôs usually hard to get a seat!), but after taking the first bite of the signature Samsui Ginger Chicken, I realised how much I missed it. ALL the dishes were so delicious‚Äîjust like how I remembered it. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Special shoutout to Ah Moi, who took our orders. She was super warm, friendly, and patient with us‚Äîeven gave us great recommendations and helped us enjoy the best discounts. In a world full of QR code ordering, it was so refreshing to still have someone take our orders personally. Please don‚Äôt ever switch to digital-only‚Äîit makes a huge difference!

Also want to thank Yan Fei and Michelle, who were equally friendly and provided amazing service.

Great food, great people, and a really memorable celebration. Will definitely be back again!
Had a beautiful lunch with my family and we were served by an attentive waitress called Tang Ah Moi throughout the whole period. Made our experience extremely enjoyable

Decent Chinese restaurant serving local dishes from a bygone era.. Food that would have been very familiar to my mom and granny.. Not that many places serves steamed mince pork patties nowadays or their famous samsui chicken which is basically steamed chicken. What makes Soup really tick for A Cantonese like myself is the double boiled soups (obviously)... Rarity nowadays as most modern families and/or the younger folks just either hv no time or knowledge how to make these stuff anymore. So good to have a place that can prepare it in single portions for those sopu deprived souls.

The place can be hard to find if you are not accessing it from Oceanarium.
Do read the directions on Ocean Restaurant website or your reservation email carefully. ‚Ä¶

I ordered the 4 course lunch menu and was blown away by the incredible food, service, and atmosphere.

I can't applaud the staff enough on how professional and friendly they were. I had the lovely May explaining each dish to me and making sure everything was going ok. There was also a group of diners at the table next to me making a lot of noise and crowding the tank to take selfies, so the staff kindly shifted them to the other end of the restaurant to allow me to enjoy observing the fish in the tank in peace - I was blown away by their kindness and consideration!

I was impressed with each course that came out. In addition to the menu items, there were also several complimentary hors d'oeuvres and desserts.

Each dish was expertly cooked, and each ingredient was extremely high quality and treated with utmost respect. As I had arrived at the restaurant just after it opened, I was shown a smoked duck neck the chefs had prepared for one of the hors d'oeuvres, as part of the restaurant's ethos to minimise wastage.

The Hokkaido scallop was large, plump, sweet, and had a buttery texture. The morello mushrooms had an amazing umami flavour and juicy beefy texture, I could have easily eaten a whole bowl of these. The white asparagus was tender and sweet, with no fibrousness at all. The sauces were also packed with flavour and complimented the dish wonderfully. A faultless dish!

The turbot was fall apart tender, as was the cabbage. The sauce also packed a lot of umami flavour which helped bring out the seafood flavour of the fish. The pickled shallots provided an acidity needed to balance the dish, and the tobiko provided some nice crunch as well to contrast the with the softness of the fish and cabbage.

The magret was cooked excellently, the fat had been rendered from the skin and the meat was blushing pink. I really enjoyed the toasted hazelnut garnish on the magret. The grilled orange provided a nice sweetness to combat the bitterness from the endive - which was cooked until it had a lovely soft texture. The only thing I noted was the toasted coriander seeds on top of the magret were a little bit too chunky, but I can imagine it would complement the magret nicely if it was ground down a bit more finely.

The dessert was very nice as well, the passionfruit jelly was very bright on the palette and packed with flavour. The pavlova was crisp and light, and the coconut jelly provided a good creaminess, along with the cream filling of the pavlova. The crispy rice was light and indeed crunchy, and had been coated in caramelised sugar which provided the slight bitterness needed to counteract the sweetness from the rest of the dish. I loved the addition of the lime zest sprinkled over the top of the dish. The only thing I noted was that the flavour of the mango sorbet was a little too subtle.

The complimentary bread was another unexpected highlight. I especially enjoyed the brioche and comte cheese bread. The brioche was crisp on the outside but light, fluffy, and buttery on the outside - i've never had anything like it before! The flavour of the comte cheese bread shone when eaten with the butter and honey.

The hazelnut dessert was also very delicious, the pastry tasted like a choux bun and it had a light chocolate/hazelnut creme filling inside which left a very clean mouthfeel afterwards.

Overall i'm very impressed with this restaurant and hope to come back the next time i'm in Singapore!

Just a note, the entrance of the restaurant can be difficult to find due to it's location in the carpark of the Equarius hotel, but there's a video on their website outlining the directions to find the restaurant :)

The place can be hard to find if you are not accessing it from Oceanarium.
Do read the directions on Ocean Restaurant website or your reservation email carefully.

The ambience is simply fantastic, food is lovely & presented well.
Room for improvement: Having 1-2 more mains choices would be ideal. At the present, one would have to choose between beef or duck.

I had the pleasure of dining at Ocean Restaurant at Resort World Sentosa, and it was an unforgettable experience!
The ambiance is both elegant and serene, with soft lighting and tasteful decor that complements the marine theme.
The menu is a culinary journey, showcasing a blend of fresh seafood and innovative flavors. I opted for the six courses menu, which featured beautifully presented dishes. Each course was a delight, bursting with flavor and artistry. Notable highlights included the seared scallops‚Äîcooked to perfection.
The service was impeccable; the staff were knowledgeable and attentive, special recognition to Ms. WINNIE LIEW who is always ensuring that every detail of our dining experience was flawless.

Overall, Ocean Restaurant offers not just a meal, but a memorable experience that combines exquisite cuisine with breathtaking views of marine life.

Based on the previous reviews, I'd fully expected to only enjoy the view. However, we were pleasantly surprised that the food was actually really good. There were also some surprising elements that just elevated the dishes like the crispy prosciutto sprinkles. Just that the beef was really meh. Should stick to just seafood.
They accommodated our dietary requirements. Service was good. They also called a buggy to send us out where it's easier to get transport back to the mainland. Overall an enjoyable experience with good flavours and textures. Really nice ambience too as it was quiet.

I am writing to express my frustration regarding my recent visit to your establishment. The service we received was unacceptable and significantly marred our experience.

First, the abrupt change to the menu was neither communicated in advance nor handled properly, which left us feeling unprepared and disappointed. Additionally, we were pressured to order items we clearly indicated we could not eat, specifically beef, which felt intrusive and disrespectful.

Furthermore, I noticed a concerning disparity in treatment from the lady I believe to be the manager. Her demeanor toward us was noticeably less respectful than that afforded to other tables, creating an uncomfortable atmosphere.

Finally, the overall management of the restaurant seems lacking. Our experience this time was inconsistent with the positive visits we've had in the past. While I acknowledge that the service staff were generally okay, this did little to mitigate the overall disappointment.

I hope you take this feedback seriously and address these issues to improve the dining experience for future guests.

Had a pleasant dinner experience celebrating a birthday, the staff were attentive and the food came very fast. Would recommend abit more time in between courses (had to inform our waiter to pause on the main courses)

It was a beautiful experience dining with a view of the aquarium. However, I had called in weeks before to inform the staff that it was a birthday celebration, noted that we would have to purchase a cake directly from the restaurant. As it was a 6 course meal and only 2 diners, it would have been too much -  passed that option and requested for a simple ‚ÄúHappy Birthday‚Äù to be written on the dessert plate. It was unfortunate that the staff had forgotten to do so, which is surprising considering that I‚Äôd called way in advanced and the staff had told me this was noted.

Experience was good but would have been completed if the staff had not forgotten it was a birthday celebration.
