I love the croquettes, was super creamy and crunchy! Fried baby squid was nice as well. Basque burnt cheese cake was also good. Tomato tartar was not that tasty, rather plain.

We had the seafood paella, the rice was ok, but we found the chicken, prawn and mussel not fresh, would not order this again.

Final verdict: I will return to this place with Eatigo discount.

Went for lunch using eatigo discount and I must say I feel this taste the most authentic and my favourite of all the tapas places I tried in SG. They allowed us to enjoy drinks on happy hour though we were using eatigo and service was brisk and friendly. Only dislike is that there's no AC even for indoors (mostly high chairs), we were seated outdoors thankfully it was nice and cooling under the fan. Can imagine it would be nicer for dinner. Generally we liked the food we ordered, especially secreto pork which was moist and tender. Complaints would be the paella is too salty and chicken in paella way too dry. Churros were very very good love the caramel dip the most. Overall was an enjoyable lunch and we would love to return and try other food!

Tbh Tapas24 should be called Tapas12 because it was only half good. The food is not cheap and the service was ok. I think the standout dishes were the pork ribs and the paella. Although there is much to be desired, I think the food made me feel some form of inclination towards Spain. Overall not too bad.

Only half filled on a Sunday lunch. Standout dishes for me were Bikini, Jambon croquetas, and scallops cerviche. Gambas ajillos could do with a bit more garlic. Grilled pardons and battered calamari were average. Pollo fritas tasted too ‚Ä¶

Food was delicious and prices were not too bad, especially with the love dining discount. The sangria was surprisingly strong. The restaurant is big and crowded, so service wasn‚Äôt the best‚Äîwait staff always appeared to be in a rush.

Only half filled on a Sunday lunch. Standout dishes for me were Bikini, Jambon croquetas, and scallops cerviche. Gambas ajillos could do with a bit more garlic. Grilled pardons and battered calamari were average. Pollo fritas tasted too much like Korean sweet sauce fried chicken and was the least favourite among us 4 diners. Churros was fried just right, not too brown nor doughy. Tropical flan was too sweet with a less than smooth texture.

The amex discount was pretty useless here. While we got 50% (since there were 2 of us) on the food , the 2 drinks per person were super expensive. There was a weekday 10 dollar drinks which net net would have cost us the same on the total ‚Ä¶
Love the vibrant vibes here! Tapas 24 bikini sandwich was so good and a must try! Also loving the flavourful paella! Signed up as member and gotten a small free cake in birthday month

The service is excellent. Staff are friendly and very helpful with wine and food selection.

Food is also great, portions are generous.

I'm so sorry I can't remember our servers name but after we left he called us to inform that we had left a pair of glasses there. He very helpfully arranged to have it returned to us within 2 hours.

Absolutely top notch service. 10/10 would recommend.

Great Food, Great Service! They even serve us free ice cream and a small drink for Mother‚Äôs Day celebration! Our host - Mr Satia, and 2 other colleagues Bri and Sasha, all are very friendly and nice! Enjoyed the dinner very much:)

The restaurant is located inside a private club but is open to the public. There is free parking from 12 pm to 2 pm (not sure if it's every day or weekdays only). The food was above average, the prices were reasonable, and the atmosphere ‚Ä¶

The restaurant is located inside a private club but is open to the public. There is free parking from 12 pm to 2 pm (not sure if it's every day or weekdays only). The food was above average, the prices were reasonable, and the atmosphere was good, except that it is an open-air restaurant and not air-conditioned. The service was excellent.

[Edit 8 months later] The food was disappointing. The beef in the Beef Bee Hoon Wokhey was too tough to eat, and the Chengdol was not good.

We were looking for a good fish of the day meal here in St Helens for the last night of our trip. The Pink Ling main dish was fabulous, delicious spice and sauces with perfectly cooked veggies. Our scallop entree was also very tasty.The waterfront location is the best in town. Service was a little slow as we came in behind a larger party on a busy Friday evening but the view was there to enjoy while we waited. Highly recommend!

We decided to try The Wharf last night for dinner and it left a bad taste in our mouths on two accounts:
1. Wait staff insisted that I had ordered beef beehoon soup instead of seafood when it was delivered. No problem, I was willing to consider that it may have been a miscommunication, and my toddler son was willing to eat it. But...
2. The wait staff asked for our credit card before preparing our order and retained the card (physically) throughout the duration of the meal.
We have never had this done to us anywhere, not even in fine dining restaurants in Switzerland. Moreover, I was not able to find this policy clearly posted or explained anywhere on the premises. One could, if so inclined, take this as a grave insult before even considering the possibility of misuse of the card.

The saving graces were the portion size and flavour, which were both decent for the price paid.

As this club is primarily meant for members, I suppose perhaps the staff see no reason to treat outsiders with any special care - which I will be sure to consider when looking for or recommending dining options in this area in future.

Service is terrible, this is the second time we have been. Staff are willing to ignore all individuals who are members. We have waited 30 minutes just to have order taken for a mediocre food and beverages. Even on calling the restaurant to ‚Ä¶

Went for lunch with 2 acquaintances at Riviera Restaurant and coincidentally on a St. Valentine‚Äôs Day.  Because of this special day, they serve only the 4 Course Valentine‚Äôs Day set lunch menu.  The lunch came with artisanal bread with whipped butter.  The 1st course was the Hamachi Carpaccio - cured yellowtail fish loin with Kaluga Queen Caviar drizzled in yuzu ponzu, pickles and pistachio.  Quite refreshing and taste good.  Next, the Hokkaido Scallop served in sweet corn and cr√®me de persil and crispy chicken skin served in a stick.  The sweet corn and cr√®me go very well with the scallops! You could also dip the paper-like chicken skin into the cr√®me!  I love this dish because it‚Äôs so refreshing and I kept asking myself whether this is real chicken skin or not.  The 3rd course was the Australian Grass Fed Wagyu Beef with pomme puree and mustard sauce.  Unfortunately they didn‚Äôt ask me about the doneness I wanted for the beef.  Luckily it was not tough and was done appropriately.  It‚Äôs quite good actually.  Finally, the dessert was Ice Cream and Sakura Tea Cake with vanilla mascarpone cheese, strawberry on white chocolate piece.  It came in the form of a beautiful rose ice cream.  Overall, the lunch menu was very good and the restaurant has a beautiful view of the Marina Bay.  No wonder there were so many Valentines couple lunching there!  It‚Äôs worth a visit as the food is also quite good.  $$$

We recently held two dinner events at Riviera, and the experience was exceptional. Danial, Nazrin, and the entire team were incredibly professional, attentive, and supportive from start to finish. Their dedication and seamless coordination made the planning and execution stress-free and smooth.
It was a real pleasure working with such a reliable and committed team. I‚Äôm truly grateful for their outstanding service and highly recommend Riviera for any corporate event or special occasion.

@riviera.sg
Dine with spectacular view of Singapore River, Merlion, and Marina Bay.
I had their 4 course lunch where all the dishes deserve an applause! Each course had its own delightful surprise elements and flavours which weren‚Äôt overwhelming in taste, just perfection.

I highly recommend this restaurant for its delicious food, fantastic view, attentive service, and elegant atmosphere! It is definitely worth a visit!

*Amuse Bouche

*Cold Starter
Hamachi Carpaccio ~
Cured Hamachi Loin | Yuzu Ponzu | Pickles | Sicilian Pistachio

*Hot Starter
Gambas & Chorizo Iberico ~
Olives | Artichoke | Yuzu Kosho | Espelette Pepper

*Main Course
Poulet Pastilla ~
Organic Free-Range Chicken | Morrel | Almond | Muhammara

*Dessert
Chocolate ~
Valrhona 64% Chocolate | Almond Dacquoise | Hazelnut Praline | Cacao Sorbet

*Complimentary bread.

Insta @yummmmmmmmonica

This restaurant has a great view for a special occasion and the the service was pretty good. -1 on service for rushing out food order while we were still looking at the wine list. They told us to start with food, which was odd. And, there was no course menu left at the table, which was unusual for a fine dining tasting menu.

Unfortunately, we just didn‚Äôt like the food. At all. We love Mediterranean food, especially French, and this food just had really odd flavors and combinations to us.

Here‚Äôs what we didn‚Äôt like:
-the tomato salad was out of season and very heavy on black pepper.
-they poured an awful and very spicy sauce over the lobster pastilla. It was called ‚Äúlobster bisque‚Äù but had the color and flavor of chili sauce. The inside of the pastilla was a very wet shredded vegetable. Sad because I love the original Moroccan pastilla.
-the fried artichoke with the wagyu tasted strongly of brine (from a tin).
-the roll with the cheese plate had an odd, fishy, taste. Might have been seaweed, but we just didn‚Äôt like it.
-the grapefruit and raspberry dessert was so, so tart it made your mouth pucker and had nothing rich to balance it.

I‚Äôd expect fresh, seasonal, produce and a strong understanding of how to balance flavors from a fine dining restaurant. This place is pretty, but mostly trades on the view.

Great view with great service.

Usually I don‚Äôt do reviews, but I would like to share my thoughts.

Husband planned for our anniversary at Riveria and initially I was worried if the menu would be unsuitable as I‚Äôm pregnant. Eg. No raw food/alcohol in food etc

However, the waiter was really nice and explained that the Chef will be able to accommodate to how I prefer it to be. Indeed, the Chef himself came personally to explain and ensure that all will be pregnancy-safe.

Really appreciate the thoughts and even though I may not enjoy the same as what my husband had, eg. Medium rare wagyu, scallop carpaccio, salmon roe, etc. The food was still yummy and we really enjoyed ourselves.

Thank you so much Riveria team, for making our anniversary a memorable one. The complimentary cake was really good too tho! Yums. And not forgetting the refreshing dessert we had in the end!

We wish you all the best!

Celebrated vday with their 5 course menu. Am a seafood lover so I enjoyed the uni tartlet, scallop and cured yellowtail. Highlight was actually the strawberry chitose. Cod didn‚Äôt actually taste like cod, was missing the oily texture.

Great French food, especially the cheese. Great service as well, with attentive servers.

The restaurant management is also really kind and checks in regularly. Thank you for the great dining experience.

Location is also strategically located to have an amazing view of MBS and the Merlion as well.

Amazing thai experience! Very solid and delicious food, and an amazing place to destress and relax with friends over dinner on a Friday night. It has a  fantastically big interior which can accomodate families and big group of corporate events. Personally love ALL their cuisines, very similar to BKK style. Definitely coming back again

Wow this place is really a "hidden gem" for me. Who would have visited a neglected mall in Orchard Road and would have found such a good izakaya hidden at the basement of the mall?
Saw this on social media and hence decided to pay a visit. When we arrived we were told the place is fully booked for the night for a weekend dinner and told us to call and make booking next time. However the place still looked pretty empty and I asked if we could do a quick dinner less than an hour and they said ok.
Was told since this place is an izakaya, there is a requirement for every diner to at least order an alcoholic drink. Not that I dont usually drink alcohol,  I said okay just for the sake of trying this place out.
They really have a wide selection of drinks and you have to keep flipping the menu to get to the food section. There's more small dishes than main dishes and also there's a wide variety of items we didn't know what to order, so other than some of the recommended dishes on social media, had to ask the staff for some recommendations.
First had the coriander bamboo. Its not a dish for those who dont like coriander but its definitely one of the very tasty dishes as the taste of the coriander really elevates the dish. The bamboo shoot tasted so good it felt like we were eating like clams or abalone you won't be able to know its bamboo shoot just by eating the dish.
Then we had the mentai mayo omelette. The portion was big for the price and was also tasty but I didn't like it that it was slightly on the wet side. The usual tamago in Japanese dishes is more dry which is one I'm more accustomed to.
The karaage was very big portion and value for money. Chicken was fried well and still managed to be juicy. The white radish complemented well and they were really generous with the white radish.
The truffle somen was pretty good, one of the mains we ordered. Its recommended to share this and not eat alone so could order more food to share.
The dish I enjoyed the most has to be the Hokkaido potato with butter and salted squid. I didn't expect the 2 ingredients to complement each other so well, its so nice I could eat a few servings.
Last but not the least though we were quite full, we decided to get the sashimi. Ordered a small one to share and the cuts were big and the fish was very fresh.
Was a very enjoyable meal and the price was quite reasonable. Would definitely visit this place again!

The food here is fantastic! The dishes are creative yet delicious - a delightful chili crisp provided a nice kick for the chilled tofu, and the somen is lighter than it seems, just can‚Äôt stop slurping! Scallops, karaage, and grilled miso ‚Ä¶

The food here is fantastic! The dishes are creative yet delicious - a delightful chili crisp provided a nice kick for the chilled tofu, and the somen is lighter than it seems, just can‚Äôt stop slurping! Scallops, karaage, and grilled miso eggplant are also really good. However, the sashimi selection is quite basic. We have been to their East Coast branch as well which has the same quality of food, but less casual and more local ‚ÄúJapanese‚Äù izakaya feels, and also amazing and unique sashimi - worth a try!

The meal was unremarkable. While the appetizers were excellent, the main course, a fish dish, was mediocre.  Although we typically anticipate the dessert with enthusiasm, it failed to meet expectations, necessitating a visit to the hotel ‚Ä¶

I last visited Iggy‚Äôs years ago when it was still in a hidden corner of the Regent Hotel, when it was one of a mere handful of ambitious new eateries at the leading edge of what was to become Singapore‚Äôs contemporary fine-dining movement. Back then it was exciting, innovative, and remarkably unstuffy with its counter seating and close contact with the chefs.

At Voco, the interior design is still defined by a sleek, low-key sensibility (the main entrance is so well hidden, it looks like a side door); the chefs are now safely corralled behind a large glass window, and so the FOH now takes on the role of social contact, which they do well. Despite the fact that Iggy‚Äôs nowadays has to jostle elbows in an ever-burgeoning gastronomic food scene, the food has remained engaging and true to Iggy‚Äôs east-west DNA.

The ‚ÄúGastronomic‚Äù degustation menu is well-executed and beautifully plated, and consistently plays between the twin poles of French and Japanese cuisine. Pumpkin tofu, a Hokkaido scallop carpaccio, a salad of red Carabinero prawn, and a jap-influenced karasumi linguine were all delightful.

The stars, for me, were the 2 main courses: a longtooth grouper, and the Bresse pigeon. The longtooth, a firm white Japanese version of the familiar fish, was paired with duck confit and a duck-infused bourguignon sauce (!) which turned out to be an inspired combination. The pigeon, pink and tender, was exemplary. Iggy‚Äôs has a long tradition of playful pop culture-inspired desserts; the Rocky Road, a high-end interpretation of familiar carnival fare, went down well, as did its ‚Äúcorny‚Äù palate-cleansing predecessor.

The service was ever able, knowledgeable and warm. Much recommended.

Dining at Iggy‚Äôs at voco Orchard Singapore was a beautifully paced journey through refined flavors and seasonal Japanese ingredients with European finesse. The evening started with delicate snacks like shiro ebi and pumpkin tofu, easing into standout courses such as the Tennen Buri with caviar and shiso oil, and a silky Murasaki Uni dish featuring Hokkaido scallop and inaniwa udon. The King Crab with Japanese rice and crab miso was deeply comforting, while the Poulet de Bresse offered a classic yet elevated touch. The cheekily named Iggy‚Äôs Happy Meal ‚Äî featuring Miyazaki wagyu, epoisse cheese, and amela tomato ‚Äî was playful and indulgent. Dessert, a thoughtful blend of Dekopon orange, black sesame, osmanthus, and yoghurt, was light, floral, and the perfect ending. Elegant, restrained, and masterfully executed ‚Äî Iggy‚Äôs remains one of Singapore‚Äôs finest.

The meal was unremarkable. While the appetizers were excellent, the main course, a fish dish, was mediocre.  Although we typically anticipate the dessert with enthusiasm, it failed to meet expectations, necessitating a visit to the hotel cafe for a more satisfying conclusion to the meal.  However, the service and ambiance were exceptional.

Lovely experience.  Good service and attentive staff. Well deserved Michelin star with the food. Has fantastic courses paired with champagne. Air- conditioning is way too cold and freezes everyone. Any warm dish turns cold too quickly. Dessert was also a star and did not let down the entire course of dinner. Felt the staff could have been more confident in introducing each course.

Came here on Valentine's with my wife and the little one. Staff graciously accommodated us in a private room. We had the Valentine's dinner menu and I indulged in the wine pairing myself.

Wine pairing was thoughtful and actually complemented the meal well. A dessert wine pairing with the pudding (which needed more sweetness) would be a welcome touch.

Menu and wines showcased strong fundamentals. In particular, the Hokkaido scallop (with sake pairing), kinemedai and striploin exceeded our expectations. The two Burgundy wines selections lived up to expectations.

Iggy's certainly has the potential to rise beyond one star. Presentation was good but could benefit from more creativity, and may I suggest the introduction of a cheese menu and addition of some elements of surprise to further elevate the fine dining experience.

Iggy's, Singapore: A Fusion of Global Flavors and Refined Gastronomy
Iggy's, a long-standing one-Michelin-starred restaurant located within voco Orchard Singapore, is a true institution in the city's fine dining scene. Under the visionary guidance of restaurateur and sommelier Ignatius Chan, Iggy's has carved out a unique niche by offering "Modern European cuisine with Asian overtones," primarily focusing on exceptional seasonal produce from Japan and around the world.

Ambiance and Atmosphere
Iggy's provides an elegant and intimate dining experience. While it may not boast panoramic skyline views, its refined interior creates a cozy and sophisticated atmosphere perfect for quiet conversations and special celebrations. A key feature is the picture window offering a glimpse into the kitchen, allowing diners to witness the culinary team in action. The meticulous decor and comfortable seating contribute to a tranquil environment, ensuring guests can fully immerse themselves in the gastronomic journey. For those seeking even more privacy, private dining rooms are available.

Culinary Philosophy and Highlights
Iggy's is renowned for its seasonal, ever-evolving tasting menus, reflecting the dynamism of the international culinary scene adapted to the Singaporean palate. Chef Ignatius Chan, with his deep knowledge of global ingredients, continuously pushes culinary boundaries. The cuisine is characterized by modern European techniques infused with subtle Asian flavors, often leveraging premium Japanese produce.

While specific dishes may change, some themes and popular creations that have graced Iggy's menus include:

Premium Sliders: Often featuring decadent ingredients like Kagoshima Wagyu with Epoisse cheese and brioche buns, showcasing a miniature yet sophisticated take on comfort food.

Sakura Ebi Capellini: A timeless classic, this dish features al dente pasta coated in umami-rich lobster oil, topped with crispy Sakura ebi, kombu, and sorrel, highlighting a delicate balance of textures and intense flavors.

Wagyu Beef Creations: Dishes featuring high-grade Wagyu (like Miyazaki Wagyu) are expertly prepared, often paired with nuanced accompaniments that complement the richness of the meat.

Seasonal Seafood: Given the focus on fresh produce, expect exquisite seafood preparations, such as Hokkaido Scallops with Oscietra Caviar or innovative fish dishes.

Deconstructed Desserts: Iggy's often presents unique and artful desserts that play with textures and unexpected flavor combinations.

The menu also caters to diverse preferences with vegetarian and plant-based gastronomic menus available, demonstrating versatility and a commitment to high-quality ingredients for all diners.

Wine Program and Service
A defining feature of Iggy's is its extraordinary wine program, curated by Ignatius Chan himself, a celebrated sommelier. The restaurant boasts an extensive cellar of over 25,000 bottles, with a particular emphasis on rare and exceptional Burgundy wines. This impressive collection allows for impeccable pairings that elevate the dining experience.

Service at Iggy's is consistently described as impeccable, personal, and highly attentive. The staff are knowledgeable about both the food and the extensive wine list, providing seamless and unobtrusive service that anticipates diners' needs. This commitment to warm hospitality ensures guests feel valued and comfortable throughout their meal.

In conclusion, Iggy's offers a refined and memorable culinary adventure. It's a destination for those who appreciate high-quality ingredients, innovative yet harmonious flavor combinations, a world-class wine selection, and impeccable service in an elegant and intimate setting.

Had the pescatarian menu. Intriguing starter, memorable dishes (seabream, scallop, croacker)washed down in nice sencha. Closing desserts were tad too sweet for us but overall a great dining experience.

Overall is nice! Sea food here is tasty, and if excludes the 10% service charge and 9% GST the price still quite reasonable. Cuz that's the price for sea food everywhere. However!!!!! Tofu is NOT HOT?!!!! The worst Tofu have ever have taken in Singapore... Even got 'recommended by chef' on the menu, I don't know what happened... maybe just I am unlucky?

üü¶ One-Ninety Restaurant
üü® Four Seasons hotel
190 Orchard Boulevard, Lobby Level,
Singapore 248646

üüß My husband and I had dinner here tonight ( 29th May 2025 Thurs) at One-Ninety Restaurant at about 8.30 pm and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

üü© Decor & Ambience = ‚óè This high-end restaurant features an elegant and refined setting, with a warm and contemporary design that complements the luxury of the Four Seasons hotel. ‚ñ™Ô∏éThe ambience was calm and inviting, making it a great spot for a relaxed evening meal.

üîµ Food
*************
‚óè We ordered the local Hokkien Mee (SGD34), which the floor manager, Mei Yin, kindly spilt into two bowls for us.

‚óè This premium Hokkien Mee was very well-executed‚Äîflavourful, umami-rich, and satisfying. It struck a good balance between traditional taste and a beautiful presentation. The Hokkien Mee was chockful of ingredients like large Japanese scallops, big prawns, squid and scrambled eggs. ‚úîÔ∏è I asked for no pork slices.

‚óè  I also had an Iced Caf√© Latte (SGD13+), which was well-crafted. I requested for only one espresso shot and more milk, and the coffee brewed was smooth, creamy, and well-balanced.
_______________________________________________

üü® The service was polite, attentive, and accommodating throughout. Staff were courteous and efficient, ensuring our needs were met without being intrusive. ‚úîÔ∏è My request for adjustments to the coffee was handled perfectly.

ü©∑ Shoutout to Mei Yin, the floor manager, and a Thai service staff.‚ñ™Ô∏é  Ms Mei Yin was friendly and pleasant to us right from the start when we stepped into the restaurant. She was authentic, kind, very pleasant, and had an affable disposition. It is staff like Mei Yin who makes dining there at Four Seasons hotel a lovely experience.

üü° Overall, I must say this is a delightful dining experience in a stylish setting, with great service and high-quality food.

‚óè Dated 29th of May 2025 Thursday evening.

One of the best buffet quality I've had in a long time. Had the semi buffet on valentines day with my wife and this is basically a salad bar buffet for $58/pax, and you can add on an entree for an extra $10. They also had wines for $14/glass, but this was only limited to a specific red and white wine. The buffet spread isn't very wide, but the quality was fantastic. Almost everything was a hit. Other tab the cold cuts and salads, there was also basis breads, a cheese station, and desserts. I especially enjoyed the soup of the day, which was a corn and crab soup - something I would not order normally and was actually disappointed in hearing about, but when it came and I tried it, I changed my mind immediately - it was that good. One Ninety, if you're reading this, you need to put this soup in your regular menu rather than have it as soup if the day.

For the entrees, I had the salmon and my wife had the duck leg, and both were very solid. The duck leg came with a sauce that tastes like Peking duck sauce, very creative and the meat was fall if the bone. The salmon came with an unknown sauce that looks a bit like pesto or chimichuri,but want very tasty. Nevertheless the salmon was fresh and succulent and cooked perfectly.

Dessert selection wasn't very wide either, but several of them were good. The $14 wines however didn't tickle our fancy, so we got the regular wines, which was very good. Comes with coffee or tea at the end too. I had a caf√© latte while my wife had a decaf caf√© latte. Both were unexpectedly good for a hotel buffet. In fact better than many cafes. Total came up to about $250 for 2 pax.

Service was excellent - professional, polite, earnest, but not overbearing. Pretty much the gold standard. Even the junior waiters seemed properly trained.

Would definitely come again for special occasions.

Went for the lunchtime semi-buffet. One main course gets you free flow salad and desserts.

I had the laksa seabass as the main. The fish was the star, and was cooked perfectly, skin still crispy when served. The laksa was thick and fragrant. Would return just for the fish alone.

The duck confit is also pictured. Well done, but some people would consider the portion size of the duck small.

A warning that the salad and dessert selection was very limited... BUT... whatever they served was absolutely fantastic.

Very high quality and well-prepared. We went for seconds of many items (and even fourths, for the cherry tart). Seriously full marks.

In fact, I think this is the first time I've been to a buffet where all items are of quality.

Most hotel buffets in Singapore thrive on quantity, with above average quality so this time, it was refreshing to have something of such excellence!

Spouse favourite was the cherry tart, the crust was buttery and absolutely cracking. The Milo dinosaur cream puff was so creamy and so good. So good in fact, that we could only allow ourselves one, for health reasons. The pastry chef is pretty famous, and I can see why!

For people who love salads, the vegetables served were very fresh and very good quality. The vine tomatoes tasted practically like mandarin oranges! I need to know their source haha

Many unique plants also featured in the salad buffet, it was a colorful, healthy, and tasty feast. I would return for the salad selection.

The service was excellent. Each time we walked to the buffet table, our dishes and cutlery would be replaced, by invisible hands. It was truly service that did not intrude.

The whole restaurant was also very quiet, a welcome respite from normally bustling buffets. Very suitable for a romantic occasion.

Damage was about $130 for two pax, all taxes included. At this price, I don't feel I ever want to return to normal big-spread buffets that have average food.

Brought my parents to enjoy the high-tea weekend menu in Sep 2023. The staff was amazing. After I made my reservation, I didn‚Äôt realise that I booked the restaurant instead of the bar. They called me back to adjust the reservation for the weekend high-tea menu from the One Ninety Bar. They also took note that we were there to celebrate my father‚Äôs birthday. The staff took out a cake with a birthday greeting and even my mother was deeply moved. Our reservation was for 2pm but we arrived slightly later as my elderly parents had to take longer to leave the house. We apologised for being late but the staff did not rush us or show any displeasure. In fact, they were really attentive to my parents‚Äô request for hot water and explained every item that they served to help them understand what was in the food. We had a wonderful time as a family and I highly recommend bringing your loved ones to enjoy the quality high-tea sets they offer. Thank you for the great service. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

business_name: Ristorante Takada : Japanese Italian restaurant : Pasta Pizza Wine (Alexandra)
text: My husband and I came here to celebrate our wedding anniversary upon recommendation by a chef friend from tokyo. At 168++, the set menu features lobster, scallop, uni, and A5 wagyu. Although atmostphere was laid back, all the dishes were elegantly presented, rich and very flavourful. The food struck a good balance between being delicate but also homely. We will definitely be back. Thank you Takada for a lovely anniversary dinner.

business_name: Ristorante Takada : Japanese Italian restaurant : Pasta Pizza Wine (Alexandra)
text:
What a gem of a find in the most unlikely place, below a condominium block, right at the edge of Alexandra!

Been back twice since, the first time we went for dinner and tried the more luxe items and the second time, we went back for lunch and had the basic set lunch - both, were amazingly delicious!

My favourites include the mushroom soup, corn foam appetiser, the Spanish pork, the carbonara, the burnt cheesecake with sorbet and the Mont Blanc! That‚Äôs basically almost everything that I‚Äôve tried but it‚Äôs thaaaattt good.

They run a tight ship and so far, I‚Äôve only ever seen the Japanese chef and what I would assume is his lovely wife taking care of the front of house. When we went for dinner, it was just the chef taking care of both back and front of house, even when it was just him, the food and service was still very much on point.

business_name: Ristorante Takada : Japanese Italian restaurant : Pasta Pizza Wine (Alexandra)
text:
I‚Äôve been coming to Ristorante Takada for many years already lah.
Tried both the course and √† la carte ‚Äî always tasty, no regrets one.

My favourite still the Hokkaido scallop paste. Got big scallops and the basil taste really shiok!
Yesterday I try the new Mont Blanc dessert.
Didn‚Äôt expect the cream to come out like pasta ‚Äî wah, surprise me sia! But very nice lah.
I ask the staff, they say this year already 12th anniversary.
This place got so many memories for my family.

Hope can continue many more years ‚Äî I confirm will come back again!

business_name: Ristorante Takada : Japanese Italian restaurant : Pasta Pizza Wine (Alexandra)
text: We chose an Italian for 2023 CNY reunion dinner. The set menu offers a good variety of pasta and mains if you opt for a 4 course dinner. There were 7 adults and 2 kids so we ordered a variety to try. The porcini soup in a cup was delicious, go slow sipping as it‚Äôs really hot. The lobster was over-cooked,  the squid ink pasta was decent. The best was the kids carbonara and truffle bolognese and pesto scallop. We all loved the tiramisu and wasn‚Äôt crazy about the burnt cheesecake. Fish and beef as main were so good! They served us macarons with the gooseberry but I would have preferred madeleines. The restaurant needs a little minor repair to it‚Äôs false ceiling urgently as I can see mould and condensation as soften the false ceiling - there is a downlight that might fall off due to the weaken false ceiling.

1. Charcoal Seafood Paella by Josper
This dish, often the centrepiece of a Spanish table, unfortunately didn‚Äôt quite live up to expectations. The grains of rice were noticeably flat‚Äîboth in texture and shape‚Äîlacking the nutty bite and layered flavour profile that typically come from a well-rendered paella. At one point, I wondered if the presentation took inspiration from Korean-style scorched rice ("nurungji"), given the burnt bottom and compactness of the grains. A touch more depth from seafood stock and attention to the rice's integrity could elevate this dish significantly.

2. Grilled Octopus Leg with Potato Truffle Pur√©e
This dish showed more promise. The octopus had a pleasant char, and though slightly firmer than ideal, it was nicely offset by the silky, well-infused truffle potato pur√©e. The smokiness in the cream subtly lifted the overall flavour profile to meet expectations.

3. Prawn Casserole Saut√©ed with Garlic Peppers and Olive Oil
A delightful surprise. The prawns were fresh and delicately cooked, soaking up the aromatic olive oil and garlic. What truly elevated this dish was the accompanying bread‚Äîcrisp on the outside, fluffy inside, and perfect for mopping up every last drop of the sauce. Ironically, the bread proved more memorable than the paella rice, which speaks to the quality of ingredients when simplicity is done right.

4. Padron Peppers
A familiar Spanish snack, the version here was decent‚Äîlightly blistered and seasoned‚Äîbut ultimately lacked the punch that makes Padron peppers addictive. In comparison, the rendition served at FOC delivers bolder flavour and a better texture.

5. Strawberry and Smoked Salmon Salad -
6. The Josper Spare Pork Ribs

While not all dishes reached their full potential, the overall service and effort in presentation are commendable. The prawn casserole and Padron peppers hint at the kitchen‚Äôs capabilities when ingredients and preparation align. I left with warm memories thanks to the service. Perhaps with the chef's guidance or a tasting menu next round, Pura Brasa could truly showcase the best of its Spanish repertoire.

Nachos were pretty good even thou were store bought. The grilled octopus was nicely charred, soft and balanced out with citrus. The only thing was the portion was kinda small. Carbonara pork pizza was heavy on the pork flavours but the pizza rim was quite thick, very filling. Secreto pork was perfectly seasoned and cooked, love the slightly pinkish doneness where pork should be cooked to. Seafood paella was quite al dente, edible but should have cooked a little more. Felt like the sangria added liquor in it. Used chop vouchers for a small discount. Overall would recommend the food and great service.
Excited cause its the first time here! Great deal so we families decided to try it out! Free one hour!!

Get ready to fall into the sea many times! If you've ever watched Total Wipeout (UK), this is your chance to experience something similar. My kids (7 year old, 11 year old) enjoyed themselves thoroughly. It was a real workout for me too. Staff were super accommodating and flexible, lifeguards were friendly. Easy to spend more than 1 hr there.

Will go back again at high tide when all the stations are open.

Things to note:
- Singaporeans should sign up for Sentosa Islander and get discounted tickets
- There is a minimum height and age requirement which makes sense because some of the obstacles are spaced quite far apart.
- Only life jackets are provided (somehow I thought there may be towels)
- You need to swim out to the course - younger children may be intimidated
- Nearest lockers are at the public toilets
- Some stations (the higher jumps) are closed at low tide like when we went
Delicious!  Famous for the fish but j prefer the fried pork with chilli even more, and there is $1 promotion for the pork! They gave free pot of nice fancy flower tea too. Will be back

Unique dining experience that offers sauerkraut fish and other chinese dishes that everyone will surely love! They even have promo kids eat for free with any one main dish ordered for children aged 12yrs and below..love the taste of the century egg, sweet and chili prawns and tofu, cauliflower, and their floral healthy tea was also refreshing! Thanks to all the friendly staff Tina and Lun they were super nice and attentive to all our needs. :) Must try all the food here and the ambience was really great spacious and clean plus at the back theres the view of the boardwalk sentosa :)

In line with Singapore‚Äôs 60th National Day, elemen's Local‚ÄëLicious 8‚Äëcourse vegetarian set (S$38.80++ for members, $42.80++ otherwise) is a joyous celebration that reimagines our beloved local dishes.

Highlights from the menu:
üá∏üá¨Trio Local Appetiser‚Ä®Delicate char‚ÄØsiew puff, mini roti prata with veggie curry, and chickpea‚Äëtempeh chilli ‚Äúcrab‚Äù‚ÄØ‚Äî‚ÄØa clever, colourful starter that winks at hawker classics.
üá∏üá¨ Salad Flatbread Rolls with Indian Rojak Dressing‚Ä®Crisp greens and fruit rolled in soft flatbread, drizzled with zesty assam‚Äëinfused Indian rojak sauce‚Äîbright, tangy and refreshingly fun.
üá∏üá¨ Peppery ‚ÄúFish Maw‚Äù Soup‚Ä®Vegetarian ‚Äúfish maw‚Äù with king oyster mushrooms, goji, red date broth, topped with crispy soy croutons‚Äîcomforting, earthy, and subtly peppery.
üá∏üá¨ Lion‚Äôs Mane Satay‚Ä®Meaty lion‚Äôs mane mushrooms grilled, served with satay sauce and ketupat‚Äîsatisfyingly charred and hearty, evoking classic street‚Äëside skewers.
üá∏üá¨ Black Truffle Hainanese ‚ÄúChicken‚Äù Rice‚Ä®Star of the menu - truffle‚Äëinfused rice with plant‚Äëbased ‚Äúchicken‚Äù. It‚Äôs luxe yet familiar‚Äîa surprising twist on SG staple.
üá∏üá¨ Coconut Chendol Beancurd Pudding‚Ä®Creamy coconut pudding, pandan chendol, red beans, gula melaka‚Äîsweet, nostalgic, and silky.
üá∏üá¨ Radiance in a Cup‚Ä®Snow‚Äëgum and red date drink to round off‚Äîlight and refreshing with a ‚Äúnest‚Äëlike‚Äù nourishing feel.

elemen‚Äôs Local‚ÄëLicious 8‚ÄëCourse Menu delivers a seamless blend of creativity, nostalgia and value. Each dish cleverly reinterprets cherished local flavours in a meat-free way, paying homage to Singapore‚Äôs culinary heritage with elegance and flair.

Pink, pretty Sakura season on a plate! Here to try their limited time Blossom-Licious 8-course feast

‚ûä Sakura Harmony Trio ‚Äì Light and refreshing with a tangy plum sauce.

‚ûã Potato Salad with Kaso Medley

‚ûå Golden Root Vegetable Tempura ‚Äì Crispy and not too oily

‚ûç Kimchi Shiro Miso Stew ‚Äì Comforting with a umami taste

‚ûé Apple Cider ‚Äì a refreshing palate cleanser

‚ûè Sakura Bibimbap Gohan ‚Äì Pretty pink rice but the filling too little

‚ûê Goma Mousse with Sesame Crumble ‚Äì Smooth and nutty

‚ûë Sparkling Pink Sea Salt Yuan Yang
They have 5 or 8 courses set to choose. Basically all items on menu are available for set order. Presentation looks good, taste average. Nice dinner with family overall.

Both service and food were subpar, I wouldn‚Äôt pay such prices to come again.

We ordered 2 8-course set and 1 Christmas set. Do note that you won‚Äôt be able to change any dish in the Christmas course meal. Each course was served super fast, we didn‚Äôt even have time to finish before the next one was served, so it got to a point where the table was filled with appetisers, soup and mains. Some servers would practically dump the plate on our table loudly and walk away like we owe them?

Moving on to the taste, the fruit rojak, sesame tofu, and unagi roll with tofu were not bad. Everything else tasted pretty average. Some of my friends found it weird that the appetisers and soup are sweet. We were looking forward to the desserts since they looked really pretty from the photos, but they tasted like store bought frozen 711 products. They didn‚Äôt even properly defrost them before serving.

The restaurant closes at 3.30, and they really chased all of us out on the dot. As such, we were scrambling to finish our food. Have been to other restaurants that closes in the afternoon before, and they all allowed guests to stay on in the restaurant, just that there would be no ordering/serving/billing after the stipulated closing time. So not sure why Elemen would do it this way.

Overall it wasn‚Äôt a very pleasant experience especially at this price point.

Decided to go with the staff recommendation of the Hitsu set. Grilled unagi had a nice crisp on the exterior and was lightly flavoured.

As per the staff recommendation,  first tried the unagi with rice alone, and then with the broth... and then with the broth and condiments added. Each has its own flavour notes, and I enjoyed the unagi + broth + condiment pairing (scallion, seaweed flakes and a touch of fresh wasabi)

Fresh grated wasabi was an interesting condiment to pair with the grilled unagi.

There were also a variety of sauces and table condiments available, such as typical teriyaki style unagi sauce, spicy sauce, and green peppercorn.

Domi
* Sea bream sashimi with a Korean like bamboo
* The fish was just amazing delicious. Slipped down my throat with little chewing.
Gyeram
* Stunning. Spanner crab with egg style custard. Broth to die for. Sweet delicious crab. Sensational dish.
Capsicum salad
* The rolled capsicum was very juicy. The broth was sensational
Tuna sandwich
* Belly tuna in between smoked eggplant toast like cracker. You had me at Belly tuna.
Scallop tart
* Scallops sashimi on a Parmesan crisp. Salty meets amazing delicious delicate Scallop went down in one bite.
Prawn toast
* Ahhhh okay that is a prawn that is toast. Then that‚Äôs Caviar.  Wow.            Succulent sweet just yummy.
DOMI
Asparagus | Bamboo shoot | Ddang dureup
* Sea bream with a Korean bamboo shoot & small type of asparagus. Oil made the asparagus and bones of the fish.
* Wow. Such soft delicate fish with lovely crunch and green flavour. Delicious.
GYERAN JJIM
Crab | Haemultang I Shirako
* Haemultang is a Korean spicy seafood stew filled with an abundance of fresh seafood and vegetables in a hot bowl
* Spider Crab
* Shirako is the milt, or sperm sacs, of male cod.
* Stunning dish. Soft roe like milt with even a slight nutty taste. Then delicious sweet crab meat. All on base if egg custard and amazing broth. Loved it no matter how weird some might think.
JEJU ABALONE
Kamtae | Lilybulb | Juk
* Oh my golly gosh the aroma. The deep deep aroma is from the light torching on top of the abalone.
* The Abalone is ‚Äútreated ‚Äú with Kombu & Radish to cure it creating a soft meat then torched to release stunning aroma delicious char tastes.
* Ahhhhhhhh screaming. My my not right. It is SO SO BLOODY GOOD. The softest sweetest abalone ever.
* It‚Äôs just under 1cm thick. Lightly torched. Handled with just amount skills. Abalone this thick usually would be over chewy. But in this chef‚Äôs genius hands it‚Äôs delicate divine deliciousness.
* My taste buds are dancing.
OK-DOM
Minari | Radish
* Korean fish expertly cooked light luminous. Tasted like a sweet reef fish juice. Flavours just keep going and going. Mouth is full of different experiences Add Korean Squid butter broth from the bones radish. It‚Äôs soft delicate delicacy that keeps giving
* I finish I‚Äôm sitting. I have buttery Sweet delicious fish tastes swimming around my mouth.
MILMYEON
White kimchi | Fermented chili | Perilla
* pickled Eggplant on right with seaweed, Kimchi Noodles made from seaweed.
* pleasant
KBBQ
Wagyu | Burdock rice | Celtuce
* Burdoch rice is traditional Korean rice cooked in broth and butter with Korean type of Asparagus. It‚Äôs just beautiful taste nutty with green crunchy
* Wagyu hello my little morsel slip down my throat with a quick chew. The amazing Extreme taste of beef dances on your tongue in a way of pure enjoyment.
STRAWBERRY
Burrata | Basil | Rhubarb
* Strawberry in season in Korean. Rhubarb. Burrata cheese ice cream. Oil and strawberries juice. On their own the fruit is very sweet. But then balanced with the creamy ice cream it‚Äôs a wonderful pleasant dish.
SWEET POTATO
Rum | Buckwheat
* Okay lots going on here. Buckwheat is cake like is okay I suppose it needs the base. There is small fruit I don‚Äôt know. The ice cream the ice cream yes I am repeating myself. The ice cream is just bloody delicious. There‚Äôs crunchy bits of chocolate there is rum there is just Deliciousness.
Petite Fours
Geotgam
* Dehydrated Persimmons stuffed with nuts. Nice fruity nutty bite.
Juak Korean nut type of mini donut.
* Toffee chewy nutty sweetness. Nut comes through with sweetness. Delicious. The fruit flavour I can‚Äôt identify. But I love it.
Chestnut cream puff as written.
* Light chestnut sweetness.
I was privileged to have a chat to Chef Kim. Which led me to expressing maybe too much delight in the abalone dish. I switched to say even your rice is just an amazing nuttiness. He offered his philosophy. We try to do things simple. One thing should shine. He does exactly that but at a level to the extreme. 2 Michelin Stars no surprise.
What an experience what a journey.

The son of a restaurateur Chef Sun Kim brings a combination of Korean heritage and Japanese aesthetics to Meta Restaurant, a 2024 upgrade from one to two Michelin Stars awarded for Food that is modern but minimalist.

A tasting-menu only affair occupying 9 Mohamed Sultan Road, black ceilings and concrete floors abutting an open kitchen, it is from posh banquettes that diners are served twelve courses flanked by gifts with an option for Wine or housemade non-alcoholic Beverages.

Not limited to local terroir, but instead focused on sourcing the best Ingredients and applying French techniques, dinner begins with cold Salads and bites including a two-bite ‚ÄúSandwich‚Äù of Toro with Egg  Yolk and Roe.

Born in Busan, their beaches yielding a love of Seafood seen in a citrusy Scallop Tart followed by plump Prawns on Toast with Caviar, Kim‚Äôs second ‚ÄúSalad‚Äù slices Yellowtail adjacent Cuttlefish and Korean Seaweed before rethinking Egg Souffle with Crab and Shirako.

Not afraid to focus on Korean Ingredients, roasted Seaweed accenting Abalone over Porridge, Tile Fish with crispy Skin comes next prior to handmade Noodles and Kimchi as setup to ‚ÄúKorean BBQ‚Äù of Wagyu alongside Black Truffle Rice.

Trained at Wakuda, but also traveled through Europe and Japan, Kim‚Äôs sweets begin after warm Tea and from Korean Oranges to a Baba au Rhum of Sweet Potato both taste and texture is refined through a trio of traditionally themed Mignardises.

Meta gives you a full-mounted experience of modern Korean cuisine, with an expert blend of textures and subtle flavors. They use high-quality ingredients (scallop, uni, abalone, octopus, wagyu) to bring you great flavours and balanced dishes. I was worried that the fancy ingredients would be a crutch but I submitted to the experience and was impressed by how well integrated the dishes were. Courses to me that showed great control and flavour were - tart, toast, jeju abalone, ok-dom, and sweet potato dessert). Also, unlike some 2-3 Michelin star restaurants that leave you feeling a bit hungry (which is a shame considering the cost), Meta's menu is for heavyweights and I had to tap out by the petit fours. I was rolling out of the restaurant at the end of the night.

The front-of house team is highly professional. I never had to wait more than a few seconds to get service and they paced the meal really well. Knowing you're well looked after allowed me to drop my guard and focus on the food. I was noticed how they worked in pairs to ensure to sweep away all diners plates at the same time. My only mild feedback is that the seats left me with a slight back crank so could do with a bit more padding.

Overall, I would highly recommend going for the food and experience. Chef Sun is a real black-belt of the culinary world and I look forward to dining at Meta again!

This was a restaurant that I‚Äôve been wanting to try when they were a michelin star and eventually took the plunge after they were awarded two stars. Unfortunately, the experience was similar to what other reviews had described.
1. Squeaking in at one Michelin rather than two.
2. Chef played it too safe, nothing mind blowing, just familiar and simple flavour profile.

Other pet peeves included
1. Not having a menu on their website. While the menu may change daily depending on the quality and supply of ingredients, the overall dish still remain the same with the exception of one or two being entirely different. Include a disclaimer on the menu that the chef reserves the right to amend the menu. Having a menu with general indication on what‚Äôs going to be served does help customers understand what they are in for.
2. Not checking in with customers on the food. I left the tail of the prawn on the plate because it was not properly deveined with the black bits visible. I left the scales of the fish because it was just too gross to eat fried scales (though I know it was an intentional attempt by the chef to create texture in the food). No one came and ask how the food was.

Despite the above, I have to commend the restaurant for making amendments to the menu to align with my preferences and for offering additional ‚Äòsurprise courses‚Äô.

Food wise - the scallop tart and sweet potato rum dessert were well executed and flavourful. They should be kept on the menu.

The bananan cream puff was bad, tasted like overripe bananas. Geotgam was terrible, tasted like stale biscuits. The rest of the dishes were just normal, tasted them before in other restaurants, nothing fancy won‚Äôt come back for them.

Overall, dine here if you‚Äôve always wanted to try this restaurant but manage your expectations. The average reviews are indeed true, don‚Äôt get carried away with the five star reviews.

Not a bad attempt to fusionize the dishes from different parts of KR. Tasty yes, some expensive products perhaps to justify the cost, but there was no explosive standout that warrants the price. No narrative or journey. And the presentation slightly above average. I agree with other reviews that they were heavy handed with the sodium. My wife and I were thirsty a few hours after the meal! :(

I tend to indulge in a bottle of wine at these posh establishments even knowing the margins they make. But Meta jacked up the numericals in the wine list that we agreed to work our liver after the meal. We had their free water though ;)

Overall spent ~$800 for two for dinner. ROI was not positive, unfortunately. I'd recommend OMNI for better food and more savings.

We‚Äôd been wanting to come here for a while and decided to book during the festive period. What an outstanding meal. The food is a modern take on Korean and Japanese fusion. The tastes, the textures, the presentation ‚Äî everything just works. There is tremendous attention to detail in the preparation and the ingredients chosen are of the highest quality. Perhaps my only gripe would be that the quantity of food could be a little better. Some of the portions were just too small. The wine pairings were interesting and well executed. You get a selection of unusual wines, as well as sake, that excite the palette and pair wonderfully with the dishes. You also don‚Äôt leave feeling like you had too much to drink. It‚Äôs balanced and satisfying. The service was well-timed and unobtrusive with an attention to detail that‚Äôs hard to find. If Meta is on your list, definitely do book ahead. They will call you to confirm and also ask about any dietary issues so that the menu can be adjusted accordingly, if needed. Unless you have particular issues, I‚Äôd say just go with flow and see what they serve you. Perhaps the only caveat I would give is that it‚Äôs not cheap. For the cost of a meal here, you could eat at nearly any restaurant in Singapore. That said, it‚Äôs a course menu with little in the way of add-ons, so you pretty much know what you‚Äôre paying and there are no surprises.

Came here on a Wednesday night with my wife.

1) Reservation: straightforward and easy on their website. A authorization hold ‚Ä¶
Food is great. Staff are friendly. Great place for a celebration. For all Fresh Oyster lovers try their Fresh Oyster promo. Mon - Thu. Do give them a call to make a booking.

I had an incredible experience at Una! The hospitality and service from Seraj and the entire team were absolutely impeccable.

The food was nothing short of spectacular ‚Äî every dish bursting with rich Spanish flavors and beautifully presented. The Salpic√≥n de Mariscos was the highlight of the night, offering unique textures and a true taste of the sea, followed closely by the Croquetas de Jam√≥n ‚Äî perfectly crispy and seasoned to perfection.

Both the red and white sangria were hands down the best I‚Äôve had in Singapore ‚Äî bold, fruity, and with a unique, refreshing twist.

I left with my heart and belly full, and I can‚Äôt wait for my next gathering at their Wednesday Wine-Down Night to enjoy the free-flow tapas and sangria!

Great place for a date with nice ambience and friendly staff.

But food wise some hits and misses. Salpicon and lobster bisque was good and value for money. Gambas decent but nothing extraordinary. Scallops definitely over priced and would not recommend. Used to be 3 pieces in the past but perhaps because now they added some caviar. Can just order Salpicon which itself contains 1 scallop already (along with other seafood).

Thus overall I would recommend Una for the venue and setting. But food wise, for the standard / quantity, it is kinda pricey.

Everything from the food, to the service and the atmosphere was top notch. We were hosted by Seraj and Brandon for the night and they were ever so prompt and attentive throughout our entire dinner. We had the Coca De Higos Y Foie Con Vermouth and the Vieras A La Plancha Con Sobrasada Iberica as starters, the Paella De Chorizo Y Habitas to share and Churrors el Classico for dessert.

Both starters were cooked to perfection and we especially liked the chorizo topped scallops which had a good balance of saltiness. The small sized paella was perfect for the two of us and the chorizo used was not too salty and had a perfectly minced texture.

When it came to ordering our dessert, we were throughly impressed by Brandon‚Äôs psychic abilities. He brought out the churros and an anniversary cake almost immediately after placing our order, almost as if he knew we were ordering the churros.
I will most definitely return here to dine again and I highly recommend Seraj and Brandon as your hosts if anyone dines there. Keep up the good work!

Celebrated my 11th wedding anniversary at UNA tonight. The service is top notch and food is great!

Think we ordered too much and the manager gave us a free cheese cake which is not available on the menu to congratulate our marriage :)

Thank u so much. My wife is very happy and keep laughing at my nonsense. Sorry she laughs too loud.

My friend and I both ordered steak. My medium rare was perfect. Delicious. However my friend‚Äôs medium rare was a bit well done. Another friend ordered pork chop which was a bit too hard for my friend although the taste was fine. All the side dishes are fine.

Service was great. They gave us free chocolate ice cream for the well done steak. Ice cream taste awesome by da way. Overall, I enjoyed it and would definitely come back again.

1) The restaurant is cozy and comfortable, making it suitable for gatherings, though the space is not very large, so reservations are recommended.
Pleasant dining environment, making it a solid choice for casual meals or small group gatherings.
2) Affordable prices, casual atmosphere, and good variety of Western and fusion dishes.
Value-for-money set lunches and the reasonable pricing for mains, which typically range from under $20 for pastas and risottos to the mid-$20s for meat dishes.
3) Signature items like the bacon-wrapped chicken breast, duck confit, and Australian braised lamb shank are tender, flavourful, and well-executed.
The crab cake comes with generous crabmeat, and desserts such as the apple crumble and chocolate lava cake are recommended for their taste and presentation.
The seafood pasta, served in a crab-shaped container and packed with prawns, crab meat, mussels, and clams, is also a standout for its rich, bisque-like sauce.
4) Overall experience is positive, especially for those seeking affordable Western and fusion cuisine in the area.

Love their crabmeat pasta‚Ä¶ forever a repeat order for me. Already my third order of it in the last year. Do note that they usually come with mussels but I‚Äôve requested for a swap as I don‚Äôt eat mussels. The service staff told me that they would be swapped with prawns (four prawns came in all).

Carbonara is pretty solid too. The creaminess with the salty bacon was a delight. My partner requested for cooked egg and they kindly complied.

Have visited a few times, seldom long queue due to its ‚Äúhidden in plain sight‚Äù kind of location. I wouldn‚Äôt call it obscured, more like if you know, you know.

Surprisingly decent, the decor and weekend lunch discount (~$20 for a set of appetissr + mains + drinks) made us think it was just an average place but we went in to try all the same and were glad that we tried!

We got the pumpkin risotto and the pork belly, plus crabcake and truffle mushroom soup.
The risotto was actually really refreshing and tasty, while the pork belly wasn't fatty at all and it's honestly the first time I ate something like that, enjoyed the texture.
Overall quite value for money.

Glad that we didn't judge the restaurant from how it looks outside, may come again if in the area.

The food was average at best.

The broccoli was pretty tasteless and the onion rings were decent but felt a little overfried. Same for the duck leg confit, which seemed a little overfried, though its inside didn‚Äôt taste as dry as it looked on the outside.

The seared scallops were a little dry. The char siu chicken thigh, brussel sprouts and flying fish roe rice were ok.

Not very expensive but not great value for money.

Mushroom soup was amazing but it‚Äôs a little too salty for my liking. Seafood marinara was great, I thoroughly enjoyed it. Price was reasonable too! Mains and pasta comes with free drinks and mushroom soup from 11-3pm. Recommended for a try :)   Truffle fries was okay~ We ordered two portion but one had more truffle taste than the other.

Disgusting attitude from the large Chinese woman serving. I have bought Filipino food from here several times yet have never encountered the type of attitude I just received from this so-called server. I approached the counter and in my ‚Ä¶

Disgusting attitude from the large Chinese woman serving. I have bought Filipino food from here several times yet have never encountered the type of attitude I just received from this so-called server. I approached the counter and in my friendliest voice I asked "Hello, do you have lechon?" The woman totally ignored me and refused to answer me even though I asked three times. Eventually she snapped and shouted "Yeah, I know you want lechon." I asked her if they had it (they often sell out) and again she refused to answer me. I will not give my money to support someone with such a disgusting and hostile attitude so I spent my $40 at the Thai stall next door where I received friendly service. Will not go back to this stall while this disgusting woman who doesn't understand customer service works there.
Collaboration between chef-owner Christian Calledo and Bjorn Shen for Singapore Food Fest's Open Stoves. Really enjoyable but rather small.

Only ordered the fried pork and har Cheong gai and the seafood noodles soup.

it was quite tasty but u can't go wrong with fried food.

Came on a Wednesday night. It was crowded and service was quite prompt.

***

Came again on a public holiday. Called and surprised could get a booking one hour before the time I wanted... Realized why. The food was really sub par. The bee Hoon soup hor fun and soup lacked flavor. Har cheong gai also was just fried chicken. What happened to the shrimp paste? Restaurant was not really full. Better improve or else restaurant will soon be empty... Downgrade from 4 ‚≠ê to 3 ‚≠ê
A mug of beer at 6.90 net ...a jug @ $25...free parking... but nowadays rather rowdy n noisy...

One of the best restaurants I‚Äôve dined at in Singapore in 2022 (if not ever). Each dish did not just hold a story and significance but packed a punch of new flavours that were not typically found in other restaurants. I found that every ‚Ä¶

2nd time here after many years. Can't even recall the first visit's experience. But this time we were not disappointed. The ambience was as pleasant. So was the ribeye wagyu, lobster pasta, mushroom soup and grilled asparagus. Very ‚Ä¶

2nd time here after many years. Can't even recall the first visit's experience. But this time we were not disappointed. The ambience was as pleasant. So was the ribeye wagyu, lobster pasta, mushroom soup and grilled asparagus. Very appetising. Will visit again. The lady waitress attending to us was super helpful. She even helped us to settle down at a table downstairs for the band performance, which was very entertaining. They sang "Flowers " very well. Solid music.
All great!!

Been wanting to try their steaks for the longest time so made a reservation for a friday dinner.

For appetiser, we had the Hokkaido scallops and Foie Gras. For mains, we tried the spring chicken, iberico pork chop and fillet mignon paired with fries and grilled asparagus. For dessert, we ended with sticky date pudding.

We really liked the scallops, pork chop and of course the beef! Total bill came up to about $370 for three pax.

Overall, love the vibe of this place, service crew were pretty attentive and friendly too. Will return again to try other steak cuts.

We came early for dinner. Best to book as this place is popular. We had the Ceaser Salad and ox tail ragout. The ragout is recommended and done very well. We shared the Surf and Turf and would also recommend it. The beef was well prepared and tender. It is also great that they offer tap water for free and kept refilling! Many restaurants now do not offer this and it turns customers off. So very glad that this restaurant is far sighted. Kudos also to the service staff for attentive service!

We were there 2 weeks ago on 5th Nov to celebrate my wife's birthday
The waitress Ling was very friendly, professional & attentive in the way she served us.
Karma was very pleasant and experience in his knowledge of wine though the first bottle he recommended to us was a bit acidic but he's allows us to reject it & recommended another bottle to us without any unfriendly body languages or facial expressions.

The steaks were tender and tasty.  Would love to come back again.

Ramd was very pleasant and welcoming.  He greeted us and talked to us in a very welcoming way.

Overall,  great experience but honestly,  it would be ideal if the price can be a little cheaper taking into consideration the service tax + the GST, the amount we are paid for that is already for another steak.

Would be nice if parking is free or redeemable. ü§≠

Oh, thanks for the compliment birthday cake for my wife!

business_name: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club Restaurant
text: While they have an extensive menu, however be prepared for a long queue during peak hours as layout can create a bottleneck. Some popular items, like the satay, can also disappear quickly. The "crab" on offer is flower crab, typically ‚Ä¶

business_name: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club Restaurant
text:
Came on Sunday for dinner 2+1 child.. Booked a 6.30pm slot.. Crowd was surprisingly acceptable..
Love the generous spread of food.. The dessert corner has many yummy food especially the ondeh-ondeh, churros, bread pudding and pulut hitam..

The buffet spread was great with variety of food choices from Indian, Malay and Western.. even have the Sup Tulang merah..

Live station outside served satay, corn, sausage & bbq winglet..

Seafood such as mussels, mini lobsters, chilli crab, black pepper prawns were delicious.. there are plastic gloves provided too, so happy for that..

Drinks are free flow and have many choices! Yayy.. they also have live band playing not so loudly which is pleasant for the environment..

Service was good, the plates were cleared almost immediately after we finished eating.. Good job..

Will definitely come again on days like this when it is less crowded..

business_name: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club Restaurant
text:
We had dinner buffet at the restaurant with my family.  It is a halal restaurant and is very big.  It is mostly indoor seating with some tables al fresco but still sheltered, so no worries about inclement weather even if seated outside.

The variety of dishes served was amazing.  The seafood dishes were fresh and I loved the flavours. Among the seafood dishes, there were prawns (of good size), crabs, fish, mussels, clams etc.  If you are looking for more meat, there‚Äôs chicken cooked in a few styles, rendang beef, satay, chicken and mutton with a delicious satay sauce to go with.  There is also a salad corner for you to assemble your little simple salad.  I love the dessert corner, it offers a good variety of western and local desserts to choose from.  There were kueh kuehs, cakes, bread/mango puddings, pulut hitam, ice cream, churros etc all not overly sweet, which is great as we are more health conscious these days.

The food was continually replenished in a timely manner though there was a huge dinner crowd, there wasn‚Äôt anything that completely ran out that I have to give it a miss. Satay was very popular among the diners and it ran out fast but eventually we also got to try it and there were sufficient for everyone.

Though there were many diners, everyone queued in an orderly manner at the buffet line.

The wait staff is also very polite, friendly and efficient and I really do appreciate the good service.

There was also live music too on the night that I was there.

Overall it was a lovely dining experience and our family enjoyed the company and the amazing variety of food (everyone in the group could find something they like) üòç

Parking is also easy as there are many parking lots (unless there are special functions taking place).

I love the buffet (so did my family) and I would come back again for family gatherings in future.

Update:

Went back again on a Saturday night for the buffet due to the favourable experience the last time on a weekday.  The restaurant was very crowded and I think it was full house.  However, this time round, the experience wasn‚Äôt as great, so I have moderated the rating based on both visits.

The queue for drinks was very very long and people were filling a few cups each and queueing for their relatives and friends, such that when I thought I was just behind a few more people, they were suddenly joined by a whole group of others and each one filling a few cups - very irritating. The drinks queue actually reached the door leading to the outdoor satay station, until they had to designate a staff to do the filling of drinks for the diners.  As we were seated near to the drinks machine, there was so much spillage on the floor that we were practically stepping on sticky liquid every time we left the table to get more food.  The queue for food was super long too and sometimes one of the dishes run out but we still have to move along the buffet line in order not to hold back the rest of the diners, but when the dish was replenished later and we only wanted to get hold of some of that dish, we will need to re-queue because some of the diners actually don‚Äôt allow us to go straight to the dish that we missed.  Satay station had no plates or bowls, and people were just grabbing bunches of satay and trying to put satay sauce on them initially, until someone feedback to the staff, only then were some bowls and dishes placed there.  Very different experience since the first time we were here.  Probably won‚Äôt be back for a while.

business_name: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club Restaurant
text:
I don‚Äôt usually leave Google reviews, but this experience was disappointing enough that I felt the need to.

The so-called ‚Äúinternational buffet‚Äù was very underwhelming‚Äîlimited food selection that didn‚Äôt live up to its name. Yet, the price was $1xx++ per pax, the same as premium buffets in town. It feels like they inflated the price just to offer a 1-for-1 promo, making it seem like a deal when it‚Äôs actually not worth it.

Service was also a letdown‚Äîespecially the Indian lady at the reception, who was cold and unfriendly. When I casually asked about any birthday promotions, she simply replied, ‚ÄúNo, Mdm,‚Äù with no warmth or effort to provide a better customer experience. In contrast, town restaurants with similar pricing often offer at least a small birthday treat or a polite response.

For this price, I‚Äôd rather dine in town, where both food quality and service are far better. Not worth it, won‚Äôt be back.

business_name: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club Restaurant
text:
While they have an extensive menu, however be prepared for a long queue during peak hours as layout can create a bottleneck. Some popular items, like the satay, can also disappear quickly. The "crab" on offer is flower crab, typically enjoyed by dipping the meat in sauces alongside fluffy mantou buns, however there is not much "meat" in them.

The restaurant offered a 1-for-1 discount during my visit, making the average price per person very reasonable. The live performances¬† lighen the atmosphere and the staff were very efficient in clearing plates from tables.

business_name: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club Restaurant
text:
Great place for family and staff gatherings. Buffet spread was awesome.

Do book earlier because it can be quite pack.

Not accesible, need to drive or grab in. Plentiful of free parking space.

Staff is helpful and  pleasant. Lovely ambience.

business_name: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club Restaurant
text:
Came on Sunday for dinner 2+1 child.. Booked a 6.30pm slot.. Crowd was surprisingly acceptable..
Love the generous spread of food.. The dessert corner has many yummy food especially the ondeh-ondeh, churros, bread pudding and pulut hitam..

The buffet spread was great with variety of food choices from Indian, Malay and Western.. even have the Sup Tulang merah..

Live station outside served satay, corn, sausage & bbq winglet..

Seafood such as mussels, mini lobsters, chilli crab, black pepper prawns were delicious.. there are plastic gloves provided too, so happy for that..

Drinks are free flow and have many choices! Yayy.. they also have live band playing not so loudly which is pleasant for the environment..

Service was good, the plates were cleared almost immediately after we finished eating.. Good job..

Will definitely come again on days like this when it is less crowded..

business_name: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club Restaurant
text: First time dining here at the Royal Palms @ OCC and the experience was very pleasant. The location is convenient to get to with free shuttle service from Yishun MRT to the Royal Palms and vice-versa (every 15 minutes, schedule can be found ‚Ä¶

business_name: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club Restaurant
text:
Very nice place, I reserved the place for 12 adults and 3 kids, they had 1-1 free dinner offer. The dinner set has tons of options for non-vegetarian folks but a limited option for vegetarian, however staff managed to get us two curries (Daal makhani, Palak paneer and some nice rice) the food was super duper authentic (probably the best North Indian daal makhani I had). Everyone was happy and staff was very much welcoming, all in all best place. They also gave us complement bowling vouchers which we enjoyed nicely.

We took table near pool side, if you have some kids who need a bit of extra space I suggest to sit out as inside it could become crowded and kids not having space they need. However, be very careful with kids and net the pool as it‚Äôs a bit risky.

Place closes 10 pm they also had live band :)

business_name: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club Restaurant
text:
Tender turkey, chicken & juicy beef. Fresh clams & mussels,  juicy big prawns with black pepper sauce, spicy sauced long leg crabs, small lobsters,  üòã
I have been here half year ago. Food finished fast when the crowd got big and replenishment of more food was slow but today the speed in replenishing food  & topping up drink is fast, thumbs-up! Just got to know Seniors have got further discounts during the promo period :). There is a free shuttle bus at Yishun MRT exit B waiting area to the venue.  Do review the shuttle bus' departure timing. In the afternoon, there is a gap of one bus leaving at 1355pm & then have to wait till 1525pm for the next bus.

business_name: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club Restaurant
text:
First time dining here at the Royal Palms @ OCC and the experience was very pleasant. The location is convenient to get to with free shuttle service from Yishun MRT to the Royal Palms and vice-versa (every 15 minutes, schedule can be found at the Royal Palms official website).

There is an on-going promotion (went on the 10th of Sept 2022, Sat) for 1-for-1 so we gathered our loved ones for a wonderful dinner after work!

I really like the ambient; spacious (there's room to walk around) and well-lit, the dishes are placed neatly like any other buffet setting. The service staff were all friendly and approachable. They will walk around and assist to clear away your plates so you can go ahead and grab yourself some more morsels or hefty portion of what's available on the menu.

For that particular evening I helped myself to a generous plate of White Rice, Beef Rendang, Teriyaki Chicken Cutlet and Mixed Baby Kailan. Beef Rendang was tender and it's Rendang you can never go wrong it was so-good! Teriyaki Chicken Cutlet was on the slightly sweet and savoury side really complement with the crunchy Mixed Baby Kailan veggie dish (there's baby corn, mushrooms, but prominently Kailan). This was definitely filling.

Next round I grabbed two Sweet Potatoes, BBQ Wings (I think?), two Mantous, three Peppery Sausages and Kambing Golek (Skewered Lamb, I think) douses generously in Black Pepper Sauce Chicken Tikka and Flatbread, let's just say they were wiped cleaned despite the first plate of rice and side dishes made me kind of full.

I also had traditional Malay kuehs but I am bad at Malay kueh names so... there's kueh lapis like rainbow color, brown chewy kueh in shave coconut? There are cakes, pastries, churros and Satays (mutton and chicken) as well.

Fruits, salad, ice-creams you name it you'll definitely be spoiled for choice.

Dinner was also accompanied by acoustic performances a mix of Malay and English songs though am not sure if the singer is a staff, on contract or a dinner guest? But on that night it was a very talented Malay lady who sang. At the end of the evening the staff came over and asked how was our dinner and we had a small wonderful chat, color me impressed and these small gestures really makes me want to visit another time.

Oh, we also got to meet Chef Bob, friendly guy! Definitely give the Royal Palms @ OCC a go if you haven't.

business_name: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club Restaurant
text:
I don‚Äôt usually leave Google reviews, but this experience was disappointing enough that I felt the need to.
The so-called ‚Äúinternational buffet‚Äù was very underwhelming‚Äîlimited food ‚Ä¶

Ordered pizza seafood mentai , rack of pork is so tender and juicy and kids is always happy with the free Carbonara pasta.
Would recommend for family . Good food and nice environment.

We (family of 3, 2 adult one child) come to Lazy Lizard Upper Thomson a couple of times alr. The food are awesome. Kid eats for free with one main ordered. Kid portions are quite huge. The kids food are a little bit on the salty and sweet ‚Ä¶

Lovely homely place with a wide spread in the menu!

We had the oysters which were fresh, sweet and plumb. The pork was fragrant and paired perfectly with the whipped potatoes. The Dons were very well done too!!

Also, kids eat for free! Such a good deal! Savings!

First time here!

Tried their Hokkaido Oysters. Half dozen for $10, super worth it. The fresh one is fleshy and fresh. The baked cheese one is juicy with a generous layer of savoury melted cheese and mayonnaise.

The pork rack 350g is super huge, probably can share with someone. The meat is super soft and tender, the peppercorn cream sauce is so fragrant and enhanced the flavours of the meat. Love the fries that taste good even when cold.

The sirloin steak is good too. The pepper taste is on the stronger side with a spicy kick.

They give a free juice or double scoop ice cream for a Google review.

I will definitely be back to try more of their dishes

We (family of 3, 2 adult one child) come to Lazy Lizard Upper Thomson a couple of times alr. The food are awesome. Kid eats for free with one main ordered. Kid portions are quite huge. The kids food are a little bit on the salty and sweet side. But once in a while should be fine. Pizzas are delicious, especially truffle salami.

Not a lot of people, always managed to get a table promptly.

Service staffs are attentive.

Family-oriented restaurant with unique choice of food. Ordered the pork rack, ribeye, pesto pizza, meat platter and pasta, which were all yummy. Was served complimentary fried squid as the pizza took longer time to serve. There is vegetarian options and kids eat free pasta too.
The food is simply delicious and comforting on a cold night like this. The staff is friendly too. Nice place! And my 11yrs eats for free.

Rly value for money and delicious as well. Got the messy cheeses burger and beef don and both were really tasty, not dry or overly salty. Free ice cream or juice is a good incentive to express my true thoughts about the food!

Ordered live oysters and rack of pork. Portion is good for pork and it‚Äôs juicy and tender. Also, $10 for half a dozen fresh oyster is a steal.

They also provide baby chair and there is a kids corner with toys and colouring materials to keep your kids entertained. Kids eat free on weekend too.
