Dining at Crimson within Bird Paradise was truly a highlight of our visit. From the moment we stepped in, we felt a sense of warmth and elegance that set the stage for a memorable meal.

It's clear that Crimson's team puts immense care into creating an exceptional experience. The service was simply impeccable, with every interaction feeling genuine and attentive. In particular, Jessica's service stood out. She was incredibly helpful and made sure we felt completely at ease, adding a personal touch that elevated our dining experience.

As for the food, each dish was a delightful exploration of flavors. We started with the truffle fries, which were perfectly crisp and wonderfully aromatic ‚Äì a truly satisfying beginning. The lamb shank was a masterpiece; the meat was so tender it practically melted in our mouths, a testament to the chef's skill. The King Prawn Aglio Olio pasta was another hit, with perfectly cooked prawns and a lovely balance of garlic and olive oil. The King Prawn Laksa was a revelation, bursting with authentic, rich flavors that left us wanting more.

For dessert, the red wine poached pear was a sweet and sophisticated finish, a beautiful blend of texture and taste. And to accompany our meal, the lemon mint tea was refreshingly light, just the right amount of mint and lemon without being overly sweet ‚Äì a perfect palate cleanser.

Crimson restaurant isn't just a place to eat; it's a place to savor moments. The combination of delicious food, thoughtful service, and a pleasant atmosphere makes it a must-try for anyone looking for a truly special dining experience within Bird Paradise.

Tucked inside a tourist spot, Crimson Restaurant defies expectations with great food, stunning views, and excellent service.

We had low expectation for the food, given that crimson restaurant is nested within a tourist attraction. However, we were surprised, the quality exceeded what we had anticipated, and the food turned out to be quite good.

Their window seats offer the best view in the entire bird paradise, creating a unique dining experience with a bird watching backdrop. The staff were very friendly and welcoming even during a busy weekend lunch service. Despite being informed that the restaurant was packed and food will take about 45mins to prepare, our order was served in just 15mins. Our kid enjoy the kids meal that came with a cup of juice and an ice cream.

As expected for a restaurant within a tourist spot, the prices are on the higher side. However, posb credit cards may enjoy a 10% discount, while those with cooperate passes can get a 20% discount to offset gst and service charge.

We will definitely head up the lift to level 2, at the entrance of Crimson wetland, the next time we visit bird paradise.

Ordered Rendang and Laksa. Rendang was sumptuous with substantial amounts of meat and flavour. Forgot to take picture of that.

Service by Kumar and Syah was immaculate. They were friendly and responsive, ready to help with photo taking and even gave us a free cake.

Atmosphere here speaks for itself. Just look at the photos lah Hor

Jessica whom was working in crimson was really hospitable and had a really comfortable aura around her when she was recommending me on what I should have for dessert after my main course. Love the dessert choice she recommended to me! Thank you so much for giving me such a comfortable experience when I was dining alone and the view in the restaurant was breathtaking just watching the birds flying freely :) The lamb rendang was really deliciously delightful and the meat just comes off the bone easily! Will definitely be back here again! :)

This restaurant is really located in the wild west. The place is very ulu and quite difficult to get to unless you drive. Parking is free as there is no designated parking lots. The meat were all tender and juicy. Specially love the roasted pork belly. There is outdoor seating so pets are welcomed

Place is easy to drive to. Ample free parking. As I brought my furkid so we sat outside. Most diners were seated inside. We reached about 7plus for dinner, exterior is all dark. Nothing much to see. ‚Ä¶

What a gem of a find! Hidden along Jalan Lekar.

Wide range of food options available, with many kids friendly meal options. Tried their in house menu and even had customised noodles off the lunch menu.

The Impossible Meat Pizza was an excellent vegetarian dish! Will be back for more!

Vegetables are fresh from the local farms; the salads are a must try!

Service staff are friendly and accommodating, and environment is clean and lots of fresh air.

Best part is that the restaurant is mosquito free, including the outdoor areas which is also pet friendly!

Will be back often!

Place is easy to drive to. Ample free parking. As I brought my furkid so we sat outside. Most diners were seated inside. We reached about 7plus for dinner, exterior is all dark. Nothing much to see.
Ordered steak, carbonara, impossible burger, chicken chop etc. Portion is small. Taste wise average. Food took a while to serve. For 6pax, we spent about $270+.
A nice cosy place for family or even friends gathering. Lots of free parking lots. The pricing is reasonable and staffs are friendly. The food portion is reasonable. ‚Ä¶

They‚Äôve gone through several rounds of rebranding and relocating, but in any case this is currently their only outlet! One of the OGs in the vegan scene that I‚Äôve been to multiple times across outlets hehe. Fully vegan and allium-free menu, ‚Ä¶

Amazing Vegan Food and great ambience. There is the jack and dill pizza that is completely vegan and enriched with proteins. It even tasted like real cheese pizza! The chilli sauce that accompanied it with was very flavourful and was delicious. The nachos was an exact replica of the ones with meat. Yummy and delicious guacamole and vegan cheese sprinkled on top. The wellness drink was enriching and enhancing.
The waffle was extremely crisp and delicious with no 'eggy' kind of smell.The ice cream was smooth and creamy enriched with zest.The ice cream is made with rice cake milk, which is extremely nutritious. Also please check for discounts such as 1 for 1 pizza.
However, the service was not that efficient. The lady who took our order was really rude and told us to hurry up. She looked annoyed and did not explain many food items properly when we asked her. Please improve and look into this.
Overall, it is a pretty good place and I recommend it.

They‚Äôve gone through several rounds of rebranding and relocating, but in any case this is currently their only outlet! One of the OGs in the vegan scene that I‚Äôve been to multiple times across outlets hehe. Fully vegan and allium-free menu, with limited-time specials sometimes available, such as the current Sambal Cheeze Luncheon Panini (Nasi Lemak-Inspired Sandwich), Mee & You (Bak Chor Mee-Inspired Pasta), Sunny Island Spritzer, and Iced Orange Americano. Zenna‚Äôs stellar vegan bakes are sadly no longer available (except for when they run pop-ups like at Ahimsa‚Äôs launch), but their signature Waffles and R'ice Cream as good as ever if you‚Äôre looking for desserts. Lovely cafe with a lovely team, nestled in the heartlands, 15-20min walk from Chinese Garden MRT!

Great vegan food! As I‚Äôm lactose intolerant, I really appreciate that this place provides non-dairy options of foods that are typically dairy heavy e.g. cheesecake. Would highly recommend the lasagna and truffle cheeseburger pizza! The ice cream is rich and creamy, made with rice milk. Kombucha is also very tasty, I‚Äôve had the watermelon passionfruit and the hazelnut float. Both are great.

Have been coming to this place since it used to be called Brownice and am glad that they‚Äôre still serving really good food.
its practically self service all the way. food is good but also on the pricier side.

Scan the QR code to order your food, and it will arrive by train. Everything else that we've ordered is good, fresh, and reasonably priced.  The seared salmon belly is a little disappointing. Expecting to have nicely seared salmon skin with the salmon belly, but it is full of fish scales that I need to remove the skin. Overall highly recommended.

Edit: 28 Dec 2024
Return for their seasonal item, but they ran out of scallop. Their grilled salmon belly has a good grill this time. üëç

Don don donki first sushi üç£ restaurant & what fun is it. Sushi delivered via sushi train.
Sushi prices are super affordable with 4 pieces of scalllop sashimi at $6.  Chawan mushi at $2.80
Ordering via QR code & service is brisk & efficient.  Sparkling sake (300ml) at $10.80
Love the wallet friendly price
Food is very yummy, we‚Äôve been here many times. Yee who served us was very friendly, even provided the my dad a free meesua dish for his birthday (which was very yummy).

1st time order their food & also 1st time using their apps. Delivery took almost 1.5 hr, though pioneer mall is only less than 15min walking distance. Apps stated delivery will take no less than half an hour. Called the branch many times but no one answer. No courtesy call if the order was gonna be extremely late. The best part, delivery fee was $11. Lucky we have discount to offset some of the ridiculous fee. Sorry but no sorry, this will be our 1st & last to eat & order from Texas chicken.

My family and I dined in at Texas Chicken Pioneer Mall. We ordered through the first kiosk on the left and paid a total of $67. But guess what? The kiosk crashed on me, and we have received no receipt, but the money was deducted from the bank account. So we brought it up to the manager, his name is Oliver. The manager printed a receipt from the NETS machine, and i wanted to use it for proof that we had paid but he said it is confidential and could not give us. Then, he was very rude about this whole experience. He told us off as if it was our fault when in fact it was the machine‚Äôs fault. So, we had to pay another $58 to finally eat. Imagine spending $110 + at Texas Chicken. I don‚Äôt know if this is a scam tactic by your staff. I have also contacted the bank, and they said that it was not possible for the cashier to not receive any information backend as payment was already deducted. I am now discussing with NETS. I have also messaged Texas Chicken, and no reply. I will be raising disputes soon. Come here at your own risk if you want to lose money and get told off by the rude manager when it‚Äôs not even your fault in the first place. To Texas Chicken, please feel free to check the CCTV or any records as proof that we‚Äôve paid. As I am not in the wrong, I am not afraid. Oh and we went there for the rendang burger which we could order from the kiosk but when we approached the cashier he said no more very rudely. Then what was in the kiosk? You think we blind is it ? Texas Chicken, if you‚Äôre trying to cut cost by finding someone incompetent to be a manager then i suggest you change it. This manager would only result to this outlets downfall with how terrible his customer service is.

business_name: Bottle tree cafe restaurant by sembawang eating house seafood restaurant
text: Cafe style dining. Queue to buy food and wait for your order number to be called. Self tray return after eating. Ordered pan-fried beehoon, hacheong chicken and hotplate toufu. Overall rating of the food is not bad,  just that the hacheong chicken (prawn paste) is a little salty. Price is reasonable.

business_name: Bottle tree cafe restaurant by sembawang eating house seafood restaurant
text:
We love to go to this place for weekday  lunch.

Free parking on weekdays lunch, plenty of parking space.
The cafe is inside of Singapore Discovery Centre.

They serve different Daily Special Menu, it is always something to look forward to.

Ok, price is on the higher side, maybe even slightly more ex than foodcourt price. A meal with a drink could cost around from 7 to 10 bucks.

But their food really got standard, taste good and portion is reasonably big.

Personally I love their Butter Cream Chicken with Egg & Rice.

business_name: Bottle tree cafe restaurant by sembawang eating house seafood restaurant
text:
The best cafe ever had in SDC. Didn‚Äôt even realise it is halal until my wife told me. Tasted just like any Zi Char stall outside.

But the down side is to enjoy the 10% member discount, need to order over the counter. Self service kiosk doesn‚Äôt support member discount

business_name: Bottle tree cafe restaurant by sembawang eating house seafood restaurant
text:
TLDR: AVOID holiday or when there is a crowd if possible as the system to collect the food is FLAWED.

After ordering 4 mains from the self ordering kiosk, my family sat down and waited. The system calling the order was found to be based NOT in order of Q number. Worse, one staff has to key in the Q number based on whichever dish is cooked and handed to him.

Something was amiss after 30 mins and we found our Q number not being called while Q number after ours were called.

It was observed a lot of people waiting at the counter and I noticed dishes which we ordered were taken away. It occurred to me that people were not waiting for the Q number and simply taking the dishes on their own. I was pretty sure as I saw the Q number of the receipt from the people taking the food was many numbers after ours.

After waiting closed to 50 minutes, we gave up and asked for the refund.

We started with Fish Maws soup, followed by Asparagus stir fried with scallops in truffle sauce then Kurokuta black pork then Peking Duck then I-mien then Red bean pan cake, last mango Sago. All are super duper yummy, tastes perfect, good ‚Ä¶
Very fresh soon hock and abalone. Love the yam basket with prawns & scallop as weak as the abalone & spinach dishes. Good value T about $70 per person. Crab meat soup yummy too.

had family dinner there. food was awesome. highly recommend the cod fish!!
service was also great. we ordered 3 desserts for 4 ppl (intending to share) and the waitress took initiative & automatically brought an extra sharing bowl for us.

We started with Fish Maws soup, followed by Asparagus stir fried with scallops in truffle sauce then Kurokuta black pork then Peking Duck then I-mien then Red bean pan cake, last mango Sago. All are super duper yummy, tastes perfect, good quality food.
Nice atmosphere, excellent services

Absolutely outstanding experience at The Captain‚Äôs Table! Every dish was a delight, and the service was top-notch.

We started with the Fish Maw Soup‚Äîrich, flavorful, and comforting. The Steamed Fish was perfectly cooked, fresh and tender, with a light, fragrant sauce. The Roast Chicken was juicy with crispy skin and a hint of spice‚Äîso satisfying!

The Prawns and Scallops were incredibly fresh and cooked just right, while the Mushrooms with Sea Cucumber brought a luxurious, umami-rich depth to the meal.

To end on a sweet note, the Mango Puree with Pomelo and Sago was refreshing and not overly sweet‚Äîabsolutely perfect.

What really stood out was the attentive and professional service. The staff were friendly, prompt, and thoughtful throughout the entire evening. Every detail was taken care of.

Highly recommend for anyone looking for quality food, great atmosphere, and excellent service. Will definitely be back!

disclaimer: they‚Äôre a little understaffed, so service and food may be slower for this place. I don‚Äôt mind as I like to take my time with food!

Wonderful place to have dinner at - the sunset views are stunning at the correct hour.

Fish maw soup: Very balanced. Just the right saltiness and texture. Have a little sip first before adding in (just a little bit of!) vinegar and pepper to taste the difference.

Stir fried scallops with asparagus in truffle: interestingly good! In many dishes I‚Äôve had, the truffle taste is stronger (and after a while it gets overpowering), but in this dish it was just a hint - a really delicate highlight to compliment the dish as a whole. Asparagus texture was just right - easy to chew but not too crunchy.

Stir fried kurobuta (black pork) in black pepper sauce: very tender!

Peking duck: must order in advance! Make a reservation and order in advance due to the preparation the kitchen must make prior to the meal. I really love the ‚Äúpastry‚Äù they use to wrap the skin for the meal, it‚Äôs thin and fragrant. They‚Äôll serve it half with cucumber and half with spring onion. For the second round, you can choose to have it one out of several ways (if I remember correctly : fried rice, stir fried with e-mian, salt and pepper stir fried, ginger/garlic and onion stir fry, or just chopped up and served).

Mango and pomelo was nice and fragrant, not too thick but also not too watery.

Deep fried Red bean pancake: MUST ORDER. Can‚Äôt stress this enough; this was actually so good. Exterior was wonderfully crispy without being too oily, and the red bean paste in the middle was fragrant and delicious. Got a ‚Äúnot too sweet‚Äù of approval from family members! (ps: you should probably order this dessert slightly ahead of time, not at the end of the meal but maybe before your second last or last dish arrives since it takes time to prepare by hand.)

Star of the whole meal was service staff Simon, who also did the table side Peking duck serving. Very charismatic and charming. Will definitely come back again!

Total was around 300+ for 5 people.

(Do ask them for parking ticket discount coupon if you‚Äôre dining in without membership. Gives a 4 dollar discount, equivalent to two hours of parking I think!)

1st time we are at this restaurant with 2 table booked (22 pax) one week in advance.
Making use of their NDP 95 promo that came in a set comprising Seabass, prawn & spring chicken@$95/set.
We also order peking duck,
fishmaw crab soup, coffee pork ribs, tofu shimeji,redbean pancake,hot yam paste,mango pomelo, heineken, steam rice,coke,chinese tea,braised peanuts.
I am so glad my family enjoyed all the food so much as it were everybody 1st  despite some delayed at the last minute where more diners started to walk-in. The manager offers his apologise & fill our 2 tables with complimentary food which we really appreciated.
I must said:
the steam prawn is exceptionally fresh & nice, the fried seabass is so flavorful, chicken is so yummy & juicy, tofu is crisp & soft, fishmaw is thick with ingredients,
a "WOW" to the pancake,
yam paste is thick with gingko nuts, ribs is tender & crisp.
Peking duck come with 2 combi flavour that need to order in advance.
I am not a noodle person but the remaining duckmeat fried with noodle caught me by surprise. Light & refreshing.
As most member of the family are taught to cook when we were young we find all the food are flavourful, not salty nor sweet. We had a bountiful stomach after having our meal. Everybody said affordable & worth.
Menu & price can be located in the website.
Thanks to the manager & his dedicated staff were serving us well.
10.08.2025

If you‚Äôre heading to Marina Raffles Lighthouse, it‚Äôs one of the two nearby restaurants.
The ambience is typical fine dining. But the 5-Course menu we had was just too small in serving size (please see pictures) and taste is quite common and similar to Hawker‚Äôs Centres. The menu includes: Soup, Sides, Main Dish, and Dessert. However, some of the dish weren‚Äôt available and was randomly substituted. The dessert was also just some slices of water melon ‚Äî which was a little funny for us. Also tea that‚Äôs initially served isn‚Äôt free, just for awareness. With additional 10% service charge + 7% GST.

Overall, not seemed to be worth it.
Crowded on weekdays but ok on weekends. The food is nice and value-for-money for a Chinese restaurant. Members get a huge discount

Usual salad bowl. Subway store located at the furthest end of the west of Singapore. Mainly visited by people working around tuas area. Nice aircon space with ample seating. Service is fast. Free parking available
Can't imagine you can find a Subway in Tuas South industrial area. Business hour from 8 AM to 3 PM. Environment and service is good. Ample parking space and most importantly is FREE parking.

aircon with ample seating.
Service is fast , staff is friendly.
Free parking available

but always out of fresh bread :(
Nice to have Subway in this "Ulu" part of SG. Great variety of offerings. Easy to order and Yes , free parking. My fav Sub in this part of town!

Seroja, only restaurant in Singapore awarded with Michelin Star and Green Star. Enjoyed the dishes & wine, thanks for the birthday cake celebration. All the dishes are so flavourful and rich in taste, enjoy the food. Except the scallop with ‚Ä¶

I‚Äôll admit I was skeptical at first. As a Malaysian, I‚Äôve seen too many ‚Äúelevated‚Äù takes on our food that end up stripping it of soul, layering it with truffle or uni, and calling it fine dining. ‚Ä¶

Seroja, only restaurant in Singapore awarded with Michelin Star and Green Star. Enjoyed the dishes & wine, thanks for the birthday cake celebration. All the dishes are so flavourful and rich in taste, enjoy the food. Except the scallop with laksa which we don‚Äôt enjoyed, the laksa is too rich that took over the taste of the scallop, no more sweetness but left with fishy taste when we eat the scallop alone without the sauces. Overall it‚Äôs a very very very good dining experience and the staffs are so lovely, we will definitely come back again, thank you Miki, Sam and Chef Kevin and your team!

A tour of innovative Malaysian cooking with an emphasis on seafood and sometimes subtle, interesting call outs to the country's ingredients and flavors.  Spacious communal bar table balances proximity to the culinary team with comfort.  Warm, humorous, friendly service throughout.

I‚Äôll admit I was skeptical at first. As a Malaysian, I‚Äôve seen too many ‚Äúelevated‚Äù takes on our food that end up stripping it of soul, layering it with truffle or uni, and calling it fine dining.

But Seroja surprised me. Every ingredient was sourced from Malaysia. Every dish honoured the original flavours I grew up with, and a lot more: bold, earthy, layered while still elevating them in a way that felt opened up your tastebud in a surprisingly good way. Every single dish on the tasting menu was on point (and I‚Äôm also biased with the nostalgic points here).

The dishes were complex, but not precious. Refined, but still delicious. I loved the open kitchen concept. The menu felt like a love letter to Malaysia. I walked away full and a little proud.

Have been a big fan of the rise in regional fine dining and Seroja does a great job at exemplifying what‚Äôs exciting about the ingredients and techniques from the Malaysian Straits. It‚Äôs a filling menu and the journey you take is worthy of a Michelin star - I loved the bread, tripe and truffle broth, as well as the scallop. Menu is pricy but seems in line with other fine dining restaurants these days. Location may be a bit hard to locate and the bathroom is outside the restaurant itself - I didn‚Äôt mind it but others may.

I don‚Äôt know why this restaurant has a star and is so popular. After so many Michelin experiences, this was a disaster.

Food was mediocre. The so called signature chicken wings were the most terrible experience.

No interactions with staff when dining.

Was quite excited to visit Seroja after all the hype surrounding its opening. Eventually made my way there to celebrate my birthday with family and was left rather disappointed. The food was good. But it wasn‚Äôt great. It lacked the ‚Äúwow‚Äù factor that meals of this ilk ought to evoke. The canap√©s were creative enough, especially the duck with sambal hijau. The tuna with ginger kerabu for the first course was good, but nothing special and set the tone for the rest of the meal. The second course was fish, the presentation of which was somewhat lacking as it consisted of all-beige tones and lacked colour. The dish, again, tasted good with the fish being well-cooked and the sauce adding a bit of spice. The third course was a scallop in sort of laksa sauce. The best dish out of a rather middling menu. Then came the main course. The moment it was laid out before me, I recognised the style of plating. Meta does (or did, not too sure as I haven‚Äôt visited since they moved) the exact same plating for their main of Korean bbq. I opted for beef short ribs over the lamb. Short ribs were very well cooked. But again, the fact that the plating seemed to be copied and all the elements of the dish could be found down the road at Arab Street for far cheaper left me sorely disappointed. When you want to showcase a cuisine in a fine-dining format, you need to elevate the ingredients and the traditional dishes. This elevation should not only involve a change from cheaper beef to more expensive alternatives. Rather, it needs to be demonstrated in the chef‚Äôs level of finesse. Desserts and palate cleansers were ok. Their bahulu was completely average. Once again, the chef seems to have confused elevation with using premium ingredients. A home-cook can opt to use Wagyu instead of regular beef to make a burger patty. That alone, however, does not elevate the burger that the cook is making.

VERDICT:
Don‚Äôt believe the hype. Clearly the people singing praises of this restaurant have not gone down the road to eat malay food or have never tasted it. Where the Michelin guide is concerned, it‚Äôs understandable that they‚Äôd be so easily enamoured as they‚Äôre French and haven‚Äôt gone down to Geylang to eat proper malay cuisine. Priced at $218 for lunch, you‚Äôd be better off dining at other, more creative, Michelin-starred establishments like Sommer or Poise or even Nouri which has started it‚Äôs lunch specials at $68++.

Amazing experience that reflects Chef Patron Kevin Wong‚Äôs unique culinary journey. The Nusantara tasting menu is the way to good with dishes that are familiar yet innovative at the same time. Hokkaido scallop, roughscale flounder and trader‚Äôs rice are all dishes that can‚Äôt be missed. In fact I‚Äôd order any of the dishes again in a heartbeat. Do yourself a favour and make a booking soon.

I made a reservation in advance for lunch for two persons. When I made the reservation, the regular lunch menu was priced at 218++ SGD per person, as displayed on the website, without any mention of special pricing for Valentine‚Äôs Day. One ‚Ä¶

A young restaurant which deserves more visits. The scallop course was exceptional, both in the quality of ingredients and the sauces. The bread had a wonderful chew, and I ate far more than I should have. The coconut in the kurma dessert was beautiful.

But there were also some areas of improvement. The kerabu was too dominantly sweet, and didn‚Äôt evoke the taste profile of the kerabus I‚Äôm used to. The chocolate cake was too salty. The lunch menu could use one more piece of protein, since the soup, egg custard, and noodle dishes didn‚Äôt really have any significantly sized protein to give a textural chew.

But those are niggles that can be fixed. I‚Äôm looking forward to seeing what else the team dreams up.

business_name: ASAP & Co. | Award-Winning Halal Steakhouse | Wagyu Steak | Smoked Meats Singapore
text: Went to ASAP for my bf‚Äôs birthday. Mentioned in the booking remarks if i could get a good table since im celebrating his birthday, they surprised him with a free ice cream with happy birthday written on the plate! Thank you so much. ‚Ä¶

business_name: ASAP & Co. | Award-Winning Halal Steakhouse | Wagyu Steak | Smoked Meats Singapore
text:
Went to ASAP for my bf‚Äôs birthday. Mentioned in the booking remarks if i could get a good table since im celebrating his birthday, they surprised him with a free ice cream with happy birthday written on the plate! Thank you so much.

Food wise, we ordered the Miyazaki A5 steak, Dry Aged Steak, Fingerling Potatoes, and the Octopus.  Super good food, 100% worth the money. Definitely would come back!
I've always wanted to try this farm to table theme restaurant and have high expectations since they advertise their ingredients are locally sourced. ‚Ä¶

I hadn't visited this place in at least six years, but one dish that still stood out in my memory was their delicious Curry Mussels. I recalled their seafood being exceptionally fresh back then. This time, I decided to make a reservation ‚Ä¶
This restaurant has a unique concept, serving locally farmed seafood fresh from Singapore. ‚Ä¶

I hadn't visited this place in at least six years, but one dish that still stood out in my memory was their delicious Curry Mussels. I recalled their seafood being exceptionally fresh back then. This time, I decided to make a reservation and bring my family to experience their cuisine.

This visit, I made a point to try more dishes, and my top favorites were:

1. *Curry Mussels*: Best enjoyed while still hot, the flavors truly shine.
2. *Roasted Prawns*: The seaweed butter adds a delightful elevation to the dish.
3. *Canto Grouper*: The Cantonese-style broth is tasty, and the freshness of the lala and fish is impressive.

Other notable mentions:

1. *Seabass Puttanesca*: The fish and pasta texture were not to our liking, but the fish was undeniably fresh.
2. *Shimeji Fries*: The brown sauce adds a unique twist.
3. *Seabass Kabayaki* w Bread: Although enjoyable, I thought the seabass spread portion could be reduced for better balance. Additionally, the bread could be cut into bite-sized pieces, as the large chunks were slightly difficult to bite through.

The restaurant can get quite noisy when it's 80% full, making it challenging to hear the staff. However, I appreciate their attentive service, particularly the explanations provided for each dish.

Overall, this remains a great spot for elevated seafood dishes.

I've always wanted to try this farm to table theme restaurant and have high expectations since they advertise their ingredients are locally sourced.

Seafood was generally fresh as expected and we're all very well plated and look really appetizing and Instagramable. Would highly recommend the curry Mussels which were very fresh and plump and goes really well with the fish curry and mantou.

Service was excellent and staff was prompt to refill the complimentary warm/chill plain water.

What was disappointing to me was the prawn that was served with the Aglio Olio, while they were quite fresh it doesn't meet the expectation of "live" prawn which I was expecting at this price point.

Overall a very cosy restaurant with good vibes and service that serves good decent seafood dishes. Note that it can be quite noisy as the restaurant is pretty crowded and packed during dinner.

This restaurant has a unique concept, serving locally farmed seafood fresh from Singapore.

And yes, the seafood was definitely fresh. You can taste that. But that‚Äôs about where the excitement ends. The dishes were decent, but nothing that stood out. I expected something more memorable. Instead, the food was just‚Ä¶ fine.

Service was great, the staff took the time to explain the dishes and how to eat them, and they were attentive enough throughout the meal.

All in all, I had an okay dinner at Ah Hua Kelong. Would I come back? Probably not. Would I recommend it as a must visit? Definitely not. But if you‚Äôre already nearby and in the mood for seafood, sure, just keep your expectations in check and don‚Äôt be fooled by the inflated Google reviews.

Came to this place for a birthday treat, great atmosphere & the staff provided great service - they recommended us dishes to get & checked in with us routinely.

The best dishes imo were the curry mussels (HUGE mussels) and prawn aglio olio. I'm generally not a fan of aglio olio but I'd come back for this one - it's SUPER flavourful and the prawns served were huge and the heads were full of crunchy umaminess. The Seabass puttanesca was full of foreign flavours in a good way! It was slightly tangy from the starfruit, the fish was super fresh. Actually all the seafood was super fresh, the menu indicated which ones were sourced locally & I'd recommend ordering those dishes to get the ultimate freshness experience!

Nice place to go for good food. What I like most is that the fish are locally farmed. Support Local! And because its locally farmed, the fish was extremely fresh. Good to try if you like fish. Service was also very good. Waitress explained ‚Ä¶

Amazing pizzas just the way pizzas should be. Crusty chewy edges, thin base, generous toppings. We had the Diavola and Prosciutto Rucola Burrata pizzas and I preferred the latter. They use the San Daniele Ham here instead of Parma, which I thought was a good choice. The ham was still thin but softer without the chewy, 'plastic-ky' texture of Parma.

We also had the Calamari, a Carbonara and a seasonal Granchio Risotto to share.

The Calamari was on point, nothing wow but faultless too. I always found Carbonara a good choice for sharing as a normal portion is often too heavy (or jelak as we locals say) for one, leaving no space to try other stuff. So being able to share with 4 others and having just 2 mouthfuls is just nice. Though I wished the bacon was a bit more seared/burnt.

The risotto was an interesting burst of flavours that isn't traditional of a risotto but delish.

They don't serve table water here so it's still or sparkling at $2.50 each but it comes free flow.

Not sure if I'll return for the pasta but am certain it'll be worth returning for the pizzas at least.

Reservations recommended.

Food was excellent! We had the Mentaiko & Ikura pasta, the Prosciutto e Rucola Burrata Pizza, and the Harami steak. The pizza smelt amazing and tasted even better! And the steak was grilled to a perfect medium, with juices flowing out and a melt-in-the-mouth tenderness to it. Service was great too! They had taken quite awhile to serve the steak, but took it upon themselves (unprompted) to offer a complimentary tiramisu and a discount on the overall bill - that's service recovery done right! (: We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner here!

It was a nice experience, great place to hangout but they give you limited time (for me it was 1.5hrs as the place was mostly fully reserved.
Love the food as it came with enough version to share for 2 or 3.

First time at d.o.c and probably wouldn't be the last. The Frito misto was well fried and the batter was tasty. The risotto al polpo nero was creamy and al dente, the cheese flavour was not too overpowering.

The scallop linguine was the highlight for me, the minimal quality ingredients created a very well balanced dish that came together very nicely.

The margherita pizza had a very chewy interior with a crispy but not too hard crust that I enjoyed.

The tiramisu was creamy but had a coffee taste that did not overshadow the other elements of the dessert as well.

The service was splendid as they suggested for the pizza to be served the last which allowed us to really enjoy all the dishes hot and fresh.

Overall a treat and will be back!

Made a reservation 5 days before actual day. When I was there server asked if a 90 mins dining timing is ok for me as they are full house for the day. No problem at all. Specifically told the waitress who took our order that we would like ‚Ä¶

Tried once at downtown osteria. The pizza quality exactly the same as with this outlet. I LOVE their pizza dough - so airy yet doughy. Think my fav is the anchovies pizza becus it cannot be found everywhere. Salty but delish. I managed to get my pizza half and half - do note they charge the higher priced pizza.

As for scallop pasta, dunno why reviews said it is nice. The sauce/gravy was nice but the scallop had no flavour and was not moist/soft. The garlic cloves were crunchy and quite raw.

Tiramisu also highly raved here but for its price, I think can skip. Very basic.

Made a reservation 5 days before actual day. When I was there server asked if a 90 mins dining timing is ok for me as they are full house for the day. No problem at all. Specifically told the waitress who took our order that we would like to start with appetiser first followed by main course. But our pizza was served together with our appetiser. Told the on duty manager about it and he was apologetic. However when our pizza was served during our main course, it was cold. Suspect that they left our pizza somewhere and re-served it to us again. A bad experience as I was looking forward trying their pizza. Def a first and last time dining at this establishment.

One of the more authentic Italian restaurants in Singapore, d.o.c serves up quality food, worth the price paid even though its on the high side.

We tried the Diavola Pizza, Gorgonzola e Salsiccia Pizza, Risotto al Polpo Nero, and a Tiramisu for dessert. They start you off with a bread basket, which, unlike the typical Italian restaurant, is a soft kind of bread but nonetheless tastes very fragrant. The pizza was good, not the best I've had but well above average. The pizza crust had a good savoury taste to it, though I felt like it lacked the flavour of a long fermented dough. I personally preferred the Diavola to the Gorgonzola, as it was more flavourful. I really liked their risotto, this was very authentic. The octopus was cooked to perfection and had that delicious sea saltiness to it. The rice also wasn't overcooked, and still had a firm bite to it. As for the tiramisu, it was also very good, not too sweet and moist enough for the coffee taste to shine through.

However, we were all quite parched after the meal, so we had to drink a lot of water afterwards but they serve tap water free of charge here, so no matter.

Service here is average, it can get a bit confusing for customers though, as the waiters don't wear uniforms. The atmosphere is good for meetups, but they could improve on the air conditioning, as the place was quite hot.

Overall, if you're craving Italian food, this restaurant is definitely worth a visit! I'll be returning as their quality of their food is really rather high.

Food and service is impeccable! Staff is constantly on the lookout if we require any refills. Very service oriented compared to other f&b places! Extra bonus is that the boss gave free tiramisu that was quite delicious too!

I got the time wrong and arrived at the restaurant an hour late. They called me, but I thought it was a scam call and didn‚Äôt pick up. They tried calling twice. It wasn‚Äôt until I got to the entrance that I realized I was an hour late. I‚Äôm incredibly grateful they didn‚Äôt cancel my reservation, even though I had already paid a deposit. The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîespecially the pizza! The mushroom soup was amazing: a huge bowl, super rich, with finely chopped mushrooms inside. Every spoonful was packed with mushroom flavor. The red wine was also excellent! If they had canceled my reservation, I would have ruined my sister‚Äôs birthday party. Thank you again for waiting for me.

We came on a weekend night and had a great time there. Five stars food and five stars service. The interior is minimalistic where tables are arranged around an open concept kitchen counter, there is a private room that sits 8-10 pax at the back. Expect nothing less for food presentation, dishes were colorful like how French cuisine is supposed to be. Great attention to details e.g. micro slices on our king oyster mushroom pieces, symmetry of the ensembles, etc. Of all the dishes from our Degustation set, we enjoyed the starter, Le Crabe, the most as the dish was very light and refreshing. Lobster bisque was outstanding and scallop carpacio melted in our mouths. At the end of the main courses prior to desserts, cheeses were served. As it was my wife's birthday, we got a complementary cake as well. The sommelier was knowledgeable and our wine pairing was pleasant.  Chef Alexandre was very friendly and chatted with us throughout the course. For what it's worth, I think the charges were very fair. I definitely recommend this place for a good night out.

When I reserved a table at Fleur De Sel, I was only thinking of just enjoying some nice French food at a modern setting, and oh boy, this restaurant brings so much more onto the table. I'm totally impressed since I enjoy the complete set of classic French hospitality here: complimentary Bread with French butter, the Canap√©s, the pouring of sauces over the dishes in front of the patrons (I miss this nice little gesture so much, my last experiences with this were at Odette and French restaurants of such caliber many years ago), the French palate cleanser and the Petit Fours.

Best of all, I get to enjoyed these without costing an arm or a leg. And yes, lots of videos ensured to capture the pouring of sauces. Feel free to request the friendly and patient staff to hold on for a while while getting the video mode ready. By the way, the service here is exceptional. It really takes me to the days of dining at classic French restaurants that achieve perfection in service.

The setting of the restaurant is contemporary and classy, with the colour white as main theme. I can really feel that I'm in a fancy French restaurant here (the French songs playing in the background helps with that), but without the dining-is-serious-business vibe due to the modern feel of the place. So I feel very ease here actually and loving it lol

The real show begins when Le Crabe is served. The rich-in-flavours ingredients really work their magic here. Briny fresh crab, buttery n grassy avocado and refreshingly, mildly sweet balsamic sorbet work so well together. I love this creamy treat.

The awesome dining journey continues with La Saint-Jacques. The seared succulent plump Hokkaido scallop has this amazing pan seared surface that is slightly crispy and carries an iota of smokiness, Butternut squash pur√©e adds the earthy sweetness while Parma ham introduces bits of excitement into the taste.

Lychee granita is one of the best palate cleansers I have. I love the sweet floral taste of lychee and the minuscule bites of lychee gives a nice variation in texture.

Le Baba is oh-so-good. In fact, I heard the patrons at a neighbouring table swooning over this.

The service staff will slice the baba cake in half in front of the patrons. And the cake actually jiggle a bit when the knife slice through it: a testimony to how fluffy it is. And a look at the interior proves it. Next comes the Bailey's. The staff will enquire on the preferred amount of Bailey's to be added prior to adding it in. Lastly, the generous amount of light and fresh creamy Vanilla cream is added onto the Baba. This hits the right spot in both taste and texture. The cream and the tart taste of passionfruit glaze juxtapose so well with the herbal bitterness of Bailey's.

This is a must-try here.

I'm really surprised by how intricate the dining experience here, and I feel so pampered when dining here. By the way, there is no dress code, so one can enjoy fine French food in a relaxing ambience and clothing. This is one of the places I will recommend to experience the full extent of French dining while not over-stressing the wallet.

Thoughts: Lovely French Restaurant for Indulgence

Had a Saturday lunch, degustation menu. As a fine dining restaurant, the service can improve such as providing envelopes for facemasks, louder and clearer voice when explaining the dishes. Very good quality ingredients, but bland overall to me. Difficult to notice complexity in some of the dishes. White asparagus with Panchetta and Scallops with Leek were my favorite. Amuse bouche and the main (Le Boeuf) were my least favorite. The beef jus with the main was too salty, almost like soy sauce. Looking back at the menu on the website, I wonder why we got the white Asparagus instead of Foie gras üòÖ maybe I have overlooked the menu at the restaurant?
Wine pairing was superb though. Lifted experience well. Nicely selected wines.
Heard the chef Lozachmeur was out of town today, so may have to come back again later.

Mediocre for the price. Perhaps it was because the resident chef wasn‚Äôt present? It could be the execution but the flavours didn‚Äôt meld together well. The scallops were downright bland and the sauce for the beef wasn‚Äôt reduced enough, ‚Ä¶

Our favourite French restaurant in Singapore, Fleur De Sel, has refreshed their charming interior and Chef-owner Alexandre Lozachmeur has added new food and wine selections to their menu ‚ù§

Let's enjoy a degustation set meal with wine pairing in Fleur De Sel's newly renovated interior. We love the new decor in elegant cream and white palette, with lovely white orchids and palm trees that transport us to a charming tropical paradise as we indulge in the wonderful creations by Chef Alex:

üåü Amuse Bouche: We start off with a delightful bubbly Champagne Delamotte and an Amuse bouche of beef terrine with saffron mayo and pickled vegetable to whet our appetite for the wonderful food journey to come üòã

üåü La Truite: We love the beautifully presented fresh Tasmanian ocean trout sashimi with aromatic herbs tartare, tangy finger lime from Australia, avocado pur√©e, all topped with an elegant round lattice squid ink crisp. Each mouthful explodes with refreshing flavours and textures üòã

üåü Le Canard: The enchanting smell of truffle wafts up as we enjoy duck consomm√© infused with Lapsang souchong tea, mini foie gras raviolis, julienne Australian Manjimup black truffle and truffle toast. We pair this with a light sweet Mount Riley Marlborough Pinot Gris 2020, one of our favourite wines üòã

üåü La Saint-Jacques:¬† Special pressed dehydrated Kaviari caviar is grated over plump seared Hokkaido scallops, decorated with cauliflower pur√©e and chicken jus. Delicate in flavour with wonderful textures üòã

üåü¬†Le Boeuf: We love this 2-hour sous-vide and seared Toriyama Wagyu beef tenderloin A4, with Romanesco broccoli pur√©e, poached yellow and green zucchini and red wine sauce. We pair this with a mellow St Hallett Barossa Faith Shiraz 2019 that further elevates the delicious beef flavour üòã

üåü Selection of Cheeses: We enjoy a palette cleanser of cucumber and mint followed by a beautiful selection of cheeses from the cheese board. We pair this with a sweet digestif from Domaine Cauhap√© 2018 Ballet d'Octobre (Juran√ßon)

üåü Le Baba: Our must have dessert at Fleur de Sel! We love the rum soaked baba glazed in passionfruit juice topped with Tahitian vanilla whipped cream. A wonderful and classic dessert üòã

üåü Petit Fours: Look at how cute these Petit Fours look on the little bulldog serving plate! We get delightful canel√©, macarons, jellies and more. Such a lovely end to a wonderful meal üòã

Fleur De Sel Restaurant is the perfect place for a business lunch,¬† a most romantic restaurant for you to impress your loved one, and a wonderful place to celebrate any of your achievements big or small! The ambiance is beautiful,¬† the service is warm and friendly and the food is amazing!

The service, food, and ambience were nothing short of exceptional. What first appeared to be a cozy, intimate setting turned into one of the most memorable evenings we had in Singapore. Every detail‚Äîfrom the attentive staff to the inviting atmosphere‚Äîmade the experience feel special. If you‚Äôre dining here for any occasion, one dish you absolutely must try is the French onion soup. I would go as far as to call it the best in Singapore. A truly unforgettable dining experience that exceeded all expectations.

Cute authentic French restaurant in town. Delicious cold cut platter, escargot and medium rare steak. Loved that it came with free flow fries and salad. Restaurant is quite small and cosy with interesting decor. Would revisit!

Nice Ambience for a lunch n dinner.

Their Grilled Chicken Waffles with Bbq Sauce is great. it come with crispy fries and the crunchy Waffles.

Their Black Pepper Pork Chop Rice is good. Patty is will done but need a bit more black pepper.

Come here for lunch, they will have special lunch set.

For dinner, they will have live band performing.

I suggest if they can provide free WiFi to customer as I try to post here in the restaurant but I needs to retype everything cos its hanged.

Have tried a few dishes here and so far it didn‚Äôt disappoint! One of my favorite Fusion restaurant‚Ä¶. The chili crab sauce spaghetti with flower clam, prawns and scallop has a very nice chili crab sauce, combined with the seafood gives it an excellent overall taste!

Website says open at 11am. Was there 11.20-11.30 still not opened. Came back after early lunch and finally opened. Room was spacious for 2-3 pax. Input system for song request was at corner wall and you have to literally be standing around there all the time to search for songs and then input. Not recommended for seniors who want to select mandarin or Cantonese oldies as their list is really pathetic. Most songs and pop singers of the 80's and 90s are not available, not even under YouTube.
The food was delicious and best - kid get to eat free. Will definitely visit this restaurant again soon

We had the pork rack and cheesy beef burger. Prefer the pork. Beef patty is thick and juicy. Need more salad as the taste is quite heavy. Kids ate free, pepperoni pizza is a lot for my 2 kids. 1 set is enough

ü¶é **Lazy Lizard: Cozy Comfort with Generous Portions**

Popped into Lazy Lizard with my daughter and left pleasantly stuffed. The beef burger was solid‚Äîjuicy and flavorful‚Äîwith a mountain of curly fries that stole the show. So generous I couldn‚Äôt polish it all off.

My daughter‚Äôs shrimp pasta was tasty and well-balanced, and we both appreciated the warm, attentive service. Staff were friendly and welcoming throughout. The rustic decor gave the place a laid-back charm that‚Äôs easy to settle into.

Bonus: kids eat free on weekends‚Äîa thoughtful touch for families. All in all, a satisfying experience worth a return.

We stumbled upon Lazy Lizard along Bukit Timah, just after exiting the Downtown Line. We arrived early at 11:55 am and were warmly welcomed and promptly seated.
We started with a half dozen fresh oysters ($12). They were a decent size and tasted fresh. The beef cheek was a standout‚Äîsoft, succulent, and a favourite with my wife.
The ice cream was a delightful treat (edited, after served). It wasn‚Äôt just good because it was free; it was genuinely delicious.
The upbeat but not overpowering music created a pleasant atmosphere for our meal.
We‚Äôll definitely be back to try more dishes, especially the tenderloin steak and beef sliders we spotted on the menu.

Arrived at a rather unassuming restaurant that also looked like a cozy pub for gathering, I was feeling a little regretful if we have picked the right place for a cozy dinner.

The waiter was courteous and patient to allow us pick our options. For starters, we ordered the Caesar salad with chicken breast, truffle fries and beef sliders. The truffle fries was crispy and hot. When paired with truffles, it was simply amazing. The beef slider was also delicious.

We also ordered the Margherita pizza which were decently appetizing as the cheese was generous and accentuates well with the tomatoes. The highlight has to be the squid ink seafood risotto. It was very balanced and refreshing with every bite and comes with three large fresh prawns cooked to perfection.

The duck confit was also delicious. Not the best, if you compare to the standards of France, but decently good. The pasta penne was also above average.

Overall, I was wrong to judge the restaurant by the outlook. The food was truly amazing and cost me about S$180 after using the "Eatigo" app which gave a 20% discount. Parking is a little hassle though you could park at the nearby mall and walk to the restaurant.

Portions are good even kids size is quite generous (Kids eat for FREE on Sat/Sun/PH which was pleasant surprise üòç). Pork ribs and rack of pork are cooked to perfection. Quite a lot of families coming to eat. You can use your CDC voucher as well.

Very good family restaurant. Kids eat for free! We love the rack of pork. It‚Äôs super delicious. Food averages out to 4 star. But the pork is definitely a 5 stars for us. We will come again just for that!!! It‚Äôs sooooo goood.

Overall nice experience. The bbq pork rib was not as amazing as others had commented. Maybe it‚Äôs because of leaving a good review gets free ice cream. Still the pork rib was tender and the sauce was great.

First time dining here and it was amazing ü§© we love the Bulgogi Iberico Pizza & Pork Ribs. All the meat so tender and juicy üòç the kids also loves the Peperoni Pizza (free kids menu every weekend) ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è ‚Ä¶

Came on a PH , and kids eat free! (Every Weekend + PH) and have a small play area for kids which is a plus to keep them occupied. Portion for food is good. Overall, i think is really recommended for families or group with kids.

this place damn good omg free food for kids on weekends?! & PH?? and the food is rly damn good + yummy + superrrrr good priced. it's so hard to find a cafe now in SG that isn't exorbitantly expensive!!! also service is good cos the food came super fast
food is good and my kid loves the mini play corner. free kids meal on weekends and PH. will come back again

First time dining here and it was amazing ü§© we love the Bulgogi Iberico Pizza & Pork Ribs. All the meat so tender and juicy üòç the kids also loves the Peperoni Pizza (free kids menu every weekend) ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Cosy baby-friendly restaurant with attentive staff. Booked via eatigo for additional discount off mains. Rack of pork and tikka masala pizza were superb. Burger was pretty good but the beef patty was under seasoned. Curly fries were done very well. The only disappointing dish was the oysters which tasted bland.
Staff here were very friendly and helpful. We made reservations and they called to follow up promptly! ‚Ä¶

Superb Service by the staff on our request for kids‚Äô meal. Kids eat Free on Sat/Sun/ PH.
Love their Food! Recommended Calamari!

Made a reservation via Eatigo for 50% discount during dinner time. A nice and quiet restaurant for gathering and food was good and affordable with the discount. Else could be considered as pricey. Do note that their service charge is base ‚Ä¶

Made a reservation via Eatigo for 50% discount during dinner time. A nice and quiet restaurant for gathering and food was good and affordable with the discount. Else could be considered as pricey. Do note that their service charge is base on the actual price and not after discount. Would recommend their chicken quesadilla and Caesar salad. Would be back to try their fajitas the next time.

Another fantastic visit to CALI! We ordered a variety of dishes this time ‚Äî the burger, chicken Caesar salad, and stuffed jalape√±os ‚Äî and everything was well-executed.

The burger was hearty and juicy, with a nice balance of toppings and a toasted sesame bun. The fries were crisp and golden, served in a generous portion alongside a light salad. The chicken Caesar salad was fresh and satisfying, with a good amount of chicken and just the right amount of creamy dressing and shaved parmesan. The stuffed jalape√±os were the surprise highlight ‚Äî crispy on the outside, stuffed with flavour inside, and paired perfectly with the fruity mango salsa.

What stood out most was the service. The staff were attentive without being intrusive, and the pacing of the meal was just right ‚Äî each course was served only after we finished the previous one, which made for a relaxed and enjoyable dining experience. With the Eatigo 50% discount, the value was unbeatable for the quality of food and service.

Highly recommended for casual lunches, business meetups, or a chill weekend meal. We‚Äôll definitely be back again.

Very quiet place. The service was on point. Food is tasty. Feel that the price is on the higher side though. The staffs are very freely towards the kids. House wine was not bad too. Serving food speed was on the casual side.

Ordered the beef quesadilla and chipotle chicken rice yesterday and it was great. Service was ok, however when I was drinking from the glass cup provided halfway through my meal, the bottom of the cup I was drinking from dropped and half of my coke spilled on the table (yeah that‚Äôs crazy), which then flowed to the floor and my pants. Staff came to clean up after and ask if we were alright, but no apology, compensation or discount was offered by the staff or manager, even when we went to pay shortly after, which is disappointing when dining from such an establishment. Hopefully you can improve on your customer service.

The food here is terrible in my view. Plus drinks (outside happy hour) it can be expensive. You feel like you just spent a lot of money for rubbish. And there‚Äôs one guy I call him the seat mafia. He decides where you can sit even when the ‚Ä¶

The food here is terrible in my view. Plus drinks (outside happy hour) it can be expensive. You feel like you just spent a lot of money for rubbish. And there‚Äôs one guy I call him the seat mafia. He decides where you can sit even when the place is half empty. Generally you don‚Äôt feel welcome. And oh they have only one toilet nearby and it‚Äôs usually disgusting. We only come here when we cannot get into our favourite bars nearby. The only good thing about this place is it has a good vantage point, right in the middle of HV,  which makes it a fun place to people watch.
Great service, amazing food, Evelyn was particularly attentive to us and gave us a great overview of the desserts that we ordered and presented them aesthetically to us. ‚Ä¶

Came here for the Janice Wong Chocolate Painting workshop and had a great session with Seth! Had a pretty good time getting creative with our chocolate bar painting and pretty impressed how everything is done in merely 45mins. On top of 2 chocolate bars we get to bring home, we also had hot chocolate and 2 bonbons for tasting.

A really cool experience especially with kids!
$45/pax, can be booked directly on Janice Wong website even 1 day in advance

Great service, amazing food, Evelyn was particularly attentive to us and gave us a great overview of the desserts that we ordered and presented them aesthetically to us.

Had the lava chocolate cake, which was supposed to be a Father‚Äôs Day special menu, love the rich chocolate taste of the dessert, with a tinge of alcohol in the cake. (Could consider having them permanently in the menu ü§™)

Strawberry ice cream is still tasty, but pales in comparison to the lava chocolate cake.

Upon arrival we proceed to select our preferred wine for lunch from a small but well-curated cellar featuring a mix of old and new world selections. The selection, while not extensive, was respectable and provided enough variety to suit different preferences.
While we were tempted to explore more of the menu, we focused on the cold and hot appetizers. The monkfish liver‚Äîoften called the ‚Äúfoie gras of the sea‚Äù was a standout, boasting a smooth, creamy texture that melted effortlessly on the palate. In contrast, the duck rillette, rich in fat, presented an entirely different yet equally indulgent experience, offering a deep, savory flavor that reset the senses after the monkfish liver.
Moving on to the hot starters, the escargots were baked in a fragrant garlic butter that was impossible to resist, especially when paired with bread to soak up every last drop of the flavorful sauce. The chorizo sausages were another highlight, boasting a coarse texture and a well-balanced spice profile. Unlike many places where chorizo is served overly dry, these were perfectly moist and among the best I‚Äôve had in Singapore. The beef tartare was yet another well-executed dish, made with high-quality beef and seasoned to achieve that unmistakable note of indulgence.
To finish, we opted for a cheese platter and grilled peppers, both of which were enjoyable. However, the meal was not without its shortcomings. Our first bread basket included a decent sourdough, but alongside it was an inexplicably dry, hard-to-swallow piece that felt entirely out of place. Even more surprising was the absence of a proper baguette‚Äîan essential staple in any French dining experience. When we requested more bread, only the sourdough remained an acceptable option.Given the quality of their charcuterie and appetizers, the subpar bread felt like a glaring oversight that detracted from what was otherwise an excellent meal.
Overall, the restaurant delivers on flavor, technique, and ingredient quality, particularly in its cold and hot appetizer selection. However, for a French establishment, neglecting the bread selection is a misstep that should be addressed to elevate the dining experience to its full potential.

A popular dining establishment in Singapore known for its modern French cuisine. The restaurant is noted for its commitment to using seasonal and high-quality ingredients, and it often features a menu that showcases both classic and contemporary French dishes. The ambiance is typically warm and inviting, making it suitable for various occasions, from casual meals to more formal dining experiences. Additionally, they offer a curated selection of wines to complement their culinary offerings. If you're a fan of French cuisine, it's definitely a place worth visiting!
They have the very affordable set lunch menu, which is only $48++.

Authentic French restaurant. Service is excellent.
Champagne Oyster was super good. Champagne taste is a clever touch that elevate the oyster taste.
Steam mussels cooked so well that can't stop eating it and the saffron cream sauce with herbs make it taste super good.  (normally mussel in other places were dry due to over cooked). Its a must to order dish.
Roasted lamb portion is bigger then we expect, but meat was soft, tender and juicy, and the roasted garlic went so well with the meat.

Dessert was Rhubarb crumble with strawberry ice cream. The warm crumble and rhubarb mixed with ice cream taste so good.

We arrived at 6.30pm which early and less crowded but it was dramatically busy after we ordered our foods.

Suggest to make reservation to avoid disappointment. They have indoor and outdoor seating.

Had dinner last night at the restaurant.  We have Cantabarian Anchovies, traditional French onion soup, sauteed frog legs, fries and rillete as appetizers.  Have peppercrusted ribeye and "claypot chicken" as main.  Meal, wine and service are good.  very lively ambience on Tuesday night, tells you that they are popular.  For dessert, we ordered profiteroles, black forest cake, and melted chocolate.  Our group very much enjoyed the profiteroles.  We brought 1 wine and bought 2 bottles.  Corkerage is $50 but you buy one get one free.

The food is fantastic!
The drunken chicken is well drunk with Chinese wine, scallop which has the crunch, and prawn with a nice wasabi mayo. ‚Ä¶

Service was excellent. I really appreciate that my server saw that I paid with a credit card and immediately told me that the credit card has a discount and went to deduct the bill. And even the wait staff was very attentive making sure our ‚Ä¶

The food is fantastic!
The drunken chicken is well drunk with Chinese wine, scallop which has the crunch, and prawn with a nice wasabi mayo.
Birds nest with crab meat had lots of crab taste in a thick broth and birds nest is plentiful with every mouth.
The peking duck is a needless mention on the flavour and every roll is packed with meat too!
Next it's my favourite for the night, the sea perch. It is glisten with all natural fish oil, every mouth just has it melt in your mouth giving a full flavour of the sea perch with light soya sauce.
Next is the kurobuta pork, I really liked the sweet balance, switch to red and the flavour just came out nice.
The mee pork was one i was looking forward to, but it disappointed a little, the texture of the noodles is not something I like and wish I had gotten some chilli to spice it up.
Last was dessert, it was a good balance where it is not really sweet and really refreshing. Sadly no pictures.
Overall, love the portions and food flavours!

Service was excellent. I really appreciate that my server saw that I paid with a credit card and immediately told me that the credit card has a discount and went to deduct the bill. And even the wait staff was very attentive making sure our tea cups were filled and plates changed. Appreciate the attention to detail.

Food presentation and food was good. The veggies was so nice that we forgot to take a pic and it was finished! üòÖ Very nice and would have loved more stomach space to try more‚Ä¶

Nice cosy atmosphere. Very chill.

The Min Jiang at Dempsey offers exceptionally fine dining. The peking duck (part 1) comes with two sets of condiments: traditional and Szechuan. The pancake is translucent and stretchy. The lettuce for the diced duck (part 2) had an incredible light yet crisp texture ‚Äî perfection. The soups ‚Äî we tried the hot and sour soup and the goldfish and scallop soup ‚Äî are refined with complex tastes. The crab fried rice was super delicious. The pork knuckle (pre-order required) was tender and came with a delicate spicy mustard seed sauce and lightly sweet pickled cabbage. An amazing feast for the palate.

We reserved the private dining area with a minimum spend and ended up spending just over $3000 in total. The set menu, priced at $520 per table (for 6 people), offered a refined selection of dishes, including Beijing duck served with homemade crepes, double-boiled chicken soup, steamed sea perch, braised abalone, braised mee pok, and a dessert of mango sago with pomelo and vanilla ice cream.

Alongside the set menu, we added several √† la carte dishes to further explore the menu. Highlights included the crispy eel with vinegar sauce, crispy white bait fish with pork floss, and fried carrot cake with XO sauce. Other dishes like the Alaskan crab with steamed egg in truffle oil, deep-fried white corn pearl, and the braised fish maw with sea cucumber didn‚Äôt quite hit the mark, with some of them (such as the Alaskan crab) tasting more like imitation crabmeat.

The set menu portions were not particularly filling, especially given the additional a la carte orders, so it‚Äôs worth noting that you might need to order more if you‚Äôre looking for a more substantial meal. However, the standouts for me were the Beijing duck, double-boiled chicken soup, and steamed sea perch. These dishes truly elevated the meal.

A downside to the experience was the lack of soundproofing in the private dining area. The space was only separated by a rattan wooden door with holes, which led to a lack of privacy and noise from the surrounding restaurant. Additionally, the service was slow and the staff seemed stretched thin, which affected the overall dining experience. While I understand that the waitstaff were doing their best, it felt like the restaurant was understaffed, and more ground crew could have made a difference.

On the positive side, parking was plentiful and free, which is always a bonus in the Dempsey area.

This is my first time to Min Jiang, the food meet my expectation but the place is a bit noisy as the guest are seated in the main hall with enclosed environment surrounded by glass window which reflects sound. This resulted in the noise being amplified.

The waiters ( part timers ) are not well trained, they tried to cleared the plates a couple of times when we have not finished eating.

Lastly, there was a house fly inside the restaurant flying around, and it is so fond of our table that from the time we sat down till we leave, it kept hovering on our dishes , cup and the chair. We have to keep waving it off throughout our entire meal time....

Despite our few times of feedback to the staffs, all we received is just verbal - " We apologies , sorry about that etc "

I used to be in the F&B ,  if i am the manager, i will recommend to change to another table immediately and, probably give a 10-20% discount as a good gesture without the guest requesting....

Really nice Cantonese restaurant in a cosy location that makes you feel like you are out of the country.

Service is really attentive and prompt with helpful suggestions on what to order, and portion size etc. The food quality is very high and some of the dishes are quite innovative. The dishes I ordered were,

1. Deluxe Dim Sum Platter

Imaginative and tasty selection of dim sum items. I enjoyed this, and the prawns used were nice and crunchy.

2. Double-boiled chicken soup with goldfish dumpling

Flavoursome stock with good clarity.

3. Double-boiled chicken soup with eel max and shrimp

This is a heavier and milky soup. Just as nice as #2, just different.

4. Pan-fried Kurobuta with melted onions

Nicely executed with the sauce and caramelised onions providing a good pairing with the pork.

5. Soaked rice with prawn, scallop and mushroom

The stock is quite prawn-forward. Good fresh ingredients. The very nice touch is that the puffed rice is served separately in a bowl which keeps it nice and crispy. The sizing is generous so you could probably have your crispies in every spoonful.

6. Iberico pork fried rice in pumpkin with XO sauce

A must-order in my opinion. Pretty near perfectly executed. Top marks for the XO sauce.

I did find it strange that they didn't offer "normal" Chinese tea. Their tea options will set you back a pretty penny. You know you are in trouble when you have a description of the individual estates. The alcohol menu is very impressive and interestingly quite competitively priced compared to the tea menu. Maybe I'm just not conditioned to paying so much for tea.

The waitress kindly reminded me of their credit card promotions, so I ended up saving a bit. That was a nice bonus because the food is quite expensive.

We went to Micasa at the recommendation of family, and Chef Micah was superb in meeting the gluten-free and nut-free needs of our group. The lobster appetizers were delightfully delicious, and the tomahawk steaks and pork chops were ‚Ä¶

We went to Micasa at the recommendation of family, and Chef Micah was superb in meeting the gluten-free and nut-free needs of our group. The lobster appetizers were delightfully delicious, and the tomahawk steaks and pork chops were absolutely perfect. And then we got to the lobster and prawn paella... All of us left full and impressed by the taste and presentation of the dinner course. Thank you for providing us with a safe culinary experience and we look forward to visiting again the next time we are in Singapore!

The food was great! Went for the pork cheeks, lamb rack, Iberico slices, Ultimate Paella, churros if you want some ideas. Look out for the tomatoes in the salad - the freshness cuts through the meat. The person who topped the experience was Silva, who attended to us. So friendly and welcoming! Great at giving recommendation! If you need some, call out to him!

No more Next Time... First time dining here and never again returning. Reserved a table to buy a friend a birthday dinner. All was ok in the beginning. We ordered a bottle of wine, burrata, beef cheek stew and 3-ribs of lamb rack.

TBH, the food here is pretty decent. Until the lamb rack was served. My friend and I stared hard at the dish, specifically the meat to fat ratio. Since it was a birthday treat, my friend was polite and picked up a piece of lamb and began to eat it. I hesitated for a bit and finally decided to call it in. Told the staff that the proportion of fat to meat was more than 50%. I told her that it was unacceptable to serve customers this way without trimming off the fat, and on top of that, the dish is charged by the  weight of the lamb racks. I also referred her to Google pics of the same dish posted by other customers, who all got very nice cuts of meat. I requested for a change of meats. After all, I was there for this dish. We asked for the menu and was about to decide on a replacement dish when an elderly man, who looked like the owner of the restaurant came to our table to tell us that all lambs have fat, each differs in fat content.

Ok fine, it's not like my friend and I haven't eaten lamb racks before. But we never got served with such fat proportions before. I explained that I was very willing to pay for the meat with some fat but not 50% fat! Why can't I get the ones which his customers posted on Google?

We ended up with a lecture from his elderly man instead. Who replied "Next time, if you are not happy with the dish, don't touch it." I could feel my blood pressure go up at that point. And I told him to charge us for the eaten piece of rack. To which he said they will cancel this item from the bill, and repeated his lecture of "Next time...". We didn't want to engage him further. We finished up the rest of our beef cheek and took away our half consumed bottle of wine. The experience left a bad taste in our mouth. And to make it worse, an unpleasant birthday dinner.

Arrived at around 5.30pm for dinner on a THU evening. The place was quiet and it seemed we were the first customers for the evening. Very typical kind of the peranakan dishes. Have that home-cooked taste and feel. It was fully packed by the time we left at around 7pm.
Will be good to call and reserve coming, even in a normal weekday.

Simple, a little haphazard, but oh-so-comforting ‚Äî rice vermicelli soaking up that rich, flavour-packed broth, loaded with prawns, scallops, clams, sliced fish, egg, and veggies. And not forgetting the scrumptious sidekicks: signature meat & seafood rolls and crispy squid prawn cakes ‚Äî great for sharing. üíñ

The white bee hoon definitely was the star of the night, but the other dishes were really good as well. Thoroughly enjoyed all the food! Mix the chilli with the white bee hoon if you want it to be richer in flavor but eating it by itself doesn't disappoint as well! The XO scallop fried rice smelled sooooo good and had a stronger taste which we all liked. The deep fried tofu ball was springy, nice and easy to chew, complemented the carbohydrates well. The sesame chicken was good too but hoped for more ginger to make it more outstanding. I recommend prioritising the beehoon and fried rice, they were the most memorable!

Visited this place many times, always ordered my usual XO sauce fried rice with scallops. Portion is large and also love the slight spiciness.  Also, will get my usual sesame braise chicken, portion wise is strange the first time I order ‚Ä¶

Walk in on a Saturday early afternoon, waiting time was around 10 minutes.

Most of the dishes are nice and delicious especially the Signature White Beehoon, Samba La La, Samba Kang Kong, Prawn and Chicken Sausage Fried Rice and the Signature Fried Wings.

The XO Twin Scallop Fried Rice is a little bit oily and Spicy, the Meat and Seafood Roll taste is still ok.

Overall a nice experience and customer service is good as all the service staffs are very attentive.

Tried their 4 pax value meal set. Total 5 dishes including white beehoon with sufficient scallop and prawns, sweet and sour pork, tofu, prawn roll and vegetable. Portion is good for 4 and taste is good. Good choice.

Visited this place many times, always ordered my usual XO sauce fried rice with scallops. Portion is large and also love the slight spiciness.  Also, will get my usual sesame braise chicken, portion wise is strange the first time I order the small portion it was small but in the latest visit it so huge a portion, but I love the taste.  Service is fast and staff are attentive and clears each table very quickly once the customer leaves so nice and clean always.

Had the Signature Grilled Chicken Chop with Tender Wagyu Beef for the SG60 Singapore Sale (Selected dishes were 60% off hence SG60) and calling it disappointing would be an understatement. When the meal was served, I was stunned. Chicken ‚Ä¶

Had the Signature Grilled Chicken Chop with Tender Wagyu Beef for the SG60 Singapore Sale (Selected dishes were 60% off hence SG60) and calling it disappointing would be an understatement. When the meal was served, I was stunned. Chicken chop with tender wagyu beef? Absolutely not. What I got were five tiny pieces of so-called ‚Äòtender wagyu‚Äô beef even one of which was just pure fat, looking as if it was scraped off someone else‚Äôs leftovers. The beef wasn‚Äôt even medium rare as advertised; it was well-done and tough to chew. The price? $19.90 SGD, which came up to $23.86 after GST. The rest of the plate was mediocre at best, I‚Äôd honestly rather eat at Astons. Please revamp this dish, or better yet, take it off the menu entirely. I wouldn‚Äôt wish this meal on my worst enemy.

Collins Jurong Point is an absolute gem in the world of fine dining! From the moment I stepped into the venue, I was drawn to its warm ambience and friendly staff. The menu offers a delightful fusion of flavours, showcasing a wide range of dishes to suit all tastes.

Their attention to detail is evident in every aspect. .

The dessert menu is an indulgent treat. The molten lava cake is a chocolate lover‚Äôs dream come true, while the tangy lemon tart provides a refreshing contrast.

In addition, I must commend their attention to dietary preferences. They offer a number of vegetarian and gluten-free options, ensuring that everyone can enjoy the experience.

Collins Jurong Point has certainly set a high standard for dining venues. It is the perfect place to celebrate a special occasion or enjoy a memorable meal with loved ones. Whether you are a food lover or a casual eater, Collins Jurong Point will provide you with an unforgettable culinary adventure. I can‚Äôt wait to return for another fine dining experience!

Great deals, awesome staff, inviting ambience, cosy place to dine and bond with your loved ones. Service was prompt and overall the family enjoyed the memories together at this dining place which has a long list of menu to offer. Ala carte or set meal, worthy for every dollar spent. Be awed by the generous portion served for the combination grills, chicken and pork chop. All family members were satisfied gastronomically and definitely will come for next celebration soon.

Overall, a pleasant dining experience.

Servers were attentive and helpful, and carried a generally friendly demeanour. The area was clean and very well-lit.

The food was pretty nice. Collin‚Äôs chicken chop always hit the spot, and the aglio olio was aptly seasoned, with a generous helping of garlic. Dishes were served hot and fast. Specifically, the squid tentacles were bussin.

However, my only gripe is with their wild mushroom soup - it was reminiscent of canned versions of such a soup. The mushroom flavour could have been more pronounced.

Collins Jurong Point is an absolute gem in the culinary landscape! From the moment I stepped in, I was captivated by its inviting ambiance and friendly staff. The menu offers a delightful fusion of flavors, showcasing an extensive range of dishes that cater to various palates.

Their attention to detail is evident in every aspect, from the beautifully presented dishes to the impeccable service. The appetizers were a fantastic start, with the crispy calamari and flavorful bruschetta stealing the show.

For the main course, I opted for their signature Collins Steak, and it was a revelation! Cooked to perfection, the tender and succulent steak left me craving for more. The accompanying sides were equally impressive, providing a harmonious blend of textures and tastes.

The dessert menu was an indulgent treat. The molten lava cake was a chocolate lover's dream come true, while the tangy lemon tart provided a refreshing contrast.
