Moreover, I must commend their attention to dietary preferences. They offer a diverse selection of vegetarian and gluten-free options, ensuring everyone can relish the experience.

Collins Jurong Point undoubtedly sets a high standard for dining establishments. It's the perfect place to celebrate special occasions or enjoy a memorable meal with loved ones. Whether you're a food enthusiast or a casual diner, Collins Jurong Point promises an unforgettable culinary adventure. I can't wait to return for another exquisite dining experience!

Called restaurant twice in Apr and May to confirm if they have suitable food for Vegan customer. They ensure me there is pasta vegan can consume.   But today when I dine in the restaurant, staff told me he just checked with the chef and the pasta is also contained egg. Now end up we are left with only salad and minestrone soup suitable for the guest. Very disappointing with such service.

13pax lunch on 30.1.2024

great value lunch set @ collins jurong point

1 main with 2 free sides

the soup - cream of mushroom la & fresh tomatoes ok good standard

appetiser - the tempura octopus ..not quite tempura but very good value as free side

mains -
chichen with huge prawn & pasta $17..
mixed grill with chicken pork ok iberico sausage not great with great dips & corn veg etc

great value average food

Ordered a 2-person portion chicken + 2 cuttlefish porridge at a total of $15. Reasonably priced and portions were more than sufficient.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

The porridge is a classic Cantonese-type texture, fine broken down rice bits and watery. Very generous portion of cuttlefish in each bowl of porridge. The steamed chicken was also delicious, the accompany soy sauce was slightly on the sweeter end but I enjoyed it. Staff was also polite and everything was fuss-free.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

The hawker centre was one of the stuffier and warmer ones, but no fault of the stall.

If one is talking about the recommended food stalls in Jurong West 505 Market & Food Centre, it's of no surprise that one of them will be Soh Kee Cooked Food.

Soh Kee Cooked Food has been serving delicious Cantonese style porridge ever since my childhood days. This stall has brought back a lot of memories in me ~ I still can remember the days when the lady will automatically provide a small empty bowl on top of my main bowl of steaming hot porridge without fail. That really helped a lot in separating the scalding hot bowl of porridge into a smaller bowl. It had left me a great impression as a child with the kind of warmth gesture offered.

Soh Kee Cooked Food is known for its Chicken Porridge. Nevertheless, they do offer chicken, fish, cuttlefish and mix porridge. The usual ones I had will be their Chicken Porridge followed by fish porridge.

Like many of the patrons, I cannot resist ordering their chicken porridge set. For a Two Pax Meal, the portion of poached chicken was considered generous.

The chicken was succulent, tender and moist. What's more, the wonderful mixture of soy and sesame sauce had elevated its taste.

Though this bowl of porridge is simple and down to earth without many ingredients like spring onions with white pepper. I honestly claimed that it does satiate my appetite even in its plainest form.

The porridge was served in perfect silky smooth watery consistency and had never failed to satisfy my meal. Every meal is an enjoyment for me. Ever since I had shifted out of Jurong, I'm still missing their porridge frequently.

Besides having the bowls of stomach warming porridge, another noteworthy item will be their Salad. They used to serve "Yu Sheng" but due to the with the advent of  Group B Streptococcus (GBS) infections, such dish is no longer served due to NEA‚Äôs ban. Instead, the dish has been changed to Abalone Salad. The dish brings out a connotation of simplest items like abalone slices, scallions, shredded carrots with zesty and citrus taste including the user of crackers, enhancing the crunchiness in the bite.

In conclusion, Soh Kee Cooked Food has maintained its standard all these years and YES! I'm still loving it and that means I won't get bored even till the extent of having their food daily. On top of that if you are looking for healthier choices of food, their chicken, fish and cuttlefish porridge are indicated with the healtiher choice logo.

Decided to try after reading some blogger who wrote about this place. There wasn't really a menu and the staff just verbally told what was available and basically we ordered each of everything. Service was a little slow even though there ‚Ä¶

I made my order via Whatsapp, which was prompt and fuss-free (after trying website and FB messenger, which always indicated non-availability and didn‚Äôt respond, respectively). Sellers were friendly and polite when I went to pick up at the store. The Ayam Penyet Burger meal was generous in portion for the price ($19.90). The two sauces provided were tasty and not too spicy. However, there was only tofu fries in my order although tempeh fries were supposed to be inclusive as indicated in the menu. Batter of the fries tasted the same as that of the chicken, which can be rather jelak towards the end of the meal. The chicken also tasted more like fish and chips than ayam penyet. Nonetheless, an enjoyable meal.

Decided to try after reading some blogger who wrote about this place. There wasn't really a menu and the staff just verbally told what was available and basically we ordered each of everything. Service was a little slow even though there were only 6 people in the entire cafe. 1st was the rojak churro which was quite interesting, the churro was like the youtiao and the rest of the ingredients were wrapped in the rice paper. It tasted good but was kinda deconstructed didn't really know how to go about eating it.
The crab burger and Tofu fries was next. Burger was okay quite enjoyable and so was the Tofu fries with the dip sauce. I guess it was a good combination and the tofu fries would just seem kinda out of place by just ordering ala carte.
Last was the coffee pasta, which I thought was the "disaster" of the entire meal. Kinda hard to appreciate coffee taste on the pasta, which left a bitter aftertaste even after the meal. On the other hand the beef that went along with the pasta was so well cooked the meat was very tender and juicy. I think it was cooked separately and later added to the pasta before serving so it didn't really have much of the coffee taste (which I said thank God).

New item in the menu! Good attempt but could have been better. The pork burger is crispy at the outside and juicy in the inside but the gamey / porky taste from the patty is quite unpleasant. If the curry sauce is more it could have cover it and create a more flavourful burger. The signature curry sauce is too little to called a monster curry burger.

The fish taste just like regular fish burger. Nothing special.

It was quite a hassle to queue physically there. Apart from that, everything is pretty good. It was a busy weekend evening, a dish was missed and that was all the blunder. Host & servers are all smiley. Food were tasty and on the heavier side. Especially liked the Ee-fu noodle, Chicken in Chinese Wine & Boneless Chicken.

Favourite place for our ‚Äúherbal duck‚Äù treats, especially since their recipe originated from the famed È∏≠Áéã (Ya Wang) in JB üòã

Besides that, they do serve a decent selection of other dishes, though not as widespread as other restaurants might do.

However, taste wise was great for each dish - couldn‚Äôt find any complaints so far as I recall in all my previous visits.

Dian Xiao Er serves very tasty Chinese Delicacies. They have private rooms that allows for gives a cosy gathering of family and friends.

Their duck has a herbal sauce that is nice and it's smooth and juicy. The wheatgrass tofu is the first I have eaten and it's soft and fresh. Tofu is served with prawns, pea, etc. The salted egg york is not too salty, century eggs with soft vegetables. Jasmine tea is refillable. Soup was nice with pepper and vinegar. Above dishes were ordered for 4 adults. Portions were just nice.

Waiting time was not too long despite having much crowd when we were there. Staff were fast to respond when we call for attention.

The toilet is just directly opposite Dian Xiao Er.

#ILoveDianXiaoEr

Had dinner at the Jurong Point outlet today. Service was excellent. Ordered Fried Ee Fu noodles but it was too salty. Told the waitress and she said they would redo it. While waiting, we were served 2 free soy bean curd. Not many restaurants would refry it for you. Excellent!

Awesome food, their herbal roast duck is always good. Service is quite fast and they will keep walking around to top up your tea or water. Love that they have brown rice as well and quite a lot of healthier options for the dishes. Fuss-free and good food.

Ordered my favourites - Mongolian ribs, salted egg fried lotus root with pumpkin and ÂçÅÂÖ® duck rice (Angelica root duck I think).

For some reason the shop forgot the duck and rice, hahas. But all is good. They made another trip to deliver to us when we called the outlet. Normally I would prefer a refund to avoid the hassle but we didn‚Äôt order a lot that day and would prefer to have the food.

The lotus root is still very crispy yum yum.

- - - - - - - - - -

Back at Dian Xiao Er, dined in for 2 pax today.

Their style is somewhat like a Tze char style, with dishes not always commonly found at neighborhood Tze char stalls.

The portion is just right for 2: 1 bowl of rice, 1 small portion of ÂçÅÂÖ® duck and 1 small plate of salted egg pumpkin and lotus root

Yummy lunch.

Had lunch here while celebrating friend birthday during a Sunday lunch. Ordered signature set with 7 items for 3 pax. Overall considered quite tasty, got free longevity cake "shou tao" for celebrating birthday in their restaurant.

Ordering web app is a mess and unable to locate dishes we wanted to order. In the end, ordered manually via staff and requested for drumstick specifically but the food came which was breast meat.

Waiter went back and forth and say will change it for us but the chef was reluctant to do so as they stated will throw the food away, maybe they don't want to bear the cost? If it is the company policy to reject change request for wrong order before the food is even touched, don't overpromise by saying will change it for customer. Ding dong back and forth and say cannot change.

Overall food is ok and consistent, just the way of doing things for people working in the kitchen is not transparent. Spoilt the dining experience as i was a big fan of the duck drumstick at here.

I've always like eating here with my parents. The food is always fresh and served piping hot. Today I tried the baked scallops and white baits! Definitely my cup of tea! Will definitely come back for more, as always. One more thing to add, ‚Ä¶

There is a student discount that is pretty good. Good for students. They can have free drink as much as they want when they order students‚Äô meal.
Local students took me here. ‚Ä¶

One of our favorite place for fish & chips.  We ordered New York fish & chips and seafood platter. Fried white fish was stuffed with cheese, flaky & juicy fish üêü top up with fresh lemon and creamy tartar sauce. The plating of the meals were beautiful.
Seafood platter is the star, we didn't realize it's huge. It can easily feed for 3-4 pax. It got grilled squid/calamari, grilled fish, grilled prawn, braised muscles, chips, vegetables & paella rice. It's delicious üòãüòãüòã, I like squid ü¶ë & prawnü¶ê, it's fresh, succulent & tasty.
The fish & chip we ordered as student meal, with free flow of drinks & available all day, even on PH üòÑ
Nice & cozy ambience with friendly waitresses. Definitely will come back again.

There is a student discount that is pretty good. Good for students. They can have free drink as much as they want when they order students‚Äô meal.
Local students took me here.

Very big fish and chips.
Valuable.

Western atmosphere.

I've always like eating here with my parents. The food is always fresh and served piping hot. Today I tried the baked scallops and white baits! Definitely my cup of tea! Will definitely come back for more, as always. One more thing to add, the service by the manager and the other servers are always on point. Interestingly, the manager actually remembered us. Maybe we've been here often üòä Thank you for the great service, like always!
Poor noise ventilation. Service is quite slow. Fish texture is decent but abit tasteless . Overall pricey without discount

After Westgate's closure, this is my next nearest Fish & Co.

We are your long time supporters, choosing to boycott MFM instead but our love was not reciprocated.

I had the cajun chicken this time and the set lunch came with a iced (lemon) tea. Added a soup of the day as I wanted more sustenance. You can add more sides and other stuff at a slight discount.

My cajun chicken was well marinated and thoroughly cooked BUT there was just too much flour/batter.

I would appreciate it if it was for my fish n chips but it got cloying until I had to scrap it off. I know there are others who'd like that, but not me. So I apologise to the cashier when I made payment. It's unlike me to waste food but I wasn't feeling too well.

Still love your food!

Fish&Co at Jurong Point had been our favorite all these while due to its good food and service. But our dining experience today was really a huge letdown. We ordered their seafood broth and not only did the dish come not fully cooked, the baked scallops, mussels and prawns were not fresh at all. The mussels, especially, left a sour and bad taste in our mouths. The manager only gave us a 10% discount after everything that we've been through. Definitely not the kind of compensation we've been expecting. It was very disappointing. We won't be going back in the near future after this bad experience.

Had not eaten @fishncosg for quite some time
A lunch set comes with a drink. Tried seafood or clam chowder but this is 1st time trying prawn chowder.

The prawn chowder soup is heartily warming. The fish and chips are standard is still there. Passion fruit soda is basically soda and passion fruit flavoured fudge

The pricing is a draw. Fish and Co goes easy on our wallets.
