Disappointed with the Mother's Day set meal.  Main course salmon was smaller and dry. The 2 pieces of scallop was rubbery & tasteless. The appetiser salad vegetable was cut into very tiny pieces & looked like leftover greens. The minestrone ‚Ä¶

Disappointed with the Mother's Day set meal.  Main course salmon was smaller and dry. The 2 pieces of scallop was rubbery & tasteless. The appetiser salad vegetable was cut into very tiny pieces & looked like leftover greens. The minestrone soup was too oily. Given the quality of the food, final bill of over $50 for this set meal was not worth. Is way more expensive than order each of the items by a-la carte!!!

Thank you to the team Dado, Snow, Roland and Vishnu for the excellent service and warm hospitality. There was a mistake in the bill that was quickly corrected with fuss-free ease and professionalism. The food was absolutely delicious and fresh. We truly enjoyed our dining experience!

UPDATE: 2025.05.09
steak -> chewy, and raw. for a medium well doneness. not worth 20$ for a mediocre size and taste. iSteaks restaurant is much better at the same pricepoint.

UPDATE: 01.11.2024
grilled chicken salad before and after photos.
portions too small for the price.

UPDATE: 02.25.2024
food: ordered NZ striploin. meat was grilled straight from the freezer. hard as rubber. no taste as well. not even properly seasoned. ordered medium, given medium well. well done good job.

service: find it annoying that the servers has to go rounds (meaning every minute), have to watch someone eat, immediately take empty plates on the table even though people havent finished the whole course yet.

atmosphere: noisy as its directly at the back of an arcade center.

Hot Tomato offers great value for the price, especially with their student discounts! The generous portions and tasty dishes make it an excellent choice for a satisfying meal without breaking the bank. It's definitely worth it for the price and flavor!

Excellent customer service, affordable pricing for a restaurant. Membership is free and can be signed up through the qr code on the table. The points are quite generous which can be used in the future to deduct the total bill. There's also a student meal lunch where even after including top up of soup and drink, the price can be compared to food court western food if you account drink and a soup in that latter case. Here, theres even waiters serving you food and better food quality.

Nice food, pasta, olive rice taste good. Very good pricing for the portion and you may top up for a meal with soup and drink.

Especially love the seafood pasta and mixed grill dishes.

The staff are friendly. And there‚Äôs free membership program.

Putien@JP is a delightful spot we tried on a Sunday with my family (2 adults and 1 young kid). My son loved the lor mee, calling it ‚Äúyummy,‚Äù while my husband enjoyed the fish, though I wasn‚Äôt a fan of fish with bones in soup. However, the ‚Ä¶

It‚Äôs been a long time since I ate at Putien and I was craving for some specific dishes. Stir fried yam was still as good, one of their yummiest dishes. I liked the 100s yellow croaker too, just be careful of fine bones.  However, dishes like white cabbage with beancurd (soup-based) and noodles (soup-based) were far from good, pales in comparison to my previous experience. I noticed there was some element of inaccurate marketing as well (the little pop-up for membership sign up included a free fruit sampling of some sort) but I checked with the staff and that‚Äôs non-existent. They have indeed waived off service charge but GST is still included, so the label that says ‚ÄúNo service charge. No GST.‚Äù could be confusing. Good service though.

Putien@JP is a delightful spot we tried on a Sunday with my family (2 adults and 1 young kid). My son loved the lor mee, calling it ‚Äúyummy,‚Äù while my husband enjoyed the fish, though I wasn‚Äôt a fan of fish with bones in soup. However, the soup had a delicious peppery flavor with a slight heat. My favorite dish was the crispy fried chicken‚Äîa nostalgic favorite from my pregnancy days. The sweet and sour pork was juicy and flavorful, another highlight of the meal.

The service was excellent, with staff frequently checking on our orders and keeping the table clean. The warm lights above each table beautifully illuminated the dishes, making them look even more appetizing. The restaurant‚Äôs decor, especially the fresh flowers on each table, added a lovely touch.

This newly renovated branch at Jurong Point even has a private room for families who prefer a more intimate dining experience for celebrations or gatherings. We spent $101 on the meal, and it was well worth it. My family and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience, and we‚Äôll definitely be back to try more dishes. Overall, an excellent dining experience!

2 üåü - Below Average: Needs improvement in multiple areas, not meeting expectations.
3 üåü - Standard, Average: Meets basic expectations, nothing exceptional but acceptable.
4 üåü - Standard, Above Average: Exceeds expectations slightly, better than the norm.
5 üåü - Special & Unique: Outstanding experience, highly memorable and exceptional.

The food at Putien is generally good, and usually never fails to comfort and delight.
I felt that the service here was not as genuine and friendly as the other branches that I have visited. The staff were efficient, just lacking the warmth that takes the dining experience to the next level.
The fried Bee Hoon was surprisingly flavourful, and the Ca Fen (braised Mee Sua) was delicious. The luffa was nice, especially the scallops. We weren't especially hungry, so we didn't order much. The staff who took our order was nice enough to suggest an extra dish but didn't push when we declined.
This is overall, still a good place to go for nice food.
more like kids meal, food ordered are like one size smaller‚Ä¶while inflation still around you can‚Äôt increase the price yet also discount on the portion‚Ä¶. ‚Ä¶

more like kids meal, food ordered are like one size smaller‚Ä¶while inflation still around you can‚Äôt increase the price yet also discount on the portion‚Ä¶.

service is so so‚Ä¶

JP basement restaurant continue to have flies flying around which is annoying‚Ä¶.

They charged us 8 to 9 pieces of broccoli with tiny scallop for 12.90 before gst and service charge.

I'm not exaggerating.

Look at the pics and tell me it's the same thing in the menu. The broccoli is served on a small one person plate and as you can see it's not even filling up most of the plate.

Service was prompt but the place was a bit warmer and stuffier than outside the restaurant.

Ordered via Grab and we got the Premium Abalone Duo set for $25.90 as there was a discount.

Porridge with Abalone & Meat & Abalone Longevity Noodle was decent though I would struggle to eat these again at the original price point.
The food is nice and service staff are polite and friendly! We also got a free small dessert :)

Tried their rojak. Sauce was fine, it was more on the sweet side, but a bit spicy and sour. However, it didn‚Äôt suit my personal preference. Too fulfilling. I didn‚Äôt even order too much. Maybe it‚Äôll be great for sharing. Reasonable price tho. It‚Äôs 3.5$ for 1 egg, 1 fried tofu, 1 sausage, and 1 fried batter (idk what was that called sorry)

Food is not too bad. Though they do not take phone call reservations seriously, won't even ask for your name, or keep a record. I called in on 12 June to book a table for 14 June (Sat), told them specifically that we would like to be seated indoors and repeated myself to ensure that they heard me. My mum called on that day itself to change the timing to half an hour later than our original booking, same thing, they did not bother to ask for names, or anything at all to verify the person on the other end of the line. We did not think much of it at this point, however, when we reached, we were told to sit outdoors. They took a long time to verify our booking, and they looked confused. I had to show them my phone call log, with the date of calling etc. This is the first time I've seen an eatery handling reservations this way.
Not forgetting, the food is overpriced as well, for this price I could order more food elsewhere. It was great the first time, hence we went back for a second time for Father's Day celebration. It was disappointing for most of the dishes.
It is not easy to get the staff member's attention, as they avoid looking at you when you have your arm raised. One younger looking lady even avoided us when we had our arms raised, not sure if she deliberately did that or not. The service is bad as well, they will go over your head to serve the food, leaning in so close you will get into contact with them if you move back a little. They serve food at their own convenience, they will simply squeeze themselves right between you and the person sitting beside you, instead of approaching from an empty space where no one is seated. I was shocked to find lizard droppings on the side of the lazy susan, where it could have rubbed off food that stuck out from the bowl a little if the lazy susan was turned.

Tried ÂçóËÆ∞ for the first time today and was genuinely surprised. The weather was super hot, so we decided to give this place a try since it‚Äôs air-conditioned and that already made it a comfortable dining experience!

At first, we weren‚Äôt expecting much because it wasn‚Äôt crowded during lunch, but the food turned out to be really good. We had the steamed chicken rice (roasted was already sold out must be popular!), and it was tender, tasty, and the rice was fragrant without being oily. Each of us also got a bowl of soup, which was comforting and full of flavour.

One of the highlights was their chilli, it packed a good punch! Plus, they provided free flow ginger and dark soy sauce in bottles on the table, which is great for those who love their condiments.

We also ordered a few side dishes to try and everything was satisfying. The place is clean, the staff are friendly, and they even have a private room for booking with a minimum spending of $200. perfect for small group meals or family gatherings.

Overall, definitely a hidden gem near Sheng Siong in Taman Jurong. We‚Äôll be back, next time, hopefully early enough to try the roasted chicken!

Am not sure why we didn‚Äôt know about this place earlier. I love a good plate of chicken rice, and Nam Kee certainly ranks up there for offering precisely that.

We came here for dinner after a run around Jurong Lake Gardens, since you can park at the open air carpark at Super Bowl.

The restaurant is air-conditioned and really comfortable, and the staff are very friendly and helpful.

We ordered half a poached chicken, sweet and sour pork, the home made prawn rolls and the chicken rice.

Everything was delicious. The poached chicken was tender and juicy, and tasty even without any sauce. In any case, the free flow dark soy sauce and chilli were still there to elevate the flavour. The rice was also really flavourful and was perfect to pair with the chicken. As with other traditional chicken rice restaurants, your chicken rice comes with free refillable chicken soup, which was such a comfort for the evening.

They also do tze char dishes in case you want more variety. The sweet and sour pork and prawns rolls were both good as well.

The food also came pretty fast.

All in all, it was a great experience and we‚Äôll definitely be back the next time we have a chicken  rice craving.

Came here to takeaway their chicken rice since I have not tried, yet I almost left because of the service. I told the waiter I wanted to takeaway 5 chicken rice yet he kept pushing other dishes to me. Understand that they are a tze char store but I just wish to have a simple chicken rice. After all they are called Nam Kee Chicken Rice Restaurant? Eventually after repeating 3 times asking about the pricing, the waiter said to me, "chicken rice is normal price loh, $5 la." And walked off. Lol?? I've never had such experience purchasing a simple rice, so definitely a brand to remember. üòÖ
Worth a try!!! Service was good also :) the rice and tofu were good! The free soup given was great too! Will come back again!
This is a short section of the mall that has a variety of Japanese food. It's very lively and basically has everything to satisfy ones need for Japanese food.

Did not enjoy it - upsized portion was still relatively small, taste was just mainly salt and soya sauce from their udon sauce. Comparing it to the ichiban dry udon that I had, ichiban is wayyyy better. Udon was not Q, just flat. Probably some cheap variant.

Also be prepared to wait 20 mins in an afternoon with nobody because the ‚Äúchefs‚Äù (management trainee) have no idea how to make the food. I saw them flipping through a printed piece of paper which showed the steps on how to make the food. Imagine that. Subsequently lots of staff were called to the kitchen to help after customers piled up. Imagine a group of newbies making your food. That‚Äôs how it‚Äôll end up tasting.

Tried the fried Rice before. While it looks nice, it‚Äôs tasteless and flat. Very little meat also. Definitely not worth the price paid.

Manager Kim saw the crowd piling up and customers looking increasingly frustrated, chose to turn her head and walk away. Deliberately avoided eye contact with people.

Went to Jack's place at Jurong Safra branch for dinner using the Great Eastern voucher.

Upon reaching the store, it was slightly crowded and the staff put us on the waiting list and took down our contact number.

However we waited for almost 45 mins and they didn't called, went to check and saw the remark no response. We were dumbfounded as there is no call received. Didn't want to argue with the staff as we understand it's peak period for them.

Managed to get a seat after, the staff that took our order are friendly and efficient.

Food came pretty fast as well.

Overall it's a good place to dine.

Went there for lunch today with a voucher given by Great Eastern. Not sure is it because im eating a meal for free and got the worst possible food and service. At the door while waiting to be seated a male staff with name starting with H came and didnt say a word and just looked at me, after i got seated at a table i took out the voucher to let him know im ordering with the voucher, he appears annoyed and turned his back on me without saying a word to get the menu for the available selection for this voucher. I ordered the striploin steak a medium rare and ordered a coffee along with it. An ice lemon tea came instead and the steak was pretty much well done. When the steak arrived i waited awhile for the condiments for the jacket potato, of course it didnt come until i asked for it. When i called for the wait staff he once again didnt say a word, stood at a considerable distance and cant be bothered to approach to listen what i want to say. For some reason he was alot more polite to the lady seated in front of me. Frankly Ive had better service and food at hawker western food stalls.

Excellent yakitori, the food is straightforward such as pork belly, chicken, chicken cheese balls on sticks but unlike most stalls selling such food it is dipped in sticky BBQ sauce. Good value, basically the same as Old Chang Kee but I find Wadori is better. Does value meals or you can just order whatever you like.

Food didn't taste as it used to be...
The service was really bad, the waiter keep on moving up and down when we make orders. Never want to wait till we choose and order.No customer service orientated.
We asked any fish curry which is spicy, they recommended a dish called garlic fish curry which was not even spicy and had blend taste. It was more like hor fun sauce rather than calling it curry.

I used to dine here long time back. The food and service was good but it's not the same anymore. Disappointed.

I had been to this branch the other day and experienced the worst customer service possible. I love their food. I have reviewed their food under their east point mall branch. It's our go to for comfort food. Delivery service has been amazing, the gentleman who delivers to ours has always been the same and very friendly. My assumption was the service was their priority regardless of dine-in or delivery. But no! This restaurant thinks differently. The gentleman managing the store and his staff assume ppl are going there to eat free food. Way too much attitude. It's like, you want to eat, you eat, else pls leave. It was the worst attitude we have ever faced here, all the more disappointed because, we went out of our way to go there to have a good time. But the attitude that was thrown at us, just ruined the whole experience. I would definitely not recommend this place ever. For such poor customer service. If neither the staff nor the gentleman manning the store understand how to treat the customer. This ain't the place for one to go, even if the food is amazing. Your chef might be great but sir, thanks but no thanks.

Not stepping in ever.
We celebrated my dads birthday at the Joo Koon branch and the manager gave us a a discount just for us. Really great service and delicious food. Big thanks to the manager there!

The pepper chicken gravy is way too salty like free salt..  NAN is disappointing too... There is no tandoor taste..service is ok..  If not only 1 star.  Panne Masala is abit too sweet..

3-4hr after.. Having bad LS..  I guess must be the pepper chicken gravy.. Only food that is not fresh is seasoned with alot of salt..!!  Stomach keep having rolling sound feel bloated n funny.. n LS bit by bit...!

Brio ‚Äì A Gem That Keeps Calling Us Back

Every time we find ourselves in Jurong Point, there's only one place on our ‚Ä¶

Lunch set comes with either free soup of day or choice of drink.  Chicken and salmon were nicely done seasoned well and not being too dry. Salmon Thai Basil Cream Linguine also tasted delicious with its spicy sour sauce. Salmon was also tender without overly cooked.   Service from staff prompt and great.

Brio ‚Äì A Gem That Keeps Calling Us Back

Every time we find ourselves in Jurong Point, there's only one place on our minds ‚Äî Brio. This isn't just a restaurant; it's our go-to comfort spot, our "must-stop" destination. With every visit, Brio reminds us why it's always worth coming back ‚Äî and we do, wholeheartedly.

The food? Always satisfying. The flavours are bold yet balanced, and the presentation is just the cherry on top. Whether it's a quick bite or a full-on feast, Brio delivers every single time. Their menu strikes the perfect chord between variety and quality ‚Äî a rare combination that makes each meal memorable.

But what truly sets Brio apart is the consistent warmth ‚Äî both in the service and the atmosphere. It's the kind of place that feels like home, but better. You walk in and you're greeted not just with a smile, but with a sense of familiarity and care that‚Äôs hard to find.

Brio is always a gem ‚Äî shining brightly in the heart of Jurong Point. If you're ever in the area, do yourself a favour: go to Brio. And if you're like us, you'll find yourself always coming back.

It varies to be honest.
On average the food is awesome! In the past, the portion size has not justified the prize. I am specifically talking about the salads.
The lunch set is really great though! The taste is always good.
Anyway, it has kinda changed. The last salads had been awesome and probably the best I had here in Singapore!
The staff is kind and helpful!

The customer service here is really good. The person that served me was called Dhilesh and he was very friendly and engaging with us and I would definitely recommend others to check this outlet out as well!

Today went for dinner as I have coupons to claim to this outlet. When I approached to the staff over the counter (Malay) guys said this voucher not for this outlet . Than he called another staff (Malay lady) she said her manager not around ‚Ä¶

Today went for dinner as I have coupons to claim to this outlet. When I approached to the staff over the counter (Malay) guys said this voucher not for this outlet . Than he called another staff (Malay lady) she said her manager not around so couldn‚Äôt redeem the voucher. I felt so embarrassed , on this era if manager not around couldn‚Äôt claim voucher than I couldn‚Äôt understand why this not mentioned on the terms and conditions. She don‚Äôt even apologised for this matter hopefully  some action taken for future.

Went to order nasi lemak and nasi rawan. I politely asked to add a chicken wing to my nasi rawan, and the auntie told me I had to wait. I said okay, no problem, and then let her know I wanted a chicken wing for my nasi lemak as well. Her response? ‚ÄúOrg dah bilang ayam kena tunggu, lagi cakap ayam!‚Äù (Translation: ‚ÄúAlready told you the chicken needs to wait, still talking about chicken!‚Äù) in an annoyed tone.

I was genuinely shocked at how unnecessarily rude she was. Treated like I was asking for free food.

If you‚Äôre unhappy serving customers, maybe it‚Äôs time to reconsider your job. Attitude makes or breaks the dining experience, and unfortunately, this one was ruined before the food even arrived.

The BOGO (buy one get one) free deal which is applicable to take- away is definitely worth it!  The wagyu may not be the best as they don't entertain the doneness of the meat (meat is well done) and the foie gras is probably from duck (and ‚Ä¶

The BOGO (buy one get one) free deal which is applicable to take- away is definitely worth it!  The wagyu may not be the best as they don't entertain the doneness of the meat (meat is well done) and the foie gras is probably from duck (and not goose) , it is huge, but the price is certainly right! The sashimi is definitely top grade and really fresh! The kurobuta pork is delicious and there is 1 abalone in it !

5/12/2021 - returned for their Omakase Teishoku. Teishoku means the meal is served all at one go. It was good and included sake which we could take home instead of drinking there, but they gave us only 1 bottle although there were 3 of us.

‚≠êÔ∏è
16 Aug 2025: The SG60 Omakase set menu is really super value for money. The quality in all the dishes are fantastic. Chef‚Äôs signature no. 1 roll is also bursting with flavour. Simply delicious.

6 Aug 2023: There‚Äôs a cheaper $60+ Omakase set for lunch and it‚Äôs very value for money! Ingredients used are very fresh and of great quality. Oyster is plump and juicy; otoro melts in your mouth, so does the A4 wagyu; scallop is Q-ey and good; Uni is buttery and creamy and sweet; yuzu ice cream is refreshing and satisfying!

Dec 2021: The $89 Omakase set might seem a little on the expensive side but it also comes with a bottle of sake. The chef‚Äôs selection is not bad and mostly fresh! Uni is not as sweet as expected but the salmon is fantastic as the cut has a good mix of fats in it making the sashimi melt-in-your-mouth üëçüèø
The oyster and scallops are also plump and sumptuous.

Small place within Tunglok Seafood restaurant. Best to do booking.
Yummy food.

Douraku Kaiseidon Set($38++)
Uni, Hokkaido Scallop, Botan Ebi, Maguro, Salmon and Ikura over a bed of sushi rice on that day. Sashimi were fresh and thick cut.
Served with chawanmushi, miso soup, refreshing salad of the day & dessert of the day.

Legendary Wagyu Don Set($36++)
Not legendary at all. The aburi wagyu tataki beef taste was great with chef's special teriyaki sauce but texture was well-done. What an instant disappointment. Foie Gras was sinful and fatty. Served with koshihikari rice, deep-fried garlic chips, sous vide egg, nori, pickles and radish.
Set comes with salmon sashimi, miso soup, salad of the day & dessert of the day.

Eihire($15)
Dried stingray. Texture was chewy with a taste of savoury and oceanic sweet note.

Very hard to recommend to anyone. Came here because of the past reviews. Perhaps the standard has dropped over time. For the price range, 2 stars is being generous. The sushi rice was cold, which is basically akin to supermarket sushi. The douraku sushi platter which was supposed to be the chef's choice of sushi essentially contained California roll with different slices of sea food placed on top. The bara chirashi don was acceptable if you can forgive the cold sushi rice. My recommendation is for Tung Lok to stick to what they do best. No need to keep this Japanese station.

I had submitted a feedback that after I ate a bowl of this premium rice waygu bowl yesterday, I had diarrhea, suspected the foie gras not fresh etc.. No one call back to check at all.. Terrible.. Will not visit any of their restaurants anymore.

Japanese sake
Hydrangea and tomato salad
Sashimi platter: Botan shrimp, scallops, salmon, bluefin tuna
Volume 1
Foie gras and truffle chawanmushi
Caviar and sea urchin fried rice hand roll
Premium salmon fillet
Tempura udon

Product of Tongle, quality guaranteed

business_name: Trattoria da Mimmo Restaurant and Pizzeria
text: Had a great meal here, from starters of calamari, a tasty seafood soup and burata cheese, to a medley of freshly basked pizzas to hearty al dente pasta, everything we ordered was delicious and authentic. Had to call ahead to reserve for our party of 7 but had an enjoyable evening. Thanks to the helpful service and kitchen staff!

business_name: Trattoria da Mimmo Restaurant and Pizzeria
text:
Can you come here for absolutely delicious calamari, spaghetti carbonara, and four cheese pizza?  Of course you can, and you will enjoy perfectly made, hearty country style cooking served in family sized portions. The chef makes every ingredient shine.  The beef tripe is fresh and beefy, the pork is hearty and sweet, and the tomato paste is perfectly balanced.  The pizza also has probably the softest, fluffiest base we've had.

The thrill is to ask about the specials of the day, and this is where the chef's style absolutely shines through.  Every special we've tried had been absolutely delicious concoctions that we've not had in other Italian restaurants, made with seasonally available ingredients.

Service here is friendly and impeccable.

Sadly, the restaurant seems sadly underrated, as lunch service seems under utilized each time we've come.  On the bright side that means you'll be likely to get a table.  I do recommend calling ahead though.

amazing jeyuk (spicy pork), generous portion and really worth the price along with the free side dishes given. also comes with rice and seaweed soup :) highly recommend unlike the other reviews‚Ä¶ maybe they ordered the wrong stuff or wrong day but personally, I genuinely enjoyed the meal. also highly recommend their kimchi jjigae, really gao and loaded with ingredients! (meat, flat rice cake, glass noodle, well fermented kimchi, tofu etc.)

Good choice for dim sum as its name suggests! Pleased with the operational hours and we decided to drop by late one night when we had cravings. Good variety of dim sums and all were tasty. The place was also relatively crowded at 11ish on a Friday night. Will be back when the craving calls!

Came here specifically for their take on the Geylang Lor 9 beef hor fun üòÑ it didn't disappoint. Had their other dishes and sliced fish hor fun and dim sum dishes to try too. Service was warm and food came out super quick. Surprise find not far from our area so was happy to have discovered them. Recommend a visit. ‚Ä¶

Came here specifically for their take on the Geylang Lor 9 beef hor fun üòÑ it didn't disappoint. Had their other dishes and sliced fish hor fun and dim sum dishes to try too. Service was warm and food came out super quick. Surprise find not far from our area so was happy to have discovered them. Recommend a visit.
Used to patronize this stall once in a while. But I think their standard drop pretty drastically. My normal favorites are now disgusting. ‚Ä¶

Used to patronize this stall once in a while. But I think their standard drop pretty drastically. My normal favorites are now disgusting.

Ming xia jiao‚Äôs fillings is extremely salty.
Salted egg ribs, salted egg is powdery, ribs is those low ended kind and it‚Äôs with bones.

Best dish; chee chong fun. Taste normal. But at least it‚Äôs not too hard to finish.

Will not come back again. ü•≤

No service charge but got gst.

business_name: Five Star Kampung Chicken Rice & Kitchen
text:
3 stars are my average reviews.
See the receipt I took, actually it is consider ok. O man! My hubby love the TongPo meat (3 layer pork) because the dark sauce is so so special and taste unique, better than Â∫óÂ∞è‰∫å! Impressive!
The fried fish is ok, broccoli scallops is ok but the fish soup.... too small. I am petite and look at the photo that I show my palm, too small. But the fish is fresh, average taste for soup.

No smiley service, I don‚Äôt mind as long as they are not rude. Hope the staff service can improve.

We will surely return for the sake of TongPo meat, too delicious!
Make your booking with eatigo is good. With max 50% discount (based on timing), pricing of the items are more reasonable. ‚Ä¶
They have glutton free pizza and some sides. The pizza wasn't bad but I think the highlight was the desserts (although that's not glutton free)

Make your booking with eatigo is good. With max 50% discount (based on timing), pricing of the items are more reasonable.

Pizza is not bad. The crust is thin crispy type. Not too filling if 2pax share 1 pizza. They allow half-half at $36++ so opt for more ex pizza flavours more worth. They have ALOT of flavours for pizza to choose from.

The aglio olio pasta taste ok only. Add prawns (5pcs) $6++. Prawns are not fresh type, more of frozen type.

Important: water is chargeable. Tap water $2++ and warm/hot water $1++.

Overall, its a cosy little restaurant located near holland village mrt. Convenient with a bus stop nearby too.

I‚Äôve been a loyal customer of Madrinaa Italian Restaurant for the last 7 years, and it continues to impress me with its consistent quality and warm atmosphere. The staff is always friendly and attentive, making every visit a pleasant experience. The food is exceptional, with a special shoutout to their gluten-free pizza ‚Äì it‚Äôs hands down the best GF pizza in town!

I also appreciate their dog-friendly outdoor tables, which make dining with my furry kid a breeze. The restaurant strikes a perfect balance in pricing, being neither too cheap nor too expensive, making it a great option for both casual and special occasions. Plus, it‚Äôs family-friendly, which is a big bonus when dining out with kids. Highly recommend Madrinaa for anyone looking for a delightful Italian meal!

An Authentic Italian Gem in Holland Village ‚Äì A Must-Visit!

If you‚Äôre looking for authentic Italian cuisine in Singapore, Madrinaa Italiano in Holland Village is a hidden gem that delivers an unforgettable dining experience. From the moment you step inside, you‚Äôre greeted with warm hospitality and a cozy, rustic ambiance that transports you straight to Italy.

Food ‚Äì 10/10

The menu offers a fantastic selection of classic Italian dishes, each crafted with high-quality ingredients and rich, traditional flavors. We started with their Burrata with Parma Ham, which was fresh, creamy, and paired perfectly with the delicate saltiness of the ham. The Seafood Risotto was a standout ‚Äì rich, creamy, and packed with fresh prawns, scallops, and mussels. The homemade pasta dishes, especially the Truffle Carbonara and Lobster Ravioli, were absolute perfection.

And let‚Äôs talk about their wood-fired pizzas ‚Äì thin, crispy, and loaded with flavor. The Diavola Pizza had the perfect kick of spice, and the Quattro Formaggi was indulgently cheesy without being overpowering.

For dessert, the Tiramisu was heavenly ‚Äì light, creamy, and just the right balance of coffee and mascarpone. We also loved the Panna Cotta, which was smooth, velvety, and paired with a delightful berry compote.

Service ‚Äì 10/10

The service was impeccable. The staff were friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu, happily recommending dishes and wine pairings. They truly made us feel welcome, checking in just the right amount without being intrusive.

Ambiance ‚Äì 9/10

The restaurant has a charming, intimate vibe, perfect for a romantic dinner, a cozy family gathering, or even a casual get-together with friends. Soft lighting, tasteful decor, and Italian music in the background make for an inviting atmosphere.

Value for Money ‚Äì 9/10

For the quality of food and service, Madrinaa Italiano is well worth the price. Portions are generous, and every dish is made with care and authenticity.

Final Verdict

If you love authentic, high-quality Italian food, Madrinaa Italiano is a must-visit in Singapore. Whether you‚Äôre craving pasta, pizza, seafood, or fine Italian wines, this place never disappoints. A true 5-star experience!

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Highly recommended!
Nice atmosphere but gluten free pizza, not very good. The dough is salty, it's thin crust like just tortilla. ‚Ä¶

I feel so grateful to have found such a lovely place to enjoy gluten free food! Madrinaa Italiano has a very extensive menu with so many great options - it was hard to choose! Settled on a pizza, pasta and the Warm Spinach Salad, which both my son and I thoroughly enjoyed. To top it off all servers were extremely attentive and kind, Anne is particular made our visit extra special, thank you so much!

Nice atmosphere but gluten free pizza, not very good. The dough is salty, it's thin crust like just tortilla.

There are other ways to make gluten free pizza dough with rice flour for example.
So I felt like it's kinda a minimum effort the restaurant put.

The atmosphere was nice here. Good breeze and friendly service.

Taste, cannot recommend.

And they boast gluten-free options but not my thing.

It is the good place for gluten intolerance. My daughter enjoyed so much for her first time fresh pizza. There are many choices and difficult to choose and yes! It‚Äôs all can be gluten free. Pasta also great. Staff so nice, helpful and verry attentive.

Came here on a saturday night with a group of friends for dinner and the restaurant didn't seem too busy. There is a wide variety of food from the Italian cuisine to choose from and pizzas are named after different places in Italy. We started off with truffle fries although could not taste any truffle and they just tasted like plain fries. Garlic bread was good. We ordered three pizzas, one that was gluten free since one of our friends there were gluten free. I had half of the gluten free one although thin crust pizzas are not really my thing and I did not really like the taste. The service was alright although staff did not seem like they knew what they were doing. Overall it was an alright experience but maybe its just because I have never tasted a gluten free pizza before and I am used to the usual pizza taste but my friends really enjoyed their pizzas!

On July 24th, I received a call from Barrio, Liqi; the operation manager from the group, to apologize for the previous issues I raised. I appreciate the call and the opportunity to express my concerns. It‚Äôs clear that Barrio is committed to ‚Ä¶

Located at the tail end of a one way road. The restaurant signage could be easily missed as the Barrio word is on top of the awning. The lower ends of the awning reflected some other words which I mistook for another restaurant instead. Parking could be a challenge during peak hours on weekends, free parking though.

Food was generally good. I enjoyed the cauliflower and the prawn dish. But the price is considerably higher than average. Service was ok but nothing spectacular.

On July 24th, I received a call from Barrio, Liqi; the operation manager from the group, to apologize for the previous issues I raised. I appreciate the call and the opportunity to express my concerns. It‚Äôs clear that Barrio is committed to maintaining high standards in the food industry. As a result, I will adjust my star review. Thank you!

20th July
To the owner of the restaurant,

Thank you for the delicious food and the freshly prepared dishes from the kitchen. We ordered several items, and I particularly enjoyed the roast cauliflower, paella, and sandwich. However, I wish the grilled prawns had been cooked a bit more, as they were somewhat undercooked.

Unfortunately, my family and I had a disappointing or experience with your server, Daniel. I even took a picture of him. I believe he would need additional training; he seemed unwelcoming and appeared curt when we request for additional things or when we ask questions. When we arrive 1140am, he was busy with his face gluing to the iPad and side facing us and make us wait at the door. When we said Hi, he gives us an extremely lukewarm and unwelcoming face and I already felt very taken back ..

Additionally, he was not prompt or attentive. While I like the food, I will not return due to the subpar service we received. The restaurant was warm in the afternoon, and your server appeared more focused on standing at the door rather than checking in with the tables to see if assistance was needed. We even had to stand up and take our finished plates to the counter, as well as fetch our own forks and hot sauce.

I rarely write reviews like this, but I felt compelled to do so, especially since it was my husband's birthday , clearly written in my Chope message and we left feeling dissatisfied, particularly with the service.

Your price is not cheap too.. Thus, please spend some effort and to train your waiter.

A nice little place that serves great food. Wait staff are attentive and communicative. But family with kids really up the noise and stress level in an otherwise quiet and relax place.  May be it will be better during weekdays. Went there in a Sunday, plenty of free surface parking.

Had a wonderful dinner. Had squid ink paella, garlic prawns, lamb, and ended with a dessert of grilled pineapple. Good ambience, great service of warm water too. Had a good bottle of wine, good selection of wine at reasonable price range. Many thanks for warning not to over order for food, some hot tapas portion is indeed quite big.

The surrounding area has free parking, just need lots of luck to find one, requires patience.

Budget $70-80 per pax without alcohol. It's on the high side, but worthwhile. Reservation is recommended, although notice on Sunday evening there's available tables for walk in as well.

This food court, located within one of the country clubs in Singapore, is a hidden gem serving some of the most delicious local fare. Signature dishes like Singapore laksa, Hokkien mee, and prawn noodles are highly recommended for their rich flavors and authentic taste. The prices are very reasonable, the portions are generous, and the service is impressively fast‚Äîmaking it a perfect spot for a satisfying and fuss-free meal.

Fantastic restaurant in the midst of a forest, good golf view, good price for food, delicious food & exceptional good table service. Very impressed with Si Hwee, a part-timer, who knows her work & made our day memorable for her good recommendation! Highly recommended plc To go for bar drinks & Family outings!
Restaurant has goner downhill since last visit, they dont take phone calls for bookings so not advisable To book for events!
The restaurant staff r rude mainly from China or elsewhere,mainly rude with bad attitude & can embarass u if ur not a member!
Love the ambiance but get humiliated every time I go there with guests, best go alone!!

One of the best places to enjoy eating out. Breakfast, lunch dinner options available. Very extensive food menu. Vegetarian options available. Staff is very humble. Inside and out side seating available. Paid Parking is available. Members get discount, public can eat at nominal price.

Nice spot to relax after your round. Location wise, overlooks with first tee and next to the upstairs putting green. The staff provide table service which is fast and friendly. Good selection of food and drinks, with very reasonable prices. They also have regular offers, listed on their website.
order the duck confit and St Louis BBQ pork ribs and both tasted great! Pleasantly surprised by the general kids meal portion, free on weekends! Will come again!

Kids dine free on sat/sun/PH, my 2 years old son loved their pasta. We ordered rack of pork, 50 degrees king salmon. Portions were generous and delicious. Highly recommend the rack of pork, meat was very tender and flavourful. Will be back here again!

Went with family of 7 on 4 may 2025. Teriyaki chicken burger was simply succulent. Sirloin medium rare was just nice and fresh. Kids‚Äô free meals like pepperoni pizza and prawn spaghetti were satisfactory. Family enjoyed the dinner & Will patronise again.

Came here many times. Food is always up to standard. The variety is great too. I always have a mojito and it hits the spot. Occasionally I get the truffle mushroom soup. The soup and bread itself has changed and unfortunately the previous garlic bread is better üòü Mains - Pork and fish, all cooked very well. The pizza category is most value for money imo. Chope has discount vouchers if you can make it during weekdays.
We visited lazy lizard with my husband and 3 kids, food came out very fast and tasted sooo nice! Free kids meals bargain! Staff very good.

Had the classic ribeye steak and aglio olio w clams and both dishes were great! Not to mention kids dine for free for every main course order for adults. Oysters deal was good and very fresh.
Will return again !

Neighbourhood gem that‚Äôs worth supporting! Food and service were way above expectations.

We chanced upon the cafe with google map‚Äôs recommendations and were attracted by the Kids Eat Free promotion on weekends / PHs. For less than a hundred dollars, we enjoyed the squid ink risotto ($20.80), classic ribeye ($32.80), pint of beer, tiramisu and ice cream, with a kids shrimp pasta and fish and chips!

The squid ink risotto was 10/10 in terms of taste and value. While the ribeye could be a little thicker for a better bite, the sear was done right and served medium rare like we asked. Tomato sauce on the shrimp pasta was on point.

While the setup seemed to suggest a beer garden vibes, most diners seemed to be families or older couples out for a simple meal. We very much enjoyed the place and will certainly be back to try their rack of pork and other mains.

Edit: came back a few times since, and standards have held firm üí™üèª
Food is good and kids dine for free on weekend! Can get quite crowded on weekend.. Definitely will come back again! :)

The food was delicious, especially the Beef Bolognese pasta which my daughter loved.

We love the fact that kids can dine free on weekends and public holidays.

The Lazy Lizard Big Breakfast is also awesome!

The outdoor waiting area has a desert-inspired aesthetic, featuring a large illuminated moon backdrop, cacti, and tropical plants. Canvas camping chairs add an adventurous, bohemian feel.
‚Ä¢
Inside, the bistro has a modern tropical vibe with woven rattan chairs, white marble tabletops, and warm wooden flooring, creating a laid-back and inviting atmosphere.
‚Ä¢
When the food arrived, the first thing we noticed was the massive portions!
‚Ä¢
We started with a shrimp salad, a refreshing appetizer that added bits of seafood and more greens to balance out the meal.
‚Ä¢
For mains, we had the shiok burger, grilled free-range chicken, Cajun lamb chop, and pasta aglio olio (turkey bacon & chicken ham).
‚Ä¢
My favorite was the shiok burger‚Äîthe crispy crust on the chicken thigh patty, paired with chili crab sauce, made it extremely addictive.
‚Ä¢
The proteins, like chicken thigh and lamb chop, came with a generous serving of assorted greens, making the meal well-balanced.
‚Ä¢
The molten chocolate lava cake and signature waffle with ice cream were classic and satisfying, the perfect sweet ending to our feast.
‚Ä¢
To accompany our meal, we had iced teas in passionfruit mango earl grey, lychee & orange earl grey, and raspberry mint earl grey flavors.
‚Ä¢
Each came beautifully garnished, and the staff informed us that they would be slightly sweet, so we paced ourselves with sips throughout the meal.

Visited Good Bites for my wife‚Äôs birthday and had a wonderful experience. The menu is mainly Western, and the food was delicious. The place itself is very Instagrammable, with a cosy and stylish vibe. What stood out most was the excellent service ‚Äî they surprised my wife with a special lava cake and even treated my child to a free scoop of ice cream. Overall, a delightful experience that made our celebration extra special.

Loved the Waffle with Fried Chicken!!! Waffle was simply amazing, and Chicken was satisfying too. Signed up as a member and redeemed a free ice cream. Lovely service by the staff. Will definitely be coming back again.

Had supper here and it was a great experience.  The food came really promptly after we ordered maybe about 10 minutes? The fried chicken and waffles were amazing, carbonara was good as well, though the mash with the free range chicken could ‚Ä¶

walked in without reservation and managed to get counter seats for 2! quite pricy but worth it for authentic italian cuisine and the novelty and fun of sitting at the counter watching the chefs in action!!! so tasty and filling. service was great too, we had our free water refilled 3x without any prompting!

total was about $87 for 2 ppl (prices seem to have increased as they are higher than the prices on their website's menu)
- lasagna $19
- mushrooms ~$12-14
- raviolacci $24
- lava cake w espresso ice cream $16

Came back after a long time and the Stuffed Roman Schiacciatas (Truffle) was still very good! I do recall there used to be a lot more truffle, but the flat pizza is still crispy and delicious. We also ordered the raviolacci with beef filling with marsala sauce, which was tasty, but a smaller portion than expected. Overall would say that the food here is decent, but pricey.

We didn‚Äôt order a lot, but I can see people spending more than $100/pax if they ordered more.

Super not impressed by their seafood platter.. Squids were overcooked, scallops weren't that fresh and prawns were passable. For that price, the fishes were 2 sad looking miserable pieces of tail-end scraps..  I had to speak up in order for ‚Ä¶

Prepare to queue. If you have knees problem like me, it‚Äôs better to ask your friend to help to queue.

The reno was pretty nice and good lightings for western dining. Staff are helpful if you require their help to take physical order (rather than QR code ordering) A good selection of mains and drinks (including Twinings hot tea that comes in a small pot)

You have to try their side dish- brussel sprouts- it was crunchy with a light sweet sauce that went well with it. No bitterness.

I didn‚Äôt expect the mixed grill came exactly like in menu photo- a rather large stone platform. It was good for photos lolll! But some may find it difficult to eat from it- but there is nothing you can‚Äôt resolve if you ask for a side plate.

We had 3 mains, a lychee drink and a hot tea. The bill came up to about $100 plus. Joining Collin‚Äôs as member is free- all you have to do is to download their app and get your account set up. I enrolled as a new member and got 5% off straight away and the final damaged was about $98 üëçüèª

Would be back for more. Besides the queuing, i must say I enjoy the food, ambience and service a lot.

As always the service at Collin‚Äôs Westgate is terrible, especially for the oldest uncle in the restaurant. I have asked for less sweet for my drink and this old uncle told me he was busy and said I should have told them before the order. I told him that when I called the staff non came to us. It is a common sight that the staff will pretend not to see the customers, so sad. This place is poorly managed, otherwise the staff wouldn‚Äôt have behaved like this. Food wise is okay and reasonable priced but very poor service.

Walk in on a Saturday evening at around 5pm and waiting time is less than one minute as there is no queue ahead of us.

The Grill King Prawn with US Scallop and Ravioli are nice and delicious.

Overall experience is good as nice ambience with light music.

Will return to dine in again.

If can I give 0 star. Whole shop empty, waited 1 hour, food was bad. Chef asked to recook twice, but beef just couldn‚Äôt be eaten cos so chewy. Vegetable was refried twice‚Ä¶ end up it was soggy and bad. When gave feedback, the store supervisor offered a $1 discount. Yes ONE DOLLAR. He say because it is the best they can do. Wow. The Eihire was I believe, tossed into a toaster instead of grilled. Total bill was $156 for 2 person. But end up the store supervisor waived the beef which was $28++ because we simply couldn‚Äôt and didn‚Äôt eat it.

Quite a bad experience for me. I called to make reservations for 2 pax to celebrate mother day. First they gave me a small table next to fridge and squeeze. Then I asked to move to another table just in front of the serving food from kitchen that‚Äôs not so ideal. After ordering my food, they moved me to a bigger table as they realised I ordered quite a lot of food and probably can‚Äôt fit into a small table. Right into middle of the dinner, it was so noisy as other patrons on other table is shouting and screaming. I asked to lower their loud voice, i was told it is a family restaurant and they can‚Äôt do anything about it. In a way saying to me , you want to be quite do go to better or higher end restaurants to dine. I bear with it and now come to food.

- sashimi : terrible toro that I sense the meat about to expire probably no one orders this for longest time due to ‚Äúfamily‚Äù restaurant. 5 PCs @$60. See the pictures you can tell!
- Aji sashimi : I can‚Äôt even taste the freshness or sweetness of the meat! Another disappointment!
- grilled fish of the day: not sure why they used some kinds of mentaki sauce , red in color and tasted weird. Fish is not fresh at all‚Ä¶ it should have grilled with salt only
- California maki and the asari/clam soup probably the best !
- the grilled stingray is rather too big and too hard to chew
I don‚Äôt think I would be back here for sure! Disappointing!
Amazing customer service 5‚≠êÔ∏ènice environment with air-conditioning and free karaoke üé§. Food is nice and reasonable price üëç üòã ‚Ä¶
Amazing customer service 5‚≠êÔ∏ènice environment with air-conditioning and free karaoke üé§. Food is nice and reasonable price üëç üòã

business_name: Brotzeit German Beer Bar and Restaurant - WestGate
text: Celebrating my birthday here with my family. Authentic German food and beers. Had a free barrel of beers because of my birthday month. Very friendly and patient staff. The semi outdoor atmosphere was very pleasant and relaxing.

business_name: Brotzeit German Beer Bar and Restaurant - WestGate
text:
Dropped by Brotzeit at WestGate for a casual meal and drinks, and overall, it was a decent experience.

We started with the oysters ($3 per piece, with a minimum order of six). They were relatively plump and fresh enough to enjoy. For the mains, I had the chicken schnitzel, which was alright but nothing to rave about. The potato wedges were a pleasant surprise‚Äîwell-seasoned and not soggy, just the way they should be.

Unfortunately, the rosti was a letdown. It came out cold, hard, and rather tasteless, which was disappointing considering it‚Äôs typically a comforting, crispy dish.

That said, Brotzeit still serves as a good spot to hang out and grab a drink with friends, especially if you‚Äôre not expecting mind-blowing food. It's more about the vibes and casual dining here than a standout culinary experience.

business_name: Brotzeit German Beer Bar and Restaurant - WestGate
text:
Occasionally to come to such place to enjoy someone‚Äôs birthday is good.  There is no need to travel to oversea to eat food, Singapore has many good food and we need to support local F&B.

They have very tasty sausages (is a must to try)!

Register as member to get instant promotion on the very day, this is very good.  Membership last only one year but with some dining points earn along the way your membership can be renewed.

Free birthday cake and more member perks, so ask staff for membership QR sign up member and enjoy the perks!  They have very nice quality pizza too.

I ‚ù§Ô∏è the pork knuckle, the sour mash potatoes. The sour veggies (I called it - not sure the name), very very nice!

The beer is nice too.

business_name: Brotzeit German Beer Bar and Restaurant - WestGate
text: Easy to reserve a table via their website. They have membership programme going on which is greatly attractive with the free birthday cake and free flow alcohol available. ‚Ä¶

business_name: Brotzeit German Beer Bar and Restaurant - WestGate
text:
Easy to reserve a table via their website. They have membership programme going on which is greatly attractive with the free birthday cake and free flow alcohol available.

The emperor‚Äôs pancakes are soft and freshly cooked, tastes wonderful when dipped in the sauces that came with it! Greatly recommend for children as a treat, and for adults as an after meal dessert.

I liked that they have platters available for sharing. Service was attentive and prompt, did not feel like we are neglected even though we were seated indoors. As the seating indoors are enclosed, it is easy to overhear the conversations at neighbouring tables (coupled with alcohol).

Will return again.

business_name: Sen Sen Sushi Jem by DON DON DONKI Singapore
text:
Arrived 1245pm on Saturday for lunch. No queue.

Their sets are fuss free but I prefer to order ala carte based on my preference. ‚Ä¶

business_name: Sen Sen Sushi Jem by DON DON DONKI Singapore
text:
Arrived 1245pm on Saturday for lunch. No queue.

Their sets are fuss free but I prefer to order ala carte based on my preference. Service is good. Food is fresh, including sashimi. Price is reasonable for restaurant standards. Been returning whenever I‚Äôm nearby.

business_name: Sen Sen Sushi Jem by DON DON DONKI Singapore
text:
Wow, I must say... The high close to 5 star rating given by more than 2k people are legit. At first this place didn't really catch my eye among all the Japanese places in jem since it was managed by donki. But oh man, did I miss out on a great restaurant that is even better than other better known chains.

Firstly the restaurant had the typical conveyor belt Japanese restaurant vibe. Almost similar to sushiro or Kura. But! It stands out so much better in terms of the food quality and even quantity. The sushi pieces looked fresher and thicker. I was super surprised by the size of the chirashi bowl. It had a really good amount that needed 2 people to finish. Typically if you order this bowls from sushiro those types of places, it comes in a smaller sized portion, almost like it's a side dish. Over here it is like a main dish!

The price is also super reasonable for the quality and quantity. I was super impressed and will definitely be back again very soon.

When join member there‚Äôs a buy one free one drinks cost $4.90 per pack.
And for the birthday reward mentioned is not valid in Jem branch.
It‚Äôs a coloring matter and the taste really really sweet and disgusting. ‚Ä¶

ÏïàÎÖïÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî. Catching up with my brother here for some Korean food. Food portion is huge.

Their kimchi pancake offers a delightful combination of textures and flavors. It's typically crispy on the edges and slightly chewy in the middle, with a savory, tangy, and slightly spicy taste from the kimchi. The other two dishes were good too.

When join member there‚Äôs a buy one free one drinks cost $4.90 per pack.
And for the birthday reward mentioned is not valid in Jem branch.
It‚Äôs a coloring matter and the taste really really sweet and disgusting.
I saw online mentioned this is more budgeted and food are delicious but I don‚Äôt feel really. And the portion is suit for one female portion only.
Btw, as picture attached it‚Äôs cost $34.9 in total with just a meal and an appetizer which is real appetizer and please do not aim to feel satisfied with the appetizer.

First time trying Korean Street Food, and in a restaurant setting

Place was interestingly decorated with metal bin converted chairs
Not sure folks with slighly large bum could sit for long

Plus plus point is plain water ( hot or cold ) with lemon slice... üëçüëç
Thin as it may be, adding lemon seem to upscale the plain drink... prefer this anytime to sugar-laden drinks

Ordered 2 soupy noodle dish to try, but was not particularly impressed
It is basically nstant noodle, 1 with luncheon meat, the other with beef slice
They did try to up-end the dish with self-made broth
The creamy soup broth had seafood taste that seem a tad bit off, and next day we had some gastric digestion issues

Probably just a 1 time try to understand why the large crowd at lunch or dinner time
The food was great but the service is just meh, I don't why the service crew is looking at the floor when we call for them and why does mains come before starters? ‚Ä¶

The food was great but the service is just meh, I don't why the service crew is looking at the floor when we call for them and why does mains come before starters?

Need grow mushroom first isit?
Floor got money?
Best part is the service crew do not practice FIFO(first in first out)
I saw my soup been sitting by the counter for a good 15mins before serving it to me and i got my soup cold, one of the worst outlet I've been to.
Never ever gonna patronizing this outlet ever again, restaurant environment was so negative, cleanliness was bad there were flies flying around our food.
Tried calling the staff om numerous occasions all they do is look at the floor, SUCH BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!
personal hotpot! Many soup choices. you can also get double soup pots! seafood were fresh. meat thinly sliced. free flow sauces and fruits!

First time had a personal hotpot with my bf. Had a precious dinner here as we can choose our favourite soup and ingredients. Really delicious and worth the price. Free flow of snacks, sauces, condiment and soup. No wonder so many people queue for it. Best to reserve a seat before you go.

Very large air conditioned restaurant just outside the main Jurong point building.

Love the decor and food!

Dishes are fresh and portions are good.

Free flow Sides dishes, Condiments and sauces are displayed nicely in an impressive centre counter.

Staffs are friendly and prompt.

Frequent here for the hotpot. Wide variety of yummy food and at affordable pricing. Love the laksa and bak kut teh soup, goes really well with maggi noodle and meat üçú Like it that condiments and fruits are free flow. Great ambience for family and friends gathering. ‚Ä¶

We reserved a table of 3 to celebrate our friend's birthday.  The restaurant opens for dinners at 5pm but unknowingly I arrived earlier around 4.50pm as I wanted to pass them a birthday cake to be served as a surprise for my friend.  The lady who was busy preparing food (Jessica if I got her name correctly) was very helpful to help me to keep the cake first while I went off to meet my friends.  When we returned to the restaurant, the staff was very fast to lead us to our table.

We took quite a while to decide our order but their staff made it a breeze for us explaining what are the promotions and options.  At the end, we decided to order 2 pax Set D seafood and drinks.  The portion is actually sufficient for 3 of us. The seafood, meat, veggies etc all very fresh.  Free helpings to their wide varieties of sauce, kimchi, pickles and fruits.  The water melon was super sweet.  The staff also kept helping us to refill the different soups we have ordered.

Subsequently we received a call from another friend saying she and hubby could join us for dinner too.  Jessica and her team immediately helped to shift us to another bigger table.  My friend and hubby ordered their 1 for 1 promo meal.  The portions of wagyu ribeye/beef were very generous and nicely sliced.  Their veggies and handmade yong tau fu baskets were beautifully displayed and sumptuous too.

Jessica besides asking her team to clean up the table before bringing the cake out, she personally helped to sing 3 versions of birthday songs (English/Chinese/Cantonese) with background music playing.  We are highly impressed by the standard of service by Jessica and her team.

Thank you for making our gathering such a memorable one!

Had a great experience. Opt for 2 pax set meal. They allow us to swap liver and cockles for meatballs as not a fans of them. The beef and lamb quality was excellent, and the price was reasonable for what we received. The free condiment station was well-stocked, letting us create our perfect dipping sauces. The service was friendly and attentive. Overall, it was a satisfying and enjoyable meal.

Frequent here for the hotpot. Wide variety of yummy food and at affordable pricing. Love the laksa and bak kut teh soup, goes really well with maggi noodle and meat üçú Like it that condiments and fruits are free flow. Great ambience for family and friends gathering.

Food is really fresh!

I love the idea where everyone of us get an individual hotpot.

Free sauce and fruits too

Many different broth to choose from

Cosy dine in place, two and four seater options, free flow sauce and fruit bar. Soup can be thickened upon request. What‚Äôs more! They have delivery too! $150 spent and free islandwide delivery. Hotpot comes to you instantly!

business_name: Rasa Istimewa Restaurant @ Safra Jurong (Halal Seafood)
text:
Takes long to serve during rush hour at lunch time. and not sure why they keep adding chilli to my Maggie goreng when specified not to.

ps my colleague's finished meal. I haven't received my non chilli Maggie goreng.

okay i add back one star as they gave free ice cream for the delayed service.

Self service ordering and free seating area shared with wadori at Jurong point basement Japanese food street.  The signature Niku Udon was chewy and good with light soup.  Also tried the Nikku curry udon with fried beef patty which is also delicious.  They also have a section of tempura items where you can choose from.
Yummy kitsune udon with free upsize. The side dish also tasted good but a bit oily.

nice udon, fast service. order at kiosk or on line. free sitting in restraraut, first come first serve. find seat then order, need to go collect food. luckily no one took the table i sat when i went counter to collect food. both thick and ‚Ä¶

Really love the choices available at Idaten, be it for their mains or their tempura. Ordered and the food came very quickly and was delicious. Was lucky to chance upon a free upsize of udon as well which was very good.

Food portion is small and food is not hot. Perhaps it is near closing time and that's why food not hot.

Chicken cutlet is small, like 4 fingers sized portion. Saving grace is the free crispy bites that can be added.

But curry given is not generous and not hot.

Hesitant to try again.

nice udon, fast service. order at kiosk or on line. free sitting in restraraut, first come first serve. find seat then order, need to go collect food. luckily no one took the table i sat when i went counter to collect food. both thick and clear soup available pending on your selection from wide list available. fried food is ok, get two portions for better fill.
one of the best udon places out there, frequent it pretty often. love their mapo tofu udon and kitsune udon, even got a free upsize!
Always a fuss-free and consistent eat here. Having tried the usual beef udon soup, curry beef udon, mentaiko udon, kimchi pork udon - it‚Äôs all tasty for its price üëåüòå ‚Ä¶

Garlic Chicken Maze Udon is always satisfying as usual, whether dining in or takeaway. But the mentai carbonara udon was rather disappointing. It was way too bland, and the soup was not able to coat the udon like how cream sauce would. Chicken was bland too. Tempura were a little to oily leaving an unpleasant aftertaste.

Also, spotlights were too glaring and the hanging display was casting shadows on and off like a lunar eclipse. Maybe hang them more strategically.

Food was okay. But staff Chen Yao was unfriendly and stonic. Ignored customers trying to order and did not bother giving receipts thinking customers know their order number when called. Did not bother scanning for rewards when asked as well.

Really want to call out this Malaysian staff from Idaten Udon, JP outlet (the man in the photo) Attitude is so bad, choice of words and tone used is unacceptable. The manager should retrain him to level up his customer service proficiency.

Extremely disappointed with the order that I received. Ordered chicken tom yam but received prawns,. Even for my pad Thai when I clearly mention in my notes, ‚ÄúNO PRAWNS‚Äù. I am allergic to seafood. When I called the restaurant they way they ‚Ä¶

Extremely disappointed with the order that I received. Ordered chicken tom yam but received prawns,. Even for my pad Thai when I clearly mention in my notes, ‚ÄúNO PRAWNS‚Äù. I am allergic to seafood. When I called the restaurant they way they responded to me was like, not bothered ans still can argue. Not willing to send the correct food to me. Total disappointment. Worst service.

Spoke to Lim over the call.

The pad Thai I had was very shoik.
The Thai basil with egg and minced beef was tasty as Thai.
The spring roll tasted very crispy and fresh.
I usually don‚Äôt prefer the papaya salad at restaurants compared to the usual mango but it was given free so we just took. There was a lot left over.
The chicken skin was the crowd favourite.
The ingredients of all the food range from okay to fresh.

The clear Tom yum and red Tom yum soup was so spicy myself, my MIL and wife both took one spoonful of each and all choked. We could see the mounds of chilli thrown in at the bottom.
My wife usually don‚Äôt have an issue eating spicy stuff but this got to her. Maybe must warn customer? üòÇ

The red ruby ice was much too hard and not finely shaven so not so nice. Was afraid my teeth would crack when I bite down so I removed most of the ice and the red ruby left behind was really measly portion. Quite watery too. :(

Probably the only neighbourhood Thai eatery in this area.

They see pretty brisk business too.

The sea bass is pretty good. Eat it fast though, the gravy will slowly cause the crispness to turn soggy.

The Tom yum soup is good but will suggest ordering seafood or something else instead of chicken. The chicken has a certain taste to it (freezer burn? not sure what it is‚Ä¶)

Great food, super fresh seafood and good service! Always a good time here. White pepper crab is tasty, pomelo chilli crab is interesting and surprisingly nice too! Go and support! Your kids will love the free entertainment outside the restaurant (Pool table, hand soccer, live seafood viewing)

Nice dim sum, free parking and no GST. Not crowded on Sunday noon. However, I think staff should have asked before clearing plates away. They should also pace out the refilling of cups as I prefer to sip tea slowly but if they keep ‚Ä¶

Nice dim sum, free parking and no GST. Not crowded on Sunday noon. However, I think staff should have asked before clearing plates away. They should also pace out the refilling of cups as I prefer to sip tea slowly but if they keep refilling, the tea turns cold very fast. In our one hour there, staff refilled at least 6 times even though my cup is still quite full. One interesting point to note is that they only provided the dim sum menu upon request.

food quality is good and atmosphere is also good.

it's pricey considering the location and also the serving size of the food in comparison to the price.

there should be dim sum buffet but there is none currently. the whole jurong hill shopping mall is left this restaurant.

no GST and free parking is one of the attraction to come as well.

Some dishes are tasty, others are average. Not much more comments about the food.

I wish to comment on the gimmick. If you come at lunch time, there's a free car wash that they don't tell you about upfront. Some random guy just starts spraying your car with water, then soap, then water again without wiping dry. Water marks form on the car under the hot midday sun. Disgusting.

If you want to do a job, do it well. Else, don't bother. If you want to be gimmicky, might as well offer free dessert.
Typically we come here for curry fish head but wanted a change so went for bbq seafood instead. ‚Ä¶

Typically we come here for curry fish head but wanted a change so went for bbq seafood instead.

The sotong was nice, worth ordering.

The stingray lacked taste somewhat. And the flesh wasnt thick as well.

Prawns were nicely grilled but could have just been served without the sambal sauce? cos all 3 dishes tasted the similar after a while. But if you like ‚Äúthat‚Äù particular taste it would be ok.

I don't typically like Chinese food that much but I was truly impressed with the food here! Extensive and clearly labelled menu of allium-free vegetarian Chinese and local dishes, most of which are vegan by default or have vegan options. ‚Ä¶

I don't typically like Chinese food that much but I was truly impressed with the food here! Extensive and clearly labelled menu of allium-free vegetarian Chinese and local dishes, most of which are vegan by default or have vegan options. Highly recommend the Creamy Abalone Mushroom (made using oat milk for the vegan option), Multigrains Cereal Tofu, Hotplate Black Pepper Chicken Cutlet Rice, and Hotplate Assam Fish Rice. A bit out of the way (8min walk from Joo Koon MRT) but definitely worth visiting when you're in the West. They also sometimes organise special events, such as collaborations with the Japanese vegan home-based business Veg-An.

Firstly, I didn‚Äôt expect a restaurant where you have to take your own plates and utensils, and even wipe your own table. If I could give a rating lower than zero, I‚Äôd give it -100. What kind of logic is this‚Äîcalling it a restaurant but making it self-service?

And to top it off, they still had the nerve to add a 20% surcharge for CNY Eve. Understand that is CNY charges but come on such services trash.

Worst experience ever, Honestly, should I even pay that when everything is self-service?

There was a moment when all of our dishes had been cleared, but the new ones hadn‚Äôt arrived yet. When they finally brought the new dishes, they just stood there holding them, waiting for us to clear the space ourselves?

Even if it‚Äôs self-service, they could‚Äôve informed us about it beforehand, not after the dishes arrive, when we have to walk over and ask. It‚Äôs basic customer service to let your guests know in advance, and that‚Äôs something any restaurant or service crew should do.

Don‚Äôt use excuses like ‚Äútoo many people‚Äù or ‚Äúlack of staff‚Äù ‚Äì that‚Äôs not the customer‚Äôs issue, it‚Äôs the restaurant‚Äôs. Don‚Äôt shift your problems onto the customers.
