The food was great, but the service was lacking.

Stumbled this stall by chance in Google Map. There's another stall by the same name in Boon Lay Market around a kilometer away that sells identical items and menu, which is a newer branch of this eatery (covered in separate review). Seems to make sense since many members of the Burmese diaspora live and work in the West area.

Tried some of the items I haven't tried from the previous visits to the Boon Lay Market outlet - namely mutton curry, banana blossom stew with coconut milk, coconut milk noodle (onno kaw shwe), and some veggie fritters which looks like Indian pakora (and samosa). All tastes from okay to great, but personally some items like the oily meat dishes are better to be consumed as treats instead of daily meal (for obvious reason). Price tends to be on steeper side - above $5 except perhaps the fritters that fetches $3 for 4 pieces. I guess they give some sort of discounts to Burmese customers (CMIIW).

The young female server treated me with disrespect. It felt like she thought I was eating for free.  When I asked about the food, her responses were unhelpful and rude.  Even when she returned my change, she simply placed it on the table ‚Ä¶

The young female server treated me with disrespect. It felt like she thought I was eating for free.  When I asked about the food, her responses were unhelpful and rude.  Even when she returned my change, she simply placed it on the table and walked away without a word.  This kind of service is unacceptable. I would not recommend this restaurant based on the poor service I received.
Found this Zhi Cha store in a hidden place . Special offer on their Curry fishhead and is very delicious. They open Mon-Sat. Close on Sunday.

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text: Our first time here. Wide variety of Hunan dishes and non-spicy choices are available. Service was good, freeflow ice cream, snack and drinks. ‚Ä¶

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text: The lamb is good , less spicier with the choice, the smell was not strong and right portion. The China Shandong screw pepper was crunchy and fresh with the Iberico Spanish pork ! They also have less oily option to choose . Free tidbits and ice cream while waiting. Spacious seating too !

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text: I have visited the same shop in Vivo City. However, the Jurong Point branch seems to offer a wider selection of menu items, complimentary snacks, and free ice cream. I highly recommend the Lamb ribs, as they are, in my opinion, among the best in Singapore.

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text:
Overall, Xiang Xiang is a decent place that serves reasonably good standard Hunan dishes at affordable pricing. 5 pax we spent around 130+ to have a sumptuous meal. It‚Äôs particularly crowded during weekend dinner and you can sense the popularity of the restaurant.

The stir fry potato, green pepper fry pork, steamed egg, and cabbage were all delicious and you can taste that they use fresh ingredients. We really love their steamed rice as we ordered two pots of rice.

You can help yourself with free ice cream dessert too after your meal. Their service is top notch and the staff are all very polite. Do remember to register yourself as their member as they give free $ credit for certain amount of top up after becoming their loyalty member.

We will surely return again !!!

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text:
The food at Xiang Xiang never disappoints!! Flavorful yet reasonably priced hunan cuisine dishes, supper yummy! We spent around $200ish after GST and Svc charge for 7 pax adults.

What would I recommend? I‚Äôm not sure because everything was super good tbh, depends on your food preference.
- Stir fried pork is their must order signature dish.
- Spicy cold noodle dish is good for sharing
- Claypot tofu (non spicy version) was interesting. It‚Äôs more like beancurd skin in tofu shape, it was good. We got non spicy to balance out the other spicy dishes
- Cauliflower was good, they used a lot of pork lard and garlic so it was really savory.
- Tea oil beef was spicy but fragrant, sooo much garlic that I love inside!
- Eggplant was cooked well and soaked with yummy sauce
- Sour spicy fish soup is one of the best around. It‚Äôs so addictive as it‚Äôs not too spicy, and they add lemon slices in it for a refreshing twist
- Shredded potato was nice and crunchy!
- Luffa dish was lighter compared to the other strong dishes we ordered but a nice complement.

Overall, we enjoyed the food and finished everything. There‚Äôs free flow crackers and ice cream available at the self serve area.

One thing the outlet could improve on, though, would be service during lunchtime! Compared to other outlets we visited during peak hours, the food here was served pretty slowly.

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text:
Our first time here. Wide variety of Hunan dishes and non-spicy choices are available. Service was good, freeflow ice cream, snack and drinks.

Highly recommend the claypot egg plant and century egg. A young handsome man asked if we wanted to mince it and we did. It looked disgusting but very tasty with a little spicy.

My kids enjoyed the steamed egg with shrimp and the antler mushroom braised chicken.

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text:
Relatively new Hunan cuisine restaurant at Jurong Point! Interesting menu selection, such as the Antler mushroom braised chicken (tender meat & flavourful soup, we like it so much, there wasn‚Äôt enough to go around!), Golden broth sour & spicy fish (nice sourness from the lemon but very spicy), & Iberico pork belly & fore shank. The Stir-fry organic cauliflower was quite sweet & fresh too.

Most of the items come with the option to make it non-spicy, which makes it kids-friendly. There‚Äôs also free-flow ice cream & snacks at the entrance!

IG @pingguo301

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text:
We dropped by unplanned and we were absolutely happy with our meal. Apart from the minor issue with the online order system, the service was very prompt, and efficient. They provided excellent recommendations and switched to plan B quickly when there was an issue with the system.

There were only two of us so we could only order limited dishes to try. They achieved the Goldilocks zone with the doneness and seasoning of the dishes. That appetizer made of eggplant and century egg mashed up together was surprisingly very enjoyable!

Free flow ice cream to finish off is always welcomed. Overall, happy with our first visit at Xiang Xiang. Happy to return again.

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text: Happen to chance upon this shop, please don‚Äôt get fooled by the queue. The food was average at best, while price is on the high side. Obviously, this shop tries to copy the Haidilao concept, where customer service is prioritised. Besides that, nothing much to boast about. Comes with free flow snacks and ice creams.

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text: They have free ice cream. Food is tasty and portions are huge for 1 person. The chef have exceptional knife skills as the meat slices are deftly cut into bite sizes. I did order 2 more dishes, the suan cai fish and steam egg with prawns as I was hungry for more.

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text:
Very very crowded on a friday night, but staff is very professional.

Take your queue number via scanning qr code. We took queue number at around 6.48pm and waiting time was about 40mins as per webpage. Around 7.17pm, we got our table so its faster than expected.

Free snacks and ice cream to take.

When ordering food, can choose less oily option. But the 18-sec beef dish, after choosing less spicy, is still very spicy, but taste good. Steamed egg dish is good for kids. White rice taste is good.

Large iced lemon tea, if unable to finish, staff can pack takeaway for you.

Be a member and buy credits, will be more worthy if you come frequently.

August 2025 have birthday 20% discount islandwide, but no more freebies for birthday boy. Too bad.

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text:
After dining at this chain for the second time myself and the third time for my wife, we started to feel that it wasn‚Äôt as amazing as we once thought it was.

The tofu which we ordered for the first time was great however. Broccoli which we used to love was really just meh this time around, and nothing else really stood out.

The pot of rice definitely was quite a good gimmick, especially for those who are feeding a large table - same with the free flow snacks and ice cream üòÖ

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text:
Walk in on a late afternoon and greeted by friendly service staff Zhiwei.

Upon entering the restaurant, saw freeflow small packet snack and ice cream.

The pork intestine is very tasty and delicious.

Nice and cozy environment and good customer service.

business_name: Xiang Xiang Hunan Cuisine ÊπòÈ¶ôÊπñÂçóËèú @ Jurong Point
text: 5/10 to 7/10 have opening promotion at 40% discount. Foods good just not spicy to us. Free flow snacks and ice cream.

This is a definite comfort Mexican food especially on the go or home delivery. Burritos are really good and filling, salad bowls are better for just right eating. Good quality ingredients, hassle-free ordering and delicious too. Staff here are welcoming and it‚Äôs a cash only place (I‚Äôd to run to atm so many times)

Went to get my burritos at around 8.10pm yesterday and was informed that they're closing at 8.30pm. They was practically sold out and not much ingredients were left. QQ went the extra mile to check the back area if there was still anymore ‚Ä¶

Commented about the thin slice of braised pork ($3.80/slice)...the tired and rude storekeeper (aunty) snapped back "suagu"... Calling us mountain turtle!!
Haa.. Expensive food + rude staff, lethal formula for failure.

Popular local as well as Hongkong Malaysia Penang Ipoh Thailand Indian Indonesia delights including Sandwiches pastries cakes bakery noodles cuisines Soups desserts Tim Sum tea coffee and beverages all at discounted prices spacious lounge aircond relaxing atmosphere comfortable seating and warm services. Conveniently located at neighbourhood heartland of Jurong West walking distance covered pathway to Jurong West MRT bus interchange Jurong Point with plenty of dinning shopping banking supermarkets library cinemas entertainments groceries sundries Electric Electronic telecommunication postage services household products community centre and amenities nearby. Friendly cosy comfy welcoming ambience for romantic intimates groups students expats locals visitors and families.

Had a bad experience with a rude and obnoxious cashier who was in her 60s and with golden bracelet.

Was queuing at 3.50pm to buy a little snack for my hungry mother. Right before my turn was a customer with a big order and the cashier was reviewing through the receipts for them multiple times. I did not rushed her even when she was taking quite some time and a queue was building up. After waiting for a while, I asked if she could kindly bill my items first. This cashier replied ‚ÄúÊ≤°ÊúâÊó∂Èó¥‰∏çË¶Å‰π∞Âï¶ÔºÅ‚Äù (No time don‚Äôt buy).

I was appalled by her attitude and replied her ‚Äúwhat are you saying ? I‚Äôm only asking for you to collect payment.‚Äù She did not stop there. She continued saying ‚Äú‰Ω†Ëµ∂Êó∂Èó¥‰∏çË¶Å‰π∞Âï¶‚Äù (in a rush don‚Äôt buy la)

While she unwillingly collected the payment, she still continue to say ‚ÄúÂéªcomplaintÂï¶ÔºÅ Complain Âà∞‰Ω†Â§üÂï¶‚Äù (Go complain, complain until you‚Äôre satisfied)

During years of my patronage, I have not encountered such rude service from the staff before. The attitude of the staff is very upsetting and disappointing. I hope the management will provide better customer service training to your staff. You are a globally known brand of Singapore and this is not the service standard you should be giving any of your customers locally or globally.

I want to mention particularly this chinese lady. She was the cashier.
Basically, I went to buy 2 sotong head which costed ÂõõÂùóÂõõ. I payed her exactly 4.40 and after that she claimed that one of the 10 cents i gave her was dirty and ‚Ä¶

if im being honest the staff at Jurong Point outlet were not only unfriendly but also RACIST. went there 2 days in a row this week and both times was a terrible experience , on the 14th of april at arnd 730+PM , my boyfriend & i were queuing in line to order some food when i got a phone call half way so i asked my boyfriend to order what he wanted first but shockingly they didn't bother to take our order n shoo-ed us away, making hand gestures for us to requeue AGAIN (mind u, it was not a short queue and we were THE ONLY PEOPLE OF COLOR IN LINE) this didn't happen once but happened AGAIN today, on the 15th of april around 710+PM, this time i was alone in the queue. I managed to got what i wanted to order but when i was ready to pay, i paid by paywave so once i tapped my card i was waiting for this chinese lady who assisted me at the cashier to tell me my payment when thru and i was good to go but she didn't open her mouth at all to talk nor did she pass me my food i bought instead left me standing there waiting for no reason while she served all the other ppl. Ridiculous service ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è if nothing is being done abt this , ill be going back there again tmr to make a complaint in person

Was totally disturbed by the service of this outlet. But only to one specific person. I refer to the person whom I had asked around other staff if she is the supervisor, and they said yes, and to highlight she is the supervisor (chinese speaking Vietnamese lady). Here's how it went down.

Was browsing the menu at the door when the supervisor came to ask if we (my spouse & I) wanted to take a seat. As we were still considering, we told her we would just take a look first, we went on looking around the food court and eventually decided upon Uncle Leong. After we were seated, we decided on the 2 pax set menu when I raised my hands to get the attention of the service crew, which happens to be the supervisor. I asked about the poster on the table of scanning the qr code for a $1 drink.

The issues
1. The poster states only coconut, ah yu jelly, etc. I pointed out to the supervisor, and immediately, I was rebutted. "Oh, it's up to us to decide what drinks to offer, so now changed to this this and this," pointing to the drinks menu.

Woah, I sound like a cheap skate freebie hunter at this point.

2. My wife decided on the choice with the set and placed her order. At this point, the supervisor seems to be irritated with our order speed and proceeded to say she will go send the order first while my wife finishes scanning the qr code.

We started to wonder if we weren't qualified to be eating at this restaurant ü§î.  Maybe what we ordered is not those of the higher class dishes.

3. Drinks served wrong, we ordered a lime juice & a peach tea, came 2 lime. The other server at this time was great üëç thumbs up for him (prc guy). He quickly apologised and brought us the changed drink.

Food choice we served wrong, one of the bean curd we ordered was the hotplate, but came Á∫¢ÁÉß. We decided not to be picky about it and just ate what was served.

The order was taken by the supervisor. This obviously shows how interested is she on her work.

4. Next table hoo Haa. Overheard the conversation of another table with the same supervisor. The other table ordered 2 set meals, but the supervisor specifically said that she keyed in already, she cannot revert. It seems to me that the other table had ordered 2 set meals for 3 to 4 pax. But I was already causing some confusion. I saw the same irritated side eye roll of the supervisor...

5. The second table commotion, a couple came in again attended by the dame supervisor, this time they were talking about voucher or promos they had bought online. What again that attracted me was, the supervisor exclaimed, "This I can't decide! I'll call my management and let them speak to you."

The ironic part is that after she called the management, she passed the mobile to the customer, and she went around gossiping and pointing towards the table of the customer holding her mobile. How rude!

To wrap this up. If a business that fails at any one point, this "Supervisor" is the cause of all the reputation, the chefs effort, discredited the other kind service or the other crew. Straight to the point, she behaves as if she's a successful business owner (maybe she really is) that does not need our poor peasants business.

What an unpleasant dinner experience we've had that spoils my whole evening. I hope the other tables also put up  a review so that it does justify what I've been through and witness.

To be fair, other than this supervisor, I have no issue with the taste of the food. The other service crews attitude were good too. I guess it up to the management to re-educate the customer service of your staff. Or you may attempt to write a "look into the matter" to brush away my elaborated review. Let's see how it all works out again when we return.

Their chilli crab is a no go.. Jumbo is still the best. Service üëé Didn't offer to change new plate eventhough our plates full of shells.
Set meal not entitled for 20% grab discount.
It was crowded during lunch time. Taste of food was fairly good with the  set menus for 4 people. However one of dish named xo scallops vege was under expectation. Service was ok.

Decent location for supper and the staff were friendly. However, the prata with mutton set wasn‚Äôt served with gravy, and the mutton does not have much gravy so we had to request for it specifically. Maggie goreng taste decent but very salty. And the prata bom‚Äôs ingredients, such as sugar and butter wasn‚Äôt spread well, resulting in clumps of sugar in the prata and over butter parts.  All in all, a decent place to go to if you‚Äôre in the area but definitely not worth a trip specifically to dine there.
Really yummy! Make sure to get the free soup refills. The soup is peppery but not tooo peppery. Make sure to get the dough sticks. Most people like peanuts with it too. ‚Ä¶

Really yummy! Make sure to get the free soup refills. The soup is peppery but not tooo peppery. Make sure to get the dough sticks. Most people like peanuts with it too.
Rice is the most common thing to eat it with, but I preferred the noodles on the side. They were really fresh.

A popular BKT shop who has been operating around for a while.

It is the standard clear BKT soup with peppery taste, goes well with the sweet dark soy sauce. The braised pork belly, however, is something to praise about. For $7, there were about 5-6 chunks of meat. The fatty portion practically melts in the mouth.

Additional BKT soup is available to be replenished (self service - pour it from the jugs available at condiments area).

Nothing to be said about service or atmosphere. What do you expect in a coffeeshop setting
The owner is an amazing host! Food was great and also gave some free food during the World Cup games. Will definitely come back when I‚Äôm in Singapore. Must try!

I ordered at 10pm at night, but the food didn‚Äôt arrive by 12am. I checked the website, and dominos stated that the store was open, so I patiently waited. However, after a while, I decided to head down to the store. THE WEBSITE SAID IT HAD BEEN PREPARED IN THE STORE BUT THE STORE WAS CLOSED. This is utterly unacceptable since I ordered, and now, i literally am unable to get my food. Please give me a refund.

I made an order at 7.30pm, up till 9.30pm i did not receive the order and i tried calling them
multiple times but nobody picked up. My order was $100+ and i had to physically ‚Ä¶
We had a discount code for regular pizza. The pizza is kinda small so we all bought two of them. 11/12 pizzas were done in 5 minutes, one took like 15 minutes. The taste was ok.

I made an order at 7.30pm, up till 9.30pm i did not receive the order and i tried calling them
multiple times but nobody picked up. My order was $100+ and i had to physically head down to the store to ask for more order and guess what it wasn‚Äôt even ready and was told to continue waiting. The staff also said that they had a lack of manpower and it wasn‚Äôt their problem. There were a few other people who had issues with their orders as well and one of them was told that the outlet didn‚Äôt have enough dough?? üòÇ. Wrote in to dominos and was only offered a voucher with a minimum order of $15.00 hahaha and they asked if i received my order after 1 whole dayüòÇ. Will not order from you guys again, such a horrible experience. Seriously need to work on your service recovery standards.

Ordered 15inch pizza(doesnt look like 15inch at all)on the 08-01-25.opened the box only to find my pizza all smashed up all slide to the side.all the topping is out of place and it doesnt look like pizza already.Placed order at 22:29,pizza came at 23:01(timing of my cctv) so fast and mind you its from NTU to Jurong west ave 1.pizza is cold too! Already took pics n vids of the pizza sent to me.tried calling but failed and only to find out outlet is closed already after checking Google.but i guess will nvr get thru,after reading the other reviews in Google,outlet will never answer.no email to complaint,feedback thru website.hope to hear from the management! 17:25hrs:i have already feedback thru website.Still no response from your side!

3 out of 4 items were delivered wrongly.
Mozzarella twisty crust came with a normal hand tossed crust despite me paying for the extra charge.  Hawaiian Paradise came with zero  topping.  Was only hand tossed crust with pizza sauce and cheese.  Ordered Cinnastix but came Breadstix.  Looking at it, not sure if the Breadstix is even edible ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è. The wrong order ruined my mood for dinner.

Not able to get in touch with outlet over the phone number.

Feedback form on website sent. I request for refund of the wrong items and shortfall! Shall wait for your response.

Horrible experience.  Will not order from NTU outlet anymore.  Please close this outlet for good since you have so many negative reviews.

‚∏ª

Disappointed with the In-Store Experience on 5 June

I visited the store on 5 June at around 12 PM, intending to place an order at the counter. Despite two staff members being inside, no one acknowledged me or offered any assistance while I stood waiting. It wasn‚Äôt until I had to call out to them that I was told to scan a QR code and place my order online.

This was extremely frustrating and felt dismissive. I had purposely come down to order in person, but instead was made to go through the hassle of signing in digitally just to get a pizza. If customers aren‚Äôt allowed to place orders at the counter, then what is the point of having one?

The entire experience felt impersonal and inconvenient. I hope Domino‚Äôs reconsiders this system and allows walk-in customers the option of ordering directly with staff.

After ordering online and more than 30 unanswered calls, I had to come down to the NTU branch in person just to confirm if my order went through; this very much defeats the purpose of online ordering and delivery. There was no email confirmation, nothing on the app either. To say this is the worst customer service I have ever experienced in Singapore will be an understatement. This is also not the first bad experience I have with Dominos SG. I first had a bad experience when it just opened at NTU years ago. I wanted to support it. Since then, I have not ordered from Dominos SG. But I thought that years later maybe it has improved. Nope. It is just as bad as before. Apparently, I am not the only one complaining. I hope you can improve your service. It is unfair for your employees and customers.

I wish there's no star rating at all for this outlet.  ordered food at 7.22PM.... suppose to receive at 8.22PM... it was still showing its at kitchen at 8.45PM. when I called the outslet few times no answer at all. Then I went to see the reviews, I wasn't the first person to experience this.

Very disappointed by the service of the Dominoes NTU outlet. Ordered at 1040  through grab, told would be delivered through 1140, waited another hour but not delivered. Called the outlet 9 times no reply. Went all the way to the outlet to ‚Ä¶

i ordered at 11.50pm and my food was still not delivered by 1.30am (their closing time). tried to call their hotline but it was always busy. why are you still operating despite numerous of bad reviews? it‚Äôs new year and you are already ‚Ä¶

Very disappointed by the service of the Dominoes NTU outlet. Ordered at 1040  through grab, told would be delivered through 1140, waited another hour but not delivered. Called the outlet 9 times no reply. Went all the way to the outlet to check status, was told that the order didn‚Äôt go through cus of postal issue, did not even notify me the problem. Wasted half a day trying to solve this issue and no food in the end. Terrible service, will never buy from here again!

I am extremely frustrated with the service I received. I ordered $60 worth of food from Domino's NTU on FoodPanda at 5 PM, with an estimated delivery time of 40-60 minutes. However, after an hour, I still hadn't received my food. I attempted to call the store multiple times but no one answered. Additionally, I couldn‚Äôt reach anyone through the FoodPanda app since it stated that the food was being delivered by the outlet‚Äôs driver and couldn‚Äôt be tracked.
Another hour passed, making it two hours since I placed my order, and I had still received no updates. The app still showed my food was ‚Äúpreparing.‚Äù Finally, I was able to get through to someone at the outlet, but he sounded unsure and was unable to provide any useful information. He took my details, mentioned that the driver had been sent, and then said the food had been placed at the lobby . When I told him I hadn‚Äôt received any food or communication, he took my details again and promised to call me back after checking. However, no one ever called me back.
I then went to check in person, and to my disbelief, the food had been left outside on top of a fire safety box for over an hour without any notification. I called the outlet again and explained the situation, but the staff member(ANN)  defended the store's actions and claimed the driver had delivered the food. She also said most workers are old and might not understand, which is completely unacceptable.
I am thoroughly disgusted with this terrible service. Since the food had been left outside for over an hour in a fire safety box, it was no longer safe to consume. This is not the first time I‚Äôve had issues with this outlet. The last time I ordered, the driver left my food on a table outside without informing me.

Scheduled a delivery for new years a few days before just so I thought they could better coordinate and deliver it more efficiently as I understand it was new years . Yet I received no updates and now it has been one night and they made me starve so bad ! Now I want a refund but they are not answering all of my calls since yesterday !

I have ordered twice and they have taken the money but didn't delivered the items I have spent like around 80SGD, If they can't deliver they shouldn't we accept the orders in the first place and when I try to call they dont answer the calls for some reason. This is really so annoying I need my money back.
I ordered pizza from this Restaurant through Food panda on 1Jun 2025. After 2 hours, it didnt deliver and no one pick up the calls. Terrible service.

Absolutely horrible service. I have ordered 2 times so far, first time the food didn‚Äôt even deliver. I had to repeatedly contact the Domino‚Äôs service to get my refund. Second time they delivered half an hour late. Funnily enough, they started making the order near to my delivery timing(8pm) then delivered half an hour late(8:30pm). Many times when I try to call them, no answer. The ‚Äúcrispy fries‚Äù I ordered were all soggy even though the delivery is distance is so close. The pizza taste is okay though.

Absolutely Horrible waste of money.

All the other comments are also pointing to the horrible service and food, and the replies that  Domino gives is always the same, trying to improve, but there is absolutely no change in the attitude or service.

Never ordering from this place ever again.

i ordered at 11.50pm and my food was still not delivered by 1.30am (their closing time). tried to call their hotline but it was always busy. why are you still operating despite numerous of bad reviews? it‚Äôs new year and you are already spoiling everyone‚Äôs mood.

i came over to their shop and the staff were busy chit chatting instead of calling customers to inform the orders were cancelled or delayed? the 2 hours of waiting yet no courtesy to inform your customers?! rubbish service. stop replying thank you for your feedback with no solution!!!

edit: it‚Äôs 5th March 2025, i ordered on 31st December 2024 yet no refund has been made.

Nabei i waited for my food for 2 hours, called multiple times yet no respond. Went down to the branch and found out it was close. next day call multiple times also no answer and said food was delivered? No food was delivered, only air

This was our first time ordering from this outlet, and here‚Äôs a list of issues we encountered:

1. We found several strands of hair in the food and had to spit it out.

2. The "Classified Chicken" didn't taste right‚Äîthe sausage was unusually small compared to what we usually get from the Joo Koon outlet, and we couldn‚Äôt taste any cheese; it was incredibly dry. We even thought they sent the wrong flavors initially.

3. Several slices were burnt and overcooked.

4. We were told the wait would be 20 minutes, but it ended up taking 45 minutes.

5. Their phone line was odd; when someone picked up, we could still hear the dial tone, and the call suddenly cut off mid-conversation.

Overall, it was a very disappointing experience and a poor first impression. We‚Äôre not typically critical and rarely leave Google reviews, especially negative ones, but this experience was so bad that we felt compelled to share. This outlet really needs to revamp its operations and consider a new chef.

I ordered a pizza last night through Grab, but the pizza never arrived. The Grab app shows that the order has been marked as delivered, and the payment has already been deducted from my account. I called the next day, no answer, and my $30 was gone. When ordering here, you should keep in mind that you might lose your money.

I used domino‚Äôs app to order(because there was discount:d), worst decision ever. Didn‚Äôt receive my order. I didn‚Äôt get called when the order arrived, didn‚Äôt received a photo Prof of package delivery. App said simply order arrived. Ofcourse ‚Ä¶

Drinks are deliberately missing in order for another time. No hotline to call for missing item or wrong delivery. Send feedback and do not even bother to response. Customer are forced to suck their own thumb. Surprise to see such low sales trick still exists in Singapore and still can survive! Authority should look into such unethical sales tricks!!

Edit  :

Stopped replying and act as if you guys care by replying in google with a standard template answer.. you should try your own, send feedback on your own platform, and see if your staff or yourself reply or not. Last but not least, go REALLY check on your feedback and count the number of scam food and drink that you guys scammed!!

Jasphine & team.(Jurong Point)
I just wanted to take a moment to express how truly touched I was by your kindness and thoughtfulness during my visit. It was heartwarming to see you reserve a table specifically for your staff to break their fast. This small but incredibly meaningful gesture speaks volumes about your character and the care you have for those around you.

It‚Äôs rare to come across such genuine consideration, and witnessing it firsthand made my experience at your Pepper lunch jurong point even more special. Thank you for not only serving food with such dedication but for also fostering an environment filled with compassion and respect.

Wishing you and your team continued blessings and success!

Standard remains consistently good even after many years. Clean and excellent customer svc. The cashiers, be it part timers or regular staffs are very helpful. Was checking if they recently changed their menu. She explained to us what are some of changes.

Maybe this is the only time I‚Äôll finish all the rice! üòÜ be it beef, salmon, or chicken, scallops, it‚Äôs always good. Be sure to quickly ‚Äúcook‚Äù it with their special butter once the food arrived!

But if u re seated inside the restaurant area, where the cashier is located, rmb to spray the fabric mist on your way out. Cos you may smell alittle oily if you don‚Äôt.

I ordered a cheesecake as a side dish along with two drinks, but when my table number was called, I only received the drinks. I went to check with them, providing my table number, but since I didn‚Äôt keep the receipt, they refused to give me the cheesecake even though I showed them a screenshot of my order ID. The staff just kept saying ‚Äòcannot, cannot‚Äô when we asked if they could check. Very disappointing service.
Excellent Food, restaurant is very clean and neat. The service is excellent, the cashier explained that there is 15% discount for students on ala carte mains after 5pm. ‚Ä¶

Excellent Food, restaurant is very clean and neat. The service is excellent, the cashier explained that there is 15% discount for students on ala carte mains after 5pm.

I ordered jumbo beef pepper rice and added 2 vegs of mushroom and beansprouts. The beef is tender and the mushroom tasted damn good with the special butter.

Awesome would come back again:)

Yummy yet healthy! It‚Äôs my all time favorite! There‚Äôs a wide variety of healthy condiments to choose from. For Bento, Oat rice to their iconic rice ball. If you don‚Äôt want to stress yourself over the many choices, choose from the recommended menu.

Price is a bit high, at least $7 for a meal with drink. Cos they serve healthy drinks, such as Roselle, organic soya, etc. However always look out for the many discounts, from Grab or Fave.

Dining in is not recommended, cos there‚Äôs limited and uncomfortable seats.

Tried the famous chicken burger and realised that the mayo spread is hella spicy ü•µ. I practically had to gulp down a bottle of barley water to help to cool down the ‚Äòheat‚Äô. Well, I still enjoyed the succulent buttermilk batter patty made ‚Ä¶

Tried the famous chicken burger and realised that the mayo spread is hella spicy ü•µ. I practically had to gulp down a bottle of barley water to help to cool down the ‚Äòheat‚Äô. Well, I still enjoyed the succulent buttermilk batter patty made with fresh chicken thigh sandwiched between soft buttery brochie buns despite this fiery-hot experience though.

Mix and Match for $6.90 is pretty good.

You can also do a Google review for free cheese fries!

The service was amazing. The staff came to my table whenever a course was served, and they explained the dish and everything ingredient inside it. Even though the staff were still students in training, they were still very professional and knew what they were doing. The atmosphere also felt cozy and the jazz music playing in the restaurant also helped to create a calm and posh atmosphere. The food was also mostly delicious and fresh. Especially the turbot which was very fresh and the scallop mousse which melted in my mouth. However, the blini in the first course was a bit dry and the fried fish on the blini was a little hard to chew. But the rest of the courses all did not have any issues at all and I would definitely come back again.

Love this place.
Value for money, quality food.
The chicken dishes are clearly the stars on the menu and what they're famous for. Speaking of which, they have an extensive menu with locally inspired and international flavored dishes.
Healthy bowls are their latest items on the menu, and it's fantastic - greens, egg and protein!
I'll say skip the non-chicken dishes. The salmon in the salmon bowl was very skinny. Not sure if they were trying to go for the sashimi cut, but the fish serving was rather modest....Beef burger was so-so....

Service is fast and store is clean. Tried the honey glazed roasted chicken. It come with salad and coleslaw. The portion for salad and coleslaw are pathetically little portion (ordered a whole spring chicken). At least give some decent portion which allow 2 person to eat. The chicken although soft but the meat is on the dry side.

All fried chicken are equal but some are more equal than others.  Tenderfresh belongs to the former. The fried spring chicken was indeed tender (somewhat juicy) but it wasn't inspiring. Quite generic in fact. Not sure if any marination has been done but the seasoning that I could taste is basically salt ü§î. Redemption is still possible as they have an extensive menu serving heaps of pasta dishes, salads and other meats. The crab salad is pretty good. Will want to try the French roast chicken next time and see how's that faring.

The food at this restaurant is generally good, with the weekday menu being a standout feature. The sashimi is exceptionally fresh, and the ambiance is authentically Japanese, which enhances the dining experience. However, there was a ‚Ä¶

The food at this restaurant is generally good, with the weekday menu being a standout feature. The sashimi is exceptionally fresh, and the ambiance is authentically Japanese, which enhances the dining experience. However, there was a disappointing moment during our visit when some of our meals took 45 minutes to be served due to a kitchen oversight. While the quality of the food is commendable, the service could use some improvement to ensure a smoother experience for diners.

Definitely not your usual conveyor Japanese restaurant. We chanced on this hidden gem, located in the western part of Singapore. We ordered the salmon belly sashimi (Sake Harami) to share. Dish came with 6 slices of sashimi. The slices were thick and fresh. Immediately melted in my mouth. Damn delicious. Wifey and me then ordered a Deluxe Kaisen Don each. It‚Äôs a rice dish with egg, crab sticks, raw scallops, prawns, tuna and salmon. Topped with I believe salmon roe and uni (sea urchin). This dish was fabulous. It was so fresh and definitely filling. I washed it down with a nice bottle of warm sake. Abit pricey but definitely worth every dollar. Will recommend not to order too many dishes first as the portion is pretty big and the richness of the dishes will leave you satisfied quickly. Ample parking available so no worries about parking.

This place can really get crowded at lunch. Serving is big, and service is damn good. But the quality of food is so so. I'll still recommend this, though. Oh, and I commend the free refills of green tea

Feels like being transported back to an old izakaya in Japan (now that we can‚Äôt travel). Set lunch was good with free coffee, nice ambience, service is good. At night it turns into an izakaya. A rare find in that vicinity.
Delicious reasonably priced fresh Japanese food in the heartlands. It would be advisable to reserve a place as it is well patronised. 10% discount during Happy hour (5.30 pm to 7pm).

My favourite tzechar go to in Singapore, tucked away in a corner of a bustling
neighbourhood.

Food
The beancurd is a must order, crispy yet tender at the same time, paired with the sauce, it‚Äôs heavenly.
The chicken in the photos is a limited time offer, which is made up of seafood paste, without chicken meat, just the skin.

Price
It was honestly much cheaper (like 20-30% lower) a year or two ago. I guess the recent renovation works added to the rising cost which is passed downwards to us consumers. 4 of us, feasting on a crab, a fish, limited edition ‚Äúchicken‚Äù, beancurd, broccoli with scallop and long beans cost us $160 ü§î

All in all, still the go to place whenever we feel for tzechar. Would recommend making reservations during weekends though.

üëéüèª Note to self: The deep fried baby squid isn‚Äôt for us - hoping for a calamari kind of dish but it was literally ‚Äúbaby‚Äù squid that‚Äôs deep fried, my bad

Ordered food at 7 pm and waited .. 1 hour still not ready ! Call to cancel order but woman staff shouting say order placed already cooked ! But waited another half an hour still no food delivered. Have to wait for 2 hours if u order Zhi char here on weekends and the food are not nice also

Worse service ever. Called on New Years to place an order for dinner at noon and called again at 5 pm to confirm order for collection at 6pm but food was not even prepared by 615 and attempted to even check on order status was not being ‚Ä¶

Worse service ever. Called on New Years to place an order for dinner at noon and called again at 5 pm to confirm order for collection at 6pm but food was not even prepared by 615 and attempted to even check on order status was not being entertained. Workers gave me the hand signal to keep quiet and not ask. If you can‚Äôt even manage your kitchen workers and check on status maybe your restaurant don‚Äôt deserve a favourable review. Despite the crowd, I find it absurd that my orders came at 7 only despite calling twice to check and confirm that I could collect my order at 6. Staff was very rude. Even the table beside me who ordered after I arrived, their food was already served. I find it absurd that staff is not even willing to find my order and at least check to confirm that it has been taken. I would never patronise this place again. This experience was unwarranted for on New Years.
Called to reserve table for 10 paxes but when reached there. They said only have up to 6 paxes. The staff was rude as well

business_name: Yi Jia Le Wah Chye Seafood Restaurant
text: Yi Jia Le Wah Chye Seafood, or as the 'hood dwellers call it, "Wah Zai" (Cantonese: Âçé‰ªî), is a familiar sight and impossible to miss when one walks past Block 546. The bright lights, the nigh irresistible smells of zichar delicacies, and the ‚Ä¶

business_name: Yi Jia Le Wah Chye Seafood Restaurant
text:
Yi Jia Le Wah Chye Seafood, or as the 'hood dwellers call it, "Wah Zai" (Cantonese: Âçé‰ªî), is a familiar sight and impossible to miss when one walks past Block 546. The bright lights, the nigh irresistible smells of zichar delicacies, and the sounds of merry makers chugging down swigs of beer with zichar dishes makes Wah Zai an easy rendezvous point.

The lady boss and her husband are a lovely folk who run the business. While there are the commonly expected dishes from a zichar stall, a common staple which I witness ordered by popular demand is the sambal chicken cubed fried rice (Sambal È∏°‰∏ÅÁÇíÈ•≠). The crab dishes are also worth a try! For its price, the crabs are well worth it.

However, be patient on weekend evenings if you order from them. Orders can take up to 30 minutes. But, if that does not faze you, do try the neighbourhood's irresistible Wah Zai.

business_name: Yi Jia Le Wah Chye Seafood Restaurant
text: A typically local seafood restaurant located at Blk 546. It famous cray pot XO crabs"Beehoon".

business_name: Yi Jia Le Wah Chye Seafood Restaurant
text: Good crab bee hoon at $36 with lots of bee hoon with scallop and ËôæÁ±≥. Free parking on Sunday.

Great location in historical area - Little India district plus MRT station underneath the hotel are making this place very attractive to tourists. Vast choice for breakfast plus a discount in hotel restaurant for the guests with the really ‚Ä¶

Great location in historical area - Little India district plus MRT station underneath the hotel are making this place very attractive to tourists. Vast choice for breakfast plus a discount in hotel restaurant for the guests with the really tasty food also are the big advantage of the Holiday Inn Little India in Singapore. And if you need sth just ask for Virendra from the hotel staff. He is THE guy. You gonna love this buddy.

I came here to wait and work. Also had breakfast and coffee. Peta‚Äôs presence and service is warm and superb! I like the interior design too. Wifi is not that fast, about 50 to 100mbps, but it‚Äôs free. It would be great if it‚Äôs 150mbps at least. Would come here for coffee or a meeting if you are looking for a nice cozy place.

Oono San been to his restaurant a few times before he moved to this new location about a year ago . Classic sushi without all the extra like caviar , nevertheless still serving very good sushi . Firstly , his sushi sari is perfect with the right amount of acidity  , didn‚Äôt miss a bit in the entire dinner . I typically love his kegani with uni and murasaki uni is so so good . Looks like I have found my new sushi place . Hope next time chef Oono San can have caviar in his kegani with the uni and it will be perfect . I will come back very often to this restaurant for sure . üëç

I have had a lot of omakases locally and in Japan. Chef Ohno ranks amongst the best of the best. One of the legends in this business. It's more than just a dinner - it's a beautifully crafted experience. Designed with love and passion, delivered with finese, perfection and professionalism. The balancing act from the first item to the last is just sublime.

Also huge shoutout to Chef Ohno's wife for the fantastic and brilliant array of wine and Sake. Trust me, there will be a bottle for all palate. If Chef Ohno runs the food service, the wife drives the drinks service. A beautiful marriage indeed - literally and figuratively.

The SGD 350 set meal comes with different types of sashimi salmon, which are delicious enough and don‚Äôt require any sauce. However, it is recommended to match them with different pickles. There is a lot of sashimi. Although one piece, there should be different types such as hand rolls, kabayaki eel, caviar, scallops, fish liver, etc. In addition to salmon and tuna, other different fish should be introduced in that section.

Attentive service! My second time here, just realized there a corner where kids get to do some coloring. Kids eat free menu is on condition that an adult meal ordered.  Deals on eatigo is more worthy :) ‚Ä¶

Attentive service! My second time here, just realized there a corner where kids get to do some coloring. Kids eat free menu is on condition that an adult meal ordered.  Deals on eatigo is more worthy :)

Pizza is crispy and delicious!
Lots of clams in white wine spaghetti
Pork ribs is soft and tender.

Would come back again.

free juice, or wing for review

cosy environment, frenly staff, cheap parking right across the road at Guthrie house mall

Pizza is crispy and delicious!
Lots of clams in white wine spaghetti
Pork ribs is soft and tender.

Would come back again.

cosy environment, frenly staff, cheap parking right across the road at Guthrie house mall

Mee Siam (SGD $6.90) @ Rumah Sayang.
.
Opened in June 2013 by the Red Ginger Group, this casual eatery is known for their delicious Malay-Peranakan dishes, and typically attracts queues during meal times.
.
Their rendition has springy rice vermicelli noodles, crisp garlic chives, crisp bean sprouts, spongy tofu puffs, and bouncy hard boiled chicken egg, with grainy vegetal herbal eggy sweet savoury flavour.
.
The gravy is thin and mellow, with mild savoury sweet zesty sour tangy spice flavour, with a slight kick from added lime juice.
.
The unique addition is otah, the tender soft spiced fish paste having a smoky savoury salty spice flavour.

Food just average nothing special only expensive price. 3 bed and rice cost me $6.00. They let my laksa at other table while I standing at cashier after I seat they call out laksa while I take multiple laksa There is house fly on it. the receipt still with me

Today's 2 Nasi Lemak was terrible, barely elidable.  All the items that came with this dish have problems...

- there was almost an entire egg shell embedded in the scrambled eggs.
- the vegetable achar were basically raw with ZERO vinegar.
- the fried chicken wing was limp and basically tasteless ... and no, I do not have COVID.

You just lost a regular customer.

business_name: Acqua e Farina - Italian Pizza & Pasta Restaurant . Rail Mall
text:
Chef Roberto was very nice to curate a special menu for my event. His team was also very friendly and helpful. The highlight of the night was the food. They were delicious! Thankful that the corkage was free for the night and this has allowed us to pair those good food with our own wines.

An excellent choice for authentic Italian food with great service!

business_name: Acqua e Farina - Italian Pizza & Pasta Restaurant . Rail Mall
text:
the focaccia (first serving complimentary) is flat like a naan not sure why, tastes decent but had better at swissotel‚Äôs Prego. It‚Äôs free so I shall not nitpick on it.

the mains were great though, the pasta was really nice, tasted like something my italian grandma would cook if I had an italian grandma and it just felt homely and rustic. pizza was great, but I don‚Äôt know why they can‚Äôt cut 6 slices for us since there were six of us. they die die just want to cut 8 slices erm ok lol. Not sure why that is so difficult. Pasta portions are on the smaller side. Expected more for that pricing tbh. Steak‚Äôs okay, chef did a salt bae demonstration for us but personally felt a little underseasoned.

Pasta‚Äôs in the $30-40 range, can‚Äôt remember the price for pizza but similar-ish to the pasta. Steak‚Äôs $80. Not cheap but worth it the price point.

Overall I would definitely come again to relive my imaginary Italian grandma‚Äôs cooking

EDIT:
Came back to eat again and realised their risotto was sausage is really one super small sausage. LOL. $30 for that. just wow. just see the last pic
Good Indian food. Pre call order also available

Review: Disappointing Thai Meal Experience

Ordered three dishes and was thoroughly disappointed with the overall quality and preparation.
‚Ä¢	Green Curry: Watery and overly dominated by coconut milk, lacking any real green curry flavor. The brinjal was undercooked‚Äîpractically raw. We returned it and requested a re-cook, but the second version wasn‚Äôt much better. It still tasted more like coconut water than curry.
‚Ä¢	Tom Yum Soup: Lacked depth‚Äîneither spicy nor sour. Ingredients were minimal: just two prawns, some frozen-tasting chicken pieces, and potato squid. Felt like shortcuts were taken with the broth.
‚Ä¢	Fried Thai Egg: While flavorful, it was excessively oily and heavy.

Although the pricing was on the cheaper side, the food quality fell short and were poorly prepared, with little care in cooking or presentation. Sadly, it‚Äôs not a place I would return to.

Pretty good Thai food around Bukit Panjang CCK area. Order via their online platform and managed to get free delivery when ordered >$40 (not sure is it only applicable for other area too). The serving I have to say is really generous even for takeaway/delivery order. will definitely order again.

Friend say heard about this stall and wanted to try.. came to eat around 8pm..

Had the lousiest Thai food here in this coffeeshop. Do not waste your calories for this.. This shop took over the zichar place which was decent.. sad max.. previously this stall was a smaller store in same coffeeshop.

My first time trying this stall and totally regretted it.. pls be patient for my long review..

Location.. store is in a typical coffeeshop.. nothing more can be said.. close to heartlands..

Price.. more expensive than ur typical hawker fare.. at first thought that the price would be justified by the quality.. $9 for a small kangkong, 6.50 for basil chicken and egg is typically what I would pay for zichar.. tomyam soup was at $8.. would pay willingly for decent fare..

Taste of food
Goodness. Help. I dont know to complain to store owner or not.. im a typical Chinese who was brought up to clean off my plate to not have wastage.. but omg.. the food was so bad tt I could not swallow my dinner..  see the remains of my dinner that I cannot stomach cause it was so horrendous.. I kid you not. More than half my plate and a full bowl of soup was left untouched.

First dish served was the basil chicken w rice and fried egg. Asked for totally cooked egg and the staff promised it to be cooked.. but served the runny side up with raw eggwhite on top of the yolk.. not how I like my eggs to be.. ok nvm..

Taste of the basil chicken.. it tasted like the basil chicken went for a swim in water and plunged itself into my plate. Whole dish was wet like a pond.. chicken tasted weird as if it was kept frozen and reheated when ordered.. meat tasted old and extra tough.. not sure what went wrong..

Second dish came the kangkong.. fried got wokhei.. not too bad.. but the seasoning was off and had no taste towards the end.. it tasted like salt was sprinkled on the top but it wasn't seasoned at the bottom after u ate the top portion off..

Last was the Tom yum goong which was damn oily with preserved food such as crabstick and fish cake.. and 1 small pathetic prawn that was dried and soaked till it was wrinkly..

Tasted one mouth of the soup and immediately questioned my life.. it was sweeter than coconut red Ruby dessert. Totally cannot take another spoonful of this sweet dessert.. wonder if I ordered the wrong item.. only took a spoonful of the soup.. whole bowl wasted.. sweet like dessert.. I've had my share of tomyumgoong.. dont try to tell me is the coconut taste.. it is totally wrong..

30mins into the meal, everything was left half untouched.. was damn hungry but the only good thing was the egg.. my photo show the wastage that I cannot stomach due to the quality of food.. for the price of $30, I would expect decent food.. I dun mind if it was not as nice as sanook or nakhon.. but at least make it edible...

Ok ill get straight to the point.

Feedback=

1. Portion size dropped by half brug
2. Affordable to a certain extend
3. Bruh like they gave us free mooping its good but i rather u take that money to bigger portion size.
4. Ik la inflation wtv but still the portion is NOT IT. Pls review your portion size.
5. I would rather u increase the price and portion with it

Overall the quality and taste is there but the quantity is like??

Taste 8/10
Portion 2/10
1 plate
Will come back? Nope.

I rather go other thai places with higher price and bigger portion

Receptionist, Cynthia of sakae holdings is extremely rude. Bad tone of voice talking to someone that is just coming here for an interview. Instructions during phone calls were also rude and practically shouting. Will definitely not come here again.
very nice for kids it is water park call wild wild

Dined at Tomidou recently and was pleasantly surprised by the exquisite tuna and sea urchin sushi. It practically melted in my mouth, and the rice was perfectly seasoned. I inquired with the chef and learned that all ingredients are air freighted from Japan, ensuring exceptional freshness. The restaurant's decor, some of which is the chef's own collection from Japan, adds to the authenticity. The highlight, though, was a delightful combination of various tuna cuts and sea urchin wrapped in seaweed offering a delightful medley of textures and flavors, enhanced by soy sauce and wasabi. The chef is generous with the portion. My meal continued with a delectable miso soup featuring sweet and fresh clams. For dessert I indulged in handmade hojicha ice cream made by one of the chefs which was both pure and fragrant providing a refreshing end to the meal. The restaurant boost delightful ambience making it perfect choice for celebratory occasions. Private rooms are also available for those seeking a more intimate dining experience. Keep in mind that they exclusively accept dinner reservation.

Had an extremely enjoyable experience at Tomidou! The chefs and restaurant staff went above and beyond to make our omakase meal a special experience, taking the time to explain the source and choice of ingredients used and even finding out the answers to any queries we may have. Do note that the establishment is reservation only, so do call ahead to book to avoid disappointment!

Dish 1: Tuna sushi from Ooma city, which is famed for their bluefin tuna.  The tuna melts in your mouth and the rice was perfectly done; how the chef managed to get individual grains of rice while still making them stick together escapes me. Ratio of rice to fish to wasabi to sauce was perfect.

Dish 2: Uni sushi from Hokkaido. The uni was very creamy, carrying a mild taste of the sea and complemented the smoky fragrance of the seaweed, which had been roasted over binchotan.

Dish 3: Rice dish with grilled fish, served with sauce from crab and Yuzu. The fragrance from the grilled fish and seaweed complemented the umami sauce. My favourite dish of the meal.

Dish 4: Toromaki made with ootoro, chuutoro and uni. Every bite managed to deliver a different flavour; the creamy uni was first to melt in your mouth, followed by ootoro the chuutoro. All the different ingredients managed to keep their unique flavours while still being cohesive as a dish.

5. Miso soup made with Shijimi clams, served delicately in a cute cup. The clams lends itself to a rich complex soup taste while still being light enough to be a comfort sip at the end of the day

6. Hojicha ice cream served in an elegant glass bowl. The scent of roasted tea successfully cleanses the palate and delivers a perfect ending to an exquisite experience enjoyed.

Visited this place for lunch with a friend. It was a gastronomic experience, the ingredients were freshly prepared and the presentation was really pretty too. I particularly enjoyed the chawanmushi with the scallop and rice. The service staff were very attentive. Overall a good experience for people looking to have Omakase.

This place looks so atas. Walked in and it‚Äôs a big dining room. There were so many dishes that I loved and never found anywhere else. Smoked bonito and , best combo I asked chef to give me another serving. Second up was a seriously delicious cold white corn soup? How does white corn soup taste so good? Very very refreshing. The AYU fish was fried to perfection even the bones could be eaten. The Uni crab bowl was also luxury for me. Chawanushi there had 2 types of cheese in it - totally something I‚Äôve never tried. They also gave us some rice so add into it! Loved the generous portion of fruits as dessert also.

The full meal was all about fishes and seafood. There wasn‚Äôt any ‚Äúmeat‚Äù / poultry dishes‚Ä¶ but I was still full from all of it.

There was also free parking :D
But we had to call a valet because we were drinking. Chef was also very courteous, he sent us right out the door!
Lunch was $300++.

Beautiful interior design, staff were super attentive and fast.

My favourite dish was the Chawanmushi with scallop. It has a cheese flavour, which was really surprising. Tasted really good especially when mixed with the wasabi. Never had Chawanmushi like this before!

Highly recommended for an affordable Omakase üëç

Would say that this is a place to head to if you have a big family looking for affordable options that can feed big appetites!

The portions were generous, even the rice bowls would come overflowing with rice! The dishes were all well priced given that the quantity of meat in every dish is really big, just look at the photos of the dishes! Compared to most tze char places out there, they definitely do not skim on the servings here!

Also, each dish was flavourful with a lot of wok hey taste. However, just note that delicious food tend to be more on the unhealthy side so I would say the flavours also come from the generous amount of oil. Regardless, if you‚Äôre rating high on the taste side, this place definitely does a great job üëè

Our recommended dishes here include the beef (beef slices are always soooo tender), chicken in kungpao sauce, tomato egg and the tofu (generous servings of spinach under the tofu not pictured).

Service is generally ok, more of a casual dining style. The servers are rather attentive so not to worry about wanting to add on more orders. Drinks are self service which was quite interesting and fuss free.

All in all, love this place!

Note: dine in earlier before the peak dinner period. Tend to be filled with many students and parking may be further out from the restaurant

First of all, service attitude was very poor and extremely disappointing. Not that we were expecting a high class service or anything, but the counter staff had a very unpleasant disposition when we walked into the restaurant and did not bother to acknowledge us or even look at us in the eye.

During the ordering process, she sent the wrong order to the kitchen as we only ordered 2 skewers - 1 mantou, 1 pork with enoki mushroom (see attached photo.) She simply insisted that we ordered 2 of the pork & enoki mushroom skewers but we only ordered 1. Even after we explained to her she still gave us bad attitude and we had to clarify once again. Then, she reluctantly changed our order.

That was not all. After receiving our food, we were shocked and astonished at the disastrous quality of the food (see attached photo.) We have eaten skewers elsewhere before and we know what to expect from a typical Chinese restaurant, and this certainly is way below the bar. The mantou (bread) is not even fried properly and does not have any taste, while the pork & enoki mushroom skewer was pathetically small and unappetising and of course no taste as well just salt.

Although we only made a small order, but don't we still have customer rights and deserve the basic respect? We are appalled at this restaurant and its food standards and hope that the management can do something about this.

Would say that this is a place to head to if you have a big family looking for affordable options that can feed big appetites!

The portions were generous, even the rice bowls would come overflowing with rice! The dishes were all well priced given that the quantity of meat in every dish is really big, just look at the photos of the dishes! Compared to most tze char places out there, they definitely do not skim on the servings here!

Also, each dish was flavourful with a lot of wok hey taste. However, just note that delicious food tend to be more on the unhealthy side so I would say the flavours also come from the generous amount of oil. Regardless, if you‚Äôre rating high on the taste side, this place definitely does a great job üëè

Service is generally ok, more of a casual dining style. The servers are rather attentive so not to worry about wanting to add on more orders. Drinks are self service which was quite interesting and fuss free.

All in all, love this place!

Note: dine in earlier before the peak dinner period. Tend to be filled with many students and parking may be further out from the restaurant
