During the ordering process, she sent the wrong order to the kitchen as we only ordered 2 skewers - 1 mantou, 1 pork with enoki mushroom (see attached photo.) She simply insisted that we ordered 2 of the pork & enoki mushroom skewers but we only ordered 1. Even after we explained to her she still gave us bad attitude and we had to clarify once again. Then, she reluctantly changed our order.

That was not all. After receiving our food, we were shocked and astonished at the disastrous quality of the food (see attached photo.) We have eaten skewers elsewhere before and we know what to expect from a typical Chinese restaurant, and this certainly is way below the bar. The mantou (bread) is not even fried properly and does not have any taste, while the pork & enoki mushroom skewer was pathetically small and unappetising and of course no taste as well just salt.

Although we only made a small order, but don't we still have customer rights and deserve the basic respect? We are appalled at this restaurant and its food standards and hope that the management can do something about this.

Uncooked food and misleading. Terrible, horrible experience. Would have given 0 stars if possible.

Drunken chicken (~$10++) was overcooked, meat texture is like a few days old or boiled in soup before, small portion and hot (its supposed to be a cold dish). Sauce had no taste of alcohol at all. I have tasted several qualities of drunken chicken before and this is definitely 100% NOT drunken chicken.

When we approached the waitress and waiter to clarify about the food, they insisted that the drunken chicken was in fact drunken chicken. Refused to change. Refused to refund too. Waitress offered to get the chef out to clarify but he never came out.

BBQ scallop ($5++ each) was raw and undercooked. Potential food poisoning hazard. NEA, please note. My cousin, who is pregnant, was about to eat the entire scallop but her mother noticed that the scallop was undercooked. The implications of eating raw uncooked frozen seafood during pregnancy is dire.

Regarding the scallop, they refused to give a new one and only gave the option of re-heating the scallop they served. Talk about customer service.

Restaurant name is È¶ôÊ∏ØÂ∞èÂé® (hong kong kitchen) but the dishes were not hong kong style but mainland chinese style. Totally misleading. But that aside, how could a restaurant serve such bad/low standard of food?

Will not go again.

My family and I do not feel safe eating in this restaurant.

Bad customer service.

Google reviews was inaccurate.

Terrible experience.

went for a weekend lunch, wasn't too crowded and decor made it a very homely and cosy environment in general. most of the food looked mouth-watering and tasted even better. ordered their quesadillas and added $3 for beef, kitchen sink burrito, tiramisu cake and a lime margerita. in my opinion, their quesadillas are a must with their generous cheese, meat and dips. burrito was basically the quesadillas but with shredded cheese instead of melted cheese and with spinach rice wrapped inside which i thought was decent but not as tasty as their quesadillas. however, the tiramisu did not meet our expectations partly due to the amount of compliments we've seen of it online, which set our bar high for it. it did not have a "strong coffee" taste at all as seen its description and we couldn't taste the kahlua coffee liquor AT ALL which was really disappointing. as for the margerita, it was slightly on the diluted side and a fresh lime would have been better instead of the dried lime which didn't really give it the citrus flavour.

An amazing and romantic way to spend our last night visiting Singapore !

High points include the great service by our server Naresh who was very entertaining to talk to and gave great energy to our fun night . The food was decadent and rich and near perfection - all flavours were incredible and the dishes were seasoned perfectly . I wish the scallop dish was brought out separate from the cold starters as by the time we got to the scallop, it was cold but still delectable . My boyfriend had the wagyu beef steak as the main and he said it was the very definition of ‚Äúmelt in your mouth ‚Äú - I‚Äôm not a steak person (I chose the cod as my main) but even I had to admit the steak was the best I‚Äôve ever tried in my life!  I‚Äôve gone to a lot of fancier restaurants like this but for my boyfriend it was his first experience at a restaurant like this and he enjoyed every single dish that we were served for our 5 course meal!

As for some points of criticism:

I reserved the garden dome and it was very pretty and private - only half of the inside of the dome had fairy lights which was unfortunate as having more fairy lights would have made the interior that much more magical as I absolutely love beautiful lighting (the exterior lighting was spot-on).  The AC unit inside the dome was hard do control - at times it was too cold and other times we had issues turning it on or regulating the temperature which took a little bit away from the garden dome experience so  the AC maintenance needs some work. Because the dome is so private and enclosed, there is a bit of an echo effect any time a sound was made inside the dome including our own voices which was an odd sensation but entertaining nonetheless - as a result of the extreme privacy, it was also very quiet inside the dome if not for our own conversations (but given the echo effect I would presume a speaker playing music inside the dome would be too echo-ey). Luckily towards the last half of the meal, there was a live band in the main restaurant that played loudly enough that we could hear it softly through our dome which was fantastic as they played great covers of 90s alternative rock songs !

As we arrived for a late 830pm reservation, by the time we finished our meal the rest of the restaurant had started to close and turn off the rest of their beautiful garden and restaurant lights so unfortunately we couldn‚Äôt walk around and enjoy the rest of the facilities afterwards but walking through initially I did get a sneak peek of how spacious and beautifully decorated both floors of the restaurant was so I look forward to booking a table in other areas of the restaurant the next time I visit !

Overall, an amazing experience in an amazing city!

My fiance chose Botanico to propose our engagement, and it was an unforgettable experience!

The atmosphere was magical‚Äîset in a private dome that we had all to ourselves for over two hours, while enjoying a beautiful five-course meal. The setting was intimate and perfect for the occasion, and the service was outstanding throughout. The staff were incredibly attentive and thoughtful, especially as my fianc√© had planned a surprise for me.

A special shoutout to Prisca Ellanie, our main server, who went above and beyond. She was warm, accommodating, and made us feel truly special‚Äîsurprising us with a complimentary dessert and even helping capture photos to remember the moment.

The food was excellent, made with locally sourced ingredients, including fresh farm-to-table vegetables from their own garden.

All in all, it was a truly memorable way to mark such a meaningful chapter in our lives.

Got the summerhouse garden dome package.

Food was ok. We loved their appetisers, especially the scallop. Mains and desserts were ok.

What was good was the atmosphere in the dome. We really like the fairy lights as they added on to the romantic vibes. Furthermore, we were being served by restaurant manager Narresh Permalu, a very friendly and funny staff who would make the effort to talk to us. The occasion at hand was a proposal, so he made small talk with us while serving the food.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Botanico at The Summerhouse, and it was an absolutely wonderful experience from start to finish. Tucked away in the tranquil greenery of Seletar Aerospace Park, this restaurant offers a peaceful escape from the bustle of city life, making it perfect for those seeking a relaxing yet refined dining experience.

The atmosphere is simply stunning ‚Äì an elegant blend of rustic charm and modern sophistication. The lush garden surrounding the space creates a serene vibe, making it feel like you‚Äôre dining in a secret garden. The outdoor seating area is perfect for enjoying the cool breeze while surrounded by nature, and inside, the ambiance is cozy yet stylish with its sleek decor and open kitchen concept.

Now, let's talk about the food! The menu is a celebration of fresh, locally sourced ingredients, and you can really taste the care and quality in each dish. I highly recommend the signature dishes‚Äîeach plate is a beautiful balance of flavors, textures, and presentation. Whether you‚Äôre a fan of meat, seafood, or plant-based options, there‚Äôs something for every palate.

We had the Japanese Hamburg and Iberico pork collar for our mains. Followed by the taro panda cotta for dessert which left our bellies satisfied.

The service was exceptional as well. The staff was warm, knowledgeable, and genuinely passionate about the food and drinks they were serving. They were happy to recommend pairings and offered great insights into the sourcing and preparation of the dishes.

If you're looking for a place that offers not just delicious food, but also an experience that feels both special and intimate, Botanico at The Summerhouse is the place to be. It‚Äôs perfect for a romantic dinner, a special occasion, or even a peaceful brunch with friends.

Not to mention, the manager of this establishment, Narresh, is also such a fun, welcoming, and course handsome fella‚Äô

So I can‚Äôt wait to return again during my wedding lunch at the end of this year!

Great ambience, a caf√© with a cool outdoor camping vibe that‚Äôs Instagram worthy.

But food? Honestly, skip the truffle fries. Paid $18 expecting truffle goodness, but all I got was plain fries with zero truffle flavor. Is truffle oil really that expensive, or are they just being stingy?

Ordered the tiger prawn aglio olio for $28, and it tasted like something you‚Äôd get at Saizeriya. The only saving grace was the size of the prawn, but it wasn‚Äôt even fresh.

Also, a heads up, the high ratings here might be because they waive your drinks if you leave a Google review but only if it‚Äôs 4 stars or above. Now you know why the reviews look so good.

And about the service charge you‚Äôre paying, what exactly does it cover? Just bringing you the food, which McDonald‚Äôs does for free. Not even a free glass of water refill for the prices they charge. Just skip this place.

Location inside Causeway Point Shopping Mall.
Not too crowded during lunch time.
Was promptly led to my seats and the menu was given to me quite fast.
Ordered was supposedly to be placed by scanning the QR code, but there was an error message, hence the staff placed the order on our behalf.
Food was a quite nice, loved the chestnut pork.
Delicious meal.
Thankfully, I used the free dessert to enjoy the ice cream.
Overall experience was great.
Would come again soon!

A Cosy small restaurant with premium meat cuts Dons or Mix Dons. I ordered the triple Buta Pork meat. I cannot taste the meat as there is overwhelming Yakiniku BBQ sauce. Meat are easy to chew but on the salty side for me. Lucky they have Asahi Super Dry Beer 1 for 1  to wash the salty taste. Surprised the chicken Naban taste good and it free serve as we spent more than $65 in one seating.

It was our first time dining there for lunch. Service offered & the food quality were great! We ordered the Premium Buta Bara Don (Pork Belly Ricebowl), Iberico Hoho Don (Pork Jowl Ricebowl) - both with Onsen Tamago, Jumbo Kaki Fry (Fried Oysters), Unagi Kubayaki, as well as Genmai Hot Tea. The tea were refillable which is great, however the Kaki Fry wasnt really up to our expectation on the physical aspects, probably due to the word "jumbo" and the menu illustration, but nonetheless it still taste great with their house tartare sauce.

We were served by an Indian lady - Ms Jagjit Kaur, she was friendly and proactive in her service, ensuring we enjoyed the dining experience in Aburi-En. Kudos to her attentiveness and hardwork :)

Minus 1 star - The cashier (Asian Chinese middle-aged lady with low ponytail) that attended to us wasn't wearing ANY MASK at all, during the whole payment process. If I wasn't mistaken, she might be having her meal or resting at the back of house before she was called by another staff to handle our payment. Even if that's the case, kindly advise your staff to wear mask at all times especially when dealing with guests. its not nice to be seen without a mask in public nowadays, unless the outlet/person wants to get fine by the Government:'). FYI, payment was made at 14:23 on 02/03/2021.

Visited on 27 August 2022 evening 7pm. Not crowded.
Quality is acceptably good. However a bit pricey. Would have given 5 stars if the rice is filling enough and the meat given were reasonable sufficient. The miso soup ought to be given more to the brim of the bowl to customers because we paid for the miso soup which does not come free with the donburi! The squid of that day was a bit tough, should be overcooked on that day!
So looking forward to a more filling meal on my next visit!

Everything was good, the service staff were friendly and helpful especially Justin and Kayven. Tomahawk was done to perfection! We enjoyed the food and wine. But the pork shank is a little disappointing as it was covered with too much sauce and we would prefer the skin to be crispy and crunchy type. Great experience and beautiful cave. environment. The parking was free after 6pm

This is a top notch dining place. The food was superb. We had the signature mushroom soup, grilled lamb, grilled prawns, grilled cauliflower and also mushrooms for sides. The service was great. The team checked in with us if we were enjoying the food, if we have suggestions for improvements, and before we asked; staff stepped in to volunteer to help us take photos. Upon knowing it was my friend‚Äôs birthday, they served a slice of tiramisu cake on the house. Will definitely return even though the location is quite out of the way. But the experience really calls for a second visit. Keep up the awesome service!!!!

Cavern Restaurant offers a unique dining experience with its impressive cave-inspired setting, the first and only one of its kind in Singapore. The ambience is lovely, and the service is great. The staff were friendly, efficient, and even helped take great photos for us, which was a nice touch. However, the experience was slightly marred by the fact that we were served the wrong food twice.

As for the food:
‚Ä¢	Mushroom soup: Tasty and enjoyable.

‚Ä¢	Mushroom ragout fettuccine: Supposedly their signature dish, but it didn‚Äôt live up to expectations. The sauce lacked depth, and I struggled to finish it. I also noticed another diner leaving behind a sizable portion.

‚Ä¢ Little Miner‚Äôs Spaghetti: A complete letdown for the little one. It barely had any sauce, and despite the menu stating spaghetti, it was served with rigatoni instead. The pasta could have been cooked a little longer, and ironically, the grapes on the plate were the best part of the dish. It felt like very little thought was put into this dish.

‚Ä¢	Balinese dark chocolate tart: Good flavor, but not sure why the toffee layer was so hard.

Overall, a great place for the ambience, but the food quality needs tremendous improvement. I‚Äôd return for the unique setting, but with different menu choices.

Celebrated a birthday here. Excellent service staff made us feel very comfortable and at ease. Food served quite quickly even for drinks and food item orders added-on during our meal. The staff prepared a small tiramisu as a birthday treat which was a nice gesture. Food is good and that‚Äôs living up to the Tung Lok brand. Will come again. Free parking at P1 West car park from 6pm-12am.

First time here and I really liked the unique cave setting! Menu isn‚Äôt huge, but the food came out super fast. Parking‚Äôs free after 6pm and it‚Äôs just a short walk to the restaurant. Portions were good for the price too. Overall, worth checking out!

business_name: Mari Mari Seafood - Woodlands Koufu Headquarters
text: Very tasty with reasonable price. Hope can keep the 1-1 free crabs offer.

business_name: Mari Mari Seafood - Woodlands Koufu Headquarters
text:
Contacted Novestine via Whatsapp and he prepared the menu for us based on our budget. He was very thoughtful and i did not regret leaving the choice to him. He was honest and said that as there were only 4 of us, there would have been too much food if he gave me a big fish and so he reduced the size. We had fish maw soup with baby abalone to start and this was one of my faves. It was not starchy. Even the abalone was  yummy and tender. Their signature flying noodles was packed with flavour. Pomfret was super fresh and the scallops, smothered in garlic was awesome! Another favourite dish for me. By the time the crab came, we were so full! Still we stuffed our faces. The crab was plump with meat and sweet! Sauce was a little on the sweet side and not spicy. I would have preferred it spicier. Overall, a really finger licking good meal and Ethan was very friendly too. He made sure we saw our crab before it, erhm, made its sacrifice for our meal . Will definitely be back for more.

Note to non- smokers: sit further away from the shop and nearer to the caifan shop next time as smokers kept going to where we were seated. It was quite unpleasant to have folks smoking when we were eating. But this has nothing to do with mari mari! In fact, their guys smoked far far away from the kopitiam!

business_name: Mari Mari Seafood - Woodlands Koufu Headquarters
text: First time was dining in. Brought family of 10 there. The portion are very generous. Given free mantou for the chilli crabs. ‚Ä¶

business_name: Mari Mari Seafood - Woodlands Koufu Headquarters
text:
First time was dining in. Brought family of 10 there. The portion are very generous. Given free mantou for the chilli crabs.

2nd time was take away. The grab app menu not much choice. The staff given me the menu list via WA. Everything was fast n smooth transaction. The best seafood in Woodlands. No regrets.

business_name: Mari Mari Seafood - Woodlands Koufu Headquarters
text: Nice environment to eat unfortunately taste of food was lacking. Kolo Mee($8) might as well just call it soya sauce noodles bcos thats what it tasted like. Egg noodles tossed in soya sauce with some fishy tasting small pieces of seafood. ‚Ä¶

business_name: Mari Mari Seafood - Woodlands Koufu Headquarters
text:
Ordered seafood crab porridge, seafood sambal fried rice and seafood tom yam soup for dinner. Joanne was accommodating when call her to change my order without hesitation. My order was send according to my preference timing.
My star dinner was the seafood crab porridge.  The taste were WOW! And I'm surprised that the portion is good. For $90 (2 crabs) I got 2 containers of porridge. My family members also said that the porridge is BEST!

business_name: Mari Mari Seafood - Woodlands Koufu Headquarters
text:
Delicious ÂÖ∞Â∑ûÁâõËÇâÈù¢ (Beef Noodles) and Â§ßÁõòÈ∏°(Big Plate Chicken) from this Halal Tze Char place that has a wide range of seafood selection, as well as the standard Tze Char menu.

Big Plate Chicken (Â§ßÁõòÈ∏°Ôºâ: Generous portion of Chicken drumstick which is very tender and broth is tasty too! Definitely one of the better ones I‚Äôve tried.

Beef Noodles (ÂÖ∞Â∑ûÁâõËÇâÊãâÈù¢Ôºâ: Soup is tasty and noodles are springy.

Parking at Koufu HQ is plentiful and they have free parking from 12-2pm and 6-8pm daily. Seating is spacious and place is airy and comfortable.

Highly recommended!

business_name: Mari Mari Seafood - Woodlands Koufu Headquarters
text: Nice environment to eat unfortunately taste of food was lacking. Kolo Mee($8) might as well just call it soya sauce noodles bcos thats what it tasted like. Egg noodles tossed in soya sauce with some fishy tasting small pieces of seafood. Sliced fish mala($12) came in a watery mild tasting soup barely taste any flavour except some flavor from the mala oil. No stock taste at all. The sliced fishes provided was also very fishy, I couldnt eat most of it. Spent about $20 hoping to have a nice meal but left very unsatisfied. Needless to say will never come back again.

Cheval once sat comfortably close to my place near Kensington Square, taunting me on a frequent basis whenever friends were looking for a quiet spot for a meetup. Of course, fate has a sense of humor, and by the time I finally decided to give it a shot, it had packed its bags and moved to a far-flung corner of the island.

The new location boasts a spacious, pet-friendly alfresco area that dwarfs its indoor seating. It is a paradise for pet lovers but perhaps less so for non-pet-friendly folks.

Food-wise, imagine stepping into a time machine and landing in the pre-Michelin Singapore of the 2000s. The dishes are nostalgic in terms of taste, cooking technique and (lack of) presentation. Prices have been scaled back to pre-pandemic levels at this new location, which sounds like a win‚Äîuntil you realize the trade-offs.

Portions are dainty, marination feels like an afterthought, and frozen ingredients dominate the plates.
- Lobster Bisque: More like a bowl of orange cream, topped with a single piece of frozen lobster.
- Fish and Chips: Lightly battered to the point of being shy.
- Beef Cubes: Best of the lot, but accompanying sauce tastes too zesty.
- Seafood Paella: Takes the cake with extremely small portion, topped with frozen seafood.

It is evident the chef knows his/her craft, but when working with ingredients this underwhelming, even the best techniques can‚Äôt save the day. A real shame really, as the food has so much potential.

The cocktail, however, is the saving grace of this place. It a throwback to the good old days when cocktails were unapologetically potent and actually tasted like a cocktail instead of ‚Äúartisanal‚Äù. The whisky sour used simple sweetened cherry, lemon and orange that elevates humble bar-top whisky to greatness. The bartender deserves a standing ovation.

Service was quick, friendly, and refreshingly unobtrusive. In fact, I think one of them doubled up as the bartender. As for the ambiance, the rustic charm of horses strutting by while you dine lends the place an effortless classiness.

For pet owners, this spot is a gem compared to most pet-friendly cafes in Singapore, where ‚Äúpet-friendly‚Äù often translates to barely edible food. Cheval‚Äôs culinary shortcomings may be frustrating, but at least  you get good drinks and chill vibes.

Free parking‚Ä¶. dog friendly ! but i never bring my dog today. üòñ. perhaps next time if this bistro is still operating as Turf club is closing. Good food. excellent service with nice backdrop of horse riding activities just beside. nice place to chill‚Ä¶ try the fried mala cauliflower. it‚Äôs crispy

Thank you Quyen and team for the wonderful service, prompt attentiveness and also the delightful birthday dessert. Love the setup of the cafe amongst the relaxing views of the lush greenery and occasional horses moving within the compounds of Turf Club Riding Area.

Food was served within 10-15mins. Love the freshness of the salmon (one of the best options) and the tenderness of the Angus Beef as well. Otah Otah Starter was also very unique. Chocolate Lava cake tops it all off as a dessert.

Overall a lovely experience and service. They have good promos for beers too if you are keen. Parking is free but of course getting here is most convenient by car. Ambience is quiet and cosy enough for an enjoyable meal. Pets are welcomed too at the alfresco seating area.

My friends and I visited Cheval last Friday evening (4th of April) for dinner and drinks.

Food: 4/5 stars. The food was typical of what you would find in a bistro-bar. Taste wise, above average and overall good. There is nothing to complain about the food but also there is nothing super impressive or amazing. The prices are reasonable and of good value. Best dish: chicken wings

Service: 5/5 stars. The waiters are extremely attentive and polite. They remove finished dishes promptly and also top up our waters quickly.

Atmosphere: 2/5 stars. The only reason for the low score in this category is due to the awkward atmosphere of the open mic event. The hostess was awkward and lacked charm or wit, failing to attract customers to participate in her open mic event. I am still awarding 2 stars for her effort in persistently calling out to customers to ‚Äúcome try sing a song‚Äù and for her attempt in ‚Äúrara-ing‚Äù the crowd. Overall, the atmosphere could have been much better with just some light background music, or with a live band instead. I think in future I would visit during lunch time instead, apparently during lunch time there is a view of people riding horses just beside the bistro!

Edit: I am actually unsure if her role was actually hostess or singer, but I assumed hostess as her singing capabilities were far below average.

Located at Singapore Turf Club Riding Center
Great selection of bistro food.
Spectacular view of the Riding Center
Free and ample parking but need to walk up a high slope üòÅ.
The Cube Beef , shiok and delicious.  So soft and succulent.
The mushroom soup, thick, and crunchy feel of the bit mushroom and taste was great.
Overall, most of the food we ordered was above average.
Nice place to unwind . ü§©üòä

Super impressed by their chair grilled Kurobuta Pork Rack! Peri peri chicken was great too. Staff were busy today yet still managed pretty well. Children 11 and below can get their kids meal and portion is similar to the regular ones we adult get, also free ice cream and fruit juice for the kiddos. Parking is free yay!

business_name: LiXin Teochew Fishball Noodles - Causeway Point
text: Fuss free yummy fishball noodles. Love the tomato sauce + chilli pasta base. The cook didn't skimp on the crispy pork lard as well. Didn't catch the name of the cook this afternoon who made my bowl of noodles but it was great. Note: I ordered extra noodles

business_name: LiXin Teochew Fishball Noodles - Causeway Point
text:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
I recently tried the signature *mee pok* noodles here, and it was absolutely amazing! The noodles had the perfect  Q texture, springy and so satisfying. The soup was incredibly generous and full of flavour, a real highlight of the meal. The fishballs were chewy and bouncy, just the way they should be.

What really made the experience even better was the staff. They were super friendly, welcoming, and made sure I had everything I needed. Overall, this place is a must-visit for any noodle lover! Highly recommend!

https://vt.tiktok.com/ZS2mDMCM1/

We went weekend as early as 11am and had early bird discount 15%.

However there was a service failure on their promotion. They don‚Äôt inform us on ‚Ä¶

Food was great ‚Äî especially the duck, which was really enjoyable. However, the service experience fell short.

The ordering system requires scanning a QR code to use an app, but the app didn‚Äôt indicate the kitchen‚Äôs last order timing. I tried to place a takeaway order around 915pm, waited for 15 minutes, only to be informed (after I asked) that the kitchen had already closed at 9pm.

There was no proactive communication from the service crew, and no last call was made to the tables. I assumed the restaurant closed at 9:30pm, as is common for many F&B places, so this was quite disappointing. The staff seemed more focused on packing up than attending to customers.

It would be helpful if the app clearly displayed the kitchen‚Äôs last order time, or if staff could check in and give customers a heads-up. This would definitely improve the overall dining experience. Hope this can be taken into consideration moving forward!

We celebrated my father's birthday here.

It was Friday, it‚Äôs not allow reservations.
With our group of 12, we requested a private room. Arriving at 6:30 pm, we waited for over 2 hours.

Despite the wait, we thoroughly enjoyed our time there, especially the delicious dishes and helpful staff.

They offered a membership promo, either sign up for free or pay $38 for a better discount.

A suggestion for the restaurant - please consider setting dining-in times for private rooms to ensure fairness to all clients since reservations are not allowed.

We went weekend as early as 11am and had early bird discount 15%.

However there was a service failure on their promotion. They don‚Äôt inform us on there‚Äôs in-store credit card 1-1 soup promo either in their order app and claimed it‚Äôs customer‚Äôs responsibility to inform them which need room of improvement.

Otherwise customer service and serving has improved and was fast. Roasted duck serves was hot and crispy. Soup was always nice as well.

I enjoy eating at Dian Xiao Er and especially appreciate the 40% weekday discount they have for dining between 2:30-4:30 pm. Whenever I find myself having a late lunch, having a meal at Dian Xiao Er comes to mind! The dishes are delicious! ‚Ä¶

My first time to try Dian Xiao Er. The food is highly satisfying and price is reasonable to the standard and quality of food being served. I like their roasted ducks especially as  it has the unique taste and after effect lingering in the mouth upon consumption. Very satisfying and highly recommended. Not too salty and simply just right. Didn't expect much actually until I had my first try at Dian Xiao Er. Their services is excellent and good. They have the set meals and also during this challenging endemic period, a 20% discount during off peak hours. It is very worth to dine in especially during such non peak hours discount. Further to that, there is also a membership possibility to the added benefits. At a rate of SGD $88, it entitles you birthday discount, 4 portion of duck meat, etc.. All in all, a welcoming satisfaction of both food, services and money well spent for family dinning experience.

Came here several times for dinner and for the roast duck. The only dish worth eating at this restaurant chain is the roast duck. Other dishes are mediocre and don't leave much impression, except for their high price tags. The duck portion seems smaller over the years and the rice is undercooked and rock hard the last time I visited. The soup of the day was tasteless. 90$ for 3/4 duck, 3 rices and 2 soups of the day  (already with 10$ discount voucher thanks to the membership points) so it's very very expensive overall. The restaurant is packed in the evenings up to about 8 plus and practically empty by 830pm.

I enjoy eating at Dian Xiao Er and especially appreciate the 40% weekday discount they have for dining between 2:30-4:30 pm. Whenever I find myself having a late lunch, having a meal at Dian Xiao Er comes to mind! The dishes are delicious! I love the salted egg deshelled prawn dish most of all. I am not a duck-eater, and have always refrained from ordering duck or eating duck. However, to my surprise, I enjoy the duck here!

The promo of $88 (use OCBC-$75) is ready worth it. You will get 1 free whole free duck and 2 X $50 vouchers. The staff was very helpful and friendly. She helped to scan the promo code and explained the terms and conditions very in detail. ‚Ä¶

The promo of $88 (use OCBC-$75) is ready worth it. You will get 1 free whole free duck and 2 X $50 vouchers. The staff was very helpful and friendly. She helped to scan the promo code and explained the terms and conditions very in detail. The vouchers can also use for take away food. Even the free duck order in quarter or half portion, and to be continue with the next visit. Order some other dishes  nice too.

We went for early lunch and given early bird discount. Herbal duck is must order.
To end it with soy pudding. Lovely meal.

Good experience as per usual, always get the crispy duck wings and the buy 2 free 1 appetisers to share. Signature is the dang gui duck which I always get. Tried the plum chicken for the first time today, it's not bad.

Standard chinese cuisine with duck being the highlight. Tried five dishes.

Ten spices duck: Duck is tender and the skin is fragrant n crispy. Sauce is very herby but duck doesnt soak it up well so be sure to douse it in the sauce first. Not a big duck fan, but its decent nonetheless.

Hotplate tofu: Hotplate didnt come hot unfortunately but the sauce is pretty good. Tofu is very standard.

Broccoli n scallops: Very healthy dish. The sauce is thin n light not thick. Good for elderly but for me i prefer a dish with stronger fragrance.

Dong po meat: Sauce is good, meat is a little tough but still manageable. Overall a good rendition.

Fish maw soup: very light taste as it should be. Quite a generous serving of fish maw even in small portion. Small portion can serve up to 3 persons.

Hidden Gem that needs polishing. Tucked in the hidden earths of Singapore, good luck finding this place without a car / grab. But once you reach there, it is a pretty wide space to park your cars for free as it integrates with the plant ‚Ä¶

Hidden Gem that needs polishing. Tucked in the hidden earths of Singapore, good luck finding this place without a car / grab. But once you reach there, it is a pretty wide space to park your cars for free as it integrates with the plant nursery. We booked and received a booking reservation but upon reaching we‚Äôre told ‚Äúbook on same day no count üòÇ‚Äù, you have to wait like walk in. We visited on a holiday so it was packed during lunch. It took 2 hours to finish our lunch not because we took our time but the mains came late. Apparently only 1 chef on duty today. The quality no doubt is well cooked but our patience wears thin. In addition, as there is no air con seating, you need to battle hard with the flies constantly. Sits possibly 20-25 tables.

Lovely country side bistro to stop over in between wetland venture and farm-hopping. Price on the high side but taste wise super delicious with fresh ingredients.
We walked in around 5pm and were told no reservation would have to vacate our table by 7pm. Not sure if it's that popular as we were one of 2 tables eating there by 6pm. Best to call ahead I guess.
Probably the best peranakan food in Singapore. Do call or text to make a reservation as it can take a year for your turn.

Food is good but quite overpriced (per pax). Forgot to serve a dish and we were given a slight discount. Our makan group unanimously agreed it would be a once-off - many other peranakan restaurants are more competitive in terms of price and taste.

I'm my opinion, the best prata and Dalcha curry in SG... been a loyal customer of theirs for since 2015...sadly recently, only very recently, couple of the staff (1 skinny fella and another older uncle) got unhappy when I ask for slightly more curry than what most other ppl ask for and began charging me extra 50 cents per packet on top of the free curry they think I need to eat with my prata. I'm NOT other people and the curry I ask for is a reasonable amount BECAUSE I like to mix my curry with 3 kosong prata I buy weekly and I want my prata drowned in curry.. That's HOW I eat it...i don't like having my prata and curry separate and AM very Very VERY disappointed they began charging extra per packet of curry. Nonetheless, I'M Gonna be fair and say they do have (IN MY HONEST "EXPERT" OPINION) the best prata and Dalcha combo IN SINGAPORE.
$1.10 PER KOSONG/PLAIN
$1.60 PER TELUR/EGG
don't bother trying other westernised versions of prata cos they're just blasphemous.

To the owner of this prata stall... Don't be stingy with your curry... I'm prolly the only one (if not in the minority) that asks for ABIT more curry than what you THINK is enough for me. I've been faithfully going to Yr shop EVERY WEEKEND to buy 4 kosong + 1 telur ( I eat 3 kosong, wife eat 1 kosong 1 egg) I think I deserve abit more respect than having someone else tell me a certain amount of curry is enough for ME OWN DINING experience.

The food was quite mediocre. The fish and chips was quite poor, doesn't taste very fresh at all with rather chewy batter and an odd taste that I can't seem to figure if it's from the fish or the spices in the batter itself. Not to mention the corn and salad are honestly there more for presentation then actual taste, considering they give one measly quarter piece of corn and chopped up mixed greens.

The burger was fine, not amazing and not really worth the price either. Taste and size of the beef patty itself was fine, but tbh you'd get more value from a McDonald's burger, so don't waste your time and money getting a burger from here. Fries were good, but there are better sides to get to be honest.

Overall the food didn't taste all that good nor fresh, potions are decent but for the tiny corn and bland salad, they may as well provide two sides instead of one and get rid of the corn and salad since its basically nothing at that point. It's NOT bad for the price point, but I think you can definitely find better food for the price point.

lady staff would let customers wait in line while she unpacks boxes of takeaway boxes. she should at least inform customers to wait a while. when it was my turn, she just walked off to pack more boxes. then when she came over, i pointed to the qr code on the counter and told her that i wanted to collect hillion points for my receipt. but she told me to collect at hillion info counter. went 3 stories up to be informed that qr has been given to collin's and therefore could no longer give customers the points. went back to collins, wait again for the lady before she finally give us the points, complaining why info counter staff so free yet cannot help them.

food wise, it looks very good but taste very normal western food at food court. mushroom soup tasted like mixed with instant canned soup. spaghetti has a instant base taste too. the quality of food does not taste like Collin's, and for the price, Saizeraya's taste better. The ice lemon tea was best out of all that we hv ordered.

Service staff are very friendly, pleasant atmosphere during lunch time and fast service time. Often visit for easy family meal.
Outlet also happened to have seasonal offer for free dessert upon review after meal.

Sunday, 29 December 2024 update: The Sashimi Gozen dish took more than 30 minutes to prepare and arrive after ordering, which is unacceptable. Observed that the sashimi/sushi staff members were busy preparing takeaway/delivery orders. Staff should have the mentality to prioritise dine in orders first, instead of only preparing takeaway/delivery orders, if they are overwhelmed and can't cope.

20 October 2024 update: The Wafu Beef Wazen was rubbish today. Gravy was way too dark and too salty.

Although there was no queue when visited on 23 July 2023, the place was already crowded. Ordering was fuss free and easy via scanning the QR code on the table. Also managed to redeem the free Aka item by informing the server. There was a normal wait for the food to arrive. Part of the total bill was offset by eCapita Voucher. Overall a good experience.

28 May 2023 - No queue when arrived on weekend morning. Ordering was fuss free and easy via the QR code provided. Food and drink came shortly after we placed our order. Settling of bill afterwards was also simple and straightforward. Food and drink were good. Overall a pleasant experience.

Mee Siam nice
Boss nice, once monthly do charity give out food free vegetarian bee hoon set to promote vegetarian

‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîLocation üìç‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
One floor below the exit of Choa Chu Kang MRT (red line) station, easily accessible üëåüèª

‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîAtmosphere ‚òÅÔ∏è‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
The table quite small.

BUT

‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîFood üç±‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
The food portion is HUGEüòÇ ( No wonder they provide a reduce portion option in the menu), if you are a small eater, please select it, or you will be struggling to finish the food.

Taste wise, I personally feel like it's still ok, not until the WOW level, but definitely acceptable. The tomato soup is very thick, and it is really concentrated with tomato LOL, no wonder it is call tomato soup. For the SiChuan soup, I am actually ABIT surprise by the colour (it's not red, but yellow)

‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîService üíÅ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüíÅ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüíÅ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Not really crowded, so there is no waiting time (I went during weekdays), the waitress can't speak Chinese, so do speak English with themüëâüëà

Can try, not badüò≥

Honestly, I find the prices of the food here a little overpriced. The prices indicated on the menu is before GST (unlike another similar looking food chain). Anyways, my brother and I ordered 2 mains and it totalled to $28.

Thankfully, both dishes didn‚Äôt taste too bad, unlike the other time in JE where the pasta was watery.

And I don‚Äôt like how the tables are placed so near each other‚Ä¶. It‚Äôs so hard to get in and out. Imagine if you bought free flow drinks? The whole vibe is just not it.

Came here for lunch on a weekday, and it was my 1st time dining at Milan Shokudo, which I have heard the food options be similar to Saiz*riya but the Halal version! I'm quite excited to try this place when I know I can bring my Muslim friends here!

üíß Water is complimentary & and self-service.

Price range starts from $6-$13 for mains for an aglio olio, which is pretty okay-ish for price. We wanted to order the lunch set deals, but the online product listing kept switching on and off? I'm not sure if it's a bug glitch because we can't order the pasta set either, when the hot plate set was the only one off. Yet when we checked with the staff again, the hot plate was back on, but the pasta was not. A lot of the items were also out of stock during lunch hour as well. We kinda gave up figuring it out and just ordered ala carte pasta.

üç§ Basil Prawn Pasta did not look like the photos, but it was still not bad. It leans towards the cream sauce with basil style with 4 shrimps & 2 salad leaves. Portion size is small, and the handmade pasta had a texture closer to korean ramyun, which was.. interesting.
I rate: 3/5 üåü

ü¶ê Seafood Tom Yum Pasta was pretty okay as well. Sauce has a prominent sour tang of a tom Yum Soup, as ingredients consisted of shrimps, clams, and scallops. Pasta like the above was chewy and wavy like korean ramyun.
I rate: 3/5 üåü

I am keen to try more dishes here in the future even though food isn't that amazing or bad. Service wise, I'm a little concerned because for some reason, all the staff here look so mopey... like they are either really tired or dread working here.

Ordered steak and was shocked to see the piece completely raw, and had to request the kitchen to grill the steak again. Not recommended even for such price point

Was given a butter knife for my steak. Perhaps the establishment management unable to differentiate between steak knife and butter knife

Purchased the free flow beverages and the root beer was flat.

Quite surprised by the large crowd patronising the restaurant

Will NOT come patronise this chain ever again

The pasta was decent, sauce is good but improvement can be made. Food was served slightly slow up to 20 minutes, understandably during lunch hours although there are many staff walking around. For the free flow drinks, the staff will give you the cup before you take the drinks. Was confused at first.

The food was alright especially if you are looking for something cheap but good. The only problem I had was the staffs there, particularly the staff that has blue hair. She was very rude when me and my friends when we simply asked her nicely if its possible to add on and pay extra to our order due to us clicking wrongly but she answered rudely and said it wasn‚Äôt possible and we were totally okay with that response as we wanted clarification. What I don‚Äôt understand is why does she have to reply to us like that as if we pissed her off when we weren‚Äôt even shouting or yelling at her? From there we lost our appetite. To add on, she was talking very loudly and rudely to her coworkers on how tired she is to ‚Äòentertain‚Äô. I didn‚Äôt know what that means but okay. And then she was yelling loudly again that she is tired and pissed and while saying that, she threw the menu. Maybe she had a bad day or that she faced too many customers that pissed her off, I understand that. But that doesn‚Äôt mean she got to shout and yell emphasising shes tired to entertain people. If she is tired then simply quit the job as an fnb staff and find another job, is that easy. Everyone is working as well but I am pretty sure that they are not complaining out loud especially if they want to earn money. Fix your staff‚Äôs working attitude if not fire her since she complains a lot on what she is suppose to do.

Not sure why I can't post photos of their so called poached eggs.. anw utterly disappointed. Their egg yellow was over cooked. Ordered basil prawn pasta and duck pizza and both eggs were over cooked. Ask them to change for me and they did a nice try by using microwave to do a poached egg but failed badly..

Tried some comfort homecooked style dishes such as nasi lemak platter, roast chicken leg and the limited time chicken katsu burger. Love the sambal chili and the crispy moringa fritter. Nasi was done well and aromatic. Didn‚Äôt manage to make ‚Ä¶

Tried some comfort homecooked style dishes such as nasi lemak platter, roast chicken leg and the limited time chicken katsu burger. Love the sambal chili and the crispy moringa fritter. Nasi was done well and aromatic. Didn‚Äôt manage to make an advance reservation but outdoor seating was good with lots of fans around. Took a short stroll around the farm after our meal. Pet-friendly.

I brought my dog (a lab retriever) and my family down to Bollywood Farms on a Sunday and we had such a great time there!
Here are what we enjoyed:
1. My dog (while leashed of course) and us were allowed to explore the farm freely. My dog really enjoyed the walk as there were so many scents from the herbs :) Just note that you will be seated outdoors at the restaurant if you have a dog.
2. The space and variety. The farm is really huge with such a huge variety of plants. There was even a large fish pond in the middle. Parking is readily available too.
3. The interesting decorations and quirky quotes around the farm.
4. The food. Food was amazing and rather reasonably priced considering the concept of the place. As it was Hari Raya weekend, we paid $15++ for a set which came with a cold drink, nasi campur and cendol. Try ordering the banana bread if available. While it costs $4 per slice, its moist, fluffy, and packed with flavour.
5. The staff. The staff were really helpful and friendly. They welcomed my dog and other doggos too. I brought a wagon for my dog to sit on while other dogs had their own chairsüòÇ really cute!

Things to take note of:
1. There may be monitor lizards around given that we live in Singapore and the place is surrounded by greenery. We spotted 2 while we were there but they were just minding their own business.
2. For outdoor seatings, it can get really hot despite there being standing fans so be sure to bring water for your pets if you are planning to bring them.

Gorgeous farm, excellent food - we had Nasi Lemak (rice was so fragrant), fish and chips (huge portions with their own grown potatoes - fragrant af too), dhal vegetarian curry (with jackfruit in place of chicken which was so unexpected yet SO appropriate), chendol (fragrant and fresh), and banana bread with ice cream (never had better banana bread really - moist, fragrant, sweet).

Walk around the farm was amazing, although we visited at like 1pm so the sun was just scorching hot.

They were giving free old Pandan leaves too so we brought back a lil bunch for the smell ü§©

Overall amazing visit, although the nearest bus stop was a 25-min walk to Bollywood farms so we waited until someone in our group had access to a car before we went‚Ä¶ well worth the trip tho. Lots of parking lots available even tho we went on a Saturday afternoon

A good find in the west. Would say that the food is value for money, not so much as a high end restaurant standard/quality. Had the Asian menu. Things are on the salty side. The  crackers are free flow, dessert is nice and hot chocolate is a hidden menu! Would come back again to try the western menu. :)

This place is a gem, one gets to enjoy fine dining and yet friendly on your wallet. You can choose either 2 or 3 courses from the menu which comes with a free mocktail. Coffee is extra charge at $2 per serving. ‚Ä¶

This place is a gem, one gets to enjoy fine dining and yet friendly on your wallet. You can choose either 2 or 3 courses from the menu which comes with a free mocktail. Coffee is extra charge at $2 per serving.
The students were very eager to please, closely supervised and attentive.
Our party of 4 ordered different mains and desserts so that we can see and try different dishes. The only disappointing dish is the seafood laksa pao fan which my friend felt it was underwhelming with too little ingredients and uninteresting plating. Other than that, the bread was delicious, appetiser of rojak was light and fresh, oxtail soup is the clear soup type, not creamy but tasty. The catch of the day, seabass was good, so was the beef cheeks. Special mention for chicken tikka which was flavourful and surprisingly tender despite the breast meat. Desserts were all delicious and went well with coffee and tea which was rich and aromatic. Plating was beautiful. Mocktail however has plenty of room for improvement. To me it tasted like soda water. Overall good & Highly recommended.

5 stars for the student‚Äôs effort, and a very encouraging petite Chinese female teacher of theirs. She would push the students to perform better, but in an encouraging manner.

Food wise... felt that the pork chop could do with a new supplier. Sent photos to a few friends who though it‚Äôs chicken breast. Nothing to do with the cooking, the original meat itself seems to be too dry and tough. White sliced mantou wasn‚Äôt filling as a carb, especially since they took the free bread & butter away and replaced it with a really really salty and oily cracker.

The mocktail could have an option to be less sweet as well. Could also possibly tone down the sugar level on the desserts too.

The seafood dish was great though. Fresh and succulent, worth the price. It‚Äôs not spicy unlike the menu says (which is great). Starters are nice.

Overall still worth going, probably when the next season‚Äôs menu is up.

We had very good dinner at Swensens. Always without fail. This outlet is quite open and bright. Staff are also very attentive. We will be back. Sign up for membership on telegram for free drink (daily), add kids for free monthly sundae. Sometimes even free mains (we got a fish and chips this time).. it was a Wednesday evening, so there was no queue. Expect queues on weekends.

P/S. I was talking to the manager who just joined 2 weeks ago and I thought the outlet was newly renovated. But actually it has been quite a while. Memories failed. Thank you for the chit chat and service.

Visited on a weekday afternoon around 1pm. It was reasonably crowded but not terribly so.

On telling the staff that served us Mr Yun Yee that it was my mum's birthday, he was very nice and helped us redeem our three free drinks, free ice cream (for birthday month), as well as free firehouse sundae (dining on actual day) - all of us are swensens coolrewards members.

Aglio olio was delicious, as well as the chicken in the basket. Mum and dad also liked the coffee.

Was a very pleasant meal and ice cream was delicious as usual. A wonderful experience especially because of the store staff (Yun Yee). Thanks a lot

Baked rice was good. Small portion but means space is kept for dessert. Cheese if more burnt will be good. Son had fried chicken. Looks good as well as he wants all 3 for himself. Ice cream as expected is good. Pricey during normal times but hey, it's my birthday month. Service here is fast and responsive. Late lunch at 3pm so more time for everything. Remember, get the membership. It's cheaper on the birthday month and you can get a free sundae.

I enjoyed a delicious burger and free birthday sundae today. It was delicious plus I ordered thank you flavor, sticky chewy chocolate zero which is lower carbs than regular sticky chewy chocolate ice cream. Very happy with the taste I hope it truly is lower carbs!! What a bonus that would be!

We ordered the fish and chips and the chicken in a basket.

The fish was fresh but the portions have grown smaller in recent months üò• the chicken is also fresh and juicy.

Definitely sign up for the free membership because the perks are pretty good!

Despite going there for just the complementary birthday firehouse ice cream, service was still very good. Narmatta the trainee manager was welcoming. Service by Linus was good too. I have to add that when I have queries and I call the branches. 90% of the time Westmall branch staff will pick up the call. Thank you.

Extremely disappointed. The prices are not equal to the quality of food, service, or atmosphere.

Food quality:
Food quality is average, around same taste as the Japanese food in food courts.

Alternatives:
For Japanese food and sashimi, try bento and sushi sets from Fairprice or Donki. If you are in the mood for tonkatsu, consider Tonkatsu by Ma Maison @ Westgate that offers unlimited rice(brown and white), soup and finely sliced raw vegetable salad with unlimited condiments (sauces for the salad). Compare that to ichiban which charges 3 sgd for a small bowl of white rice.

Service:
The poor staff are squeezed to the brim by the upper management in pursuit of greater profits for RE&S group. Understaffed, and even the manager is helping out with chores around the restaurant. Had to attract the attention of staff to even get basic service, otherwise it is basically the same as self service at the food courts.

Alternatives:
If you are looking for attentive service, consider din tai fung. Din tai Fung staff are busy but they hire way more people and their staff are much better trained. Whenever they see your tea cup empty, they will approach your table and offer to refill it, even if you are sitting at a corner. Staff is extremely attentive and friendly and despite the recent increase in prices, they have maintained their excellent service. Compare that to ichiban where you have to attract the attention of the staff to receive even basic service, it is literally food court with restaurant pricing at ichiban.

Atmosphere:
Reasonably nice decor and general clanking of dishes is to be expected of restaurants around this price range.

Alternatives:
Any restaurant. Din tai Fung has nicer decor, Xiang Xiang has free flow ice cream and snacks.

I will be avoiding all restaurants under RE&S due to their exploitative business practices of seeking profit at the expense of the consumer and workers. Won‚Äôt be returning.

Overall food is average quality.

Chicken kaarage was fresh and crispy.

Soba was a thick clump which made it difficult to untangle for dipping.

Unagi rice box was good. The eel was moist and fatty.

Beef bowl came with a perfectly cooked onsen egg. There were about 6 slices of beef and were overcooked. The ikura lent a hint of sea-saltiness to the dish.

Scallops were fresh and went well with the mentaiko sauce which were excellent.

Redeemed the Gyoza & Udon after accumulation of stamps on the e rewards card. You are also able to browse the menu on RE&S website. Tried the crispy pork, it was ok. Food here is average as always with its reasonable price. The service here is much better than JP branch.

Salmaan Food Paradise, is a sole proprietorship made up of a food and drink stall, and nothing much else. It is located in the middle of a row of shops, on the ground floor of Block 338, Jurong East Avenue 1.

This 4-storey HDB apartment block sits some 80 metres back from the main road, a couple of blocks from the Jurong Polyclinic. A small carpark that can accommodate about 20 small-capacity vehicles spreads between 337 and 338. An incline makes 338 accessible to the wheelchair-bound. However, a short step is necessary to get into the Food Paradise proper.

Except for the prestigious moniker, Salmaan's is, in a general sense, a coffee shop. Nevertheless, it has managed to attract a small niche of customers from the nearby Jurong Polyclinic, and surrounding neighbourhoods, who would need to commute to get there.

Salmaan's specialises in Indian cuisine. For breakfast, it offers the locally popular Roti Prata, the plain and egg versions. It also stocks some Malay kuehs, such as the epok-epok, kueh lapis, gendang kasturi, and karipap, presumably supplied by private entrepreneurs.

Lunch is the standard fare of Nasi Briyani, with the common but complete choice of condiments. Beef and chicken are the basic compliments, prepared in hot, spicy paste, that goes well with the cooler taste buds.

Salmaan's also has a spread of dishes for those who prefer white rice instead of the Basmati. Mutton, chicken, fish, and seafood, such as, prawns and squids, come in fried and gravy-drowned options. Vegetables, such as boiled okra, egg-plants, spinach, and cabbage, that look somewhat similar to some Malay fares, are also generally immersed in varieties of soup and gravy, that are rich in coconut milk, curry, and a mix of choice spices, turning simple ingredients into creamy and yummy meals that are sure to linger on the senses, post-lunch.

While the food may be described as 'amazing', for such a small establishment, the beverages are, on the whole, common and unimpressive. Local hot delights - the ubiquitous tea and coffee, both plain and with milk added versions - are the most popularly asked for drinks, other than the canned sodas. Those looking for unique concoctions will do better elsewhere.

Although the foods served are categorically exceptional, customers remain loyal mainly due to the friendly service and humble prices. While most coffee shops have adopted the self-service practice, Salmaan's still waits and delivers. It also allows bills to be paid at the end of meals, instead of the pay-and-eat style most others are adopting.

In short, Salmaan Food Paradise offers convenience, variety and respect, that customers fancy and cherish.
Can eat it once in awhile, always stomache when I eat their bryani, feels like it‚Äôs left overnight, I‚Äôd recommend you call for the noodles or prata but it‚Äôs just average, good luck!

If I could give zero stars, I would. We were brought to a table that hadn‚Äôt even been cleared. Although the staff said they would clean it, no one came for a long time. After finally getting it cleared, we waited another 30 minutes just to place our order. We waved for attention multiple times‚Äîstaff saw us but didn‚Äôt come over, just stood around.

Eventually, one of them gestured at us from a distance to go to the counter, like calling a dog. It felt dismissive and rude. To make things worse, the instructions were inconsistent‚Äîone staff said orders were taken at the table, another said to go to the counter.

When we tried to order, the staff seemed unsure of what they were doing. We requested a plain Maggi Goreng but were told we could only get it with chicken at a higher price. If the plain version isn‚Äôt available, it shouldn‚Äôt be on the menu.

After placing our order, we waited another 40 minutes for the food to arrive. Overall, a frustrating experience with poor service, long waits, and zero communication.

The food is not cheap. Quality is sub standard. They can serve stale food like I received today. They served spoilt potato curry with poori and lost my dinner pleasure. They don‚Äôt have phone number published where you can call and register your concerns. Very bad experience

Love this zi char place! You can order online for pick up on their website and set the collection time, making this very convenient. The prawn paste chicken is amazing, and the dabao packaging is smart; crispy noodle sauce packed separately. Prices are very reasonable, can feed the whole family for less than $50.
i love the food here, me and my friend always come here eat after school and they have free drinks

business_name: Ding Jian Hong Kong Style Charcoal Roasted
text:
There is always a queue here but after trying a couple of times, I believe what this stall offers were more of a good deal than good quality.

Their generous serving of the $2 oysters sauce vegetable is hard to beat. The meats were decent but inconsistent, previously their char siew & roast meat were mostly lean meat but this round the roast meat were mostly fatty. Their claimed of 'Dang Gui' infused roast duck were practically non-existent, it is however the gravy that gave that slight tint of the DG flavour, still a well roasted duck if without expectation.

business_name: Ding Jian Hong Kong Style Charcoal Roasted
text:
Their soy chicken is nice. Noodle is alway soggy, tried telling them dont cook too long but never successful, it seems they dont know how to not overcook it. If they can improve the noodles will be perfect.

Update: 3-8-2025
After trying 4-5 times, official confirm this is the most lousy stall in the west, or probably in sg.
Struggle to eat half, still left so much. Basically tasteless, too much hor fun. The meat portion, only soy chicken is better,but risk of sometime undercooked, which can see clearly is still raw.

Just go to 272, that stall is alot better.

Ingredients were quite fresh and the must order is the big meat ball which I believe is home made.

business_name: Loong Kee Yong Tau Fu ÈæçË®òÈáÄË±ÜËÖê
text: Items are well prepared and substantial size, not like the usual miser sizes. Love their Laksa and Chee Cheong Fun combo. Picture shown cost just shy of $5 (6 items). Free help of condiments is a plus. Will definitely go back for it again.

The quality of the food seems to have fallen over the years, still edible but I won't order anything in "large size" for awhile. Superior Soup Young Chinese Spinach was overcooked, vegetable was too old to be called "young chinese spinach". ‚Ä¶

The quality of the food seems to have fallen over the years, still edible but I won't order anything in "large size" for awhile. Superior Soup Young Chinese Spinach was overcooked, vegetable was too old to be called "young chinese spinach". Curry fish head was good, but can see that inflation got to it, fried tofu/brinjal/lady's finger quantity dropped significantly.

Dined in for 7, fortunately my grandma still likes the taste.

I lived nearby and have been eating here on and off, would suggest looking at other table's orders before committing because their waiters tend to recommend the most expensive items on their menu (and that may not actually taste good!).

Totally disappointed with the food and portion. I ordered 5 dishes of large portion of sambal kangkong, har cheong gai, black pepper pork slice, sweet and sour fish slice and tofu with crispy cai poh. The portion served was pathetic. Paid $20+ for the kangkong which I think not even worth $10. The rest of the food portion were pathetically small too. The only thing that is reasonable may be the har cheong gai - 16 pieces for large portion. Cannot understand why they used big boxes to contain such small portion of food, wonder if they tot that packing into a big container can pass off as big portion.  Will never patronise this shop anymore. Total paid $120 for the 5 dishes, wondered if they purposely reduced the portion just because we used CDC voucher for payment. Utterly disappointed. No an honest food Establishment

basically you choose your noodle type, before choosing your toppings and then your sauce. the toppings available are wide in variety and simple, like omelettes, pig's intestines and spinach. the price is affordable and is generally around ‚Ä¶

basically you choose your noodle type, before choosing your toppings and then your sauce. the toppings available are wide in variety and simple, like omelettes, pig's intestines and spinach. the price is affordable and is generally around $5 onwards. the noodles were delicious.

however, the soup is a little salty, but that can be forgiven when it comes to the customer service. the staff seemed to be very impatient and unfriendly in answering questions.

business_name: Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao
text:
Walk in on a weekend afternoon and waiting time is less than one minute to be seated.

Member can enjoy 50% off the Crispy Duck served with Egg Crepe and the taste is quite good.

La Mian with Scallion Oil, Wuxi Deep Dried White Bait, Deep Fried Beancurd Skin with Prawn and Signature Pan Fried Scallion Pancake all taste nice and delicious.

The Dong Po Pork Sesame Pocket Bun taste pretty awesome.

The portion of the dishes is quite small but quality is good.

Overall experience is pleasant as good customer service with tea refill a couple of times.

business_name: Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao
text:
Crystal Jade reopened and currently has a member only promo for their XLB. Went down for lunch and overall experience was above average. Service was not ideal as it was not even crowded, but had to call out 3 times to get out order. This was already a bad experience at a start. Fortunately the food was good, otherwise it will be a bad rating. The la mian, fu pi and XLB are really fantastic, these really salvaged the lunch.
Luckily, payment was smooth and the staff was nice and patient with us getting the app out to scan for the member's XLB deal.
Overall food was very good, but will need to improve the ordering since it wasn't even crowded. Not sure if it's only this outlet since they just reopened.

business_name: Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao
text:

However, fried rice is not warm. Tasted like something that has been put outside for sometime ü§î ‚Ä¶

text: I didn‚Äôt enjoy the food. It was rather cold and disappointing! I felt that CJ La Mian Xiao Long Bao is unsuitable for takeaway. For the same price, I rather get from Din Tai Fung. Although I reached on time, I had to wait at the restaurant for 10 mins just for the manager to verify the member‚Äôs discount.

business_name: Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao
text: Food is average, overall not so bad. Only UOB has 10% discount using card payment

Located inside the Cantine food court in Jurong point mall. It's in B1. Food taste is good. A decent place for Indian vegetarian food. The place got both veg and non vegetarian dishes. I was skeptical to taste the chutney specifically ‚Ä¶

Located inside the Cantine food court in Jurong point mall. It's in B1. Food taste is good. A decent place for Indian vegetarian food. The place got both veg and non vegetarian dishes. I was skeptical to taste the chutney specifically coconut chutney... But to my surprise it was good. All items tasted good. Do not have great expectations as of for a restaurant. It's a stall in food court and food and price is as per. Clean and well maintained. Will definitely recommend this place. Tea was reaalllly good.

Sai Kitchen Jurong Point is a must for Indian food lovers. Their extensive menu includes biryani, dosas, curries, naans and more ‚Äî all prepared authentically. We tried the fish curry, and it was rich and tangy; the roti was warm and fresh. Service is swift, and the staff is polite. Great value for the quality you get. Loved it for both dine‚Äëin evenings and takeaway lunches.

Gimmicky robot trains to serve ordered dishes. Wide variety but quality wise something felt off, especially with the hefty price tags compared to the competition.

There's a UFO ice cream catcher opportunity for every $20 spent.  The implementation is that you'll have to try your luck after you pay... Which also means that if you are lucky enough to grab an ice-cream you'll have to find another place to enjoy the ice-cream.  Not a fan of anything that's gacha, sad that now even something that's given free at other places is put up as a gacha.

Fancy having your food delivered by futuristic Go-Bots? At Sushi-GO, diners of all ages will certainly be delighted by these emoji-expressing robots that bring food directly to your table! (Note: Not available at the AMK Hub outlet.)

Sushi-GO (@SushiGO.sg) is a buzzing, fuss-free quick service restaurant offering over 150 varieties of Japanese sushi and desserts. For a limited time, Sushi-GO has launched the Bincho Maguro Matsuri, running now until 8 July 2024. The featured items include:

‚ñ™Ô∏èBin Toro Tower ($3.90): A luxurious tower of flavours, combining the rich taste of minced fatty tuna with the mild, buttery texture of albacore tuna.

‚ñ™Ô∏èTruffle Ankimo Bincho Tataki ($3.90): Lightly seared marinated albacore complements the decadent flavour of monkfish liver and truffle cream.

‚ñ™Ô∏èAburi Spicy Garlic Bincho ($2.90): Perfect for spice lovers, the seared albacore is elevated with bold, spicy garlic miso sauce and spicy sauce.

‚ñ™Ô∏èYuzu Kosho Bincho Tataki ($2.90): Refreshing and zesty, the marinated albacore is lightly seared to bring out the bright, tangy notes of yuzu pepper, paired with wasabi shrimp roe for a unique crunch.

Visit Bincho Maguro Matsuri for more information.

Available at 4 outlets across the island:
1. VivoCity, #B2-07/08
2. Marina Square, #02-277
3. Jurong Point, #B1-47/48
4. AMK Hub, #04-02

Another option for conveyor belt sushi. The choices are good. Good for a change after Genki and Genki (my son favourite).

Every $20 spend to redeem a token for ice cream crawl machine, pretty cool idea. Instead of just giving you the free ice cream, a simple game after a nice meal was quite fun too! my boy enjoy the game!

It‚Äôs just a kiosk outside West Mall beside the subway sandwich. Decided to try this as it‚Äôs something new to me other than the usual fast food.
They were having a $9.90 promotion set. I ordered the chicken wrap. It was filled with veggies and a scoop of grilled chicken. The food was well seasoned and fries was still warm. It‚Äôs a bit on the salty side for me so luckily I had a drink.
Service was fast and staff patient & friendly enough despite the hot working environment and noisy atmosphere due to on-going construction. I got my order in less than 10 min with order and prep time. The food was made to order.
Don‚Äôt mind eating this again next time if I want a quick takeaway meal.

May 2025:
No choice but to downgrade this review because of inconsistent service received that doesn‚Äôt make customer have the confidence to return. Just makes mood feels lousy to buy from there.
Also there‚Äôs no company contact or telephone number on their website and contact form also blank microsite down, social media also no response, quite impossible to feedback anything. So I give up trying. I don‚Äôt think I will buy from here anymore.

The food is very awesome and compliment redbull sugar free from staff Aidil. He is very fast service and the portion size also is very proper packaging. Please give him applause or reward üëç

Food tastes great and price is reasonable, with a meal costs less than $5 generally.
First time buying the meat! The delivery was smooth and the sender will give u a call before delivery packaging is well pack with ice !

I brought my family to Citrus before they left for Dubai next day since they lived there. We almost got disappointed for not having any seats due to full house when we turn up at 9pm ish. But, the ops manager Mike called us back when we ‚Ä¶

I brought my family to Citrus before they left for Dubai next day since they lived there. We almost got disappointed for not having any seats due to full house when we turn up at 9pm ish. But, the ops manager Mike called us back when we were almost walking to the car park and asked if we are okay wf sofa seats, we immediately said Yes!
From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere of the cafe set the tone for an unforgettable night. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with tasteful decor and just the right lighting to create a comfortable, elegant setting.

But what really stood out was the exceptional service. Every staff member we interacted with was professional, attentive, and genuinely welcoming. Mike went above and beyond and incredibly accommodating with special requests. It felt like they truly cared about making our experience special.

This place is a gem‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre celebrating something special or just want a great meal out, I highly recommend it. We‚Äôll definitely be back! Thank u Mike, for your exceptional customer service. He would go ahead and checked on every customers, which not all cafes does that!:)

Overall i like this brunch. Will definitely come again and recommend this brunch.
