Chashu Donburi was pretty good, though the portion was quite small. There's also a portion of egg salad which was rich and delicious. The set comes with iced green tea which was a little sweet but helped to wash down the meal. They have free flow pickles and spicy preserved vege. Nice environment for a solo meal but the space is a little cramped.

Price is very attractive and you can add free noodles.

However, the soup is not hot and extremely salty.

Like really really very salty that you can feel water retention a few hours later.
Love the SG60 (60cents deal) so much! I ordered the scallion oil ramen, fried goza and the lemon tea, it‚Äôs really affordable and yummy! Hope next year still have this promo hehe :)

The staff was rude and never tolded us or called the Q number that the drink of 5 persons was ready. When we asked the staff they reacted with rude. The food price was rather expensive but be treated in this impolitely way. The food taste was ok thought the space was truly small to dine in with big families.

I have been a regular customer of this specific outlet for years, I mainly order from grabfood then I‚Äôd occasionally order takeaway physically at the place. It seemed like today was crowded and there were only visibly 2 staff doing the work. Ordered from the kiosk and waited outside. But the number flashing thing outside has been broken for a while so I had no choice but to wait inside where it was cramped because the entrance had people queuing up to use the kiosk and staff coming in and out and others coming in and leaving. When I went inside, the number flashing basically skipped my number/ showed the numbers before and after my number so I thought maybe it‚Äôs not in chronological order and continued waiting. Then I saw them bring out a bag of noodles and drink which looked like my order but I couldn‚Äôt be sure. Checked the bag for a receipt with the order number but there was nothing. Then continued waiting and saw the numbers be flashed in chronological order so I realised they must have skipped my order and also not have indicated the order number on the physical food. I checked with the staff and he rudely responded to me confirming that the takeaway order is mine and he gave me the impression like I was wasting his time or I missed the timing for my order when in reality my order was not called and there was no receipt attached to the food order to indicate anything. I came home and found out my order was missing an egg which was an add on I paid extra for.

Other times when I ordered from the place physically, there was once where I ordered takeaway as usual and while I received my order receipt with the number, I went outside to wait and waited for more than 40 min and realised my order number was not flashed on the screen at all. Inside looked like it had only a few customers so I was confused. The staff saw me waiting outside the whole time but ignored me. They were generally free and not doing anything so I thought it was weird and finally went in to check. Turns out for some reason the kiosk machine had some issues sending over the order to the staff so they never received the order and I waited for nothing and had to order verbally at the cashier.

I do enjoy specific foods from this place but I hope improvements can be made on the things I mentioned above :‚Äô) maybe it‚Äôs also my fault for not clarifying earlier but even when I did try to clarify I was met with a dismissive and aggressive response. In general there were multiple times I‚Äôve had not the most pleasant experiences when ordering from the place physically.

Quite an affordable range of dishes while overlooking the gorgeous sea view and sunset. It‚Äôs pretty unique as they are situated along a Jetty along the Straits of Johor but definitely need private transport access. Alfresco dining also available to enjoy the cool sea breeze, but not a very ideal location during wet weathers.

Food was average at best on overall. Nothing above and beyond what you would typically get at a zi-char stall. The sambal stingray stood out for me amongst rest. Service is absolutely quick though so thumbs up for that. Booking in advance also recommended. Very popular amongst the young and older population. Parking spaces available 200m away.

Came to only eat salad while waiting for my aunt to do her ‚ÄúQingMing‚Äù visit.  This was the nearest restaurant I found. Ambience is nice and quiet, on Sunday morning.

Tips for the restaurant, to have kids meal for free when purchase 2 main course, like this more parents will dine in. Give drawings to kids, use cute cutlery.  It‚Äôs a waste that a Sunday when so many parents bringing kids to Bird park yet this restaurant isn‚Äôt doing as good as its neighbor beside.

Giving out cute balloons to all kids can also bring positive attention to parents.

Hope this restaurant can stay long here. See my photos for more detailed information. If you looking for job, I have post it here too.

Do give a thumbs up if my message benefits you.  I don‚Äôt earn anything here, it‚Äôs purely for my own and friends to read up. Cheers!

Food was good - went during a promotion and the ribeye (200g) with pasta and salad was $21.90++ (so worth)! The doneness was properly cooked and beef wasn't too tough to chew. For the other meals with chicken and pork, they were well cooked and marinated too and the portions are generous.

Vs other Collin's, I do feel the ambience for Mandai's is really nicer, from the lighting to the spaciousness and the decorations. Also conducive to chat and chill while eating.

Specifically for Mandai though, especially weekends, do expect to queue from 6pm onwards (due to people exiting the Mandai attractions). We queued more than 45min to get a table for 5 and it was a painful wait. But the food and price was good enough to make the wait worth it eventually.

Food selection is the same as the collin‚Äôs outside of Mandai. Price is decent and we enjoyed ourselves here. Managed to get a 10% discount with our corporate pass. Overall good experience and the staff were pretty attentive.

Good ambiance and food.  There is an SG60 promotion offering very good value meals and drinks.  Will be coming again!

Nearby parking is free after 6pm.

Pleased to find this gem of a place in Little India now. Was previously situated in Serene Centre until owner May shifted to Trio in mid 2021.

Happy to say that the food is still of the same quality as what I remembered it to be. although the pricing seems to have ticked up, which isn‚Äôt that unusual with the high inflation Singapore has seen over here last couple of years.

We had French onion soup, goat cheese salad and duck confit. All was excellent and worth the price paid, and there was complimentary sourdough and butter provided.

Will definitely come back again. Do note that this place is an appointments only place. Call or book online in advance.

Nice little cozy restaurant tucked at the 4th floor of Trio, moved from Serene Centre.
Menu is typically French favourites and also in the standard 3 courses @ $72 ‚Ä¶

As a party of two, we had to wait for an unusually long time just because a large family was ahead of us, despite there being plenty of empty two-person tables available. The QR code ordering process itself was easy, though.

Our meal started with the mushroom soup, which looked great, but the flavor was incredibly off ‚Äì I've never tasted mushroom soup that didn't actually taste like mushroom soup; it was surprisingly sweet.

When our mains arrived, everything looked physically great. The chicken was cooked perfectly, which was a definite plus. However, the accompanying mushroom sauce was completely underwhelming ‚Äì I'd strongly advise against ordering anything with it. On a positive note, the mac and cheese was great. Unfortunately, the salad and bread were also not impressive.

Overall, I'm very disappointed with my meal today. While some elements were okay, the strange soup and bland sauce, combined with the frustrating wait, made for a disappointing dining experience.

business_name: Dim Sum Express (Kuai Can Dian Xin)
text:
It is a great choice for cheap dim sum.
Price at $1.50/each. Buy 10 get 1 free.
Where else you can get this price around Woodlands, Sembawang area? ‚Ä¶

business_name: Dim Sum Express (Kuai Can Dian Xin)
text: Came here a few times already. Buy 10 free 1 dimsum. Each selling for 1.50. quite cheap imo. But food quality dont expect the best. It is good enough cheap food dimsum. Lady was very fast in serving. ‚Ä¶

business_name: Dim Sum Express (Kuai Can Dian Xin)
text:
It is a great choice for cheap dim sum.
Price at $1.50/each. Buy 10 get 1 free.
Where else you can get this price around Woodlands, Sembawang area?
Fret not, it is 24 hours stall.. you can sink your teeth with this at wee hours.
I personally love this.

business_name: Dim Sum Express (Kuai Can Dian Xin)
text:
A great place for a quick dim sum bite at a really affordable price. The variety available here is impressive, with many selections to choose from ranging from the usual classics like siew mai, har gow, char siew bao, and chee cheong fun, to other tasty small plates that make it easy to order a spread for sharing. Every dish I tried was tasty and freshly prepared, with quality comparable to what you would expect at other dim sum shops. Portion sizes are also reasonable and consistent with typical dim sum standards, so you can order a good mix without feeling that the servings are too small.

What makes this spot even better is that it‚Äôs housed within a coffee shop that also offers plenty of other food choices. This makes it very convenient if you are visiting with friends or family who might prefer different dishes beyond dim sum. You can easily mix and match, sharing plates from the dim sum stall alongside noodles, rice, or other hawker favourites available within the same space. It really adds to the overall dining experience and makes it suitable for groups of all ages.

The atmosphere is casual and unpretentious, perfect for a fuss-free meal. Service is quick, and food is served hot, so it‚Äôs ideal if you‚Äôre in the area and just want a satisfying meal without waiting too long. Parking is also not an issue here‚Äîthe carpark is located just beside the coffee shop with plenty of available lots. The rates are affordable compared to other busy areas, which makes it even more convenient for those driving.

Overall, this is a reliable and budget-friendly choice for dim sum lovers looking for good variety, value for money, and easy accessibility.

business_name: Dim Sum Express (Kuai Can Dian Xin)
text:
Dim Sum Express (Kuai Can Dian Xin): A Late-Night Dim Sum Haven with Budget-Friendly Bites

Alright, folks, listen up! My friends and I were craving a late-night dim sum fix after an our bike ride, and we stumbled upon Dim Sum Express (Kuai Can Dian Xin). This place was tucked away in a quiet corner, a little off the beaten path, but it was open 24 hours, which was perfect for our late-night cravings.

The Good:

‚Ä¢ The Price: The dim sum was incredibly affordable. They had a deal where you could get a free basket of dim sum for every 10 baskets you bought, making it incredibly budget-friendly.  That was a huge plus, especially when compared to other dim sum places where a similar amount could easily cost you double or even triple the price.

‚Ä¢ The Convenience: It was the perfect spot for a quick and easy meal, especially if you're looking for something budget-friendly. It was open 24 hours, which was a major plus for us!  It was the perfect place to satisfy a late-night craving. Plus, there was a large car park nearby, making parking a breeze.

The Quirks:

‚Ä¢ The Food: The dim sum menu had a lot of variety, but honestly, the taste was just average. The har gow and siu mai, classic dim sum dishes, didn't really wow us.

‚Ä¢ The Coffee Shop: The drink stall next to the dim sum stall only accepted cash, so keep that in mind.

My Friend‚Äôs Note: I love that it‚Äôs open 24 hours! It‚Äôs great to have a place I can go to for dim sum whenever I want!

My Note: The price is great, but I think the food could be better.

Rating:

‚Ä¢ Food: 3/5 (Just okay, not the best dim sum)

‚Ä¢ Service: 3.5/5 (Acceptable)

‚Ä¢ Atmosphere: 3.5/5 (Okay ambience)

Overall: 3/5

Overall: The ambience was decent, and the service was fine, but it was the affordability and the 24-hour availability that really stood out. It‚Äôs a good option for a quick and easy meal, especially if you're looking for something budget-friendly.  I'd say if you're in the area, it's worth popping in to give it a try, but if you're a serious dim sum connoisseur, you might want to check out other options.  But for the price, it‚Äôs a decent choice.

business_name: Dim Sum Express (Kuai Can Dian Xin)
text:
Came here on a Saturday for lunch and there was a steady queue that comes and goes. For any order of 10 dishes youll get 1 free.

Everything here is $1.50 so we spent $15 that feeds about 2~3 pax. Food here is average at best. Very much like the standard of those 'dim sum' shops in kopitiam that sells coffee.

But I have to say that their lor mai kai and chilli paste at the side was really good. For $1.50 there is nothing to complain really in this economy. And there is a huge variety to choose from too.

business_name: Dim Sum Express (Kuai Can Dian Xin)
text:
Came here a few times already. Buy 10 free 1 dimsum. Each selling for 1.50. quite cheap imo. But food quality dont expect the best. It is good enough cheap food dimsum. Lady was very fast in serving.

Place is in dirty kopitiam with rubbish n cockroach running around (probably bcos I came here during late hours for supper)

Recommend the sesame seed balls with peanut fillings inside. It's not bad!

business_name: Dim Sum Express (Kuai Can Dian Xin)
text:
It‚Äôs value for money and taste decently fit for $1.30/type. I do think dining straight from there could be nicer, as steam and fried stuff after tapao soggy. But overall still worth the walk (because it is located in an industrial building with nearest bus stop is 500m away.
~Updated Apr 2023~
The price has increased to $1.50 per portion, which I think it‚Äôs still reasonable with the recent inflation. It has been quite sometime I have not visited the place, but still decent taste and portion size still remain the same as last time. Shout out to some of the items I like, wrapped chicken, carrot cake, bean curd skin roll & fried bean curd sheet roll. I think it‚Äôs value for money compared to those outside. The spread can easily buy 10 selection then get another 1 free. Can support.

business_name: Dim Sum Express (Kuai Can Dian Xin)
text:

business_name: PastaMania - Italian Casual Dining @ Lot One
text:
I‚Äôd like to thank Miss Atikah from PastaMania Lot1, for her excellent service.

She was very helpful and accommodating when I needed to reserve a table. Her friendly attitude and professionalism made the experience smooth and stress-free. I really appreciate her support and would be happy to return because of her great service.

Thank you, Atikah!

1st time trying the foods here. Order from the kiosk. Food pick up from counter. Basically no staffs interaction at all. Foods 3/5. I order double patties steak. Very delicious. The sauce goes well with the patties. Wifey ordered lamb chop.. meat was tough even cutting it with metal steak knife. The worst was the chicken wing. It seem the wings have been too long in freezer. Marination was tasty but the meat still have frozen blood. We did not even finish the wings. Refer to the photos.

Weeknight exploration brought me to a far far away land. So might as well have dinner.

The restaurant was empty and it appears to be accidental; after thought; make shift rather than a real restaurant-restaurant.

There was not service interaction. Scan to order - pick up when number is called - return your own tray. Very efficient and robotic.

For 11 bucks I say it‚Äôs a good deal.
But food is rather meh and mid.
It‚Äôs felt like it‚Äôs assembled from various suppliers - nothing‚Äôs prepared.

The fish was fried fish loh.
Basic batter and fillet. Not fresh and not overly crispy.

The salad was ready made coleslaw. Industrial standard.

It‚Äôs functional eating. So if you need something to fill up your stomach, I guess you can be too picky.
Hassle free ordering and payment process. Serve food quickly and the food is nice.

text: So so good! Value for money buffet with amazing sides, meat options and broths. Came here on a weekday night and reserved via their online website. Fuss free. Even though there were a lot of people at the time the food was unlimited. Sides ‚Ä¶

business_name: Captain Kim Korean BBQ & Hotpot Buffet
text:
I had a fantastic time at this place. I'm usually not a big fan of Korean dishes, but this halal barbecue spot exceeded my expectations. Even without pork, the chicken, fish, and beef dishes were amazing. The marination was especially good, and I particularly enjoyed the black pepper chicken.
The staff were very attentive, constantly refilling the hotpot soup. My only complaint is that the drinks were not very flavorful; they were a bit watery. They should definitely work on improving the drinks. Other than that, everything was perfect, and I plan to come back with friends and family. The discount coupon for returning customers is also a great incentive.
We paid for 2 pax $69+
Good job!

business_name: Captain Kim Korean BBQ & Hotpot Buffet
text: Eat over here on the weekend with family. Very good range of food, quite fresh and delicious. Recommended. Although ice cream is not free‚Ä¶

business_name: Captain Kim Korean BBQ & Hotpot Buffet
text: A nice halal place for Korean bbq & hotpot. Free flow of soup based.I tried miso soup üòã. Plenty varieties of meat & seafood. Bbq grill was frequently changed. Their gojujang & sesame sauce are delicious, wrapped the meat with lettuce & put the sauce in üòãüòã

The menu was badly designed, there is no picture for every dish and there is no indication of spiciness beside the dish.
The creamy fried mushroom was too sweet.
The best dish was the tofu, which supposedly to be spicy but it's not and the tofu was so soft and tender.
The veggie was okay standard, no surprise.

They can seriously consider moving the menu online so the customer can view it more convenient and contact free in this covid situation.

My first time visit Aone that‚Äôs awww me the service that they delivered. I am in hurried because of the appointment and my good friend hungry because she‚Äôs got a gastric and need to eat on time. Thanks to Qing Ying for helping us to get our ‚Ä¶

Went there for my godfather birthday dinner! Service crew and the manager was great with friendly smiles! Even had free dessert! Appreciate the thoughts and the smiles given! Food was all great except one which they received the feedback amicably.

Service is great and food is served pipping hot. Not too salty. Disposable tissue and appetisers are optional, if u take, it is payable.

Despite being a single dinner, I was offered space and sufficient service that I felt comfortable with. The Yi Ping Guo is very good. There's fish maw, prawns, scallops, fish and broccoli. Plain porridge comes with a cost still as it has scallops and fried ikan. I had a hearty meal, to the extent of almost can't finish.

Deco of this restaurant is classic and aircon is cool enough for a hot day. Tables and chairs are well spaced and clean. But the back resting board is shaky. Pls mend it before it traps pest or fall onto customers.

Internally sometimes the staff speaks way too loudly. It is a restaurant, so Shd still have some quiet ambience. Can talk, but in the kitchen in a milder manner. Can even hear them when they are in the kitchen. Sometimes they Shd talked v loudly in the dinning area too.

Walked a big round to find Aone. It is not inside the mall but at the outside facing the road.

Hunt for the outside of Yakun and pastamania, then walked along, towards pastiamania and after a shortest u will find it.

If u walked towards Pizza Hut then u would have gone the long way.

Ordered porridge.  Their porridge comes with scallop base so it tastes nice but ingredients don‚Äôt look as much compared to the photos advertised.  For price of $12.90/bowl before taxes is a little expensive.  I feel the place is a little too big because half empty for dinner.  Maybe if they get a smaller place and be a little bit more generous with the ingredients then price okay. Or maintain ingredients but charge cheaper.  Food is good

My first time visit Aone that‚Äôs awww me the service that they delivered. I am in hurried because of the appointment and my good friend hungry because she‚Äôs got a gastric and need to eat on time. Thanks to Qing Ying for helping us to get our food on time.
And the porridge is super awesome! Definitely will come back again.

Ordered platter, chicken claypot, 4 season , shrimp fried rice. They were great tasting and we even finished the source. Ordered plain porridge, and even plain porridge is very well seasoned and cooked. Sumptuous lunch. Good service and free dessert.
Very good service. We celebrated our dad‚Äôs birthday and provided the plates n  forks and even serve us free desserts. Highly recommended.

Sanook Kitchen - one of my family's favourite restaurants in Jurong point. It's my favourite go-to place for a quick meal - be it lunch or dinner, dine alone or with family & friends. The food is nice & reasonably priced. Kudos to the friendly staff & their prompt service (orders are served promptly in 5 to 10 minutes, during most of my visits). Customers are being served free popcornüçø while waiting for their meal being served. Waterü•õ is self-service & free.  I felt comfortable with the sitting arrangements as the spaces between each table are fairly wide & not as cramped like most other restaurants. I would definitely keep coming back. üòä

Food is tasty good, decent portion, and warm, with freeflow water and popcorn. The atmosphere is nice however today happened to have one naughty fly, but the staff is immediately provide candle to help with the fly. The kids fried rice meal is superb!! Only comment is, we hope the kids meal comes first before out meal. Overall is satisfactory experience

Basil chicken rice set seasoning overly salty for me.  Green curry chicken set taste fine.  Lunch set  @ $11.90 quite reasonable.  Diners also have access to free popcorn/machine in restaurant premise.

There are good selections of vegetarian options here! Price is pocket friendly and we love their stir-fries!! Spicy food here are super shiok too, great for people who love spicy food. And kids will be delighted with the free popcorns!

Food was decent but service was terrible. Not sure if it was because I was a videographer, but the servers kept shoving me around even though I tried my best to keep out of their way.

I understand that both of our roles often block each other‚Äôs path, but they could at least call out for us to move out of the way, or take a slightly different path to the table. Many at times, I noticed that they were strictly following a certain path to let‚Äôs say the VIP table, causing all of us photographers and videographers to have to move out of the way from front of stage and disrupt our shots, even though the other areas were relatively empty.

I‚Äôve attended other D&D/Gala dinner events before similar to this, as a videographer, but this one felt the worst and most anxious for me, constantly having to look out for the servers who would just barge their way through.

Concealed Chinese Restaurant with no real ‚Äúdoor‚Äù or entrance on the 3rd level of Jurong Safra. It is a combination of 4 x ballrooms, which is massive for a restaurant itself. However, we thought the restaurant was closed when we went as there‚Äôs a wedding ongoing, but it‚Äôs actually open in the ballroom that‚Äôs not occupied.

Food üç§ - All was great, special callout to cereal prawn, one of the best I ever had! Pork had a bit of pork smell, not fantastic..

Price üíµ - Value for money set meals, ala carte pricing a little steep

Service - Excellent service, we were dressed down and they still treated us like any other customers üëçüèª

Superb service as usual. Food is nice as always. Our favourites are salted egg prawn, roasted chicken, scallop broccoli and not forgetting the yummy dessert. Yam lotus paste is always warm and soothing!  Portion size is very big. Very full ‚Ä¶
First, I called the restaurant for reservations. They said that the supervisor will call me back. Waited for a few days and still nobody contacted me. ‚Ä¶

Superb service as usual. Food is nice as always. Our favourites are salted egg prawn, roasted chicken, scallop broccoli and not forgetting the yummy dessert. Yam lotus paste is always warm and soothing!  Portion size is very big. Very full and contented after the meal. We had our birthday celebration there. They kindly help to store the cake in their fridge. Will come back again for next birthday celebration in the family.

First, I called the restaurant for reservations. They said that the supervisor will call me back. Waited for a few days and still nobody contacted me.

Then I go ahead to book the reservation online via their website. Went all the way down today. To find out that the restaurant is not open.

Then why the hell do you accept the reservation and no one contacted me saying that the reservation is cancelled?

The management seriously have to look into the matter.
Went there for ala carte buffet and found out that it's no longer available. Please at least update your website. Really unprofessional.

Very nice vegetarian eating spot if you are around here. Lovely decor, good zicha cook with enough wok-hey. No GST, no service charge! Must support if food remains this good standard and price. Can call prior to tabao to skip waiting.

(Updated review)
Fusion spoon underwent renovation and overhaul recently (new operator?). Food prices have increased across the board, some popular items were no longer on the menu.

Quality is disappointing. I ordered the curry chicken rice set ($10.90?). Only one side of one piece of chicken was burnt (black) - looks like it was perhaps at the bottom of the pan and reheated? The curry also had a slightly sour ish smell, taste wasn‚Äôt sour but wasn‚Äôt fantastic either.

We also ordered the nasi lemak burger ($18.90). For $18.90, the amount of fries was really stingy. I took a fries and my hub squeezed the chili sauce on the side when the staff came over to say they made a mistake (no further explanation), and proceeded to quickly collect the plate of burger‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ I explained to her we already touched it, but i guess she was really rushing cos she didn‚Äôt respond to me. I hope they didn‚Äôt give the burger to other customers. After about 5 min, our order was called again to collect the correct burger.

(Review in 2020)
Giving it 5-star because the place is beautiful, clean, has nice view, great variety of food and is value-for-money.

If you‚Äôre specially making a trip here for the food, you might be disappointed. I would think most patrons are park-goers looking to fill their stomach. My family enjoys coming here. Sometimes, we walk to the park, enjoy the scenery and fresh air, have our meal and walk back home.

My family‚Äôs favourite is their nyonya laksa ($6.90?), mee siam, nasi lemak and Hawaiian pizza ($7.90?) for the kids. I find their portion rather generous.

The restaurant might get really crowded on weekend dinner time and during events held at Jurong Lake Gardens.

The menu is available at the counter, on the TV and outside the door. After placing an order, you‚Äôll have to keep a look out for your number to collect your food (may involve multiple trips). The prices are pretty much fast-food restaurant prices, hence self-service is expected.

Dropped by for dinner with colleague after work. It was a quiet Thursday evening. About 10-15 mins walk from Lakeside MRT station. It is located in the park. Self order from order kiosk and collect your food. Basically no one serve you and don‚Äôt forget to return tray. Food was ok and didn‚Äôt expect much. Environment was ok. If just want to grab a quick bite, it was just ok. Price range from $8-15 for main course.

Went on a Saturday noon during post phase 2 circuit breaker. Safe management was proper and in place, staff was quick to greet and took our temperature accordingly.
Ambience was nice, cool and tables were spaced apart from each other comfortably. The place was fairly full but service was steady and calm.

Good
- short wait for the food.
- clear and audible order call number system. Lots of call number screens around the restaurant.
- must try beef rendang, vegetarian Yee fu noodles, and the hot traditional milk tea

Can improve
- vegetarian Yee fu noodles for $9.40 should include an egg. You can refer to the pic.
- remove the plastic straws and stirrers already.

Will recommend this place.

bbq chicken wings not delivered but still charged  if you have min. order for bbq item  you shd block the order or not charging me. Called and WhatsApp to refund me but not receiving immediate reply. ‚Ä¶

bbq chicken wings not delivered but still charged  if you have min. order for bbq item  you shd block the order or not charging me. Called and WhatsApp to refund me but not receiving immediate reply.
By the way The food to me is not worth the $    the pork rib is hard

Ordered in Grab food . As usual horrible taste and inconsistency. It‚Äôs a turmeric soup and not Mulakuthavani soup. Non edible chilli sticks , in large no in veg biriyani . When called and gave the review the restaurant owner was least ‚Ä¶

Deliver raw meat with tandoori masala but they called as chicken 65 üò°üò°üò°üò°. Please don‚Äôt order food from this restaurant. Money wasted . This restaurant not like before very very very worst ‚Ä¶

Ordered in Grab food . As usual horrible taste and inconsistency. It‚Äôs a turmeric soup and not Mulakuthavani soup. Non edible chilli sticks , in large no in veg biriyani . When called and gave the review the restaurant owner was least bothered to listen. Always inconsistent delivery in quality. Chefs keeps changing from Indian to Malay in Guess. It‚Äôs like hawker Center... day by day coming down from restaurant

Deliver raw meat with tandoori masala but they called as chicken 65 üò°üò°üò°üò°. Please don‚Äôt order food from this restaurant. Money wasted . This restaurant not like before very very very worst

I called IMM outlet 5 times to cancel order to due last minute emergency (5 minutes after I placed the order). No one picked up my call. Even calling other outlets in hopes they can assist to get through them - the staff can't even help ‚Ä¶

We ordered at 1955, expected delivery was 2035. When we called to check on the delivery, their phone was completely left unanswered. It's now 2105 and we've tried to get an update multiple times. We're not even sure if the food is coming? Or preparing? Or cancelled? Absolutely disgusting service standards.

Poor service standard, if you can't handle the order then don't accept it. Restaurant phone is there just for show. They never ever pick up their calls. AVOID AT ALL COST. We ended up cancelling the order 1.5 hour later because we didn't know if the food was even prepared or OTW.

I called IMM outlet 5 times to cancel order to due last minute emergency (5 minutes after I placed the order). No one picked up my call. Even calling other outlets in hopes they can assist to get through them - the staff can't even help because "it's not their branch". I've checked reviews from other customers they also experienced similar cases. Are your phones even working??

business_name: PastaMania ‚Äì Italian Casual Dining @ West Mall
text:
Tried the newly revamped pasta mania at west mall. The renovation is good, the space is clean & bright, also no stale smell now. Previously I didn‚Äôt like to go there because there‚Äôs a strong stale cheese smell. But now there‚Äôs no smell.

The seating is spacious indoor and outdoor. But outside you can smell the exhaust. Not so ideal.

The pasta or flavors are local / Asian style not like authentic Italian so if you‚Äôre a stickler for traditional Italian food then this is not the place for you.
If you want fast casual dining western style kinda Italian food, at a reasonable price, this is not bad. There‚Äôs no additional GST or service charge.
Many selections of pastas, pizza and appetizers. You can easily get a good meal for less than $20/ person.

I had the promotional set, it was good - Mentaiko cream scallop pasta, seafood tomato soup &
Garlic bread with a drink. I felt the drink was a bit too sweet and soup & garlic bread was a bit on the salty side but it‚Äôs pretty good value at $19.90. Pasta was nice and creamy. I felt the flavor was just right.

Service was prompt enough. Food was piping hot and the staff were friendly & polite. I don‚Äôt mind dining there again if I‚Äôd like a fix of western food next time I‚Äôm in the area.

business_name: PastaMania ‚Äì Italian Casual Dining @ West Mall
text:
We had a good experience at the restaurant. The prawn aglio olio, carbonara, and cheesy crumble bacon pasta were pretty good, though portions were small.

The cheesy pasta was a bit dry, but everything was hot. Bonus: they gave us free chicken fillet (5 pcs) despite us paying with Visa. Friendly staff added to the positive experience.

business_name: PastaMania ‚Äì Italian Casual Dining @ West Mall
text: The worst carbonara or pasta I‚Äôve ever had. Even the ones i cooked at home with Prego is so much better than the Carbonara here which is technically not Carbonara. Wasted my 20 bucks to turn my Carbonara into a Tabasco pasta so i can ‚Ä¶

business_name: PastaMania ‚Äì Italian Casual Dining @ West Mall
text: Went with kid, suggested to order kid meals for free. The promotion is every end of the month on Sunday. I didn't know that, but the staff Siti very friendly and gave suggestions. Happy with the service, more over the taste. Well done n keep it up.

business_name: PastaMania ‚Äì Italian Casual Dining @ West Mall
text: Best pasta place around Bukit Batok area. The place has indoor as well as outdoor dining. Best is when it‚Äôs raining and get an outside table to enjoy rain and have meal. Many times there is eatigo discount and that makes it one more reason to come here. Their cream chicken pasta is best. Will surely come again and again.

business_name: HaveFun Karaoke & Outdoor Beer Garden (SAFRA Yishun)
text:
First time back to a karaoke in Yishun Safra, this place is beautiful, hype and room design and space are just right. Staff are friendly and diligent.

Better promotional price for packages before 10pm, also a 20% discount right now while will only Safra members get 18%. Will be back next time during ‚Äúhappy hours‚Äù to try again.
Love the free flow of curry!! Prata is fluffy and great!! Mee goreng is yummy too, got wok hey! Be back again for more!

It was so crowded as we reached at 10+am.
Madness and had to find a table.
Food wise, some hits n misses.
Sadly all my prata were forgotten n I had to go remind as I saw other tables (After me) and their food were served.

Prata üëéüèΩ- only 1 Pc was served out of my 3.
The other 2 were forgotten again after my reminder.
It was not too bad.
Curry ‚≠ê- free flow curry which was the 1st time I saw at prata places
Mee goreng ‚≠ê - this was very very good. Superb and very spicy as per my request
Mutton biryani ‚≠ê - also very nice. Sauce and mutton were done right

Drinks üëéüèΩüëéüèΩüëéüèΩ - EXTREMELY BAD SERIOUSLY. IT WAS SO SO watery and bad. We barely finished all 3 glasses.
Fried Chicken ü§î - dry and not as good. Asked for 2 drums , she gave me 1 breasts and insisted every table can only have 1 drum. What a weird rule.
Probably some dumb excuse she gave me as what if I ordered 4 chicken? U GonA give me 2 breasts?

Parking is also a big challenge.

Had the chicken masala (a whole chicken breast drenched in masala gravy), cheese prata and egg prata. Prata very crispy and thin. Portions are large. Pappadam crispy, light and non oily - highly recommended to snack on while waiting for main dishes to arrive. Free flow fish and chicken curry - self service. Will be back to try their other dishes someday.

Great prata place with freeflow and self service chicken and fish curry. Must try their murtabak, onion egg prata and maggie goreng (request more chili, if you prefer spicier food). Service are fast, but they tend to miss out order, especially in big group, just gently remind the cashier by showing them your receipt.

Worth a special trip for its good food with vegetarian options (as seen in photos), lovely views of lush green (golf course) and all-day free car park. After a relaxed meal, go for a walk at the nearby Upper Seletar Reservoir Park just right beside.

What a find! There‚Äôs probably no place in the entire Singapore where you can easily find ample parking on any given weekend during dinner time. Let alone FREE parking. All beers are happy hour rate whole day everyday. Burgers is a must try. ‚Ä¶

Looking for a cozy hideaway to enjoy delicious food & escape the crowds? Look no further than golf spot! This rustic cafe & bistro, owned by Mediacorp actor Wang Yuqing, offers stunning views of the golf course & a relaxing atmosphere.

Here's what we tried:
‚ñ´Ô∏èG-Spot Fountain Cheese Wagyu Beef Burger $24.90
‚ñ´Ô∏èCarbonara Pasta with Birdie Bacon $12.90
‚ñ´Ô∏èClassic Italian Sausage Platter $18.90
‚ñ´Ô∏èCelebrity Chicken Mid Wings $6.90
‚ñ´Ô∏èCold Homemade Fresh Honey Lemon $4.50
‚ñ´Ô∏èCold Freshly-Brewed Lemon Tea $4.50

I highly recommend you try the G-Spot Fountain Cheese Wagyu Burger! This mouthwatering burger is loaded with juicy premium Wagyu beef & topped with a fountain of melted cheese that's guaranteed to hit your G-Spot. Trust us, it's the ultimate burger experience you don't want to miss.

And the best part? No GST or service charge! Come for the food, stay for the charm.

Opening Hours:
Monday to Sunday, 8am to 8pm, Closed on Tuesday

üöò Free Parking
üöâ Nearest MRT: Khatib MRT

Chanced upon this Bistro and surprised by the variety and quality of food! Setting within a golf course surrounded by greenery, the ambient here is very relax and the best part is the ample free parking. What a nice place for lunch or dinner!

What a find! There‚Äôs probably no place in the entire Singapore where you can easily find ample parking on any given weekend during dinner time. Let alone FREE parking. All beers are happy hour rate whole day everyday. Burgers is a must try. Chicken wings taste better than they look. Both must go with beer üòÇ #freeparking #cheapbeer #burgers

Small and cute bistro helmed by a local celebrity right by the golf course. I had the signature wagyu cheese burger which unfortunately fell short of expectation. Fries were too salty to my liking, thought there were too much cheese added, and the patty while well seasoned was a tad too dry. Lemon tea was ok.

Wouldn't specifically come here for a meal, but a nice quiet place to relax after a game of golf I'd imagine.

This training restaurant is right inside Assumption Pathway. It is nicely furnished and has good food and desserts. I would bring my friends here for a cosy meal away from the commercial hustle in the city. Tax free and not for profit set up.

1st time having supper at your Cheong Chin Nam outlet. As the table was dirty so i wiped it with a tissue and then after the food was served, i put the tissue on the waiter's tray so that he could help to clear. To my surprise, the waiter (seemed to be a supervisor) simply threw the tissue back at me. Was stunned for awhile for such an attitude. Food was average, prices are alittle steep (4 pax ard $50), so noisy, services by other servers was okay, except for this man. Wont come back again. Pls feel free to email me to verify.

Ordered:
- Garlic Naan: Pairs well with the butter chicken but not on its own
- Butter Chicken set: Prata was less oily as compared to usual, Butter chicken is nice.
- Teh tarik: good
- Mango lassi: Taste somewhat artificial
- Tissue prata: good amount, not bad

Would order again:
- Butter chicken
- Teh tarik

Environment is on the louder side.

Conclusion: For the price, there are better prata places. Not worth a trip specifically to come here.

The number of dishes on offer at this eatery is mind blowing! We ordered the Mee Goreng Pattaya (meat free) for myself, Tulang Soup for my dad and Butter Chicken w Rumali Roti for my mum. All the dishes were tasty, and reasonably priced. ‚Ä¶

The number of dishes on offer at this eatery is mind blowing! We ordered the Mee Goreng Pattaya (meat free) for myself, Tulang Soup for my dad and Butter Chicken w Rumali Roti for my mum. All the dishes were tasty, and reasonably priced. However, the price of the Lime Juice was pretty steep at $4.50 per pax.

Staff are very kind and helpful, so kudos to them for their wonderful service.

We came here specifically for this dish because we had it in Jeju, and it was absolutely delicious there. While I understand it‚Äôs not fair to compare, I was disappointed with the dish here.

That said, the kimchi soup was very tasty! Don‚Äôt mind coming back again for this!

However, the dining experience was not entirely comfortable as the air conditioning was blowing directly on my head.

Additionally, the side dishes were not served automatically and were only brought to us after I requested them from the waiter.

We visited this restaurant in Beauty World for dinner largely due to the high reviews on Google. Compared to the other Korean restaurants in the same building, I do agree that this one is the best. However, compared to other Korean restaurants in Tanjong Pagar, etc, this restaurant was just meh.

We made a reservation through Instagram. I suggest you reserve a table before going because there seemed to be a line growing outside the shop around 7 pm.

It is self service - you order through a QR code. Staff were distant but not rude.

I believe the ban chan was free flow - but it was not topped up though. Quite meh and unremarkable. The omelette was dry. The kimchi was lukewarm and was rather bland. The marinated fishcakes, cucumbers and potato was nothing to shout about. But it‚Äôs complimentary so can‚Äôt really complain.

I ordered the nangmyeon ($15++). The cold noodles was refreshing, though it is a very carb-heavy main. It was only topped with a quarter of a hard boiled egg and less than 10 slices (or should I say slivers) of pear, as well as shredded cucumber. It was pleasantly acidic and cold but it does get boring after a while. You may want to order another side along with this - perhaps the bongsam or mandu.

My partner got the pork soup which tasted much better and had a generous amount of pork slices. It tastes rich but the MSG was apparent.

Worth a visit only if you‚Äôre in the area

The atmosphere is homely and cozy here!

The food is decent, in particular we loved the Ox Knee soup! The broth was strong and flavorful. The hot plate was also decent, so do give it a try.

We love that the place came with free Korean side dishes like Kimchi, Korean fish cakes and omelette. There was also buckwheat tea on the house.

The service is good. Impressed by the lady boss who served us. She was very hospitable, so I‚Äôll definitely be back for more.

The five of us enjoyed our dinner at Yogiyo. Good food and generous portions. Free flow rice tea and banchan was great! Shoutout to the kimchi and eggs and cucumber. We also got the dumplings and mixed boneless fried chicken to share. My friends enjoyed them but personally I think I have had better elsewhere. My bibimbap felt like a never-ending bowl ‚Äî but maybe it‚Äôs because I am not the biggest eater.

Lady boss was very friendly üòä

I had such a good experience in the restaurant. The owner is so welcoming and it‚Äôs always bright all the time in the restaurant. I really like the vibe in the restaurant. It‚Äôs so cool that I get to hear Korean every time. It feels like I‚Äôm becoming Korean. Anyways, the food is really good of course. And I really enjoyed the food so much by eating them with my friends. U recommend the Korean stone pot bibimbap which is like a traditional food in Korea in which you stir and mix healthy ingredients in the rice and eat it with mixed Korean chilli sauce. It‚Äôs just so good that I want to visit there every day. The most important thing is that they give you basically a free and infinite refill of side dishes which has better quality than most the main foods from other restaurants. So I really recommend you to say hello and thank you in Korean. She will love it. And also ask her about her second restaurant and she will tell you how good the food is in her second restaurant. So you can go there too later.üòÉüòÉüòÉüòÉüòÉüòÉüòÉüòáüòáüòáüòáüòçüòçüòçü•∞ü•∞üòòüòò

Very good Korean BBQ.  One of the best in Singapore.

They used a huge flame thrower to melt the cheese on the scallops. ‚Ä¶
Disappointing experience. Previously tried the Tanjong Pagar outlet a few years back and recalled that the standard there was much better. ‚Ä¶

Very good Korean BBQ.  One of the best in Singapore.

They used a huge flame thrower to melt the cheese on the scallops.

Full service they cook everything for you.  Excellent service.

Not the cheapest but certainly one of the best food and service.

Easily one of the best Korean restaurants in Singapore. The food is incredibly flavorful, and the value for money is insane. We got a set for about $50, and the portion size is massive‚Äîdefinitely more than enough for several people. I always end up dabaoing leftovers.

The jjajangmyeon is top-tier, but I was also really impressed with the jjampong and the side dishes, which have improved a lot since I last visited years ago. Now they even serve egg omelette and tteokbokki on the side‚Äîwhat a surprise!

Also wanted to give a shoutout to the super friendly Indian female staff‚Äîgreat energy and service. Actually, all the staff here are lovely.

And just to be clear‚ÄîI‚Äôm leaving this review because it‚Äôs that good, not because of the free H√§agen-Dazs you get for reviewing.

Pro tip: Go during non-peak hours, around 8‚Äì9 PM, just after dinner. Otherwise‚ÄîCONFIRM NO SEATS!

Disappointing experience. Previously tried the Tanjong Pagar outlet a few years back and recalled that the standard there was much better.

Side dishes were really bad: the sausages in the ketchup-like sauce were terribly sweet, cold pasta was also too sweet, they even had one dish that was the chinese sichuan preserved vegetable which was really strange and out of place for a korean restaurant...  As for the KBBQ  the meat was too tough and thick.

The steamed egg was also a big letdown compared to the one I had previously. Jjampong was probably the only dish that was alright. Not great, but at least it wasn't terrible. I did like the texture of their noodles, it was pretty unique.

Their business was not bad on a weekday afternoon, but seats were still available, so there's no need to come early or late to avoid a crowd.

Overall, I will definitely not be returning to this outlet, the standard is not worth the price.

It taste 100% as the ones I had back in Korea. I was kinda late while my friend ordered it for me. So my jjajang noodle was a bit mushy. I didn‚Äôt even ask them but then they gave us a free jjajangmyeon for free as a service and it was really touching and a heart warming experience for me. I give 5+++ for this cuisine.

Really enjoyed the Korean BBQ here! The meats were fresh and well-marinated, and the staff were very attentive in helping us grill. The side dishes were tasty and came with free refills, which made the meal even better. Nice atmosphere, perfect for gatherings with friends or family. Will definitely come back again!

Love the authentic Korean food. Generous servings and lots of variety. The server would automatically offer to refill the sides.  Great place for casual gathering. Good to come with a few people to be able to sample more dishes.

I seldom leave a review, but I‚Äôve got to rave about this place. We chanced upon this restaurant last weekend after a rather tiring and stressful week. Food was great, service was attentive and the staff were the best. They made us forgo our troubles for the short while we were there. We ordered a beef and pork set, a half dozen of scallops and a few beers. They barbecued everything nicely for us, and the beer from the tap was excellent. The friendly staff were what made the whole experience wonderful and unforgettable. You could tell the staff were enjoying what they were doing. Food was constantly being topped up and they were attentive and observant and knew what we preferred from the first visit alone. We returned for a second time today, and again, the service and food did not disappoint. We would be back again. Thank you so much. We greatly appreciate everything.

Love their jajjangmyeon~
Sides are also good, have egg with fillings haha
And free ice cream via google review
The portion is generous‚Äîan army stew could easily feed three people. Side dishes are self-service and unlimited, with free water provided. ‚Ä¶
Good quality and cuts of bbq beef! Best part is the staff here do the bbq for u, the place is spacious as well with free banchan! The food is fresh but worth the price! ‚Ä¶

Really loved the authentic Korean dining experience! BBQ beef and pork were grilled to perfection by friendly staff and boss! The menu options were extensive. Love the kimchi stew and tteobokki with ramen too! Banchan was self service and free flow and was just the right taste! Will definitely be back to try the other dishes!

It‚Äôs my 3rd or 4th time back now, and I love the quality of the meats and the stews!! The beef short ribs is amazing- melts in your mouth and tender. And the Kimchi stew/ soy bean stew is one of the best I‚Äôve had. They also have a free flow ‚Ä¶

Good quality and cuts of bbq beef! Best part is the staff here do the bbq for u, the place is spacious as well with free banchan! The food is fresh but worth the price!
The pork taste not too bad as well, their ala carte looks good too!
Beef is a must try!

The portion is generous‚Äîan army stew could easily feed three people. Side dishes are self-service and unlimited, with free water provided.

Prices are on the higher side, likely due to the large portions. It‚Äôs best to visit in a group to share and try different dishes. The place wasn‚Äôt crowded on a Tuesday evening, but the tables are small and somewhat cramped.

It‚Äôs my 3rd or 4th time back now, and I love the quality of the meats and the stews!! The beef short ribs is amazing- melts in your mouth and tender. And the Kimchi stew/ soy bean stew is one of the best I‚Äôve had. They also have a free flow side dish station (yay to tasty Kimchi/ Beansprouts). The owner is super nice and friendly. It‚Äôs becoming my go to place! 10/10 will go back!!
Good BBQ place! The meats were good and they serve buffet condiments. Free flow of kimchi, radish, sauces etc. will visit again.

We ordered marinated crabs , seafood pancake, dried Pollock, steam egg ,Japchae and bbq pork. The service is good as the waitress will help us to bbq the pork to perfection.  Dried pollock is a steal. We love it and is paired well with soju. Free flow of ban chan and leafy veg for customers to take. Ambience is good for small gathering.
Had the beef and pork set, quite nice. Also ordered Kimchi Pancake, Tteokbokki and steam egg. Side dishes and sauces are free flow.

Had dinner here with my family and it was the first time I hear everyone praising the food - literally no one had anything bad to say! üòÅ Everyone loved the fried chicken (my SIL said it was the best fried chicken she's ever had, and given that her mom is a darn good cook I think that's very high praise indeed; even my own mother who's really picky about food said it was her fav dish in this meal). All of us loved the army stew, especially my dad - he had 3 helpings! (almost got a 4th but he backed out reluctantly at the last minute; as far as I can recall he had never been so enthusiastic about food üòÇ); also worth mentioning was the commendable service from the wait staff who promptly refilled the soup in our stew every time we requested it (3-4 times in total, I think). For my wife and I, we favoured the Ziggle Chicken, mainly because of the deliciously chewy tteokbokki which had a lovely crispy exterior; the chicken counterpart was nice and tender too, coated amply with a tasty sweet soy sauce, but sadly it was overshadowed by the fried chicken. üòã Last but not least, there was the seafood pancake and it was also a gem - see photo to believe. Overall, it was a really enjoyable experience for my family, so I guess we are definitely coming back. Highly recommended! üòä

We visited Daisy‚Äôs Dream Kitchen on Mother‚Äôs Day and had a lovely experience. The place was relatively crowded but had a warm, homely vibe. Staff were friendly and polite throughout. A thoughtful touch was the free pack of belachan given to ‚Ä¶

We visited Daisy‚Äôs Dream Kitchen on Mother‚Äôs Day and had a lovely experience. The place was relatively crowded but had a warm, homely vibe. Staff were friendly and polite throughout. A thoughtful touch was the free pack of belachan given to all mothers. The food was good, serving up traditional Peranakan flavours just like home. Indoor seating is limited, but there are alfresco outdoor seats as well. A great spot for comforting Peranakan food.

Everything was so good!

Would appreciate heads-up detail about the lunch discount prior to order. ‚Ä¶

Everything was so good!

Would appreciate heads-up detail about the lunch discount prior to order.

My photos don't do justice as we couldn't hold any further when their dishes arrived.

Oh my goodness, the spicy stew pot with seafood, tofu, vegetables, runny egg and rice was so robust and tasty, I was continuously-slurping in the soup despite choking twice due to its level of spiciness (unfortunately, I have a low tolerance for spicy food). The seafood pancake with scallions also hits the spot. It was thin, crispy, non-greasy and loaded with plenty of fillings.
Did I mention that each of their complimentary side dishes consisting of kimchi, seasoned bean sprouts, macaroni salad, stir-fried anchovies, stir-fried fish cake and egg rolls was equally impressive and refillable too! We were mindlessly eating loads of it while waiting for our food to arrive. üò¨

Delighted to see they have grilled pork belly with lettuce set so I don‚Äôt have to eat carbo. The jajjjang Mian is not too bad. Not too sweet. Well balanced. The ramyeon with tebboki is not bad too. Octopus bibimbap is ok. Prefer it more charred.. took a long while for the food to arrive‚Ä¶ seafood pancake was ok. Would have been better if more seafood. And thinner with more scallions.

One of the tastiest and most affordable Korean restaurants around! The food is consistently good, and the value for money is unbeatable in Singapore.

Highly recommend the samgyeopsal and the soondubu/kimchi soup‚Äîboth full of flavor and generously portioned.

The place is often packed and walk-in only, so it can be a bit of a gamble if you‚Äôre coming during peak hours. Try during off-peak times if you can.

They usually charge $2 for additional lettuce, but the staff was kind enough to offer it free of charge just this once‚Äîa small gesture, but it really left a good impression.

Easy 5 stars. Rarely disappointed. A place I keep coming back to.

Great place for delicious Korean food!

We came on a Saturday for dinner. It was very crowded when we reached at 6pm, so reservations are highly recommended.

We tried many things from the menu:
- Mulnaengmyeon (cold noodles) were decent.
- Fried Chicken and Chicken Gangjung (fried chicken in sweet & spicy sauce) were really good! Highly recommend.
- Samgyetang (chicken soup with ginseng) was so-so. The soup's was a little bland.
- Gimbap was good.
- Dolsot Bibimbap was really good too! The sauce mixed with the rice, vegetables and meat made a very flavourful combination. Do note it may be quite spicy.
- Haemulpajeon (pancake with seafood & vegetables) was excellent! The pancake was crispy and the taste was very fragrant. The sauce also complements the pancake very well.
The side dishes are also free flow!

Service was decent. Before we got our orders, one of the staff brought us refills of the side dishes without us requesting, but towards the end of the meal, we had to ask the staff 2 times for a refill of the kimchi.

üóìÔ∏è Visited 8 June 2024

The seafood pancake is good. I highly recommend it. The pork kimchi soup also warms the stomach on a cool day for me (I was there on a day that rains non-stop). The mixed fried chicken is a bit hit and miss. It is also a bit too much for 2 pax. If I were to choose again, I would skip the fried chicken and go for other dishes. Restaurant can be busy during weekday lunch time, I strongly encourage to call and make reservation to avoid waiting time.
Delicious Thai food, though the lemon grass drink was too sweet. Was here on a Sunday at 1130. Comfortable crowd with more people streaming in later. Free popcorn.

Popcorn is better than anywhere u can find easily. Free flow somemore!!

Typical Thai food. Serving is decent for family to share. Water is self service ‚Ä¶
Food delicious as usual but there‚Äôs changes of their services compare previously. Friendly and good service and came with free popcorn. It gave me a good impression and sure will come back again.

Popcorn is better than anywhere u can find easily. Free flow somemore!!

Typical Thai food. Serving is decent for family to share. Water is self service and free flow as well. The 2 chilli selections are damn spicy!!!

Service is fast and courteous.
Location is very good on 1st floor, right behind bus stop.

A lot of locations. HILLION Mall also has an outlet.
Food comes really hot. The AC and fan is very strong as well.

Lots of seats in the restaurant.
Clean place as well

I also love thai food that‚Äôs why we try this restaurant. Food is delicious and affordable.
My family enjoyed eating and we finished everything. For sure we will go back here next time. Have free popcorn while waiting for order but we didn‚Äôt try it because they served so fast.

Food: Orders were served promptly within 5 minutes. Staff was quick to usher us to the table, despite a visible crowd in the restaurant. Orders were through a QR code which can be scanned from the table. Prices are fairly affordable. Their Kai Lan and Sweet & Sour fish are really good.

Service: Used utensils and cutlery were picked up by the staff very quickly. Dishes were served in a very prompt manner.  For families, there are free popcorn which is self served. Good value added services, but hygiene is an issue as you might not know if the previous diners' hands are clean or not.

Atmosphere: Okay, comfortable sitting arrangements and spaces between each table fairly wide.

Overall a good 4 star rating given by me. Sanook Kitchen is just like your Thai food McDonald's style. If you have a craving for Thai food and don't want to burn a big hole in your pocket, this is the place you should visit. Damage is about SGD 25 to 30 per pax, inclusive of GST and service charge.
The food is good, service is even better üíïüíñ free popcorn and drinks üëçüèªüëçüèª ‚Ä¶

Great service to accommodate our pretty large group. Good value lunch set for 4 and dishes were served hot and fresh! Good portions as well. Nice and spacious outlet with complimentary popcorn while you wait. Fuss free lunch spot!
The food is good, service is even better üíïüíñ free popcorn and drinks üëçüèªüëçüèª
I like Sanook kitchen, the food is so delicious.  üçøüòÅüòÅ FREE WATER PPLS ARE SOOO KINDDD FREE FILING POPCORN 100 STAR‚≠ê ‚Ä¶

Roselle drink is surprisingly good. Free üçø. Large portions.
---------------
Affordable small portion dishes. Typical  menu like any other halal thai food. At peak hour the queue is long during weekends.

A very special and cosy Italian food restaurant in Choa Chu Kang Area !! It‚Äôs not easy to get good Italian food in the west, Choa Chu Kang town !
There is pool side dining too. Free parking for visitors!!
A good spread on the menu. Must try the gelato ( ice cream ) after the mea.
The food was delicious and we enjoyed it.  Will come back to this place next time .
1 month old Italian restaurant! ‚ú®Ô∏è Traditional Italian food done very well. The parking is free and non members can come here too.

Came to give this a try & was pleasantly surprised by how good it is.
We had the truffle fries starters and fries were really crispy and tasted really nice.

The mains and pizza were all handmade and it tasted really fresh. The service was on point as well, food didn‚Äôt take long and staffs were attentive.
The most surprising factor is the price of food. It is so well priced & you‚Äôll never find such good Italian food at these prices. The owner told us this was only possible because of the location. - it is situated within a golf club which might not be the most convenient but it‚Äôs well worth the travel!  Parking is free as well.

Was also surprised to know that the head chef is had over 27 years of experience in an Italian restaurant which explained how good the food was.

Thank you for the great dinner & a memorable place for us to celebrate our anniversary. Will definitely be back again!

The food is taste really good and the presentation is aesthetically pleasinh which makes the food look more appetizing. The chef, staff were all friendly and ensures that they cater and provide you their best service. Will come to dine in again

Been here several times in the past year, the food was fine (you could definitely get better food for cheaper) for the price, had always been served by a Korean lady - she‚Äôs great. But the experience by the male owner cum waiter this morning was atrocious, there needs to be a fairer queuing system in place! The man  (supposedly the owner) took note of us waiting in the queue (and he acknowledged when we first approached him to ask for a table before waiting in line) alongside other groups of patrons waiting outside the eatery for their table. When a table became available, he ended up inviting the other male and female duo (photo: the lady in revealing spaghetti strap padded top and sports shorts) in for their meal ahead of us right immediately upon their arrival, leaving us waiting in the queue. No apology made. And I  recall they do not take reservations, no? Horrible experience.

I‚Äôm really happy with my dinning experience here. Basically eat what the owner serves, at fixed set price (18sgd), cheaper for takeaway orders. It overall felt like a family dinner. Menue might change depending on the day of the week. The sticky rice waffle was outstanding.

Served by a Korean ahjussi (the owner likely) who asked if I wanted indoor or outdoor seating. There is only the daily set menu available so no ordering was required.

Was first given a 500ml cold mineral water (v much welcome in this hot weather) which is free of charge.

The menu I had for the day (16th July, can check out their IG for the daily menu):

Udon Noodle salad
Spicy Pork Stir-fry
Fried Chicken in Sour Soy Sauce
Egg Roll
Home made Mashed Potato (Korean Style)
Sliced Radish Kimchi
Seasoned Soybean Sprouts
Kimchi Pancake with Chilli paste
Kimchi
Long Cabbage Soup

Food was nothing to shout about but tasted v homely. It was quite filling w a good amount of veg, meat and carbs. A set costs SGD18.90 nett.

After the meal, a small size of pineapple (v sweet) and a hot mochi waffle were served.

Guess it‚Äôs decent and good for when you want to try a variety of things.

The food is scrumptious and mouth watering. They have exclusive deals such as their buffets and discounts. Their food is authentic Karnataka cuisine especially coastal Karnataka. They change their menus every Saturday and their food is ‚Ä¶

Swagat Indian Vegetarian just performed the culinary equivalent of a Jedi mind-trick on my taste buds. One chapati thali in, and I‚Äôm already drafting a heartfelt apology letter to every chicken wing I‚Äôve ever met. The fluffy-yet-toasty chapati is a warm hug from a carb-loving fairy, and the spread of curries, veggies, rasam, and papadum turns the humble metal tray into a full-blown flavour amusement park‚Äîno roller-coaster lines, just pure spice joy.

Highlights:
‚Ä¢ The dal? So comforting, it practically asked about my day.
‚Ä¢ The veggie korma? If velvet had a taste, this would be it.
‚Ä¢ The rasam? Imagine tomato soup got a PhD in sass and decided to party.

I left 100 % satisfied, 90 % convinced I could live happily ever after on plants alone, and 10 % wondering if chapati-scented cologne is a thing. Carnivores, beware: one visit to Swagat and you might find yourself Googling ‚Äúhow to break up with bacon.‚Äù See you on the veggie side!

The food is scrumptious and mouth watering. They have exclusive deals such as their buffets and discounts. Their food is authentic Karnataka cuisine especially coastal Karnataka. They change their menus every Saturday and their food is fresh and hot.It is also a pure vegetarian restaurant.
I recommend the methi parata and paneer.
They also do deliveries.

I recommend the amazing rava masala dosa. It was heavenly and I absolutely enjoyed its pairing with madhur vada which is a flat vada that is filled with flavour. So decadent and rich absolutely divine. The vada Pav is beautifully prepared with chutney of various flavours and a melody of the potatoes as it melts into your mouth- just like in Mumbai!!
Overall, an amazing place which I definitely recommend.

To the owner,

According to Google, your shop's listed opening hours are 7:30 AM. However, when we arrived at 8:00 AM, the shop was not open, and we had to call the staff out of the kitchen. Unlike other stalls, your shop was not ready for business, and unfortunately, the staff informed us that they were not prepared to take breakfast orders.

In a location where office employees and other customers frequently visit, it's disappointing to see such a lack of readiness. I wanted to bring this to your attention, as it may be affecting your business. If necessary, please consider adjusting the opening hours to a later time when your shop is fully prepared to serve customers, especially since other stalls would already be in full operation by then.
Does not maintain time of delivery. Delivered one hour late.Bad service did not call  nor returns / answers calls.

No longer vegetarian friendly. Insisted on asking me to pay for dhal to dip my prata, but its free if i wanted fish/chicken curry. Ordered vegetarian fried rice, was soggy and VERY salty, inedible. Used to be my favourite place, not sure why they made such rules, im sure dhal costs the same or less than meat options.

Update: just realised they responded by calling me a liar. Not only did they change to make it chargeable(ive been there before, countless times and dhal was free). They are now lying, idk why. And ignored my feedback about the poor food quality. Calling me absurd for asking why fish/chicken curry is free yet dhal is charged? Either way they didnt answer at all yet attacked back at a customer.

Fyi, when i head to other prata places, dhal is free. Your problem is changing it to chargeable without informing, and the poor quality of food. When i say dhal, i mean dhal, not sambar.

Do better instead of attacking customers feedback.

business_name: Legendary Hong Kong Restaurant @ Jurong Point È¶ôÊ∏ØÂÇ≥Â•áÈ§êÂª≥
text:
Went there for mothers day brunch. Ordered

1) 3 combi platter
2) zhu Chang fen (dough fritters) & vegetarian
3) soy chicken rice
4) lo Mai kai
5) Siew Mai
6) beef ball
7) ee fu Mee
8) char Siew soh

Generally the food here is okay.. not too bad and not very fantastic. Okay lor. The ambience is very Hong Kong like where it is noisy and lively as it is mother's day, the waiter that serves us (liao fang) wished us a happy mother's day and gave us a free green bean soup. She is very nice and gave us some menu recommendations which turns out to be good.

Overall the food is okay, not very special not very bad.

But the service is really good. Shout out to liao fang for the service.

business_name: Legendary Hong Kong Restaurant @ Jurong Point È¶ôÊ∏ØÂÇ≥Â•áÈ§êÂª≥
text: Dropped by this random spot for a weekday lunch. JK was super friendly and took great care of us. Food was yummy, and they even gave free green bean soup for Mother‚Äôs Day. Such a nice touch!

business_name: Legendary Hong Kong Restaurant @ Jurong Point È¶ôÊ∏ØÂÇ≥Â•áÈ§êÂª≥
text:
Love the food here. They have free coffee for Fathers Day celebration!. We are served by Liao Fang, very friendly and nice lady.
Do come~‚ô°

business_name: Legendary Hong Kong Restaurant @ Jurong Point È¶ôÊ∏ØÂÇ≥Â•áÈ§êÂª≥
text:
Been going to this restaurant since 2018 and had always enjoyed the food. The last visit, however, was an extremely unpleasant experience thanks to one incredibly rude staff (circled in photo). I went to get the chili and green onion at the counter, she approached me and said I didn't wear mask so it's unfair to others -( this is December 2024 and we no longer have the mask mandate). It's still okay as I understand that since I didn't wear mask, I shouldn't get the condiment by myself and asked the staff to get chili and onion for me. The same old lady staff came over and talked to me in an accusing tone saying that I already took a lot of the onions, while in fact I only took a tiny spoon on top of some chili. She then said that if I wanted to take the onion I had to pay 3$. The way she talked down to me is not only rude but also disrespectful since I am a paying customer and if there was a need to pay 3$ I had no problem paying it, but there was in fact no need as confirmed by her manager and coworkers. I don't understand how can someone work in F&B and have this kind of demeaning attitude towards customers, talking to down to customers as if they owed her something. Hope management takes this into review.

Update: Emailed the management at the email address mentioned in the response by owner below for the so-called 'service recovery' on the same day but got absolutely no reply whatsoever. 7 months on and counting. Goes to show what kind of service this restaurant chain offers.
High CP value for a chicken rice in the neighbourhood least the queue. My go to chicken rice store whenever i am free.

Wowww the food was amazing Here...
Must try restaurant in Singapore...
The egg parato and biriyani here was top notch..
Loved the experience ‚ù§Ô∏è

I know staff are busy, so I‚Äôm listening very carefully when my number being call. I show up in front of the table the next second when my number being called, but the staff just look at my receipt and turn around without passing my meal. I just keep waiting in front of table for 5 minutes until another staff pass me the meal which is already prepared on aside of table. Rude staff bad service , not recommend go to this store spend money, please have your lunch or dinner in another restaurant. Don‚Äôt let them ruin your day.

Took 25 mins just to make an order. To be clear I had only small issue with the lateness. Because I saw there was some operational issue, it seems theyre confused on which table to deliver some orders to other patrons. I saw the backlog of orders processing keep increasing on the screen. I opted for picking up my dine in item that i think will help relieve the issue.

What is dissapointing is my number was called on the screen, but my order was not ready, I saw my tray was sitting there for 10 mins because they are waiting for my coffee. I was awkwardly standing out in front of collection because my number is called on the screen, when I looked at the screen again, my number was gone as if my order is considered "done". But my incomplete tray is still sitting there. I dont know if there is KPI for order speed, but thats not right. Dont turn off my order if its not done yet.

Also what is disappointing is the lack of apology for making me wait so long by the staff. I saw some uncle apologize profusely to the customer next to me (he came after me but got the order much earlier) but the uncle delivered the order while I was waiting longer receive no apology from the server who hand in the order because i pick up the order myself. The auntie who served me was not nice at all.
Wont be coming back here again

Not once, not twice, but always miss items be it peak or non peak. My shaker fries always come as normal fries without the powder and shaker pack. Fries is soggy. Service is bad, ask the person to check for missing items, roll eyes. Queue system is bad, always calling the number before its even ready.

I was shamed by the cashier after I took a spoon and fork from this counter, when in fact I have purchased from them. I was embarrassed since many people in this food court were looking at me since I was called by the guy from this counter. This is my worst experience in Singapore so far.

I was shamed by the cashier after I took a spoon and fork from this counter, when in fact I have purchased from them. I was embarrassed since many people in this food court were looking at me since I was called by the guy from this counter. This is my worst experience in Singapore so far.

If you've never eaten leather before, this is your chance to!

For a limited time, IKEA is having lamb chop on its menu. The chops are, let's ‚Ä¶

Okay first I went on Chinese new year day one, so I thought it‚Äôll be pretty damn crowded but no it wasn‚Äôt (for IKEA standard, it wasn‚Äôt)
Second, I ordered the meatballs, and when I bit into it, it was cold. Hard cold. Couldn‚Äôt believe it. I always love the meatballs especially at Alexandra.
And finally, the drinks station probably isn‚Äôt free flow but we all just take it.
So ya might want to fix that

If you've never eaten leather before, this is your chance to!

For a limited time, IKEA is having lamb chop on its menu. The chops are, let's just say, really muscular, and really well done (in the doneness sense).

Give it a miss unless you need a protein fix - along with your teeth.

The chicken wings is tasty and delicious.

Overall experience is good but the restaurant is a bit crowded during peak hour and super challenging in finding a table.

Food and drink is at an affordable and inexpensive pricing with freeflow of coffee and drink.

A nice place for family lunch and dinner.

Free tea or coffee every day if you are a member. $3.50 for 5 meatballs and mashed potatoes. Perfect for afternoon tea or light lunch/dinner. Cheese tart and cheese cake are also delicious and reasonably priced. Main dishes are average.

Update: add a video of Ikea Soya Ice cream $0.50 to contribute

Eaten here since opening of this IKEA in JEM

Overall I decided to give my rating a average experience

Food(3 star):average
Food Is always warm, since it's not freshly cook anyway but you get your food faster than Mcdonald although sometime take time to get new fried chicken and mushroom soup

Service(3 star):average
Can be better, sometime fried chicken and mushroom soup isn't ready, when taking sauce from chilli and tomato section

Turn out both sauces are tomato, there isn't any chilli sauce which is unacceptable...

Atmosphere(2 star):dislike it
Very noisy and crowded although the queue isn't worse compare to Alexandra, don't like there a slope near cashier which is dangerous incase the cart hit someone on the coffee, drinks, sugar and utensils section...place isn't clean may due to bad diners leaving a mess, if you would like to get free refill coffee and stay to work here
Perharp think twice and consider going to Mcdonald Jem instead or Jurong Regional Library

There can be inconsiderate people with no self awareness hoarding seats during peak hours, want to have a conversation please go somewhere else been waiting for a seat was hoping they would finish the food but the food is left without eaten properly what a waste
The cheese tart and chocolate lava cake here are pretty delish! The kopi is slightly below average, but for 50c and free refills, I‚Äôm not complaining at all!

Food was average. But the service staff was Extremely very rude specifically the tall chinese guy w/ sunglasses :) and is fair skin please this guy has some attitude on customers and i understand chinese so he was saying some derogatory stuff to his other staff as he asking aggressively how many meatball i want. But anyway, i didn't gave any reaction. But by right this staff should be fired. Godbless to him. Bad experience on staff but overall food was decent. WONT VISIT AGAIN.
IKEA Swediah Meatballs are always great, love the gravy & jam. But the cold water prawns tho! so simple yet so good üòã Also the $1.50 free-flow drinks are good for the budget üëçüèª ‚Ä¶
The free flow coffee will make your day. The food is nice but the dining area is abit small.

business_name: Yan Palace Restaurant (Warren Golf & Country Club)
text: PSA: membership don‚Äôt have 10% discount for Mother‚Äôs Day, Father‚Äôs Day, CNY. Go there early if not pig trotter sold out ‚Ä¶

business_name: Yan Palace Restaurant (Warren Golf & Country Club)
text:
MANAGER ERRONEOUSLY CHARGED $3,300 FOR A $330 BILL AND DID NOT APOLOGISE.

268++ for 4 pax CNY dinner.

Service was extremely slow - waitress asked if they could serve the next dishes but each time we said ok it still took close to 20-25 minutes for the dish to be served.

The food is honestly subpar as well. Didn‚Äôt have much flavour. The yusheng was an all carrot one, surprising for a full fledged Chinese restaurant. Compare this with TungLok and the others, it‚Äôs honestly pathetic.

Fish maw soup lacked flavour. Honestly felt more like gooey mess than something that have been broiled for a long while. The cod fish was bland as well, and the texture seemed as tho it wasn‚Äôt fresh. Scallop and broccoli was a slight improvement, albeit broccoli was undercooked.

The ee-mian, a dish that everyone avoids since it‚Äôs not supposed to be the star of any meal, was perhaps the best performer in a lacklustre dinner. But that‚Äôs also because at least the green chili gave an added dimension.

Finally, dessert which was a red bean pancake. Funny thing that we asked if it could be changed to yam paste Orh nee at the start which she said no, and if we wanted we needed to top up some $20. But Orh Nee is $6 per bowl and I‚Äôm in a family of 4. Makes absolutely no sense.

To top it off they seated us in a weird square table in between large round 10 seater tables, meaning to say we were the only square table and were just in an awkward position for the entire dinner.

Long story short, absolute nightmare.

Came as a kid, thought of it as a pretty decent place. Now it‚Äôs just garbage.

Edit: it was not a pancake. It was red bean soup. And we waited 15 mins for this too.

Edit2: the manager had a ridiculous attitude also. She erroneously clicked $3,300 for a $330 meal and charged the card without realising that she added an additional 0. When we disputed she just casually remarked ‚Äúoh lucky you realised‚Äù without apologising whatsoever.

Edit3: Honestly gave up on this place lol. The manager called to try and understand but I was busy. I tried to schedule a call. And the said manager decided case closed. Pathetic.
