business_name: Yan Palace Restaurant (Warren Golf & Country Club)
text:
PSA: membership don‚Äôt have 10% discount for Mother‚Äôs Day, Father‚Äôs Day, CNY. Go there early if not pig trotter sold out

Recommend:

1. Qian long tofu. Named after the emperor, the beancurd is soft, skin is crispy, savoury source with scallop.

2. Hor fun got wok hey

3. Pig trotter vinegar gravy taste appetising. We even ordered 2, 1 to takeaway.

4. Carrot Cake. Soft and crispy. Much better than hawker centre.

5. Popcorn chicken

Don‚Äôt order: porridge, dessert, dim sum. Service is slow

business_name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
text:
Disappointed with the service here. We came with 9 pax and were told to squeeze into one table, which made no sense, so we requested 2 tables ‚Äî 4 and 5 pax. The cashier auntie already seemed unhappy about having to set up another mookata pot and gave us a really bad attitude. Later when we asked (politely) about the free ice cream promotion ‚Äî which we know is usually available with a minimum spend ‚Äî she completely ignored us, black face, and acted like she didn‚Äôt hear. Honestly, if it‚Äôs not available anymore, just say so. No need for that kind of attitude. We‚Äôre paying customers, not asking for a favour.

To top it off, another staff member who lights the pots decided to clear our table without a word ‚Äî just told the cleaner to remove our bowls and utensils and let another group sit down, without even informing us first. That‚Äôs not how you treat customers.

Food is okay, but the service is really off-putting. Not sure if I‚Äôd return. Staff need serious training on basic courtesy.

business_name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
text: This is the worst Siam Square Mookata I've been to. Prices are higher than other branches and food quality is not good. The pepper dishes are basically soaked in a small amount of fine pepper. Look at the photo to judge for yourself. ‚Ä¶

business_name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
text: Cheap and yummy! Ordered 16 dishes and it only cost 38 bucks! Yet I'm so full and satisfied üòä Like best, their fish, teriyaki chicken (all their chicken very tender!), Shishamo, oyster mushroom, broccoli (especially after it soaks up the yummy soup), and luncheon meat (especially if u grill it till the exterior is crispy!). Black pepper pork belly is not bad. Items that are mediocre includes, cheese tofu, hotdog, scallops (too thin lol), straw mushrooms, etc. Cheese dip is good but I still prefer the original taste, if not marinate. Would go back!

business_name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
text: Food was tasty, but soup is salty. Dishes priced mostly at $1.80 and $2, exception of special items. Some items is okay, while some is quite expensive with its small portion. Worth a try. They also have a buffet price around $30~ for all you can eat (excluding scallop and special menu).

business_name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
text: This is the worst Siam Square Mookata I've been to. Prices are higher than other branches and food quality is not good. The pepper dishes are basically soaked in a small amount of fine pepper. Look at the photo to judge for yourself. Service is also lousy when we told them our plate cannot even boil, they just say is ok and walked off. While our neighbouring tables all had boiling soup. The garlic pork... Can u even see the garlic? This is the first n last time I'll eat here. Avoid if you don't want to spoil your mood.

business_name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
text:
Been patronising this mookata since my secondary school days a few years ago. The attitude of the auntie, probably the lady boss, has been getting worse with every visit. Like many of the reviews I read about this place, the auntie has a very stuck up and rude attitude towards customers. The only redeeming quality is the uncle roaming around and actively topping up our soup broth promptly while remaining friendly.
Was heading over to the counter to make payment and I saw they offered free ice cream with every $20 spent. The 2 of us spent $50 at this mookata place and we just wanted to take ONE ice cream so we asked the auntie about it. she completely ignored us and glared over at us and rolled her eyes just as we were tapping our card for payment. I thought that she missed what I said so i asking again nicely. Again, she just glared at me and ignored me. After a few seconds, she then shouted at us in chinese that ‚Äúthe chocolate flavour was sold out‚Äù. I was taken aback by her suddenly shouting at me for no apparent reason?? We just walked away and proceeded to a nearby ice cream shop instead of taking her ice cream. Acting as if we are taking her stuff without purchasing anything; ridiculous.
Additionally, the portions at this place were so miserable for the price point. Meat was so thinly sliced and drenched in murky water whilst the cheese tofu had a weird taste to it. The chairs were also extremely greasy. Whilst I know that isn‚Äôt the fault of the mookata shop, it added on to the very unpleasant experience i had here.
Would not be patronising this mookata outlet again as the auntie‚Äôs attitudes is driving me away time after time again!

business_name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
text:
Location is a little hard to find cause it's away from the MRT thought this place would be quite packed at night, so I wanted to do a reservation, but for this particular outlet, they don't accept reservations, only walk in. I went there on a Saturday around the evening time like 9 pm, and there wasn‚Äôt much crowd. The staff quickly found a seat and sat my friend and me. It was really fast. The staff also assist in heating the pan and pouring the soup. The ordering process was seamless, haha, cause self order! The staff gave us a QR Code and asked us to scan and order. Save the environment (no need for paper) and also more hygienic cause you don‚Äôt need to hold the pen/pencil (need to sanitise also) found it pretty cool that a store/Kopitiam have ‚Äúonline ordering‚Äù. After you order and feel that you didn‚Äôt have enough, you can scan and order again. Simple. You can also check how much you spent easily via the website itself. Besides the self-service ordering, the sauces and the pork fats (aka oil) you are free to take by yourself. We saw button mushrooms on the menu and ordered them; for mushrooms, lovers can try grilling the mushroom. It is not bad.

Oh, yea:
- Students get discounts also on weekdays if I am not wrong it's 10%!
- Got melted cheese also for cheese lovers at an additional top-up!

I want to compliment one of the staff for helping us refill the soup automatically.

I will patronise again if I am near the area! By the way, this place is also a food paradise with a lot of other food options available as well! üòÅ

business_name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
text: Nice place. Good value. Service a little slow on weekends. Go early on weekends otherwise call to make reservations. Items starts from $1.80 a serving.

business_name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata in Singapore
text: Simple fuss free place to settle some mookata craving. Food was alright, tasty enough.

business_name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata in Singapore
text: Overall bad especially the price is much expensive than the service and foods they offer. And some of the items that they announce on their website buffet menu are not available. Not only the meat are not fresh but also we are not allowed ‚Ä¶

business_name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata in Singapore
text: Overall bad especially the price is much expensive than the service and foods they offer. And some of the items that they announce on their website buffet menu are not available. Not only the meat are not fresh but also we are not allowed to try every items on the menu.Although the website says that they have ice cream for dessert, only few branch contains ice cream dessert but the price for the buffet is the same for all branch. With this amount of price you can get a lot better mookata in other places.

Have always ordered their bento sets for my events and mini buffet sets for my training courses. Portions are generous, food is consistently fantastic, and pricing is very reasonable. Highly recommend them if you‚Äôre looking for fuss-free, quality catering!

Paid $21+ for a set of tonkatsu with free flow rice, miso soup and cabbage, and refillable iced tea. As compared to surrounding establishments this store is relatively less crowded. Pork cutlet was decent, batter crispy and not too dry. ‚Ä¶
The price is reasonable. Free flow rice , soup and cabbage. Recommended the assorted tonkatsu which have salmon, hokkaido pork, prawn

It‚Äôs my first visit, and I always believe in first impression is important, this is applicable to any F&B too. Sharing this for those who are exploring for an authentic Japanese dining experience in Woodlands, look no further than Tonkatsu ENbiton at Causeway Point. Renowned for its dedication to quality and flavor, this establishment offers a variety of tonkatsu dishes that are sure to delight your palate.‚Äã

A must-try here is their Chicken Katsu! Perfectly breaded and fried to a beautiful golden crisp, it‚Äôs crunchy on the outside while staying incredibly tender and juicy inside. Every bite is packed with flavor, making it a top choice among diners who love a good, satisfying katsu.

A great dining experience isn‚Äôt just about the food‚Äîit‚Äôs also about the atmosphere. A warm, inviting ambience can elevate a meal, making it more enjoyable and memorable. At Tonkatsu ENbiton, they‚Äôve nailed this balance perfectly.

From the moment you step in, you‚Äôre greeted with a cozy and well-lit space that feels both modern and comfortable. The seating is thoughtfully arranged, giving diners enough room to enjoy their meal without feeling cramped. Whether you're dining solo, with family, or catching up with friends, the setting feels just right.

Not forgetting to mention the restaurant also offer free flow of rice, mixed cabbage & arugula! ü•∞

Paid $21+ for a set of tonkatsu with free flow rice, miso soup and cabbage, and refillable iced tea. As compared to surrounding establishments this store is relatively less crowded. Pork cutlet was decent, batter crispy and not too dry. However the free accompanying tasted very weird; the container with a wooden scoop had a sauce that tasted like liquefied sticky haw flakes, and the sauce bottle beside it contained a dark sauce that tasted like the extract of barbecue flavored Lays potato chips. Miso soup contained funny ingredients and was quite salty.

Ate lunch with my parects and then with my wife. Enjoyed our meals, we loved the tasty quality tonkatsu with free flow salad and sauces. Dessert was great.
Today, the waitress Janet was friendly and attentive too!

A value for money tonkatsu ramen place. Had been here a few times, and it has never disappointed in the food department. Great tonkatsu, delish ramen with umami rich broth, and free flow of rice, and cabbage! Service is good but sometimes, ‚Ä¶

A value for money tonkatsu ramen place. Had been here a few times, and it has never disappointed in the food department. Great tonkatsu, delish ramen with umami rich broth, and free flow of rice, and cabbage! Service is good but sometimes, need a small nudge to remind the crew to place the sesame seeds bowls and pickles. Small matter, as I understand that this place can get super busy. Atmosphere is good but there are a few spots that can get quite stuffy. Especially the tables next to the pasta place. Overall a nice spot for ramen when the craving hits.

I really enjoyed the food here!

Ordered the Hokkaido Hire Katsu Set for myself. The meat was really not fatty at all yet really tender. I‚Äôm impressed at the quality for the price, as it reminds me of the top ones I had in Japan! At just a $1 top up from the Rosu Katsu, I definitely highly recommend this one!

The Rosu Katsu was actually pretty decent too (my family member ordered it), but there were still some fatty bits on the sides which I couldn‚Äôt bite through. Still, the meat is not bad and quite tender too.

Free flow cabbage and rice~

Overall, I really enjoyed my experience here. First timer to Tonkatsu ENbiton and I would definitely revisit. The Hire Katsu was really impressive and I would reorder for sure. Next time I also wanna try the Gyukatsu and Salmon Katsu which looks interesting!

it was quiet on the weekday evening we came by. loved how tender the pork chops were, even though they were deep fried. but the black curry beef looked non-appetising though, even though it tasted alright. do grind the sesame & mix it in with the sauce for extra flavour. loved their sesame sauce dressing for their free flow salad too! üòã

Great atmosphere over here. Bought the beef katsu and pork katsu sets. Pork was tender but there could be more breadcrumbs because it was not that crispy. Beef katsu was good. Staff were polite, attentive and offered us free refills of rice and cabbage.

This restaurant is located at Causeway point basement. We went there slightly after lunch time and the restaurant is still 80% full. The fried pork is good, the top facing customer is crispy but the below is slightly oily. The soup not that hot. They give free flow of rice and cabbage if you order a set. I have ordered the set with cheese sauce, the pot was still on with fire, cooking the cheese and which later dried up and the bottom of the pork stuck into the pot. Overall, the food is good. Will come again.

It was one of those days that I decided I had worked hard and wanted to treat myself to some good food. This was the second time I am here, and I didn't expect good service since the service at my first visit was meh.
However, there is this long hair auntie that served me the food. She patiently explained to me how to use the condiments and told me the rice and cabbage are free flow. I asked her if the seasoned yuzu radish was free flow too, and she told me it is. What I did not expect was she proceeded to bring me more radish without me asking! ‚ô•Ô∏é
Nevertheless to say, the food was good, and the attentive service just makes my experience sweeter.
Fantastic price for food. Cheese pork katsu and curry is both very delicious. Free cabbage salad with topping and soup topup! Really good

Came on a Sat during lunch, restaurant was full house. We ordered the recommended Yuzu Hire Rosu Katsu Set (which comes with free flow rice and cabbage/ aragula salad) and A4/A5 Miyazaki Gyu Katsu. ‚Ä¶
Very delicious tonkotsu. Ramen soup was above average. Various way of eating the tonkotsu. Cheese tonkotsu was good. Free flow salad was good.

Ordered hokkaido rosu miso and i became a goat due to the free flow veg + sesame dressing. Pork is crispy, light and soft. Veg is fresh with no dirt taste. Rice is rice, soup was a good balance of salt. ‚Ä¶

Had lunch during weekdays on 31 May 2023. I ordered the promotion set of deep fried yuzu pork katsu set. It comes with free flow of rice and cabbage arugula. Oh my.. the pork is crispy on the outside and succulent in the inside and the best ‚Ä¶

Great variety of katsu available here - pork, beef, prawn, scallop and even salmon. Tried the signature yuzu pork and a4/a5 miyazaki wagyu katsu on hot stone grill. Gyukatsu was tender and flavour was especially enhanced when you add a bit of salt. Tonkatsu was crispy, light and not gamey. Tonjiru soup was so good and comforting I suggest ordering one more serving! The yuzu sauce for the free flow salad was addictive and the rice was shiok!

The staff was welcoming, attentive and friendly, overall a very positive experience! So glad they opened in Woodlands!

business_name: Makan Empire by Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang
text: One of the most delicious nasi lemak i've ever tasted in Singapore, strategically located near the Sultan Mosque, it has that warm ambience that almost feel like home with nostalgic sweets snacks as the side dish. Would love to have another visit next time.

business_name: Makan Empire by Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang
text:
Food was delicious ‚ù§Ô∏è especially the sup bontot! For the grilled chicken, there are different types and spice levels. The one I got was the Taliwang which is a more mid level spiced. If you're unsure, feel free to ask the staff. They were so friendly and helpful!

One of the staff, an uncle recommended a few places to visit in Singapore as we mentioned we're on trip from Malaysia. Would recommend this place to our friends.

business_name: Makan Empire by Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang
text: Had high expectations since it was Michelin. Ordered Indomie with Ayam Goreng and Nasi Lemak with Beef rendang. The rice not much coconut taste though the beef rendang was good. The Ayam goreng was super dry that my kid could not swallow. The staff was friendly and asked if there was anything wrong with the Ayam goreng. Told him it was too dry. He accepted the feedback and gave us a 15% discount.

OE Salad Bar is a hidden gem for health-conscious diners and salad lovers. Their focus on organic vegetables truly shines through in every dish, making it a perfect spot for a guilt-free, nourishing meal. ‚Ä¶

OE Salad Bar is a hidden gem for health-conscious diners and salad lovers. Their focus on organic vegetables truly shines through in every dish, making it a perfect spot for a guilt-free, nourishing meal.

The freshness and quality of their produce are unmatched, and you can tell they prioritize sourcing the best ingredients. The variety on their menu is impressive, catering to both classic salad enthusiasts and those seeking unique flavor combinations. Their dressings are a standout‚Äîperfectly balanced and crafted to enhance the natural taste of the vegetables.

The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, making it an ideal place for a quick lunch or a relaxed meal with friends. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to recommend the best options.

If you're someone who values organic, high-quality food and wants a satisfying, healthy meal, OE Salad Bar is a must-try. It‚Äôs not just a meal; it‚Äôs an experience of freshness and flavor. Highly recommended!

Locally produced.
Healthy.
Large variety.
Generous
Affordable.

These are some of the perks you get for dining with OE Salad Bar.

Their vegetables are freshly produced locally and organically. I wanted to eat healthier and a dietician told me that a variety of fruits and vegetables is CRUCIAL for maintaining good health. Much more important than just quantity. And i am glad i came across this place. They serve a huge spectrum of ingredients and this is exactly what the doctor (dietician) ordered. Eat whole food over processed foods.

Do find them inside Hao Supermarket and do not give them a miss. I guarantee you.

Basically is everything your body needs in one meal. Great taste with a great balance of healthy diet! Yummy and healthy at the same time. Was having this from Westgate last time to Yew Tee now. Finally they opened the stall near me! One of the best salad I've tasted!

Omg we really amazed with the salad combination and portion. Is really worth the value , not only fresh but you‚Äôll find some veggie type that you hardly found at other salad shop. They have own in house plantation growing the vegetable and free from pesticides. Is ready to eat from open pack!

Also not to forgot mention the almond, the fried that with sugar and salt in slices and it given the crunchy bite on your bowls! The dessert is sagu, add with chia seed,  almost and nuts and some dry cranberry etc... superb!

Hearty, tasty and light 6.8sgd basic salad!!
Added 2.8 for the western dessert, super healthy indulgence with chia seeds and sago in coconut milk, with a decent amount of walnuts, cranberries and raisins. And puffed rice!!!
Bring own containers for 5% discount~

Lady was nice, I asked if the set upgrade to incl 2 drink/dessert could mean buying two desserts, she didn't try to hard sell me into buying a drink I didn't super want.

First time trying, will return for sure

I prefer Cedele or Poke Theory.
With the same price,, the portion is too miserable here !
The dining counter has cockroach and housefly.
The lady is not helpful with my Enquiries.
I will not eat from here again .

ps: Their pricing in the website is not updated, this is also misleading. see latest price with photos attached.

Tried Volcano Ramen at Bukit Panjang Plaza, and it was a solid experience! I had the beef bowl, which tasted quite similar to Yoshinoya‚Äôs‚Äîflavorful and satisfying. My wife had ramen (forgot which one!), but she said it was good. A nice bonus: they offer free eggs! Overall, a decent place for a quick and tasty meal.
Free hard boiled eggs. Sign up for member to gain benefit of 1 free drink (I CHOSE ORANGE JUICE) and Birthday -$5 discount! As it was my birthday Month, I paid only $11+ for this table of food. ‚Ä¶

Came here for dinner on a Tuesday night and had a great time! Portions were generous, there were fun add-ons & condiments, and the food had lots of personality!

üç≥ Free Flow Hard-Boiled Eggs
You can peel your own eggs and eat them with your ramen. I even asked the staff for some mayo and made myself a DIY egg salad with chilli flakes and sesame powder to my liking hehe.

üç∫ Sapporo Bottle Beer ‚Äì $2.90
C‚Äômon‚Ä¶ $2.90 for a cold, golden Sapporo? Can‚Äôt go wrong. Perfect pairing for ramen or karaage.

Apple Chu-Hai ‚Äì $7.00
Light, bubbly, and refreshing with a soft apple flavour. Not too boozy, just the right kind of casual drink for a laid-back dinner.

üçú Volcano Kazan Style Beef Sukiyaki Ramen ‚Äì $18.80
The star of the show. This Kazan-style ramen comes with a volcano-shaped lid that traps heat and smokes‚Äîmakes for quite the visual moment. The raw beef slices cook under the lid, and once it‚Äôs lifted, you‚Äôre left with a super rich, soy-based beefy broth.

The broth was sweet too, thanks to the generous amount of cabbage and beansprouts. Bonus: they give you a bowl of rice to enjoy with the broth afterward! You can also request raw garlic cloves to mash in, and sesame powder to tweak the flavours. So satisfying and rich!

üå∂Ô∏è LIMITED TIME: Curry Tantan Noodle ‚Äì $13.80
A thick, creamy, sesame-based broth with a strong curry aroma. Topped with spicy minced meat‚Äîit‚Äôs bold and nutty. Personally, this was a bit too heavy for me; it leaned more gravy than soup. Think: spicy Japanese tantanmen with a rich curry aroma. Definitely flavour-packed, just not for when you want something light.

üçó Chicken Nanban ‚Äì $7.80
These are crispy, tender fried chicken bites with a chunky onion-forward nanban sauce‚Äînot your usual creamy style. Great for sharing, but just a heads-up: very oniony.

ü•ü Yaki Gyoza (6pcs) ‚Äì $6.30
Nice chewy skin and a solid gyoza option for the table. Only wish the pan-fried side was crispier, but it still hit the spot.

I didn't know the hot stone bowl has noodles in it, ordered regular and it also comes with rice(almost couldn't finish it).

price wise for hot stone is rather pricey as there isn't much meat inside just lots of veggies. the soup tasted average only... free flow hardboil eggs too. not the best tasting ramen but edible.
I like the tomato noodle!!!!! Other beef dish have more vege than beef haha,,, and i didn‚Äôt check the receipt but i think egg is free haha

Got the beef sukiyaki. Beef became overcooked and tough as the soup is scalding, too much vegetables and bean sprouts. I like that it‚Äôs carb overload, with noodles AND rice

Follow their instagram for free drink, and do a review for free gyoza

$62 for 3 people‚Äôs lunch set

Free hard boiled eggs. Sign up for member to gain benefit of 1 free drink (I CHOSE ORANGE JUICE) and Birthday -$5 discount! As it was my birthday Month, I paid only $11+ for this table of food.

Small but fit shop for a ramen gathering. I ordered the Karamiso ramen for $13.80+. After GST and Svc charge it became $16+.

The best is the chashu which gave me a wow! factor. Will come back if craving ramen again.

Really good ramen. Has been a regular customer for a long time already and it‚Äôs still very good. üëç free eggs that you can eat while waiting and many condiments to go with your ramen. Very interactive experience but just a little pricey. ‚Ä¶

$19.96 after gst and service charge for this ultra spicy ramen lunch set.

This is really spicy. I tried their normal spicy and this is way more spicy. I had to add more water to make it more liquid. If you can take spicy then order the ultra spicy. Noodles are nicely cooked.

Goza is normal.

Service is with 2 star as there wasn‚Äôt utensils given nor was I given the ‚Äúfree eggs‚Äù. Though they did service free water.

Space is crampy.

Came on a weekday noon and there was no queue. Had a quick good ramen meal which came with 3 pcs of free gyoza for weekday lunch hour. There were a few seasonings on each table where you can add to your noodles, I added some chilli flake and was not bad. üëç ‚Ä¶

Really good ramen. Has been a regular customer for a long time already and it‚Äôs still very good. üëç free eggs that you can eat while waiting and many condiments to go with your ramen. Very interactive experience but just a little pricey.

Came on a weekday noon and there was no queue. Had a quick good ramen meal which came with 3 pcs of free gyoza for weekday lunch hour. There were a few seasonings on each table where you can add to your noodles, I added some chilli flake and was not bad. üëç
Besides serving good food, this restaurant still provides free water and free alcohol wipes. Many restaurants in Singapore are charging these stuff! Also, toothpicks are available. ‚Ä¶

business_name: Red Lantern Live Seafood @ 921 Upper Bukit Timah Road
text: First time there, good place for seafood if want to avoid city area. With limited parking lots. Personally I like the mantou. Overall the foods is good. Free dessert.

business_name: Red Lantern Live Seafood @ 921 Upper Bukit Timah Road
text:
Brought my family there for weekend dinner.
Main gripe is that we wanted to order Curry Fish Head or Steamboat Fish Head ($38), but was told that both were sold out and the only fish left is the seasonal fish ($48). We got that in the end which was pretty large with much meat, just that I don‚Äôt know if the reason above is a smokescreen for us to spend more‚Ä¶

Anyway the Fingertips Chicken was amazing as the meat while tender, contained so much flavor from the spices used, so I was impressed how the chef infused the spices into the meat. The rest were decent too.

Free parking available at the building but limited lots, otherwise a lot of cars park along side the small road of the building. Last resort is to park at Hilton Mall then cross the street to the restaurant.

business_name: Red Lantern Live Seafood @ 921 Upper Bukit Timah Road
text:
Live in the west but never knew such restaurant exist until i watched Zermatt video.
The food is good, and affordable. Highly recommend to bring your family there.
We even got free dessert. Thank you so much.
They even have their own car park.

business_name: Red Lantern Live Seafood @ 921 Upper Bukit Timah Road
text:
Decent food, vibes and friendly service. Seasonal fish price feels abit pricier ($75 for tiger grouper). Overall 1 fish, 2 M veggies, 1 chicken, 1 tofu is about $33/pax. The basket tofu isn't really a must-try (menu recommended it). Might try their sotong next time since it seems highly rated. There's complimentary dessert (e.g. mango pudding) at end of meal. Toilet is quite dirty so should be better maintained.

Do call to reserve table in advance, they look quite full on weekend. Parking looks free and can park within the restaurant compound or along the road beside it - looks like enough space on a crowded weekend.

Overall, can try if in the area and feeling for a fancier tze char

business_name: Red Lantern Live Seafood @ 921 Upper Bukit Timah Road
text:
Great place for occasions. Nice recommendation from staff. Had a group lunch 8+1 and ordered all the staff's recommendation and all were nice.  Recommended. With free parking (12 lots)

The aircon was not that cold maybe due to hot weather and seated beside window at noon.  Try to get seats nearer to cashier.

business_name: Red Lantern Live Seafood @ 921 Upper Bukit Timah Road
text:
Nice ambience, feels like the 80s 90s banquet style.
We ordered 6 dishes, 1 lala beehoon for 9pax. Portion was quite big, more than enough for us.
Free dessert of the day served.

They have a dining time limited. We reserved 6pm and allowed to dine till 7.20pm, restaurant wasn't even full.

business_name: Red Lantern Live Seafood @ 921 Upper Bukit Timah Road
text:
We were planning for a venue to celebrate my mum's 70th birthday. This is in fact our second choice. Many thanks to Sherry whom we got to know since a few years back. She invited us and recommended a few dishes that really suit our family, and the occasion of course.
Ambience is casual and cosy. There is ample parking for everyone. Business was good considering it's location and we noticed that there were only 2 empty tables when we left.
The staff were friendly and approachable. They responded to every request, unlike some others, where the waitress do not bother to respond or were cold during peak periods. This is commendable.
The food were yummy too. The first dish is BBQ squid. It tasted great but the portion is very small. The herbal prawn soup is nice and thick. The prawns were reasonably large and fresh too. Bamboo clams were tender and chewy, and it will be the best in Singapore only if they can shorten the steaming by abit more. Finger chicken is savory and flavourful. Scallop crab meat shark fin is thick and taste great too.
Lastly, there's free corkage and a great place for gathering too!
Thank you Sherry for the complimentary dessert and longevity buns.
Overall it's a great experience and we will be back to try other dishes.
Nice Prata served. Curry is free flow of your choice of 2.  Ginger milk is a little dilute. Will taste better if mixed thicker.

1. Prata : 5/5 Very crispy and tasty prata. We ordered egg and cheese, egg, onion mushroom and plaster. The plaster was nicely done. Prices were much more expensive than normal prata stalls.

2. Coffee and tea: 2/5 Drinks were overloaded with sugar.

3. Staff: 3/5 Very friendly Indian lady staff. Clearly they are understaff, which explains the slower service when ordering, serving and clearing tables. (We went on a Sunday morning).

4. Curry: 2/5 There are self-service, free flow chicken and fish curry at a station near the wash basin. The chicken curry was running low and tasted stale. All of us have stomachache after having the food here. I suspect it might be due to the curry station. (Hot weather, curry exposed long hours in the air,  different people handling the curry etc.)

5. Place: 2/5 Very small setting. Felt cramped and a little dirty. Aircon was leaking.  It's nice to have that small basin for us to wash our hands though.

Ordered the mutton mysore biryani meal with ginger coffee and spent around $18. Taste is comparable to the original branch at Cashew, but serving temperature was lower due to a less consistent stream of customers. Sambhar was nice and cabbage and pumpkin masala were alright. Free flow biryani rice and papadum served on a banana leaf. Mysore mutton was however very salty and not tender enough. Would‚Äôve been nice if they provided complimentary pickles and payasam/kesari to go with the meal.

This is my second visit here. This particular branch is located within the Home Team NS at Bukit Batok, so parking is not an issue compared to the Karu's along Upper Bukit Timah.
I like the banana leaf biryani. It comes with 2 choices of vegetables, papadum and curry. The fried fish and fried chicken were excellent. The hot and sour soup was served piping hot, perfect for a rainy evening.
The service here was good as long as it's not terrifically busy. It's worth checking out.

Karu's is our go-to restaurant regularly when we crave curry fish head. Were pleasantly surprised to chance upon this branch when we visited the venue. Decided to have an early lunch of curry fish head and white rice set. The white rice set that accompanied the curry fish head order offers free flow of vegetables and rice! Pappadum is included in the set as well. Curry fish head is just-nice spicy and comes with an aroma of flavourful spices. Remember to ask for Rasam. It is a small cup of spicy tangy drink at the end of the meal to cut through the oil and helps in digestion. Definitely will visit this branch more regularly from now on.

Service was extremely prompt. Had the biryani meal, but did not eat much. Meal or they call set had free flow of rice, fish curry gravy, bitter gourd curry and vegetable. The meat is only served once. Ginger coffee is really nice! Not too sweet and really the siew dao or less sugar type with a hint of ginger in the after taste.

I was impressed by how clean the restaurant was. The tables were wooden with a smooth matt finish, and any grease marks or stains would be glaringly obvious. The table that we were seated at had a uniform matt appearance without a single stain or grease mark. Being nosy, I glanced over at the empty table next to ours and saw that the table was equally spotless. Kudos to the staff for maintaining a high level of cleanliness!

I loved that the papadom was freeflow. It was great for dipping in the various sauces and gravies that came with our food.

Loved how flavourful everything was and it was a positive dining experience.

Had chicken meal, a small curry fish head and a plain naan. Chicken meal consists of rice,masala chicken and cabbage and another side dish that I was not familar with. Curry fish head was flavourful with a rich broth. Spiciness level has just the right kick:) The portion is good for two people. For the chicken meal, it‚Äôs served on banana leaf ,so don‚Äôt be surprised if you are not given a plate. You have a choice of basmati rice or plain rice. The side dishes can have extra toppings for free, same for the papadom. The rice portion is huge and they put the rice on the spot for you. The ginger tea is good. Will come again to try the bryani! Price was reasonable.

My husband brought us here for lunch as it was newly opened. Our usual Karu hangout is at Bukit Timah so we decided to give this place a try.

Service is very good. Food & drinks are ok to us (the Bukit Timah outlet is nicer). The place is clean.

Hometeam NS (HTNS) members get discount. Just show ‚ÄòMy Card‚Äô info from your HTNS app.

Must try this place called as Mani's Banana Leaf ... Especially pls try on Monday they doing more variety in alcarte and fish head curry
Singapore starters ‚Ä¶

business_name: I Love Sukhothai - Limbang Shopping Centre
text:
The wait is well worth for the food quality and service. The lady who managed guest in line was super polite and attentive - keep apologizing to guests for the wait and providing queue updates. They also served a variety of free drinks for waiting guests

Food is fantastic and priced reasonably. I like the Moo Ping, Basil Minced Pork and Red Ruby Dessert. The waitresses were all very polite and served with a smile. Will definitely revisit again but maybe a little early next time to avoid the crowd.
Shrimps fried rice was decent but slightly oily towards the end. And i recall seeing it listed as spicy on the menu but there was zero spice. ‚Ä¶

Catchy name, great quality fry
very tasty dishes by chefs
good big kitchen area ;)
cafe compared to 1F before
food portion quantity appropriate
awesome generous ingredients
woke hei for fried noodles
with frozen prawns & scallops
plenty sauce for salted egg pork
coriander & chilli garnish
kitchen fried large tofu oomph
lots of veggie selections
value for money promotions
staff tries keep up busy service
but minus star for table roach / dirty chopsticks ;(

Shrimps fried rice was decent but slightly oily towards the end. And i recall seeing it listed as spicy on the menu but there was zero spice.

ÂõõÂ§ßÂ§©Áéã veg was disappointing. The chilli paste wasn't mixed properly (still in big chunks that we had to spread with our spoon) and the eggplant skin was quite tough.

Sour plum coke was surprisingly nice - less carbonated vibe and not too sweet too.

Portion size was ok but it still feels pricier than usual restaurant tze char. $40+ for 1 main, 1 veg, 1 drink. Service was good
Extremely delicious Honey sweet chicken cubes, Plain porridge is not plain but flavoured with anchovies and scallops which is tasty!

Affordable Ramen with Great Extras

I enjoyed a meal here and found the ramen to be very affordable. It's great to have free flow of plain water and bean sprouts, which add to the overall value.

The tonkotsu ramen soup was delicious and not too salty, with the noodles being perfectly springy and textured. Due to the affordable price, the slices of pork (char siu) are quite thin, but you can always add extra slices if you prefer more.

Overall, a wonderful spot for budget-friendly ramen!

My husband and I came here after hearing my friend say how good it is. It truly didn‚Äôt disappoint! I had their Black Garlic Ramen which comes with 3 types of meat & half an onsen egg. We shared a drink (watermelon soju) and ordered their signature spinach dish with sesame sauce too, which was good.

The star is undoubtedly the soup base - savory without being too oily (heard there‚Äôs no MSG added tooüëçüèª). The noodles were firm and of bouncy texture. Ajitama was well seasoned and soft in centre. We like their extras too - free flow of barley tea and bean sprouts! Highly recommendedüòä

Good food, good vibes! Really nailed the japanese ramenya atmosphere with the decorations.

A pleasant surprise was the free sides (beansprouts, pickled ginger) as well as the free self serve tea. Where else in SG will you have a ramen place like this besides in town?

When the ramen was served, it was so visually pleasant. The soup was amazing, noodle texture was just right, eggs were perfectly cooked with the runny yolk, and the 3 different slices of meat were so delicious.

The cream tea‚Äôs light flavours were refreshing after having the ramen.

Great experience, didn‚Äôt wait long for the food at all too.

Had lunch on Sunday. Ramen is chewy and soup base is nice. Pportion is on the small side though. The free side dish of bean sprout is too spicy as well. Although rather slow when come to preparation, ao peak hour will drfinitely long wait. Not many seats available inside too.

The place is cozy, with a retro vibe. The customer service is fast and polite, the food is downright AMAZING. The Sambal Black Garlic Tonkotsu tasted divine and is probably the best I've had.

The Cream Scarlet Jade drink was a prefect blend of cream and red tea, no qualms about it.

There's even free bean sprouts and pickled ginger as sides for your preference

Ramen taisho was actually recommended to me by my Japanese colleague when I asked him which ramen shop that he liked best in Tanjong Pagar(while they were still in Maxwell).

Happy to see that they have made a come back in Bukit Batok, quality still good and the free flow roasted barley tea is a nice additional touch. Remember to add the roasted garlic flakes into your soup for an added crunchy umami flavour.

Great ramen fix in a place where food options are generally lacking!

The broths are rich and wholesome, collar chashu very tenderly done, belly chashu very flavorful and smoky. The DX option comes with chicken - though in a recent visit it was missing.

Personal faves are the black garlic or shio tonkotsu broths.

Been noticing a gradual decline in service though, in recent times often missing bean sprouts, and even more recently, not having their usual free flow tea anymore - they still served water, but wasn't cold!

Had their Black Garlic Ramen @ LeQuest. Surprisingly good ramen in such a hidden spot. The star is undoubtedly the soup base - thick and savory without being too oily. The noodles were firm and had bite. Chashu was small but tasty. Ajitama was well seasoned and soft in centre. I like their extras - free flow of barley tea and bean sprouts and even wet wipes.

Had the tsukemen. Overly salty and lack of flavour from the dipping broth/sauce.

The chicken karaage is delicious! And there‚Äôs free flow beansprouts.

Air conditioning is bad and the place feels hot.

Service was ok.

I won't come here again. Lots of other better ramen options around the area. It is slightly cheaper but I don't find it worth it.

I had the 'spicy black garlic tonkotsu ramen deluxe'.
The broth was not very rich and lacked depth of flavour. The spice just tasted like heat, and didn't really enhance the dish.
The noodles were not very bouncy or chewy.
The egg was actually excellent.
The meat was ok and a reasonable quantity, but not overly tender.

If this was an $8 dish, I would have considered it better than others in the same price range. However mine was $10.80, which puts it just outside the cheap range, and I have to compare it to other more expensive ramens.

Keisuke tonkotsu king down the road, does a ramen for almost the same price, but is vastly better, and in an air conditioned restaurant, with free eggs and beansprouts.
